papers.title: Towards Cybersecurity MOOC Certification
papers.authors: Matthias Beckerle, Argyro Chatzopoulou, Simone Fischer-Hübner
papers.abstract: Especially during the COVID-19 crisis, MOOCs have become more important than ever, also for the cybersecurity domain. The certification of cybersecurity MOOCs could help promote quality aspects of MOOCs and enable their quality assessment and comparison. We conducted an online survey to analyse the role of cybersecurity MOOC certification based on proposed quality criteria for cybersecurity MOOCs and for MOOCs in general. Participants reported mixed experiences with MOOCs and largely agreed with our proposed quality criteria. This paper shows that there is a high acceptance and need for certification.
papers.abstract_zh: 尤其是在新冠肺炎危机期间，MOOCs变得比以往任何时候都更加重要，对网络安全领域也是如此。网络安全mooc的认证有助于提高mooc的质量，并使其能够进行质量评估和比较。我们进行了一项在线调查，根据网络安全MOOC和MOOC总体质量标准的建议，分析了网络安全MOOC认证的作用。与会者报告了MOOCs的各种体验，并在很大程度上同意我们提出的质量标准。这份文件表明，认证的接受度和必要性很高。
papers.title_zh: 走向网络安全MOOC认证

papers.title: Incremental Common Criteria Certification Processes using DevSecOps Practices
papers.authors: Sébastien Dupont, Guillaume Ginis, Mirko Malacario, Claudio Porretti, Nicolò Maunero, Christophe Ponsard, Philippe Massonet
papers.abstract: The growing digitalisation of our economies and societies is driving the need for increased connectivity of critical applications and infrastructures to the point where failures can lead to important disruptions and consequences to our lives. One growing source of failures for critical applications and infrastructures originates from cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities that can be exploited in attacks. One approach to mitigating these risks is verifying that critical applications and infrastructures are sufficiently protected by certification of products and services. However, reaching sufficient assurance levels for product certification may require detailed evaluation of product properties. An important challenge for product certification is dealing with product evolution: now that critical applications and infrastructures are connected they are being updated on a more frequent basis. To ensure continuity of certification, updates must be analysed to verify the impact on certified cybersecurity properties. Impacted properties need to be re-certified. This paper proposes a lightweight and flexible incremental certification process that can be integrated with DevSecOps practices to automate as much as possible evidence gathering and certification activities. The approach is illustrated on the Common Criteria product certification scheme and a firewall update on an automotive case study. Only the impact analysis phase of the incremental certification process is illustrated.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们的经济和社会日益数字化，推动着对关键应用和基础设施连接性的需求不断增加，以至于故障会给我们的生活带来严重的干扰和后果。关键应用程序和基础设施故障的一个日益增长的来源是网络安全威胁和可被攻击利用的漏洞。降低这些风险的一种方法是验证关键应用程序和基础架构是否受到产品和服务认证的充分保护。然而，要达到产品认证的足够保证水平，可能需要对产品特性进行详细评估。产品认证的一个重要挑战是处理产品演变:既然关键应用程序和基础设施已经连接起来，它们的更新就更加频繁。为确保认证的连续性，必须对更新进行分析，以验证对已认证网络安全属性的影响。受影响的财产需要重新认证。本文提出了一个轻量级的、灵活的增量认证过程，该过程可以与DevSecOps实践相集成，以尽可能多地自动化证据收集和认证活动。该方法在通用标准产品认证计划和汽车案例研究的防火墙更新中进行了说明。仅示出了增量认证过程的影响分析阶段。
papers.title_zh: 使用DevSecOps实践的增量通用标准认证流程

papers.title: JSONPS: Secure an inherently insecure practice with this one weird trick!
papers.authors: Sebastian Lekies, Damien Engels, Metodi Mitkov
papers.abstract: JSONP, or JSON with Padding, is a cross-origin data exchange mechanism that was proposed in 2005 as a reaction to the extremely strict security model employed by browsers of the day [10]. At that time, the Same-Origin Policy (SOP) prohibited any kind of cross-site communication for security purposes. However, at the same time, this prevented legitimate cross-origin scenarios in which two websites mutually exchange data with each other. JSONP is a workaround that circumvents the SOP by leveraging cross-origin script inclusions to pass data from a backend to a cross-origin webpage. In modern browsers, Cross-Origin Resource Sharing and the PostMessage API offer more powerful and more secure ways to exchange data. However, due to its popularity, its framework support, and a large amount of legacy applications and APIs, JSONP is still very popular today. According to our study, at least 10 % of the Alexa top sites still leverage JSONP. This is problematic since JSONP is inherently insecure: To load data from a cross-origin backend, a webpage has to include and execute a script within its security context. Due to the SOP, the website cannot verify the contents of the script and thus has to blindly grant the third-party server code execution capabilities. To counter this problem, this paper presents JSONPS – a light-weight sandbox for JSONP scripts. By leveraging browser features such as iframes and the PostMessage API, the sandbox enables a website to execute a JSONP script outside of its security boundaries, while still being able to retrieve the data in a secure way. The sandbox can be deployed to large legacy code bases and modern application frameworks with minimal code changes. Furthermore, it considerably increases security when the usage of JSONP is inevitable for backward-compatibility reasons. The sandbox is designed to work in older browsers: At Google, we have deployed the sandbox to major applications serving traffic to millions of users.
papers.abstract_zh: JSONP，或带填充的JSON，是一种跨来源的数据交换机制，于2005年提出，作为对当时浏览器所采用的极其严格的安全模型的反应[10]。当时，同源策略(SOP)出于安全目的禁止任何种类的跨站点通信。然而，与此同时，这阻止了两个网站相互交换数据的合法跨来源情况。JSONP是一种规避SOP的变通方法，它利用跨源脚本包含将数据从后端传递到跨源网页。在现代浏览器中，跨源资源共享和PostMessage API提供了更强大、更安全的数据交换方式。然而，由于它的流行，它的框架支持，以及大量的遗留应用程序和API，JSONP今天仍然非常受欢迎。根据我们的研究，至少10 %的Alexa顶级网站仍然利用JSONP。这是有问题的，因为JSONP本质上是不安全的:要从跨源后端加载数据，网页必须在其安全上下文中包含并执行一个脚本。由于SOP，网站无法验证脚本的内容，因此不得不盲目授予第三方服务器代码执行能力。为了解决这个问题，本文提出了JSONPS——一个用于JSONP脚本的轻量级沙箱。通过利用iframes和PostMessage API等浏览器功能，沙盒使网站能够在其安全边界之外执行JSONP脚本，同时仍然能够以安全的方式检索数据。沙箱可以部署到大型遗留代码库和现代应用程序框架中，只需进行最少的代码更改。此外，当由于向后兼容的原因而不可避免地使用JSONP时，它大大提高了安全性。沙盒是为在旧浏览器中工作而设计的:在谷歌，我们已经将沙盒部署到为数百万用户提供流量服务的主要应用程序中。
papers.title_zh: JSONPS:用这个奇怪的技巧保护一个本质上不安全的实践！

papers.title: EssentialFP: Exposing the Essence of Browser Fingerprinting
papers.authors: Alexander Sjösten, Daniel Hedin, Andrei Sabelfeld
papers.abstract: Web pages aggressively track users for a variety of purposes from targeted advertisements to enhanced authentication. As browsers move to restrict traditional cookie-based tracking, web pages increasingly move to tracking based on browser fingerprinting. Unfortunately, the state-of-the-art to detect fingerprinting in browsers is often error-prone, resorting to imprecise heuristics and crowd-sourced filter lists. This paper presents EssentialFP, a principled approach to detecting fingerprinting on the web. We argue that the pattern of (i) gathering information from a wide browser API surface (multiple browser-specific sources) and (ii) communicating the information to the network (network sink) captures the essence of fingerprinting. This pattern enables us to clearly distinguish fingerprinting from similar types of scripts like analytics and polyfills. We demonstrate that information flow tracking is an excellent fit for exposing this pattern. To implement EssentialFP we leverage, extend, and deploy JSFlow, a state-of-the-art information flow tracker for JavaScript, in a browser. We illustrate the effectiveness of EssentialFP to spot fingerprinting on the web by evaluating it on two categories of web pages: one where the web pages perform analytics, use polyfills, and show ads, and one where the web pages perform authentication, bot detection, and fingerprinting-enhanced Alexa top pages.
papers.abstract_zh: 网页出于各种目的积极跟踪用户，从定向广告到增强的身份验证。随着浏览器开始限制传统的基于cookie的跟踪，网页越来越多地转向基于浏览器指纹的跟踪。不幸的是，浏览器中检测指纹的最新技术往往容易出错，求助于不精确的试探法和众包过滤列表。本文介绍了EssentialFP，一种检测网络指纹的原理性方法。我们认为,( I)从广泛的浏览器API表面(多个特定于浏览器的源)收集信息和(ii)将信息传递到网络(网络接收器)的模式抓住了指纹的本质。这种模式使我们能够清楚地区分指纹与类似类型的脚本，如分析和聚合填充。我们证明信息流跟踪非常适合揭示这种模式。为了实现EssentialFP，我们在浏览器中利用、扩展和部署了JSFlow，这是一个最先进的JavaScript信息流跟踪器。我们通过在两类网页上评估EssentialFP来说明它在识别网络指纹方面的有效性:一类是网页执行分析、使用聚合填充和显示广告，另一类是网页执行身份验证、僵尸检测和指纹增强的Alexa首页。
papers.title_zh: EssentialFP:揭示浏览器指纹的本质

papers.title: A preliminary study on the adoption and effectiveness of SameSite cookies as a CSRF defence
papers.authors: Luca Compagna, Hugo Jonker, Johannes Krochewski, Benjamin Krumnow, Merve Sahin
papers.abstract: The SameSite cookie attribute was introduced to prevent Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks. Major browsers support SameSite functionality since 2016. Since 2020, browsers enforce it by default. These developments sometimes have been celebrated as the end of CSRF. In this paper, we have a closer look into the potential of SameSite mechanism to effectively fight CSRF in practice. Our measurements and evaluations over most popular websites indicate that, if properly deployed, the SameSite mechanism can be effective against the major CSRF attack scenario. Still, like any other countermeasure, it is not likely to be a silver bullet to end CSRF, due to various scenarios that require additional protection. We refactor our findings in a set of guidelines for the web community on how to make best use of SameSite and what it is left to do to fight CSRF.
papers.abstract_zh: 引入SameSite cookie属性是为了防止跨站点请求伪造(CSRF)攻击。各大浏览器从2016年开始支持SameSite功能。从2020年开始，浏览器默认强制执行。这些发展有时被庆祝为CSRF的终结。在这篇文章中，我们对同一个站点机制在实践中有效对抗CSRF病毒的潜力进行了更深入的研究。我们对大多数流行网站的测量和评估表明，如果部署得当，相同的站点机制可以有效应对主要的CSRF攻击场景。尽管如此，像任何其他对策一样，它不太可能成为终结CSRF的灵丹妙药，因为各种情况都需要额外的保护。我们在一套指南中重构了我们的发现，该指南是关于如何最好地利用SameSite以及对抗CSRF还剩下什么要做。
papers.title_zh: CSRF防御中采用相同网站cookies及其有效性的初步研究

papers.title: Adopting Trusted Types in ProductionWeb Frameworks to Prevent DOM-Based Cross-Site Scripting: A Case Study
papers.authors: Pei Wang, Bjarki Ágúst Guðmundsson, Krzysztof Kotowicz
papers.abstract: Cross-site scripting (XSS) is a common security vulnerability found in web applications. DOM-based XSS, one of the variants, is becoming particularly more prevalent with the boom of single-page applications where most of the UI changes are achieved by modifying the DOM through in-browser scripting. It is very easy for developers to introduce XSS vulnerabilities into web applications since there are many ways for user-controlled, unsanitized input to flow into a Web API and get interpreted as HTML markup and JavaScript code. An emerging Web API proposal called Trusted Types aims to prevent DOM XSS by making Web APIs secure by default. Different from other XSS mitigations that mostly focus on post-development protection, Trusted Types direct developers to write XSS-free code in the first place. A common concern when adopting a new security mechanism is how much effort is required to refactor existing code bases. In this paper, we report a case study on adopting Trusted Types in a well-established web framework. Our experience can help the web community better understand the benefits of making web applications compatible with Trusted Types, while also getting to know the related challenges and resolutions. We focused our work on Angular, which is one of the most popular web development frameworks available on the market.
papers.abstract_zh: 跨站点脚本(XSS)是web应用程序中常见的安全漏洞。基于DOM的XSS是其中一种变体，随着单页面应用程序的兴起，它变得越来越流行，在单页面应用程序中，大多数UI更改都是通过浏览器内脚本修改DOM来实现的。开发人员很容易将XSS漏洞引入到web应用程序中，因为用户控制的、未经组织的输入有许多方式流入Web API，并被解释为HTML标记和JavaScript代码。一个名为可信类型的新兴Web API提议旨在通过使Web API默认安全来防止DOM XSS。与其他主要关注开发后保护的XSS缓解措施不同，受信任类型首先指导开发人员编写无XSS代码。采用新的安全机制时，一个常见的问题是重构现有的代码库需要多少努力。在本文中，我们报告了一个在成熟的web框架中采用可信类型的案例研究。我们的经验可以帮助web社区更好地理解使web应用程序与可信类型兼容的好处，同时也了解相关的挑战和解决方案。我们将工作重点放在Angular上，这是市场上最流行的web开发框架之一。
papers.title_zh: 在ProductionWeb框架中采用可信类型以防止基于DOM的跨站脚本:案例研究

papers.title: FlushBlocker: Lightweight mitigating mechanism for CPU cache flush instruction based attacks
papers.authors: Shuhei Enomoto, Hiroki Kuzuno
papers.abstract: CPU cache flush instruction based attacks (cache instruction attacks) such as FLUSH+RELOAD can function in many environments. Meltdown and Spectre adopt FLUSH+RELOAD with cache instructions to access secret data. Additionally, Rowhammer employs cache instructions to modify data in physical memory. An adversary can read and write arbitrary data using these attacks. The deployment of corresponding hardware to combat these attacks is difficult for users, and existing software-based countermeasures incur high overheads, or cannot be applied to a variety of machines. In this study, we propose a novel mitigation mechanism for cache instruction attacks called FlushBlocker, which employs an effective approach that focuses on restricting cache flush instructions. We implemented FlushBlocker on the latest Linux kernel to conduct experiments. The experimental results indicate that FlushBlocker prevents existing cache instruction attacks and runtime overhead is negligible.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于CPU缓存刷新指令的攻击(缓存指令攻击)，如刷新+重新加载，可以在许多环境中起作用。Meltdown和Spectre采用带缓存指令的FLUSH+RELOAD来访问秘密数据。此外，Rowhammer使用缓存指令来修改物理内存中的数据。对手可以利用这些攻击读写任意数据。部署相应的硬件来对抗这些攻击对用户来说是困难的，并且现有的基于软件的对策招致高开销，或者不能应用于各种机器。在这项研究中，我们提出了一种新的缓存指令攻击缓解机制，称为FlushBlocker，它采用了一种有效的方法来限制缓存刷新指令。我们在最新的Linux内核上实现了FlushBlocker进行实验。实验结果表明，FlushBlocker可以防止现有的缓存指令攻击，并且运行时开销可以忽略不计。
papers.title_zh: FlushBlocker:针对基于CPU缓存刷新指令的攻击的轻量级缓解机制

papers.title: Borrowed Capabilities: Flexibly Enforcing Revocation on a Capability Architecture
papers.authors: Thijs Vercammen, Thomas Van Strydonck, Dominique Devriese
papers.abstract: Capability machine ISAs offer a security primitive called capabilities: unforgeable tokens that represent authority over memory, and the authority to invoke other components. To efficiently implement temporary authority delegation, i.e. capabilities which can be revoked between distrusting components, ISA extensions have been proposed and/or implemented, based on forms of garbage collection, local capabilities or linear capabilities. Each of these mechanisms has specific advantages and disadvantages. In this paper, we explore borrowed capabilities: a novel mechanism that combines some of the advantages of linear capabilities without requiring linear treatment of revocable pointers. Inspired by borrowing in substructural type systems like Rust, the idea is to reinterpret capability sealing as a form of borrowing. The seals behave as a form of lifetime identifier and can be matched against a separate lifetime token, which represents the lifetime. This short paper offers a first exploration of the idea, by defining an extension of the CHERI-RISC-V ISA with borrowed capabilities and a variety of features like mutable and immutable borrows, fractional lifetimes and reborrows. We extend the LLVM assembler for CHERI and experiment with example programs.
papers.abstract_zh: Capability machine ISAs提供了一个称为capabilities的安全原语:不可伪造的令牌，表示对内存的权限，以及调用其他组件的权限。为了有效地实现临时授权，即可以在不信任组件之间撤销的能力，基于垃圾收集、本地能力或线性能力的形式，已经提出和/或实现了ISA扩展。这些机制中的每一种都有特定的优点和缺点。在本文中，我们探讨了借用的能力:一种新的机制，它结合了线性能力的一些优点，而不需要对可撤销指针进行线性处理。受Rust等子结构类型系统中借用的启发，这个想法是将能力密封重新解释为一种借用形式。密封表现为一种形式的生存期标识符，可以与代表生存期的单独的生存期令牌相匹配。这篇短文通过定义CHERI-RISC-V ISA的一个扩展，提供了借用的功能和各种特性，如可变和不可变借用、部分生存期和重新借用，首次探索了这一思想。我们为CHERI扩展了LLVM汇编器，并用示例程序进行了实验。
papers.title_zh: 借用的功能:在功能架构上灵活地实施撤销

papers.title: DAMAS: Control-Data Isolation at Runtime through Dynamic Binary Modification
papers.authors: Camille Le Bon, Erven Rohou, Frédéric Tronel, Guillaume Hiet
papers.abstract: Memory corruption attacks have been a major issue in software security for over two decades and are still one of the most dangerous and widespread types of attacks nowadays. Among these attacks, control-flow hijack attacks are the most popular and powerful, enabling the attacker to execute arbitrary code inside the target process. Many approaches have been developed to mitigate such attacks and to prevent them from happening. One of these approaches is the Control-Data Isolation (CDI) that tries to prevent such attacks by removing their trigger from the code, namely indirect branches. This approach has been implemented as a compiler pass that replaces every indirect branches in the program with a table that leads the control-flow to direct hard-written branches. The drawback of this approach is that it needs the recompilation of the program. In this paper we present an approach and its implementation, DAMAS, a framework capable of deploying protections on a running software and use runtime information to optimize them during the process execution. We implemented a coarse-grain CDI protection using our framework and evaluated its impact on performance.
papers.abstract_zh: 二十多年来，内存损坏攻击一直是软件安全中的一个主要问题，并且现在仍然是最危险和最普遍的攻击类型之一。在这些攻击中，控制流劫持攻击是最流行和最强大的，它使攻击者能够在目标进程内执行任意代码。已经开发了许多方法来减轻这种攻击并防止它们发生。其中一种方法是控制数据隔离(CDI ),它试图通过从代码中移除触发器(即间接分支)来防止此类攻击。这种方法已经被实现为一个编译器通道，它用一个将控制流引导到直接硬写分支的表来替换程序中的每个间接分支。这种方法的缺点是需要重新编译程序。在本文中，我们提出了一种方法及其实现，DAMAS，一种能够在运行的软件上部署保护并在进程执行期间使用运行时信息来优化它们的框架。我们使用我们的框架实现了粗粒度CDI保护，并评估了它对性能的影响。
papers.title_zh: DAMAS:通过动态二进制修改在运行时隔离控制数据

papers.title: Virtual Platform to Analyze the Security of a System on Chip at Microarchitectural Level
papers.authors: Quentin Forcioli, Jean-Luc Danger, Clémentine Maurice, Lilian Bossuet, Florent Bruguier, Maria Mushtaq, David Novo, Loïc France, Pascal Benoit, Sylvain Guilley, Thomas Perianin
papers.abstract: The processors (CPUs) embedded in System on Chip (SoC) have to face recent attacks taking advantage of vulnerabilities/features in their microarchitectures to retrieve secret information. Indeed, the increase in complexity of modern CPU and SoC is mainly driven by the seek of performance rather than security. Even if efforts like isolation techniques have been taken to thwart cyberattacks, most microarchitectural features can open the door to security holes. One typical example is the exploitation of cache memory which keeps track of the program execution and paves the way to side-channel (SCA) analysis and transient execution attacks like Meltdown and Spectre, which take advantage of speculative execution. This paper introduces an ongoing study aiming at analyzing the attacks relying on the hardware vulnerabilities of the microarchitectures of CPUs and SoCs. The main objective is to create a virtual and open platform that simulates the behavior of microarchitectural features and their interactions with the peripherals, like accelerators and memories in emerging technologies. The gem5 simulator, whose configuration can be customized to a specific CPU or SoC architecture, is the basis of our chosen platform for security analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 嵌入在片上系统(SoC)中的处理器(CPU)不得不面对最近利用其微体系结构中的漏洞/特征来检索秘密信息的攻击。事实上，现代CPU和SoC复杂性的增加主要是由对性能而非安全性的追求所驱动的。即使已经采取了隔离技术等措施来阻止网络攻击，大多数微体系结构功能也可能会打开安全漏洞的大门。一个典型的例子是利用高速缓存跟踪程序执行，为旁路(SCA)分析和瞬时执行攻击铺平道路，如Meltdown和Spectre，它们利用了推测性执行。本文介绍了一项正在进行的研究，旨在分析依赖于CPU和SOC微体系结构的硬件漏洞的攻击。主要目标是创建一个虚拟的开放平台，模拟微架构特性的行为及其与外设的交互，如新兴技术中的加速器和存储器。gem5模拟器的配置可以针对特定的CPU或SoC架构进行定制，是我们选择的安全分析平台的基础。
papers.title_zh: 在微体系结构级别分析片上系统安全性的虚拟平台

papers.title: Analyzing the Viability of UAV Missions Facing Cyber Attacks
papers.authors: Jukka Soikkeli, Cora Lisa Perner, Emil C. Lupu
papers.abstract: With advanced video and sensing capabilities, unoccupied aerial vehicles (UAVs) are increasingly being used for numerous applications that involve the collaboration and autonomous operation of teams of UAVs. Yet such vehicles can be affected by cyber attacks, impacting the viability of their missions. We propose a method to conduct mission viability analysis under cyber attacks for missions that employ a team of several UAVs that share a communication network. We apply our method to a case study of a survey mission in a wildfire firefighting scenario. Within this context, we show how our method can help quantify the expected mission performance impact from an attack and determine if the mission can remain viable under various attack situations. Our method can be used both in the planning of the mission and for decision making during mission operation. Our approach to modeling attack progression and impact analysis with Petri nets is also more broadly applicable to other settings involving multiple resources that can be used interchangeably towards the same objective.
papers.abstract_zh: 凭借先进的视频和传感能力，无人驾驶飞行器(UAV)越来越多地用于许多涉及UAV团队协作和自主操作的应用。然而，这些车辆可能会受到网络攻击，影响其任务的可行性。我们提出了一种在网络攻击下进行任务生存能力分析的方法，该方法适用于使用共享一个通信网络的几架无人机的任务。我们将我们的方法应用于野火灭火场景中的调查任务的案例研究。在此背景下，我们展示了我们的方法如何帮助量化攻击对任务性能的预期影响，并确定任务在各种攻击情况下是否仍然可行。我们的方法既可用于任务规划，也可用于任务操作期间的决策。我们使用Petri网对攻击进程和影响分析进行建模的方法也更广泛地适用于涉及多个资源的其他设置，这些资源可以针对同一目标互换使用。
papers.title_zh: 面对网络攻击的无人机任务可行性分析

papers.title: A Secure Cell-Attachment Procedure of LDACS
papers.authors: Nils Mäurer, Thomas Gräupl, Christoph Gentsch, Tobias Guggemos, Marcel Tiepelt, Corinna Schmitt, Gabi Dreo Rodosek
papers.abstract: In Europe the Single European Sky air traffic management master plan foresees the introduction of several modern digital data links for aeronautical communications. The candidate for long-range continental communications is LDACS. LDACS is a cellular, ground-based digital communications system for flight guidance and communications related to safety and regularity of flight. Hence, the aeronautical standards for cybersecurity of the link layer and the network layer apply. In previous works, threat- and risk analyses of LDACS were conducted, a draft for an LDACS cybersecurity architecture was introduced, algorithms proposed, and the security of the Station-to-Station (STS)-based Mutual Authentication and Key Establishment (MAKE) procedure of LDACS formally verified. However, options for cipher-suites and certificate management for LDACS are still missing. This paper proposes a cell-attachment procedure, which establishes a secure LDACS communication channel between an aircraft and corresponding ground-station upon cell-entry of the aircraft, that addresses these shortcomings. It introduces a full cell-attachment protocol including ciphersuites and certificate revocation for LDACS.
papers.abstract_zh: 在欧洲，单一的欧洲空中交通管理总体规划预见到将为航空通信引入若干现代数字数据链。长距离洲际通信的候选是LDACS。LDACS是一种蜂窝、基于地面的数字通信系统，用于飞行导航和与飞行的安全性和规律性相关的通信。因此，链路层和网络层的网络安全航空标准适用。在以前的工作中，进行了LDACS的威胁和风险分析，介绍了LDACS网络安全体系结构的草案，提出了算法，并正式验证了LDACS的基于站对站(STS)的相互认证和密钥建立(MAKE)过程的安全性。然而，用于LDACS的密码套件和证书管理的选项仍然缺失。本文提出了一种小区附着过程，该过程在飞机进入小区时在飞机和相应的地面站之间建立安全的LDACS通信信道，解决了这些缺点。它引入了完整的单元连接协议，包括用于LDACS的密码套件和证书撤销。
papers.title_zh: 一种安全的LDACS细胞附着过程

papers.title: Using Cyber Digital Twins for Automated Automotive Cybersecurity Testing
papers.authors: Stefan Marksteiner, Slava Bronfman, Markus Wolf, Eddie Lazebnik
papers.abstract: Cybersecurity testing of automotive systems has become a practical necessity, with the wide adoption of advanced driving assistance functions and vehicular communications. These functionalities require the integration of information and communication technologies that not only allow for a plethora of on-the-fly configuration abilities, but also provide a huge surface for attacks. Theses circumstances have also been recognized by standardization and regulation bodies, making the need for not only proper cybersecurity engineering but also proving the effectiveness of security measures by verification and validation through testing also a formal necessity. In order to keep pace with the rapidly growing demand of neutral-party security testing of vehicular systems, novel approaches are needed. This paper therefore presents a methodology to create and execute cybersecurity test cases on the fly in a black box setting by using pattern matching-based binary analysis and translation mechanisms to formal attack descriptions as well as model-checking techniques. The approach is intended to generate meaningful attack vectors on a system with next-to-zero a priori knowledge.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着高级驾驶辅助功能和车辆通信的广泛采用，汽车系统的网络安全测试已经成为一种实际需要。这些功能要求集成信息和通信技术，这不仅允许过多的即时配置能力，而且还为攻击提供了巨大的空间。这些情况也得到了标准化和监管机构的认可，使得不仅需要适当的网络安全工程，而且还需要通过测试来验证和确认安全措施的有效性。为了跟上车辆系统的中立方安全测试的快速增长的需求，需要新的方法。因此，本文提出了一种在黑盒环境中动态创建和执行网络安全测试用例的方法，该方法使用基于模式匹配的二进制分析和正式攻击描述的翻译机制以及模型检查技术。该方法旨在利用近乎为零的先验知识在系统上生成有意义的攻击向量。
papers.title_zh: 使用Cyber Digital Twins进行自动化汽车网络安全测试

papers.title: A Model-Driven Methodology for Automotive Cybersecurity Test Case Generation
papers.authors: Stefan Marksteiner, Peter Priller
papers.abstract: Through international regulations (most prominently the latest UNECE regulation) and standards, the already widely perceived higher need for cybersecurity in automotive systems has been recognized and will mandate higher efforts for cybersecurity engineering. The UNECE also demands the effectiveness of these engineering to be verified and validated through testing. This requires both a significantly higher rate and more comprehensiveness of cybersecurity testing that is not effectively to cope with using current, predominantly manual, automotive cybersecurity testing techniques. To allow for comprehensive and efficient testing at all stages of the automotive life cycle, including supply chain parts not at hand, and to facilitate efficient third party testing, as well as to test under real-world conditions, also methodologies for testing the cybersecurity of vehicular systems as a black box are necessary. This paper therefore presents a model and attack tree-based approach to (semi-)automate automotive cybersecurity testing, as well as considerations for automatically black box-deriving models for the use in attack modeling.
papers.abstract_zh: 通过国际法规(最突出的是最新的欧洲经委会法规)和标准，已经广泛认识到汽车系统对网络安全的更高需求，这将要求在网络安全工程方面做出更大努力。联合国欧洲经济委员会还要求通过测试来验证这些工程的有效性。这需要更高的速度和更全面的网络安全测试，而使用当前主要是手动的自动网络安全测试技术无法有效应对。为了允许在汽车生命周期的所有阶段进行全面和有效的测试，包括不在手边的供应链零件，并促进有效的第三方测试，以及在真实世界条件下进行测试，测试作为黑盒的车辆系统的网络安全的方法也是必要的。因此，本文提出了一种基于模型和攻击树的(半)自动化汽车网络安全测试方法，以及用于攻击建模的自动黑盒衍生模型的考虑因素。
papers.title_zh: 一种模型驱动的汽车网络安全测试用例生成方法

papers.title: Privacy and modern cars through a dual lens
papers.authors: Giampaolo Bella, Pietro Biondi, Marco De Vincenzi, Giuseppe Tudisco
papers.abstract: Modern cars technologies are evolving quickly. They collect a variety of personal data and treat it on behalf of the car manufacturer to improve the drivers’ experience. The precise terms of such a treatment are stated within the privacy policies accepted by the user when buying a car or through the infotainment system when it is first started. This paper uses a double lens to assess people’s privacy while they drive a car. The first approach is objective and studies the readability of privacy policies that comes with cars. We analyse the privacy policies of twelve car brands and apply well-known readability indices to evaluate the extent to which privacy policies are comprehensible by all drivers. The second approach targets drivers’ opinions to extrapolate their privacy concerns and trust perceptions. We design a questionnaire to collect the opinions of 88 participants and draw essential statistics about them. Our combined findings indicate that privacy is insufficiently understood at present as an issue deriving from driving a car, hence future technologies should be tailored to make people more aware of the issue and to enable them to express their preferences.
papers.abstract_zh: 现代汽车技术发展迅速。他们收集各种个人数据，并代表汽车制造商处理这些数据，以改善司机的体验。这种待遇的确切条款在用户购买汽车时接受的隐私政策中规定，或者在汽车首次启动时通过信息娱乐系统规定。本文使用双镜头来评估人们开车时的隐私。第一种方法是客观的，研究汽车附带的隐私政策的可读性。我们分析了12个汽车品牌的隐私政策，并应用众所周知的可读性指数来评估隐私政策被所有司机理解的程度。第二种方法针对司机的意见来推断他们的隐私问题和信任感知。我们设计了一份调查问卷来收集88名参与者的意见，并得出了关于他们的基本统计数据。我们的综合研究结果表明，目前隐私作为驾驶汽车产生的问题没有得到充分理解，因此未来的技术应该定制为使人们更加意识到这个问题，并使他们能够表达自己的偏好。
papers.title_zh: 透过双镜头看隐私和现代汽车

papers.title: Exploring Cybercrime Disruption through Laboratory Experiments
papers.authors: Lonie Sebagh, Jonathan Lusthaus, Edoardo Gallo, Federico Varese, Sean Sirur
papers.abstract: This position paper proposes a previously neglected method for investigating cybercrime disruption: laboratory experiments. As a case study for the exploration of this method, it examines slander and Sybil operations against cybercriminal marketplaces. While there has been some scholarly discussion of these interventions, carrying out empirical work on the effectiveness of these tactics is challenging. This position paper reports on a feasibility pilot study, and the results should be viewed as suggestive, rather than conclusive. The paper’s core value is in providing proof of concept for employing this methodology within cybercrime research, and offering insights for future studies of these, or other, disruption tactics.
papers.abstract_zh: 这份立场文件提出了一个以前被忽视的调查网络犯罪破坏的方法:实验室实验。作为探索这种方法的案例研究，它研究了针对网络犯罪市场的诽谤和Sybil操作。虽然对这些干预措施进行了一些学术讨论，但对这些策略的有效性进行实证研究具有挑战性。本立场文件报告了一项可行性试点研究，其结果应被视为建议性的，而非结论性的。这篇论文的核心价值是为在网络犯罪研究中使用这种方法提供概念证明，并为这些或其他破坏策略的未来研究提供见解。
papers.title_zh: 通过实验室实验探索网络犯罪阻断

papers.title: Dissecting Social Engineering Attacks Through the Lenses of Cognition
papers.authors: Pavlo Burda, Luca Allodi, Nicola Zannone
papers.abstract: In this paper we present, showcase, and analize a novel framework to dissect Social Engineering (SE) attacks. The framework is based on extant theories in the cognitive sciences, and is meant as an instrument for researchers and practitioners alike to structure and analyze SE attacks of varying sophistication, isolating specific features and their effects at the cognitive level, and providing a common structure for comparisons across different attacks. We showcase the framework against attacks reproduced in the academic literature as well as against real (highly-targeted) SE attacks reported in the wild, isolating and relating effects and techniques adopted by the attackers to the target’s cognitive process. We discuss implications for research and practice of the proposed framework.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们提出、展示和分析了一个剖析社会工程(se)攻击的新框架。该框架基于认知科学中的现有理论，旨在为研究人员和从业者提供一种工具，以构建和分析不同复杂性的SE攻击，隔离特定特征及其在认知层面的影响，并为不同攻击之间的比较提供一种通用结构。我们展示了针对学术文献中复制的攻击以及针对野外报道的真实(高针对性)se攻击的框架，隔离攻击者采用的效果和技术并将其与目标的认知过程相关联。我们讨论了建议框架对研究和实践的影响。
papers.title_zh: 从认知的角度剖析社会工程攻击

papers.title: Modelling the Cybercrime Cascade Effect in Data Crime
papers.authors: Maria Grazia Porcedda, David S. Wall
papers.abstract: This article contributes to the growing debate about the increasing importance of ‘data’ in modern cybercrime offending. In so doing, it illustrates the linkages between cyber-dependent and cyber-enabled crime bringing into focus the inability of current cybercrime legal categories to reflect such linkages which ultimately reflects how practitioners interpret them. Drawing upon data from court cases the article models the cybercrime cascade effect that results from data crimes. We argue that cybercrime is not a single action, but a process of interconnected social and technical actions in which data from ‘upstream’ cyber-dependent data crimes cascades ‘downstream’ to enable additional cyber-enabled crimes, such as scams, frauds and deceptions. By modelling the various tipping points at which stolen data cascades downstream we increase knowledge about the cybercrime ecosystem to highlight points at which interventions can be more effectively targeted. The ‘cascade effect’ is modelled by using mixed methods from law and criminology which include the “intermediate-N” configurational comparative method. By refining the tipping points of the cascade into decision trees, additional hypotheses, and the identification of the means to test them can be formulated. The article suggests that tipping points occur at each stage of the cascade model, however, the cascade into more crime is not found to be an automatic outcome as more social factors may be involved. Moreover, there exist layers of victimisation, which highlights the need to further research ways to incentivize early-offender interventions. Finally, the article illustrates the complexities of online offending, which include the presence of diverse, distributed and even disorganized actors within organised groups which do not easily fit into the traditional organized crime narrative.
papers.abstract_zh: 这篇文章有助于关于“数据”在现代网络犯罪中日益重要的辩论。在这样做的时候，它说明了依赖网络的犯罪和借助网络的犯罪之间的联系，突出了当前网络犯罪法律类别无法反映这种联系，这最终反映了从业人员如何解释这些联系。根据法院案例的数据，这篇文章对数据犯罪导致的网络犯罪级联效应进行了建模。我们认为，网络犯罪不是一个单一的行动，而是一个相互关联的社会和技术行动的过程，其中来自“上游”依赖网络的数据犯罪的数据级联到“下游”，以支持其他网络犯罪，如诈骗、欺诈和欺骗。通过对被盗数据向下游级联的各种临界点进行建模，我们增加了对网络犯罪生态系统的了解，以突出干预可以更有效地针对的点。“级联效应”通过使用法律和犯罪学的混合方法建模，包括“中间-N”配置比较法。通过将级联的引爆点细化为决策树，可以形成额外的假设，并确定测试它们的方法。文章认为，在级联模型的每一个阶段都会出现临界点，然而，更多犯罪的级联并不是一个自动的结果，因为可能涉及更多的社会因素。此外，存在多层次的受害，这突出表明需要进一步研究激励早期犯罪者干预的方法。最后，文章阐述了网上犯罪的复杂性，其中包括有组织团体中存在各种各样、分散甚至无组织的行为者，这些行为者不容易符合传统的有组织犯罪叙事。
papers.title_zh: 模拟数据犯罪中的网络犯罪级联效应

papers.title: Modelling Disruptive APTs targeting Critical Infrastructure using Military Theory
papers.authors: Yoram J. Meijaard, Peter-Paul Meiler, Luca Allodi
papers.abstract: Disruptive Advanced Persistent Threats (D-APTs) are a new sophisticated class of cyberattacks targeting critical infrastructures. Whereas regular APTs are well-described in the literature, no existing APT kill chain model incorporates the disruptive actions of D-APTs and can be used to represent DAPTs in data. To this aim, the contribution of this paper is twofold: first, we review the evolution of existing APT kill chain models. Second, we present a novel D-APT model based on existing ATP models and military theory. The model describes the strategic objective setting, the operational kill chain and the tactics of the attacker, as well as the defender’s critical infrastructure, processes and societal function.
papers.abstract_zh: 破坏性高级持续威胁(D-APTs)是一种针对关键基础设施的新型复杂网络攻击。尽管常规APT在文献中有很好的描述，但是没有现有的APT杀伤链模型包含D-APT的破坏作用，并且可以用于在数据中表示dapt。为此，本文的贡献有两个方面:首先，我们回顾了现有APT杀伤链模型的发展。其次，基于现有的ATP模型和军事理论，提出了一种新的D-APT模型。该模型描述了攻击者的战略目标设置、作战杀伤链和战术，以及防御者的关键基础设施、流程和社会功能。
papers.title_zh: 使用军事理论模拟针对关键基础设施的破坏性apt

papers.title: Follow the money: The relationship between currency exchange and illicit behaviour in an underground forum
papers.authors: Gilberto Atondo Siu, Ben Collier, Alice Hutchings
papers.abstract: Underground forums are used to discuss and organise cybercrime (as well as more conventional social activities). These forums are also commonly used for exchanging various digital currencies, either gained through the profits of crime or through less controversial means. Understanding the link between discussions of illicit behaviour and currency exchange can provide insights to identify money laundering and other parts of the cybercrime supply chain. In this paper we use natural language processing to classify posts from HackForums by crime type over a period of more than 10 years. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time that this type of classification has been used for this large forum dataset. Although the majority of conversations in the forum were identified as relating to non-criminal discussions, we concentrate on the types of crimes being discussed by those exchanging currencies. We find the most popular topics are related to trading credentials and bots and malware. PayPal was one of the most widely advertised digital currencies and we observe significant displacement from Liberty Reserve to Bitcoin after the former was taken down in 2013. Rather than an explicit ‘cashing out’ mechanism, in which cryptocurrencies gained through crime flow into state-backed fiat currencies, we instead see a circulation of capital between different forms, as cash is held and then cashed back and forward according to movements in the wider currency market. We continue our examination of discussions of cryptocurrencies and explore how the underground market has reacted to new opportunities, with a qualitative case study about Facebook’s putative ‘Diem’ coin. We find that while most discussions are related to the technical details and potential investment opportunities, some potential cybercrime use-cases are raised.
papers.abstract_zh: 地下论坛被用来讨论和组织网络犯罪(以及更传统的社会活动)。这些论坛也通常用于交换各种数字货币，这些货币要么是通过犯罪所得，要么是通过争议较少的手段获得的。了解非法行为讨论与货币兑换之间的联系，有助于识别洗钱和网络犯罪供应链的其他部分。在这篇论文中，我们使用自然语言处理技术对黑客论坛中超过10年的帖子按照犯罪类型进行分类。据我们所知，这是第一次将这种类型的分类用于这个大型论坛数据集。虽然论坛中的大部分对话被认为与非犯罪讨论有关，但我们将重点放在那些兑换货币的人所讨论的犯罪类型上。我们发现最受欢迎的话题与交易凭证、机器人和恶意软件有关。PayPal是广告最广的数字货币之一，我们观察到，在2013年自由储备被取消后，比特币被大量取代。我们看到的不是通过犯罪获得的加密货币流入政府支持的法定货币的明确“套现”机制，而是不同形式之间的资本流通，因为现金被持有，然后根据更广泛的货币市场的变动来回套现。我们继续对加密货币的讨论进行检查，并探索地下市场如何对新机会做出反应，同时对脸书假定的“Diem”硬币进行定性案例研究。我们发现，虽然大多数讨论都与技术细节和潜在投资机会有关，但也提出了一些潜在的网络犯罪使用案例。
papers.title_zh: 追踪金钱:地下论坛中货币兑换和非法行为之间的关系

papers.title: Get Rich or Keep Tryin' Trajectories in dark net market vendor careers
papers.authors: Tim M. Booij, Thijmen Verburgh, Federico Falconieri, Rolf van Wegberg
papers.abstract: Dark net markets are a competitive environment. As these anonymous markets enable criminals to trade illicit goods or services, this causes vendors to operate under pseudonyms, rather than real-world identities. The constant battle between market admins and law enforcement makes the typical lifespan of a market two years. When a market disappears, active vendors migrate to other markets with the intention to continue their business, or have already pro-actively done so in an effort to ensure business continuity. To secure their reputation across markets, they can try to obtain the same pseudonym on multiple markets, but other individuals could beat them to the punch. A much safer method therefore, is to generate a PGP-key and use the public key as identification across markets. This way, vendors signal their continued trustworthy and reputable service on markets to buyers. In this paper, we leverage the use of PGP-keys to map careers of dark net market vendors. We parse and analyze scraped data from over 90 dark net markets (2011-2015), and discern 2,925 unique careers. By employing group based trajectory modelling, a type of latent class analysis, we infer three different career trajectories - differentiating ‘established’, ‘challenger’ and ‘failed’ vendor careers. We show that these trajectories are heavily unbalanced in terms of longevity and success. We find that on average 80% of careers last just four months and generate very little sales. Only a small group (∼2%) of highly successful vendors have a long and uninterrupted career that lasts years and spans multiple markets. This group is also responsible for at least 31% of the total revenue in our data.
papers.abstract_zh: 暗网市场是一个竞争环境。由于这些匿名市场使犯罪分子能够交易非法商品或服务，这导致供应商以假名而非真实身份经营。市场管理者和执法部门之间的持续斗争使得市场的典型寿命为两年。当一个市场消失时，活跃的供应商迁移到其他市场，以继续他们的业务，或者已经主动这样做，以努力确保业务连续性。为了确保他们在市场上的声誉，他们可以尝试在多个市场上获得相同的假名，但其他人可能会抢先一步。因此，更安全的方法是生成PGP密钥，并使用公钥作为跨市场的标识。通过这种方式，供应商向买家表明他们在市场上持续的值得信赖和信誉良好的服务。在本文中，我们利用PGP-keys来映射暗网市场供应商的职业。我们解析和分析了来自90多个暗网市场(2011-2015年)的数据，发现了2，925个独特的职业。通过采用基于群体的轨迹建模，一种潜在类别分析，我们推断出三种不同的职业轨迹——区分“已建立的”、“挑战者”和“失败的”供应商职业。我们表明，这些轨迹在寿命和成功方面严重不平衡。我们发现，平均80%的职业生涯只持续4个月，销售额很低。只有一小部分(2%)非常成功的供应商拥有持续数年、跨越多个市场的长期不间断的职业生涯。在我们的数据中，这一群体还贡献了至少31%的总收入。
papers.title_zh: 变得富有或继续尝试黑暗网络市场供应商职业生涯的轨迹

papers.title: Cybercrime Specialization: An Exposé of a Malicious Android Obfuscation-as-a-Service
papers.authors: Vít Sembera, Masarah Paquet-Clouston, Sebastián García, María José Erquiaga
papers.abstract: Malware authors constantly obfuscate their files and defenders regularly develop new techniques to detect them. Given this cat-and-mouse game, specialized obfuscation services have appeared in the cybercrime industry. These services allow malware authors to obfuscate their code for a fee. This study investigates an automated obfuscation-as-a-service platform for Android applications and yields unique insights on the technical difficulties and business reality of those behind such a specialized service. The service investigated was found to be average in quality, mainly using known obfuscation techniques, and generating obfuscated applications that were still detected by anti-viruses. It had a small clientele of large-scale attackers who used the service to decrease anti-virus detections of highly malicious applications, thus increasing their chances of compromising devices. Depending on the price bundles considered, operators offering the service were estimated to have made a minimum revenue ranging from USD 5,100 (conservative) to USD 61,160 (optimistic) for a six-month operation. This study illustrates that even though obfuscation-as-a-service is a market niche, taking advantage of the value added from this specialization is not effortless nor easily accessible to everyone involved in cybercrime.
papers.abstract_zh: 恶意软件作者不断混淆他们的文件，防御者定期开发新技术来检测它们。鉴于这种猫捉老鼠的游戏，专门的混淆服务已经出现在网络犯罪行业。这些服务允许恶意软件作者付费模糊他们的代码。这项研究调查了Android应用程序的自动化混淆即服务平台，并对这种专业化服务背后的技术困难和业务现实产生了独特的见解。被调查的服务质量一般，主要使用已知的混淆技术，生成的混淆应用程序仍能被反病毒软件检测到。它有一小部分大规模攻击者的客户，他们使用该服务来减少高度恶意应用程序的反病毒检测，从而增加他们危害设备的机会。根据所考虑的价格组合，提供服务的运营商估计六个月运营的最低收入在5，100美元(保守估计)到61，160美元(乐观估计)之间。这项研究表明，尽管模糊处理即服务是一个利基市场，但利用这种专业化带来的附加值对参与网络犯罪的每个人来说并不容易，也不容易。
papers.title_zh: 网络犯罪特殊化:恶意Android混淆即服务的曝光

papers.title: The Impact of Adverse Events in Darknet Markets: an Anomaly Detection Approach
papers.authors: Ziauddin Ursani, Claudia Peersman, Matthew Edwards, Chao Chen, Awais Rashid
papers.abstract: In this paper, the notion of anomaly detection is introduced for the ﬁrst time in the area of darknet markets (DNMs). Our hypothesis is that like popular social media platforms DNMs also exhibit anomalous behaviour. However, we propose that the meaning of anomalies in DNMs differs from social media anomalies. The social media anomalies are a cause of threat to the real world, while DNM anomalies are caused by threats from the real world. We present an unsupervised learning method developed to detect anomalies. The model is based on a weighted sum of a feature set trained through an evolutionary algorithm. Our approach successfully identifies anomalies in 35 DNMs – both at the community level and at the level of its user types. Our analysis shows that most of the anomalies found align with well-known adverse events–either as a direct consequence or as a cascading effect of the root event. Moreover, the model identified additional anomalies, which we were able to link to other events through post hoc analysis. Furthermore, we show that the adverse event of market shutdown generates a two-pronged impact on the ecosystem, i.e., it not only triggers startups of new markets but it does also inflict anomalies to current markets which may become fatal in some cases. We conclude that this two-pronged impact can be exploited by law enforcement agencies to produce maximum disruption in DNMs.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文首次在暗网市场(DNMs)领域引入了异常检测的概念。我们的假设是，像流行的社交媒体平台一样，dnm也表现出异常行为。然而，我们认为DNMs中异常的含义不同于社交媒体异常。社交媒体异常是威胁现实世界的原因，而DNM异常是由来自现实世界的威胁引起的。我们提出了一种无监督学习方法来检测异常。该模型基于通过进化算法训练的特征集的加权和。我们的方法成功地识别了35个dnm中的异常——包括社区级别和用户类型级别。我们的分析表明，发现的大多数异常现象都与众所周知的不良事件有关——要么是根本事件的直接后果，要么是连锁反应。此外，该模型还发现了其他异常现象，我们可以通过事后分析将这些异常现象与其他事件联系起来。此外，我们表明，市场关闭的不利事件对生态系统产生了双重影响，即，它不仅触发了新市场的启动，而且还造成了当前市场的异常，在某些情况下，这可能是致命的。我们的结论是，执法机构可以利用这种双重影响来最大限度地破坏域名管理系统。
papers.title_zh: 暗网市场中不利事件的影响:一种异常检测方法

papers.title: Cybersecurity Test Range for Autonomous Vehicle Shuttles
papers.authors: Andrew Roberts, Olaf Maennel, Nikita Snetkov
papers.abstract: Autonomous vehicle (AV) shuttles for public transportation are challenged by a lack of cybersecurity testing and platforms to conduct testing. Real-world, operational vehicles are expensive and operators are reluctant to test cybersecurity test cases that could impart damage to the systems. Furthermore, despite rigorous regression testing methods used within the broader automotive industry, vulnerabilities of automotive systems are still being found by creative edge and corner cases. To enable testing for edge and corner cases for AV shuttles, we propose the integration of cyber-physical test beds and ranges into the testing program of real-world AV shuttles. We evaluated the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) DuckieBot as the basis for comprehensive cybersecurity vulnerability testing and show how the results can be applied to the iseAuto, a real-world AV shuttle operating in Tallinn, Estonia. The MIT DuckieBot test bed is used to replicate the complexity and interactions of relevant systems of the iseAuto AV shuttle. The practical evaluation, involving cybersecurity edge and corner test cases demonstrated that cyber-physical test beds and ranges can support agile, repeatable cybersecurity testing that is low-cost and is conducted in a controlled and safe environment.
papers.abstract_zh: 用于公共交通的自动驾驶汽车(AV)班车面临着缺乏网络安全测试和测试平台的挑战。现实世界中的作战车辆价格昂贵，运营商不愿意测试可能对系统造成损害的网络安全测试案例。此外，尽管在更广泛的汽车行业中使用了严格的回归测试方法，但汽车系统的漏洞仍然会被创造性的边缘和角落案例发现。为了能够对AV穿梭机的边缘和拐角情况进行测试，我们建议将网络物理测试床和范围集成到真实世界AV穿梭机的测试程序中。我们评估了麻省理工学院(MIT)的DuckieBot作为全面网络安全漏洞测试的基础，并展示了如何将结果应用于iseAuto，这是一个在爱沙尼亚塔林运行的真实世界反病毒航天飞机。麻省理工学院DuckieBot试验台用于复制iseAuto AV shuttle相关系统的复杂性和相互作用。涉及网络安全边缘和角落测试案例的实际评估表明，网络物理测试床和范围可以支持灵活、可重复的网络安全测试，这种测试成本低，并且在受控和安全的环境中进行。
papers.title_zh: 自动驾驶车辆航天飞机的网络安全测试范围

papers.title: Ontology-Based Scenario Modeling for Cyber Security Exercise
papers.authors: Shao-Fang Wen, Muhammad Mudassar Yamin, Basel Katt
papers.abstract: The growing demand for cyber security professionals with practical knowledge is boosting the development and conduct of cyber security exercises around the world. Scenarios stand a central position of the exercise, which sets the stage for later action by providing contextual information that the participants will need during the exercise. To manage the increasing numbers of scenario creation in the different contexts, we propose an ontology to model scenarios for cyber security exercises. This ontology identifies aspects of scenario modeling relevant to cyber security that can be used as a means to achieve a defined taxonomy of knowledge items and a standard vocabulary for cyber scenarios. With the semantic framework based on RDF/OWL, this ontology provides a common structure at a semantic level that allows scenarios to be shared and reused across applications and community boundaries. In this paper, we present the design, implementation, and evaluation of the proposed ontology.
papers.abstract_zh: 对具有实践知识的网络安全专业人员的需求日益增长，推动了世界各地网络安全演习的发展和进行。场景是练习的核心，它通过提供参与者在练习过程中需要的上下文信息，为以后的行动做好准备。为了管理不同环境下不断增加的场景创建，我们提出了一个本体来模拟网络安全演习的场景。该本体确定了与网络安全相关的场景建模的各个方面，这些方面可以作为一种手段来实现知识项目的定义分类和网络场景的标准词汇。有了基于RDF/OWL的语义框架，这个本体在语义层次上提供了一个公共结构，允许跨应用程序和社区边界共享和重用场景。在本文中，我们提出了设计，实现和评估提出的本体。
papers.title_zh: 基于本体的网络安全演习场景建模

papers.title: Success Factors for Designing a Cybersecurity Exercise on the Example of Incident Response
papers.authors: Sten Mäses, Kaie Maennel, Mascia Toussaint, Veronica Rosa
papers.abstract: Exercises are a resource intensive form of providing participants learning, capability testing and validation of plans and procedures. As exercises commonly are used in the field of cybersecurity, their effective and optimal organisation is important. This article aims at identifying key exercise organisation assessment indicators, regardless of exercise type or goal, on the example of cyber incident response exercises. Based on practical experience and literature on crisis management, incident response, and cybersecurity exercises, a 10-step exercise organisation process is identified. For each step, criticalities for the designers and other stakeholders of cyber incident response exercises are identified. These criticalities are also translated in a checklist of actionable indicators aimed at supporting them in measuring the quality of the exercise and implementing an exercise organisation learning loop.
papers.abstract_zh: 练习是一种资源密集型的形式，为参与者提供学习、能力测试以及计划和程序的验证。由于演习通常用于网络安全领域，其有效和最佳的组织非常重要。本文旨在以网络事件响应演习为例，确定演习组织评估的关键指标，而不考虑演习类型或目标。基于危机管理、事件响应和网络安全演习的实践经验和文献，确定了一个10步演习组织流程。对于每一步，设计者和网络事件响应演习的其他利益相关者的关键是确定的。这些关键点也转化为可操作的指标清单，旨在支持他们衡量锻炼质量和实施锻炼组织学习循环。
papers.title_zh: 以事件响应为例设计网络安全演习的成功因素

papers.title: Drivers and Obstacles for the Adoption of Consent Management Solutions by Ad-Tech Providers
papers.authors: Paulina Jo Pesch
papers.abstract: In the world of online marketing, Consent Management Providers (CMPs) are on the rise. CMPs collect online users’ consent to the processing of their personal data by publishers and ad-tech vendors. At the same time, there are reasonable doubts about the compliance of the existing market standard with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). This could potentially create compliance risks for the companies adopting the standard, in particular for ad-tech vendors that – in the pre-CMP era – were invisible to users.This paper reveals drivers and obstacles for the adoption of the Transparency & Consent Framework (TCF) by ad-tech-vendors, gained in semi-structured interviews with representatives of Global Vendors List (GVL) members. Presenting the first qualitative study of ad-tech vendors’ perspectives, the paper provides novel insights into the CMP ecosystem. It particularly shows existing market pressure and reveals ad-tech vendors’ confusion and doubts about the TCF’s compliance with the GDPR.
papers.abstract_zh: 在网络营销领域，同意管理提供商(CMPs)正在崛起。CMP收集在线用户对出版商和广告技术供应商处理其个人数据的同意。与此同时，对于现有市场标准是否符合《一般数据保护条例》(GDPR)有合理的怀疑。这可能会给采用标准的公司带来潜在的合规风险，特别是广告技术供应商，在CMP之前的时代，用户是看不到他们的。本文揭示了广告技术供应商采用透明和同意框架(TCF)的驱动因素和障碍，这些因素是在与全球供应商名单(GVL)成员的代表进行半结构化访谈中获得的。本文首次对广告技术供应商的观点进行了定性研究，提供了对CMP生态系统的新颖见解。它特别显示了现有的市场压力，并揭示了广告技术供应商的困惑和怀疑TCF符合GDPR。
papers.title_zh: 广告技术提供商采用同意管理解决方案的驱动因素和障碍

papers.title: Pragmatic Online Privacy: the SftE Approach
papers.authors: Vitor Jesus
papers.abstract: This position paper presents and proposes new requirements for Privacy and Data Protection. We first raise misalignments of current Privacy regulations and argue that current regulatory approaches do not benefit individuals as much as expected to the point that it primarily shields large organisations from ethical management of personal data. From this assessment, we propose the Start-from-the-End (SftE, pronounced “soft”) approach to online Privacy. It puts the focus on the later stages of the lifecycle of Personal Data (such as the Right to Erasure), while removing focus from the points of collection of personal data. The ultimate goal is to reclaim straightforward enforcement and re-empower individuals in a way that is meant to be feasible and practical.
papers.abstract_zh: 本立场文件提出了隐私和数据保护的新要求。我们首先提出了当前隐私监管的不当之处，并认为当前的监管方法并没有像预期的那样让个人受益，以至于它主要保护大型组织免受个人数据道德管理的影响。根据这一评估，我们提出了“从头到尾”(SftE，发音为“软”)的在线隐私保护方法。它将重点放在个人数据生命周期的后期阶段(如擦除权)，而不是个人数据的收集点。最终目标是以一种可行和实际的方式恢复直接执法和重新授权给个人。
papers.title_zh: 实用的在线隐私:SftE方法

papers.title: Representing Consent and Policies for Compliance
papers.authors: Piero A. Bonatti, Luigi Sauro, Jonathan Langens
papers.abstract: Being compliant with the GDPR (and data protection regulations in general) is a difficult task, that calls for manifold, computer-based automated support. In this context, several use cases related to the management and the enforcement of privacy policies and consent call for a machine-understandable policy language, equipped with reliable algorithms for compliance checking and explanations. In this paper, we outline a set of requirements for such languages and algorithms, and address such requirements with a framework based on a profile of OWL2 and a set of policy serializations based on popular formats such as ODRL and JSON. Such “external” policy syntax is translated into the “internal” OWL2 syntax, thereby enabling semantic compliance checking and explanations using specialized OWL2 reasoners. We provide a precise definition of both the OWL2 profile and the external policy language based on JSON.
papers.abstract_zh: 遵守GDPR(以及一般的数据保护法规)是一项艰巨的任务，需要多方面的、基于计算机的自动化支持。在这种情况下，与隐私政策和同意的管理和执行相关的几个用例需要一种机器可理解的政策语言，配备可靠的算法来进行合规性检查和解释。在本文中，我们概述了对这些语言和算法的一组需求，并使用基于OWL2概要的框架和基于ODRL和JSON等流行格式的一组策略序列化来解决这些需求。这种“外部”策略语法被翻译成“内部”OWL2语法，从而能够使用专门的OWL2推理器进行语义符合性检查和解释。我们提供了OWL2概要文件和基于JSON的外部策略语言的精确定义。
papers.title_zh: 代表同意和遵从政策

papers.title: Visualisation Techniques for Consent: Finding Common Ground in Comic Art with Indigenous Populations
papers.authors: Maria Wilhelmina Botes, Arianna Rossi
papers.abstract: With emerging technologies such as genome research and the digitization of health records comes the need for new models of informed consent. In this climate of innovation people are often prone to explore the latest technological advancement as possible solutions, including for informed consent. In this paper, we present the design and evaluation of a so-called low-tech informed consent solution that was designed specifically for the informational and cultural needs of a vulnerable indigenous population, i.e., the San of South Africa. This low-tech solution took the form of a comic and, although it could enhance understanding and identification, the costs and labour intensity of comic design and the deriving limitations on its scalability should be critically considered in the light of a digitised and more standardized solution.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着基因组研究和健康记录数字化等新兴技术的出现，需要新的知情同意模式。在这种创新的氛围中，人们往往倾向于探索最新的技术进步作为可能的解决方案，包括知情同意。在本文中，我们介绍了一种所谓的低技术含量的知情同意解决方案的设计和评估，这种解决方案是专门为弱势土著人口(即南非的San人)的信息和文化需求而设计的。这种低技术含量的解决方案采用了漫画的形式，虽然它可以增强理解和识别，但漫画设计的成本和劳动强度以及由此产生的对其可扩展性的限制应根据数字化和更标准化的解决方案进行严格考虑。
papers.title_zh: 同意的可视化技术:在漫画艺术中寻找与土著居民的共同点

papers.title: ODRL Profile for Expressing Consent through Granular Access Control Policies in Solid
papers.authors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Víctor Rodríguez-Doncel
papers.abstract: Solid, the emerging technology for organizing data in decentralized stores, relies on a simple authorization mechanism for granting access to data. Solid's personal online datastores (Pods) are ideal for keeping personal data, as they allow individuals to represent the access permissions in a very simple manner using Access Control Language (ACL) expressions. Whereas these expressions suffice for yes/no and read/write permissions, they cannot represent more complex rules nor invoke regulation-specific concepts. This paper describes an extension of the ACL language and algorithm to implement consent and data requests. The extension is based on the Open Digital Rights Language (ODRL) policy language, which allows expressing rich rules, and the Data Privacy Vocabulary (DPV), which permits invoking privacy and data protection-specific terms. Some usage examples illustrate this proposal.
papers.abstract_zh: Solid是在分散存储中组织数据的新兴技术，它依靠一种简单的授权机制来授予对数据的访问权。Solid的个人在线数据存储(Pods)非常适合保存个人数据，因为它们允许个人使用访问控制语言(ACL)表达式以非常简单的方式表示访问权限。虽然这些表达式足以满足是/否和读/写权限，但它们不能表示更复杂的规则，也不能调用特定于法规的概念。本文描述了ACL语言的扩展和实现同意和数据请求的算法。该扩展基于开放数字版权语言(ODRL)策略语言和数据隐私词汇(DPV)，前者允许表达丰富的规则，后者允许调用隐私和数据保护专用术语。一些使用示例说明了这一提议。
papers.title_zh: 用于通过实体中的粒度访问控制策略表达同意的ODRL配置文件

papers.title: Contextuality and Intersectionality of E-Consent: A Human-centric Reflection on Digital Consenting in the Emerging Genetic Data Markets
papers.authors: Soheil Human, Mandan Kazzazi
papers.abstract: Consent plays an essential role in different digital regulations, such as the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). As a result, obtaining consent from data subjects (e.g. end-users or end-customers) are widely practised by many data controllers (e.g. service providers, companies, or organisations). Considering the importance and the widespread practice of consent-obtaining in different domains, critical and interdisciplinary studies of the current consent-obtaining mechanisms are highly needed. In this paper, we first shortly discuss an interdisciplinary human-centric perspective to consenting and propose that, among others, the contextuality of consent, as well as the potential intersectionality of consent, should be carefully considered in the development of consent-obtaining mechanisms. Then we elaborate on the distinction between “consent to personal data processing for commercial purposes” and “consent to personal data donations intended for research” in the field of direct-to-consumer genetic testing (DTC-GT). We show that based on our human-centric perspective, the contextuality and intersectionality of consent are sometimes overlooked in the current DTC-GT services, which are of considerable significance in the emerging genetic data markets. We hope that this paper can contribute towards the development of human-centric, accountable, lawful, and ethical (HALE) sociotechnical information systems dealing with consent and privacy management as fundamental building blocks of a sustainable digital economy.
papers.abstract_zh: 同意在不同的数字法规中扮演着重要的角色，例如欧洲通用数据保护法规(GDPR)。因此，许多数据控制者(如服务提供商、公司或组织)广泛采用从数据主体(如最终用户或最终客户)获得同意的做法。考虑到获得同意在不同领域的重要性和广泛实践，非常需要对当前的获得同意机制进行批判性和跨学科的研究。在本文中，我们首先简要讨论了同意的跨学科的以人为本的观点，并提出，除其他外，同意的背景，以及同意的潜在交叉性，应在同意获取机制的发展中仔细考虑。然后，我们阐述了在直接面向消费者的基因检测(DTC-GT)领域“同意出于商业目的处理个人数据”和“同意用于研究的个人数据捐赠”之间的区别。我们表明，基于我们以人为中心的观点，在当前的DTC-GT服务中，同意的情境性和交叉性有时会被忽略，这在新兴的遗传数据市场中具有相当重要的意义。我们希望本文能有助于开发以人为本、负责任、合法且符合道德的(HALE)社会技术信息系统，将同意和隐私管理作为可持续数字经济的基本组成部分。
papers.title_zh: 电子同意的情境性和交叉性:对新兴基因数据市场中数字同意的以人为中心的思考

papers.title: TIRA: An OpenAPI Extension and Toolbox for GDPR Transparency in RESTful Architectures
papers.authors: Elias Grünewald, Paul Wille, Frank Pallas, Maria C. Borges, Max-Robert Ulbricht
papers.abstract: Transparency – the provision of information about what personal data is collected for which purposes, how long it is stored, or to which parties it is transferred – is one of the core privacy principles underlying regulations such as the GDPR. Technical approaches for implementing transparency in practice are, however, only rarely considered. In this paper, we present a novel approach for doing so in current, RESTful application architectures and in line with prevailing agile and DevOps-driven practices. For this purpose, we introduce 1) a transparency-focused extension of OpenAPI specifications that allows individual service descriptions to be enriched with transparency-related annotations in a bottom-up fashion and 2) a set of higher-order tools for aggregating respective information across multiple, interdependent services and for coherently integrating our approach into automated CI/CD-pipelines. Together, these building blocks pave the way for providing transparency information that is more specific and at the same time better reflects the actual implementation givens within complex service architectures than current, overly broad privacy statements.
papers.abstract_zh: 透明度——提供关于出于何种目的收集哪些个人数据、存储多长时间或传输给哪些方的信息——是《GDPR》等法规背后的核心隐私原则之一。然而，很少考虑在实践中实现透明度的技术方法。在本文中，我们提出了一种在当前RESTful应用架构中实现这一点的新方法，并且符合流行的敏捷和DevOps驱动的实践。为此，我们引入了OpenAPI规范的一个以透明性为中心的扩展，它允许以自下而上的方式用透明性相关的注释来丰富单个服务的描述，以及2)一组高阶工具，用于在多个相互依赖的服务之间聚合各自的信息，并用于将我们的方法一致地集成到自动化CI/CD管道中。总之，这些构件为提供更具体的透明信息铺平了道路，同时比当前过于宽泛的隐私声明更好地反映了复杂服务架构中的实际实现。
papers.title_zh: TIRA:用于RESTful架构中GDPR透明性的OpenAPI扩展和工具箱

papers.title: Privacy Considerations for Risk-Based Authentication Systems
papers.authors: Stephan Wiefling, Jan Tolsdorf, Luigi Lo Iacono
papers.abstract: Risk-based authentication (RBA) extends authentication mechanisms to make them more robust against account takeover attacks, such as those using stolen passwords. RBA is recommended by NIST and NCSC to strengthen password-based authentication, and is already used by major online services. Also, users consider RBA to be more usable than two-factor authentication and just as secure. However, users currently obtain RBA’s high security and usability benefits at the cost of exposing potentially sensitive personal data (e.g., IP address or browser information). This conflicts with user privacy and requires to consider user rights regarding the processing of personal data. We outline potential privacy challenges regarding different attacker models and propose improvements to balance privacy in RBA systems. To estimate the properties of the privacy-preserving RBA enhancements in practical environments, we evaluated a subset of them with long-term data from 780 users of a real-world online service. Our results show the potential to increase privacy in RBA solutions. However, it is limited to certain parameters that should guide RBA design to protect privacy. We outline research directions that need to be considered to achieve a widespread adoption of privacy preserving RBA with high user acceptance.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于风险的身份验证(RBA)扩展了身份验证机制，使其更能抵御帐户盗用攻击，例如使用窃取密码的攻击。RBA由NIST和NCSC推荐，用于加强基于密码的身份验证，并且已经被主要的在线服务使用。此外，用户认为RBA比双因素身份认证更有用，而且同样安全。但是，用户目前获得RBA的高安全性和可用性优势的代价是暴露潜在的敏感个人数据(例如，IP地址或浏览器信息)。这与用户隐私相冲突，并且需要考虑关于个人数据处理的用户权利。我们概述了不同攻击者模型的潜在隐私挑战，并提出了RBA系统中平衡隐私的改进措施。为了在实际环境中评估隐私保护RBA增强的属性，我们使用来自真实世界在线服务的780个用户的长期数据评估了它们的子集。我们的结果显示了RBA解决方案中增加隐私的潜力。但是，它仅限于指导RBA设计以保护隐私的某些参数。我们概述了需要考虑的研究方向，以实现隐私保护RBA的广泛采用和高用户接受度。
papers.title_zh: 基于风险的认证系统的隐私考虑

papers.title: Towards Explaining Epsilon: A Worst-Case Study of Differential Privacy Risks
papers.authors: Luise Mehner, Saskia Nuñez von Voigt, Florian Tschorsch
papers.abstract: Differential privacy is a concept to quantity the disclosure of private information that is controlled by the privacy parameter $\varepsilon$. However, an intuitive interpretation of $\varepsilon$ is needed to explain the privacy loss to data engineers and data subjects. In this paper, we conduct a worst-case study of differential privacy risks. We generalize an existing model and reduce complexity to provide more understandable statements on the privacy loss. To this end, we analyze the impact of parameters and introduce the notion of a global privacy risk and global privacy leak.
papers.abstract_zh: 差分隐私是一个量化隐私信息公开的概念，由隐私参数$\varepsilon$控制。但是，需要对$\varepsilon$进行直观的解释，以便向数据工程师和数据主体解释隐私损失。在本文中，我们进行了最坏情况下的差异隐私风险的研究。我们推广了现有的模型，降低了复杂性，以提供更容易理解的隐私损失的陈述。为此，我们分析了参数的影响，并引入了全局隐私风险和全局隐私泄露的概念。
papers.title_zh: 解释Epsilon:不同隐私风险的最坏情况研究

papers.title: A Model-based Approach to Realize Privacy and Data Protection by Design
papers.authors: Gabriel Pedroza, Victor Muntés-Mulero, Yod Samuel Martín, Guillaume Mockly
papers.abstract: Telecommunications and data are pervasive in almost each aspect of our every-day life and new concerns progressively arise as a result of stakes related to privacy and data protection [1]. Indeed, systems development becomes data-centric leading to an ecosystem where a variety of players intervene (citizens, industry, regulators) and where the policies regarding data usage and utilization are far from consensual. The new General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) enacted by the European Commission in 2018 has introduced new provisions including principles for lawfulness, fairness, transparency, etc. thus endorsing data subjects with new rights in regards to their personal data. In this context, a growing need for approaches that conceptualize and help engineers to integrate GDPR and privacy provisions at design time becomes paramount. This paper presents a comprehensive approach to support different phases of the design process with special attention to the integration of privacy and data protection principles. Among others, it is a generic model-based approach that can be specialized according to the specifics of different application domains.
papers.abstract_zh: 电信和数据渗透到我们日常生活的几乎每一个方面，由于与隐私和数据保护相关的风险，新的问题逐渐出现[1]。事实上，系统开发变得以数据为中心，导致了一个生态系统，其中各种参与者(公民、行业、监管机构)都参与其中，并且关于数据使用和利用的政策远非一致。欧盟委员会于2018年颁布的新《通用数据保护条例(GDPR)》引入了新的规定，包括合法、公平、透明等原则。从而认可数据主体关于其个人数据的新权利。在这种背景下，越来越需要概念化和帮助工程师在设计时集成GDPR和隐私条款的方法变得至关重要。本文介绍了一种全面的方法来支持设计过程的不同阶段，并特别关注隐私和数据保护原则的集成。其中，它是一种通用的基于模型的方法，可以根据不同应用领域的具体情况进行专门化。
papers.title_zh: 基于模型的隐私和数据保护设计方法

papers.title: Quantitative Privacy Risk Analysis
papers.authors: R. Jason Cronk, Stuart S. Shapiro
papers.abstract: Most privacy risk assessment methodologies are homegrown and qualitative. Numerical models generally involve largely arbitrary quantifications. FAIR, a quantitative risk model for information security related risks, can be modified for privacy, providing more meaningful measurements and supporting comparison of risks of similar scenarios with varying controls to organizational tolerances.
papers.abstract_zh: 大多数隐私风险评估方法都是自主开发的定性方法。数字模型通常包含大量任意的量化。FAIR是一种针对信息安全相关风险的量化风险模型，可以针对隐私进行修改，从而提供更有意义的衡量标准，并支持对具有不同组织容忍度控制的类似场景的风险进行比较。
papers.title_zh: 定量隐私风险分析

papers.title: An Overview of Runtime Data Protection Enforcement Approaches
papers.authors: Laurens Sion, Dimitri Van Landuyt, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: A regulatory framework such as the GDPR succeeds in (i) providing clarity about the nature and the reach of fundamental rights to data privacy and the sovereign role of the data subject, (ii) raising broader awareness of the substantial impact of large-scale, contemporary software-intensive data processing operations on these rights and freedoms, and (iii) creating urgency and imposing gravity, by forcing organizations to take these rights and fundamental principles seriously in a proactive manner. However, regulatory frameworks lack clarity on how these concerns are to be enacted. For example, guidance is lacking on how software should be constructed to consider these data protection principles by design and by default. In this paper, we argue how the direct translation of the GDPR data protection principles into design or code falls short in the context of contemporary software systems, which are both more dynamic and nature and rely on an increasing number of complex inter-organizational collaborations. This means that in such a system, data protection decisions cannot be ‘hard-coded’ but will have to be decided at run time. In addition, we provide an overview of promising existing approaches that contribute to the accomplishment of these fundamental data protection principles at run time.
papers.abstract_zh: GDPR等监管框架成功地(一)阐明了数据隐私基本权利的性质和范围以及数据主体的主权作用，(二)提高了对大规模、现代软件密集型数据处理操作对这些权利和自由的重大影响的更广泛认识，以及(三)通过迫使组织以积极主动的方式认真对待这些权利和基本原则，创造了紧迫性并施加了严重性。然而，监管框架对如何实施这些关切缺乏明确性。例如，缺乏关于如何构建软件以在设计和默认情况下考虑这些数据保护原则的指导。在本文中，我们讨论了在当代软件系统的背景下，如何将GDPR数据保护原则直接转化为设计或代码，当代软件系统更加动态和自然，并依赖于越来越多的复杂的组织间合作。这意味着在这样的系统中，数据保护决策不能“硬编码”,而必须在运行时决定。此外，我们还概述了有希望的现有方法，这些方法有助于在运行时实现这些基本的数据保护原则。
papers.title_zh: 运行时数据保护实施方法概述

papers.title: How Standards Co-Shape Personal Data Protection in the European Banking Sector
papers.authors: Ine van Zeeland, Jo Pierson
papers.abstract: Attention for the protection of personal data has increased in recent years, but the preponderance of privacy-related scandals shows there is still a clear need for practical guidance. Companies and industries often argue for guidance in the form of standards, which are thought to have several benefits, such as creating a level playing field internationally, promoting interoperability, and allowing for straightforward conformity assessments. Conversely, standards may create confusion as to what “the rules” are if they are not fully aligned with laws, for instance when international standards and national laws govern the same practices. Given these pros and cons, to what extent do standards provide clarity and practical support in the protection of personal data? This paper explores that question through an evaluation of findings on standards in an ethnographic study of the European banking sector. The purpose of the study was to find factors that influence the protection of personal data “on the ground”, with standards potentially being one of those factors.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，对个人数据保护的关注有所增加，但与隐私相关的丑闻占主导地位，这表明仍然明显需要实际指导。公司和行业经常主张以标准的形式提供指导，这被认为有几个好处，例如在国际上创造一个公平的竞争环境，促进互操作性，以及允许直接的一致性评估。相反，如果标准与法律不完全一致，例如当国际标准和国家法律管辖同样的做法时，标准可能会对什么是“规则”造成混淆。考虑到这些利弊，标准在多大程度上为保护个人数据提供了明确性和实际支持？本文通过对欧洲银行业人种学研究中标准的评估来探讨这个问题。这项研究的目的是找出影响“实地”个人数据保护的因素，标准可能是这些因素之一。
papers.title_zh: 标准如何共同塑造欧洲银行业的个人数据保护

papers.title: Structural Attacks on Local Routing in Payment Channel Networks
papers.authors: Ben Weintraub, Cristina Nita-Rotaru
papers.abstract: Payment channel networks (PCN) enable scalable blockchain transactions without fundamentally changing the underlying distributed ledger algorithm. However, routing a payment via multiple channels in a PCN requires locking collateral for potentially long periods of time. Adversaries can abuse this mechanism to conduct denial-of-service attacks. Previous work focused on source routing, which is unlikely to remain a viable routing approach as these networks grow. In this work, we examine the effectiveness of attacks in PCNs that use routing algorithms based on local knowledge, where compromised intermediate nodes can delay or drop transactions to create denial-of-service. We focus on SpeedyMurmurs as a representative of such protocols. We identify two attacker node selection strategies; one based on the position in the routing tree, and the other on between-ness centrality. Our simulation-driven study shows that while they are both effective, the centrality-based attack approaches near-optimal effectiveness. We also show that the attacks are ineffective in less centralized networks and discuss incentives for the participants in PCNs to create less centralized topologies through the payment channels they establish among themselves.
papers.abstract_zh: 支付通道网络(PCN)支持可扩展的区块链交易，而无需从根本上改变底层分布式分类帐算法。但是，在PCN中通过多种渠道进行支付需要长期锁定抵押品。对手可以滥用这种机制进行拒绝服务攻击。以前的工作集中在源路由上，随着这些网络的增长，源路由不太可能继续作为一种可行的路由方法。在这项工作中，我们研究了PCN中使用基于本地知识的路由算法的攻击的有效性，其中受损害的中间节点可以延迟或丢弃事务以创建拒绝服务。我们着重研究SpeedyMurmurs作为这类协议的代表。我们确定了两种攻击者节点选择策略；一个基于路由树中的位置，另一个基于中间中心性。我们的模拟驱动研究表明，虽然它们都是有效的，但基于中心性的攻击接近最佳效果。我们还证明了攻击在不太集中的网络中是无效的，并讨论了PCN中的参与者通过他们之间建立的支付通道来创建不太集中的拓扑的动机。
papers.title_zh: 支付通道网络中局部路由的结构性攻击

papers.title: ProMutator: Detecting Vulnerable Price Oracles in DeFi by Mutated Transactions
papers.authors: Shih-Hong Wang, Chia-Chien Wu, Yu-Chuan Liang, Li-Hsun Hsieh, Hsu-Chun Hsiao
papers.abstract: This paper presents ProMutator, a scalable security analysis framework that detects price oracle vulnerabilities before attacks occur. ProMutator’s core idea is to simulate price oracle attacks locally by mutating the data needed for price calculation. ProMutator analyzes existing transactions to reconstruct probable DeFi use patterns, thereby reducing the required simulation runs drastically. ProMutator does not require any examined contracts’ high-level source code. Additionally, ProMutator generates a report for each detected vulnerability to facilitate further investigation. In our evaluation, ProMutator successfully discovered five out of six known and 27 new price oracle vulnerabilities in DeFi protocols. Index Terms—DeFi, price oracle, price oracle attack
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了ProMutator，这是一个可扩展的安全分析框架，可以在攻击发生之前检测出price oracle漏洞。ProMutator的核心思想是通过变异价格计算所需的数据，在本地模拟price oracle攻击。ProMutator分析现有的交易，以重建可能的违约模式，从而大幅减少所需的模拟运行。ProMutator不需要任何被检查的契约的高级源代码。此外，ProMutator会为每个检测到的漏洞生成一份报告，以便于进一步调查。在我们的评估中，ProMutator成功发现了DeFi协议中六个已知漏洞中的五个和27个新的price oracle漏洞。指数术语—DeFi、价格预测、价格预测攻击
papers.title_zh: 提示者:通过变异交易检测DeFi中易受攻击的价格预言

papers.title: Publicly Auditable MPC-as-a-Service with succinct verification and universal setup
papers.authors: Sanket Kanjalkar, Ye Zhang, Shreyas Gandlur, Andrew Miller
papers.abstract: In recent years, multiparty computation as a service (MPCaaS) has gained popularity as a way to build distributed privacy-preserving systems like blockchain trusted parameter setup ceremonies, and digital asset auctions. We argue that for many such applications, we should also require that the MPC protocol is publicly auditable, meaning that anyone can check the given computation is carried out correctly – even if the server nodes carrying out the computation are all corrupt. In a nutshell, the way to make an MPC protocol auditable is to combine an underlying MPC protocol with a verifiable computing proof (in particular, a SNARK). Building a general purpose MPCaaS from existing constructions would require us to perform a costly “trusted setup” every time we wish to run a new or modified application. To address this, we provide the first efficient construction for auditable MPC that has a one time universal setup. Despite improving the trusted setup, we match the state-of-the-art in asymptotic performance: the nodes incur a linear computation overhead and constant round communication overhead compared to the underlying MPC, and the audit size and verification are logarithmic in the application circuit size. We also provide an implementation and benchmarks that support our asymptotic analysis in example applications. Furthermore, compared with existing auditable MPC protocols, besides offering a universal setup our construction also has a 3x smaller proof, 3x faster verification time and comparable prover time.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，多方计算即服务(MPCaaS)作为一种构建分布式隐私保护系统(如区块链可信参数设置仪式和数字资产拍卖)的方式，已经越来越受欢迎。我们认为，对于许多这样的应用，我们还应该要求MPC协议是公开可审计的，这意味着任何人都可以检查给定的计算是否正确执行——即使执行计算的服务器节点都已损坏。简而言之，使MPC协议可审计的方法是将底层MPC协议与可验证的计算证明(特别是SNARK)相结合。每次我们希望运行一个新的或修改过的应用程序时，从现有的结构中构建一个通用的MPCaaS将需要我们执行一个昂贵的“可信设置”。为了解决这个问题，我们为可审计的MPC提供了第一个有效的结构，它具有一次性的通用设置。尽管改进了可信设置，但我们在渐近性能上与最先进的技术相匹配:与底层MPC相比，节点招致线性计算开销和恒定的循环通信开销，并且审计大小和验证在应用电路大小上是对数的。我们还提供了一个实现和基准来支持我们在示例应用中的渐近分析。此外，与现有的可审计MPC协议相比，除了提供通用设置之外，我们的构造还具有3倍小的证明、3倍快的验证时间和可比的校准时间。
papers.title_zh: 可公开审计的MPC即服务，具有简洁的验证和通用的设置

papers.title: Modeling the Block Verification Time of Zcash
papers.authors: Fabian Stiehle, Erik Daniel, Florian Tschorsch
papers.abstract: An important aspect of the propagation delay in blockchain networks is the block verification time, which is also responsible for the so-called verifier’s dilemma. Models for the block verification time can help to understand and improve the verification process. Moreover, modeling the verification time is necessary for blockchain network simulations. In this paper, we present JOIST, a new model for the block verification time of Zcash. We identify computationally complex operations in the verification process of Zcash, and derive our model based on characteristic transaction features. We evaluate JOIST and show that the model is consistently more accurate than existing models, which consider the block size only.
papers.abstract_zh: 区块链网络中传播延迟的一个重要方面是块验证时间，这也是所谓的验证者困境的原因。块验证时间的模型可以帮助理解和改进验证过程。此外，模拟验证时间对于区块链网络模拟是必要的。本文提出了一种新的Zcash的块验证时间模型——托梁。我们在Zcash的验证过程中识别计算复杂的操作，并基于典型的交易特征导出我们的模型。我们评估托梁，并表明该模型始终比现有模型更准确，现有模型只考虑块大小。
papers.title_zh: Zcash的块验证时间建模

papers.title: An Investigation of Online Reverse Engineering Community Discussions in the Context of Ghidra
papers.authors: Daniel Votipka, Mary Nicole Dugay Punzalan, Seth M. Rabin, Yla R. Tausczik, Michelle L. Mazurek
papers.abstract: Reverse engineering is a complex task. As with many other expert tasks, reverse engineers rely on colleagues and the broader reverse engineering community to provide guidance and develop knowledge necessary to achieve their goals. For example, it is common for reverse engineers to reach out for help to understand and effectively use new tools. Thus far, however, there has been limited investigation of the way knowledge is developed in this community and new tools are adopted. This paper takes a first step toward understanding reverse engineering community dynamics around tool adoption, using the release of the National Security Agency's Ghidra reverse engineering framework as a point of focus. In this paper, we review discussions about Ghidra to identify what features reverse engineers are most interested in, how reverse engineers develop knowledge about Ghidra together online, and whether these dynamics differ between forums. In total, we analyze 1590 reverse engineering discussions between 688 reverse engineers over 3 forums (i.e., Twitter, Reddit, and StackExchange). Our results suggest reverse engineers are most interested in features that allow them to customize Ghidra. We also observe limited evidence of collective sensemaking on the forums, with few reverse engineers participating in multiple discussions threads and most acting as either knowledge producers or consumers. Finally, we found that the forums operated similarly, but Twitter was most often used to announce information (e.g., tutorial links, tool overviews, vulnerabilities in Ghidra) and reverse engineers used StackExchange mostly to get support for specific problems. Reddit acted as a middle option. Based on these results, we make recommendations to improve reverse engineering tool development, improve community participation during adoption, and suggest directions for future work.
papers.abstract_zh: 逆向工程是一项复杂的任务。与许多其他专家任务一样，逆向工程师依赖同事和更广泛的逆向工程社区来提供指导，并开发实现其目标所必需的知识。例如，逆向工程师寻求帮助来理解和有效地使用新工具是很常见的。然而，到目前为止，对这个社区中知识发展的方式和新工具的采用的调查是有限的。本文以美国国家安全局发布的Ghidra逆向工程框架为重点，向理解逆向工程社区在工具采用方面的动态迈出了第一步。在本文中，我们回顾了关于Ghidra的讨论，以确定逆向工程师最感兴趣的功能，逆向工程师如何在线开发关于Ghidra的知识，以及这些动态是否因论坛而异。我们总共分析了688名逆向工程师在3个论坛(即Twitter、Reddit和StackExchange)上的1590次逆向工程讨论。我们的结果表明，逆向工程师对允许他们定制Ghidra的功能最感兴趣。我们还在论坛上观察到有限的集体意义创造的证据，很少有逆向工程师参与多个讨论线程，大多数充当知识生产者或消费者。最后，我们发现论坛的运行方式类似，但Twitter最常用于发布信息(例如教程链接、工具概述、Ghidra中的漏洞)，逆向工程师主要使用StackExchange来获得对特定问题的支持。Reddit充当了一个中间选项。基于这些结果，我们提出了改进逆向工程工具开发的建议，提高了采用过程中的社区参与，并为未来的工作提出了方向。
papers.title_zh: Ghidra环境下在线逆向工程社区讨论调查

papers.title: Countering Concurrent Login Attacks in "Just Tap" Push-based Authentication: A Redesign and Usability Evaluations
papers.authors: Jay Prakash, Clarice Chua Qing Yu, Tanvi Ravindra Thombre, Andrei Bytes, Mohammed Jubur, Nitesh Saxena, Lucienne Blessing, Jianying Zhou, Tony Q. S. Quek
papers.abstract: In this paper, we highlight a fundamental vulnerability associated with the widely adopted “Just Tap” push-based authentication in the face of a concurrency attack, and propose the method REPLICATE, a redesign to counter this vulnerability. In the concurrency attack, the attacker launches the login session at the same time the user initiates a session, and the user may be fooled, with high likelihood, into accepting the push notification which corresponds to the attacker's session, thinking it is their own. The attack stems from the fact that the login notification is not explicitly mapped to the login session running on the browser in the Just Tap approach. REPLICATE attempts to address this fundamental flaw by having the user approve the login attempt by replicating the information presented on the browser session over to the login notification, such as by moving a key in a particular direction, choosing a particular shape, etc. We report on the design and a systematic usability study of REPLICATE. Even without being aware of the vulnerability, in general, participants placed multiple variants of REPLICATE in competition to the Just Tap and fairly above PIN-based authentication.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们强调了一个与广泛采用的“只需点击”的基于推送的身份验证在面对并发攻击时相关的基本漏洞，并提出了REPLICATE方法，这是一种针对此漏洞的重新设计。在并发攻击中，攻击者在用户启动会话的同时启动登录会话，用户很有可能被愚弄，接受与攻击者的会话相对应的推送通知，认为这是他们自己的。该攻击源于这样一个事实，即在Just Tap方法中，登录通知没有显式映射到浏览器上运行的登录会话。REPLICATE试图通过将浏览器会话上呈现的信息复制到登录通知，例如通过在特定方向上移动按键、选择特定形状等，让用户批准登录尝试，来解决这一基本缺陷。我们报告的设计和系统的可用性研究的复制。即使没有意识到这个漏洞，一般来说，参与者放置了多个复制的变体来与Just Tap竞争，并且完全高于基于PIN的认证。
papers.title_zh: 在“只需点击”基于推送的认证中对抗并发登录攻击:重新设计和可用性评估

papers.title: SoK: Context Sensing for Access Control in the Adversarial Home IoT
papers.authors: Weijia He, Valerie Zhao, Olivia Morkved, Sabeeka Siddiqui, Earlence Fernandes, Josiah D. Hester, Blase Ur
papers.abstract: In smart homes, access-control policies increasingly depend on contexts, such as who is taking an action, whether there is an emergency, or whether an adult is nearby. The vast literature on context sensing could potentially be leveraged to support contextual access control, yet this literature mostly ignores attacks, adversaries, and privacy. In this paper, we reevaluate the literature on home context sensing through a security and privacy mindset. We first describe a novel threat model in smart homes focusing on the capabilities of non-technical adversaries. Replay, imitation, and shoulder-surfing attacks are much more likely in this model. We summarize contexts relevant to access control in homes, mapping them to existing sensors. We then systematize the sensing literature to construct a decision framework for home context sensing that considers security, privacy, and usability. Applying our framework, we find that current sensors do not fully mitigate likely threats in homes. Some sensors are susceptible to simple threats like physical denial-of-service attacks, making it easy to bypass policies relying on the absence of a characteristic. Many sensors collect more data than needed and are not effective for all groups of users or under all situations.
