The work is part of an ongoing investigation on integrating detective defences into applications through established development practices.
papers.abstract_zh: 应用程序异常是应用程序中发生的异常事件。这些可能是由常见问题引起的，例如简单的编程错误；然而，它们也可能源于主动攻击中使用的试错过程的副作用。利用攻击者引发的异常作为入侵检测的金丝雀已被证明是一种可行的SQL注入检测技术，但这还没有应用于其他类型的攻击。本文提出了一种将攻击者引发的应用程序异常视为攻击金丝雀的方法。这项工作是一项正在进行的调查的一部分，该调查旨在通过既定的开发实践将检测防御集成到应用程序中。
papers.title_zh: 海报:愤怒的观鸟:将应用程序异常评估为攻击金丝雀

papers.title: Poster: DyPolDroid: User-Centered Counter-Policies Against Android Permission-Abuse Attacks
papers.authors: Matthew Hill, Carlos E. Rubio-Medrano, Luis Claramunt, Jaejong Baek, Gail-Joon Ahn
papers.abstract: Android applications are extremely popular, as they are used for banking, social media, e-commerce, etc. However, several malicious applications have recently carried out data leaks and spurious credit card charges by abusing the Android Permissions granted initially to them by unaware users in good faith. To alleviate this pressing concern, we present DyPolDroid, a dynamic, semi-automated security framework that builds upon Android Enterprise, a device-management framework for organizations, allowing for users to design and enforce custom Counter-Policies, effectively protecting against such malicious applications without requiring advanced security and/or technical expertise.
papers.abstract_zh: Android应用程序非常受欢迎，因为它们用于银行、社交媒体、电子商务等。然而，一些恶意应用程序最近通过滥用最初由不知情的用户善意授予他们的Android权限，进行了数据泄露和虚假的信用卡收费。为了缓解这种迫切的担忧，我们提出了DyPolDroid，这是一种动态的半自动安全框架，构建于Android Enterprise之上，Android Enterprise是一种面向组织的设备管理框架，允许用户设计和实施定制的应对策略，有效地防范此类恶意应用程序，而无需高级安全和/或技术专业知识。
papers.title_zh: 海报:DyPolDroid:针对Android权限滥用攻击的以用户为中心的对策

papers.title: Poster: FLATEE: Federated Learning Across Trusted Execution Environments
papers.authors: Arup Mondal, Yash More, Ruthu Hulikal Rooparaghunath, Debayan Gupta
papers.abstract: Federated learning allows us to distributively train a machine learning model where multiple parties share local model parameters without sharing private data. However, parameter exchange may still leak information. Several approaches have been proposed to overcome this, based on multi-party computation, fully homomorphic encryption, etc.; many of these protocols are slow and impractical for real-world use as they involve a large number of cryptographic operations. In this paper, we propose the use of Trusted Execution Environments (TEE), which provide a platform for isolated execution of code and handling of data, for this purpose. We describe Flatee, an efficient privacy-preserving federated learning framework across TEEs, which considerably reduces training and communication time. Our framework can handle malicious parties (we do not natively solve adversarial data poisoning, though we describe a preliminary approach to handle this).
papers.abstract_zh: 联合学习允许我们分布式地训练机器学习模型，其中多方共享本地模型参数，而不共享私有数据。但是，参数交换仍然可能会泄漏信息。基于多方计算、全同态加密等，已经提出了几种方法来克服这个问题。；这些协议中的许多对于真实世界的使用是缓慢且不切实际的，因为它们涉及大量的密码运算。在本文中，我们建议使用可信执行环境(TEE ),它为代码的隔离执行和数据的处理提供了一个平台。我们描述了Flatee，一个跨tee的有效的隐私保护联合学习框架，它大大减少了培训和交流时间。我们的框架可以处理恶意方(虽然我们描述了处理这种情况的初步方法，但我们并没有自然地解决敌对数据中毒)。
papers.title_zh: 海报:FLATEE:跨可信执行环境的联合学习

papers.title: Poster: Obfuscation Revealed - Using Electromagnetic Emanation to Identify and Classify Malware
papers.authors: Duy-Phuc Pham, Damien Marion, Annelie Heuser
papers.abstract: In this poster we present a novel approach of using side channel information to identify the kinds of malware threats that are targeting IoT devices. Although in the presence of obfuscation techniques that can prevent static or symbolic binary analysis, a malware researcher may obtain detailed information about malware type and identification using our method by leveraging side channel by electromagnetism rather than software-layer malware analysis. By capturing 100,000 measurement traces from an IoT system infected with different malware samples, we can obtain this information without altering the actual hardware. As a result, it can be implemented without any overhead, regardless of the resources available. Furthermore, our method has the advantage of non-trivial for malware authors to avoid. We were able to distinguish malware families based on side-channel knowledge without being able to see what exact hardware was involved. We were able to predict three generic malware forms (and one benign class) with a 99.89% percent accuracy in our tests. Furthermore, our results show that we are able to classify altered malware samples with unseen obfuscation techniques during the training phase, and to determine what kind of obfuscations, which makes our approach particularly useful for malware analysts.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这张海报中，我们展示了一种使用辅助渠道信息来识别针对物联网设备的恶意软件威胁的新方法。虽然存在可以防止静态或符号二进制分析的混淆技术，但是恶意软件研究人员可以通过利用电磁旁路而不是软件层恶意软件分析，使用我们的方法来获得关于恶意软件类型和识别的详细信息。通过从感染了不同恶意软件样本的物联网系统中捕获100，000条测量痕迹，我们可以在不改变实际硬件的情况下获得这些信息。因此，它可以在没有任何开销的情况下实现，而不考虑可用的资源。此外，我们的方法具有恶意软件作者要避免的非平凡的优点。我们能够根据旁门左道的知识来区分恶意软件家族，而不知道具体涉及到什么硬件。在我们的测试中，我们能够以99.89%的准确率预测三种一般恶意软件形式(和一种良性类别)。此外，我们的结果表明，我们能够在训练阶段使用看不见的混淆技术对改变的恶意软件样本进行分类，并确定哪种混淆，这使得我们的方法对恶意软件分析师特别有用。
papers.title_zh: 海报:混淆揭示-使用电磁辐射来识别和分类恶意软件

papers.title: Poster: Preventing Spatial and Privacy Attacks in Mobile Augmented Reality Technologies
papers.authors: Luis Claramunt, Larissa Pokam Epse, Carlos E. Rubio-Medrano, Jaejong Baek, Gail-Joon Ahn
papers.abstract: The growing popularity of applications featuring Mobile Augmented Reality (MAR) raises serious concerns regarding the use of such a game-changing technology inside sensitive physical spaces, e.g., memorials, hospitals, museums, etc., such that the safety and privacy of users is preserved. To address such concerns, we present our ongoing work for mediating the way MAR Content, e.g., digital objects rendered on top of a video stream, is generated, distributed, and consumed by applications. We introduce a theoretical model, a supporting framework, as well as SpaceMediator, a proof-of-concept application implementing our approach.
papers.abstract_zh: 以移动增强现实(MAR)为特征的应用的日益流行引起了对在敏感的物理空间(例如纪念馆、医院、博物馆等)内使用这种改变游戏规则的技术的严重关切。，从而保护用户的安全和隐私。为了解决这些问题，我们提出了我们正在进行的工作，以协调应用程序生成、分发和消费MAR内容(例如，呈现在视频流顶部的数字对象)的方式。我们介绍了一个理论模型，一个支持框架，以及SpaceMediator，一个实现我们方法的概念验证应用程序。
papers.title_zh: 海报:防止移动增强现实技术中的空间和隐私攻击

papers.title: Poster: Reducing Data Leakage on Personal Data Management Systems
papers.authors: Robin Carpentier, Iulian Sandu Popa, Nicolas Anciaux
papers.abstract: Over the past decade, successive steps have been taken to empower individuals with new legal and technical means, from smart disclosure initiatives to the right to data portability of the GDPR and the new notion of data altruism enacted in the EU [5]. The ultimate goal is to enable individuals to collect and share their personal information, for their own good and broader societal benefits, unlocking innovative usages when crossing multiple data sources from one or many users. The technical corollary of this movement is the emergence of personal data management systems (PDMS) that allow individuals to assemble their personal data under their control, with products such as Digi.me, Cozy Cloud or Solid/PODS, as well as initiatives like Mydata.org, supported by data protection agencies.
papers.abstract_zh: 在过去的十年中，已经采取了一系列措施，通过新的法律和技术手段赋予个人权利，从智能披露倡议到GDPR的数据可移植性权利以及欧盟颁布的数据利他主义新概念[5]。最终目标是使个人能够收集和分享他们的个人信息，为他们自己的利益和更广泛的社会利益，在跨越来自一个或多个用户的多个数据源时释放创新的用途。这一运动的技术必然结果是个人数据管理系统(PDMS)的出现，该系统允许个人利用Digi.me、Cozy Cloud或Solid/PODS等产品以及数据保护机构支持的Mydata.org等倡议，在自己的控制下收集个人数据。
papers.title_zh: 海报:减少个人数据管理系统的数据泄漏

papers.title: Poster: The Need for a Collaborative Approach to Cyber Security Education
papers.authors: Gregor Langner, Jerry Andriessen, Gerald Quirchmayr, Steven Furnell, Vittorio Scarano, Teemu Tokola
papers.abstract: Traditional forms of cyber security education mainly focus on knowledge transmission, which means that knowledge is perceived as a tangible object being transferred from an expert (i.e., the teacher) to a beginner. When practiced well, the learner may acquire such knowledge, but not the resilience to apply it in various contexts [1], [2]. This is especially troubling for the cyber security domain, given the dynamic and constantly changing nature of the field and the environments in which it is required. We therefore need forms of education that aim at understanding the interdisciplinary nature of the field of cyber security as well as at the development of joint action in context: being able to quickly analyse and understand evolving and possibly previously unseen situations and take collaborative action to prevent, detect and recover from incidents.
papers.abstract_zh: 传统形式的网络安全教育主要侧重于知识传播，这意味着知识被视为从专家(即教师)转移到初学者的有形对象。当练习得好的时候，学习者可以获得这样的知识，但不是在各种环境中应用它的弹性[1]，[2]。鉴于网络安全领域及其所需环境的动态和不断变化的性质，这对于网络安全领域来说尤其令人不安。因此，我们需要各种形式的教育，旨在了解网络安全领域的跨学科性质，以及在特定背景下开展联合行动:能够快速分析和了解不断变化的、可能是以前从未见过的情况，并采取协作行动来预防、检测事件并从中恢复。
papers.title_zh: 海报:网络安全教育需要协作方法

papers.title: Poster: Towards Verifiable Mutability for Blockchains
papers.authors: Erik Daniel, Florian Tschorsch
papers.abstract: Due to their immutable log of information, blockchains can be considered as a transparency-enhancing technology. The immutability, however, also introduces threats and challenges with respect to privacy laws and illegal content. Introducing a certain degree of mutability, which enables the possibility to store and remove information, can therefore increase the opportunities for blockchains. In this paper, we present a concept for a mutable blockchain structure. Our approach enables the removal of certain blocks, while maintaining the blockchain's verifiability property. Since our concept is agnostic to any consensus algorithms, it can be implemented with permissioned and permissionless blockchains.
papers.abstract_zh: 由于其不可变的信息记录，区块链可以被认为是一种提高透明度的技术。然而，这种不变性也带来了隐私法和非法内容方面的威胁和挑战。引入一定程度的可变性，使存储和删除信息成为可能，因此可以增加区块链的机会。在本文中，我们提出了一个可变区块链结构的概念。我们的方法能够移除某些块，同时保持区块链的可验证性。因为我们的概念对任何共识算法都是不可知的，所以它可以用许可和非许可区块链来实现。
papers.title_zh: 海报:迈向区块链可验证的可变性

papers.title: Quantitative Assessment on the Limitations of Code Randomization for Legacy Binaries
papers.authors: Pei Wang, Jinquan Zhang, Shuai Wang, Dinghao Wu
papers.abstract: Software development and deployment are generally fast-pacing practices, yet to date there is still a significant amount of legacy software running in various critical industries with years or even decades of lifespans. As the source code of some legacy software became unavailable, it is difficult for maintainers to actively patch the vulnerabilities, leaving the outdated binaries appealing targets of advanced security attacks. One of the most powerful attacks today is code reuse, a technique that can circumvent most existing system-level security facilities. While there have been various countermeasures against code reuse, applying them to sourceless software appears to be exceptionally challenging. Fine-grained code randomization is considered to be an effective strategy to impede modern code-reuse attacks. To apply it to legacy software, a technique called binary rewriting is employed to directly reconstruct binaries without symbol or relocation information. However, we found that current rewriting-based randomization techniques, regardless of their designs and implementations, share a common security defect such that the randomized binaries may remain vulnerable in certain cases. Indeed, our finding does not invalidate fine-grained code randomization as a meaningful defense against code reuse attacks, for it significantly raises the bar for exploits to be successful. Nevertheless, it is critical for the maintainers of legacy software systems to be aware of this problem and obtain a quantitative assessment of the risks in adopting a potentially incomprehensive defense. In this paper, we conducted a systematic investigation into the effectiveness of randomization techniques designed for hardening outdated binaries. We studied various state-of-the-art, fine-grained randomization tools, confirming that all of them can leave a certain part of the retrofitted binary code still reusable. To quantify the risks, we proposed a set of concrete criteria to classify gadgets immune to rewriting-based randomization and investigated their availability and capability.
papers.abstract_zh: 软件开发和部署通常是快节奏的实践，然而到目前为止，仍然有大量的遗留软件在各种关键行业中运行，其寿命长达数年甚至数十年。随着一些遗留软件的源代码变得不可用，维护人员很难主动修补漏洞，从而使过时的二进制文件成为高级安全攻击的诱人目标。当今最强大的攻击之一是代码重用，这是一种可以绕过大多数现有系统级安全设施的技术。虽然有各种反对代码重用的对策，但是将它们应用到无源代码软件中似乎非常具有挑战性。细粒度代码随机化被认为是阻止现代代码重用攻击的有效策略。为了将其应用于遗留软件，一种称为二进制重写的技术被用来直接重构二进制文件，而不需要符号或重定位信息。然而，我们发现当前基于重写的随机化技术，不管它们的设计和实现如何，都有一个共同的安全缺陷，使得随机化的二进制文件在某些情况下仍然是易受攻击的。事实上，我们的发现并没有使细粒度代码随机化作为对代码重用攻击的有意义的防御失效，因为它显著提高了成功利用的门槛。然而，对于遗留软件系统的维护者来说，意识到这个问题并获得对采用潜在的不全面防御的风险的定量评估是至关重要的。在本文中，我们对为加固过时的二进制文件而设计的随机化技术的有效性进行了系统的调查。我们研究了各种最先进的细粒度随机化工具，确认所有这些工具都可以使改造后的二进制代码的某一部分仍然可重用。为了量化风险，我们提出了一套具体的标准来分类对基于重写的随机化免疫的小工具，并调查了它们的可用性和能力。
papers.title_zh: 遗留二进制代码随机化限制的定量评估

papers.title: Saffire: Context-sensitive Function Specialization against Code Reuse Attacks
papers.authors: Shachee Mishra, Michalis Polychronakis
papers.abstract: The sophistication and complexity of recent exploitation techniques, which rely on memory disclosure and whole-function reuse to bypass address space layout randomization and control flow integrity, is indicative of the effect that the combination of exploit mitigations has in challenging the construction of reliable exploits. In addition to software diversification and control flow enforcement, recent efforts have focused on the complementary approach of code and API specialization to restrict further the critical operations that an attacker can perform as part of a code reuse exploit. In this paper we propose Saffire, a compiler-level defense against code reuse attacks. For each calling context of a critical function, Saffire creates a specialized and hardened replica of the function with a restricted interface that can accommodate only that particular invocation. This is achieved by applying static argument binding, to eliminate arguments with static values and concretize them within the function body, and dynamic argument binding, which applies a narrow-scope form of data flow integrity to restrict the acceptable values of arguments that cannot be statically derived. We have implemented Saffire on top of LLVM, and applied it to a set of 11 applications, including Nginx, Firefox, and Chrome. The results of our experimental evaluation with a set of 17 real-world ROP exploits and three whole-function reuse exploits demonstrate the effectiveness of Saffire in preventing these attacks while incurring a negligible runtime overhead.
papers.abstract_zh: 最近的利用技术的复杂性表明了利用缓解措施的组合在挑战可靠利用的构造方面的效果，这些利用技术依赖于存储器公开和全功能重用来绕过地址空间布局随机化和控制流完整性。除了软件多样化和控制流实施，最近的努力集中在代码和API专门化的补充方法上，以进一步限制攻击者作为代码重用利用的一部分可以执行的关键操作。在本文中，我们提出了Saffire，一种针对代码重用攻击的编译器级防御方法。对于关键函数的每个调用上下文，Saffire都会创建一个专门的、强化的函数副本，该副本具有一个受限的接口，只能容纳特定的调用。这是通过应用静态参数绑定和动态参数绑定来实现的，静态参数绑定用于消除具有静态值的参数，并将它们具体化到函数体内，而动态参数绑定则应用窄范围形式的数据流完整性来限制无法静态派生的参数的可接受值。我们在LLVM上实现了Saffire，并将其应用于11个应用程序，包括Nginx、Firefox和Chrome。我们对一组17个真实世界ROP漏洞和三个全功能重用漏洞的实验评估结果证明了Saffire在防止这些攻击方面的有效性，同时产生的运行时开销可以忽略不计。
papers.title_zh: Saffire:针对代码重用攻击的上下文敏感函数专门化

papers.title: Improving Fuzzing through Controlled Compilation
papers.authors: Laurent Simon, Akash Verma
papers.abstract: We observe that operations performed by standard compilers harm fuzzing because the optimizations and the Intermediate Representation (IR) lead to transformations that improve execution speed at the expense of fuzzing. To remedy this problem, we propose ‘controlled compilation’, a set of techniques to automatically re-factor a program's source code and cherry pick beneficial compiler optimizations to improve fuzzing. We design, implement and evaluate controlled compilation by building a new toolchain with Clang/LLVM. We perform an evaluation on 10 open source projects and compare the results of AFL to state-of-the-art grey-box fuzzers and concolic fuzzers. We show that when programs are compiled with this new toolchain, AFL covers 30 % new code on average and finds 21 additional bugs in real world programs. Our study reveals that controlled compilation often covers more code and finds more bugs than state-of-the-art fuzzing techniques, without the need to write a fuzzer from scratch or resort to advanced techniques. We identify two main reasons to explain why. First, it has proven difficult for researchers to appropriately configure existing fuzzers such as AFL. To address this problem, we provide guidelines and new LLVM passes to help automate AFL's configuration. This will enable researchers to perform a fairer comparison with AFL. Second, we find that current coverage-based evaluation measures (e.g. the total number of visited lines, edges or BBs) are inadequate because they lose valuable information such as which parts of a program a fuzzer actually visits and how consistently it does so. Coverage is considered a useful metric to evaluate a fuzzer's performance and devise a fuzzing strategy. However, the lack of a standard methodology for evaluating coverage remains a problem. To address this, we propose a rigorous evaluation methodology based on ‘qualitative coverage’. Qualitative coverage uniquely identifies each program line to help understand which lines are commonly visited by different fuzzers vs. which lines are visited only by a particular fuzzer. Throughout our study, we show the benefits of this new evaluation methodology. For example we provide valuable insights into the consistency of fuzzers, i.e. their ability to cover the same code or find the same bug across multiple independent runs. Overall, our evaluation methodology based on qualitative coverage helps to understand if a fuzzer performs better, worse, or is complementary to another fuzzer. This helps security practitioners adjust their fuzzing strategies.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们观察到由标准编译器执行的操作损害了模糊化，因为优化和中间表示(IR)导致了以模糊化为代价来提高执行速度的转换。为了解决这个问题，我们提出了“受控编译”，这是一套自动重分解程序源代码并挑选有益的编译器优化来改善模糊性的技术。我们通过用Clang/LLVM构建一个新的工具链来设计、实现和评估受控编译。我们对10个开源项目进行了评估，并将AFL的结果与最先进的灰盒模糊器和concolic模糊器进行了比较。我们发现，当程序用这种新的工具链编译时，AFL平均覆盖30 %的新代码，并在真实世界的程序中发现21个额外的错误。我们的研究表明，受控编译通常比最先进的模糊化技术覆盖更多的代码并发现更多的错误，而不需要从头编写模糊化器或求助于高级技术。我们找出两个主要原因来解释为什么。首先，研究人员很难适当配置现有的模糊器，如AFL。为了解决这个问题，我们提供了指导方针和新的LLVM通行证来帮助自动化AFL的配置。这将使研究人员能够与AFL进行更公平的比较。第二，我们发现当前基于覆盖率的评估方法(例如，被访问的行、边或BBs的总数)是不充分的，因为它们丢失了有价值的信息，例如模糊者实际访问了程序的哪些部分以及它这样做的一致性如何。覆盖率被认为是评估模糊器性能和设计模糊策略的有用指标。然而，缺乏评估覆盖率的标准方法仍然是一个问题。为了解决这个问题，我们提出了一个基于“定性覆盖”的严格评估方法。定性覆盖唯一地标识每个程序行，以帮助理解哪些行通常被不同的模糊器访问，哪些行仅被特定的模糊器访问。通过我们的研究，我们展示了这种新的评估方法的好处。例如，我们对模糊器的一致性提供了有价值的见解，即它们覆盖相同代码或在多次独立运行中找到相同bug的能力。总的来说，我们基于定性覆盖的评估方法有助于理解一个模糊器的表现是更好、更差还是与另一个模糊器互补。这有助于安全从业者调整他们的模糊策略。
papers.title_zh: 通过受控编译改善模糊化

papers.title: VGRAPH: A Robust Vulnerable Code Clone Detection System Using Code Property Triplets
papers.authors: Benjamin Bowman, H. Howie Huang
papers.abstract: Software vulnerabilities are a common attack vector for cyber adversaries. This problem has been exacerbated by the wealth of open-source software projects, as code is often copy-pasted to new locations. This causes a serious problem when a new security vulnerability is discovered in a particular software project, as it may potentially affect many others. Discovering vulnerable code reuse in source code is known as vulnerable code clone detection. This is a very challenging problem as the cloned code has the potential to be modified, sometimes significantly, from the original code, while still retaining the underlying vulnerability. Existing vulnerable clone detection techniques are either too strict, missing vulnerabilities when they have subtle modifications, or are too narrow, applicable only to a small number of vulnerability types. In this work we present VGRAPH, a technique for identifying vulnerable code clones, which is more robust to code modification, while still remaining generic to all vulnerability types. VGRAPHs are representations of vulnerable source code comprising three graph-based components representing code property relationships extracted from the contextual code, the vulnerable code, and the patched code. We develop a matching algorithm utilizing these three graph-based components which is able to identify vulnerable code clones with a precision of 98% and recall of 97%. Even for highly modified code clones, we are able to identify over 100 more vulnerable clones than the best performing comparison work ReDeBug. When we apply our technique to several versions of popular software packages (e.g., FFMpeg, OpenSSL), we are able to identify 10 vulnerabilities which were silently patched and are not listed in the National Vulnerability Database.
papers.abstract_zh: 软件漏洞是网络对手常见的攻击媒介。这个问题由于大量的开源软件项目而变得更加严重，因为代码经常被复制粘贴到新的位置。当在特定的软件项目中发现新的安全漏洞时，这会导致严重的问题，因为它可能会潜在地影响许多其他项目。在源代码中发现易受攻击的代码重用被称为易受攻击的代码克隆检测。这是一个非常具有挑战性的问题，因为克隆的代码有可能从原始代码被修改，有时是显著地修改，同时仍然保留潜在的漏洞。现有的漏洞克隆检测技术要么过于严格，在有细微修改时会遗漏漏洞，要么过于狭隘，仅适用于少数漏洞类型。在这项工作中，我们提出了VGRAPH，一种用于识别易受攻击的代码克隆的技术，它对代码修改更加健壮，同时仍然对所有易受攻击类型保持通用性。VGRAPHs是易受攻击源代码的表示，包括三个基于图的组件，表示从上下文代码、易受攻击代码和补丁代码中提取的代码属性关系。我们利用这三个基于图的组件开发了一个匹配算法，它能够以98%的精度和97%的召回率识别易受攻击的代码克隆。即使对于高度修改的代码克隆，我们也能够比表现最好的比较工作ReDeBug识别出100多个更易受攻击的克隆。当我们将我们的技术应用于流行软件包的几个版本(例如，FFMpeg、OpenSSL)时，我们能够识别10个漏洞，这些漏洞被静默地修补并且没有在国家漏洞数据库中列出。
papers.title_zh: VGRAPH:一个使用代码属性三元组的健壮的易受攻击代码克隆检测系统

papers.title: Multi-country Study of Third Party Trackers from Real Browser Histories
papers.authors: Xuehui Hu, Guillermo Suarez de Tangil, Nishanth Sastry
papers.abstract: This paper aims to understand how third-party ecosystems have developed in four different countries: UK, China, AU, US. We are interested in how wide a view a given third-party player may have, of an individual user's browsing history over a period of time, and of the collective browsing histories of a cohort of users in each of these countries. We study this by utilizing two complementary approaches: the first uses lists of the most popular websites per country, as determined by Alexa.com. The second approach is based on the real browsing histories of a cohort of users in these countries. Our larger continuous user data collection spans over a year. Some universal patterns are seen, such as more third parties on more popular websites, and a specialization among trackers, with some trackers present in some categories of websites but not others. However, our study reveals several unexpected country-specific patterns: China has a home-grown ecosystem of third-party operators in contrast with the UK, whose trackers are dominated by players hosted in the US. UK trackers are more location sensitive than Chinese trackers. One important consequence of these is that users in China are tracked lesser than users in the UK. Our unique access to the browsing patterns of a panel of users provides a realistic insight into third party exposure, and suggests that studies which rely solely on Alexa top ranked websites may be over estimating the power of third parties, since real users also access several niche interest sites with lesser numbers of many kinds of third parties, especially advertisers.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文旨在了解第三方生态系统如何在四个不同的国家发展:英国、中国、非洲联盟和美国。我们感兴趣的是一个给定的第三方玩家对个人用户在一段时间内的浏览历史，以及这些国家的一群用户的集体浏览历史的了解程度。我们通过两种互补的方法来研究这个问题:第一种方法使用每个国家最受欢迎网站的列表，由Alexa.com确定。第二种方法是基于这些国家的一群用户的真实浏览历史。我们更大规模的持续用户数据收集跨越了一年。我们看到了一些普遍的模式，如在更受欢迎的网站上有更多的第三方，以及追踪者之间的专业化，一些追踪者出现在某些类别的网站上，而其他网站上没有。然而，我们的研究揭示了几个出人意料的特定国家模式:中国有一个由第三方运营商组成的本土生态系统，而英国的追踪器由美国托管的玩家主导。英国追踪器比中国追踪器对位置更敏感。其中一个重要的后果是，中国的用户比英国的用户更少被追踪。我们对一组用户浏览模式的独特访问提供了对第三方曝光的现实洞察，并表明仅依赖于Alexa排名靠前的网站的研究可能高估了第三方的力量，因为真实用户也访问几个利基兴趣网站，其中第三方数量较少，尤其是广告商。
papers.title_zh: 来自真实浏览器历史的第三方追踪器的多国研究

papers.title: X-Men: A Mutation-Based Approach for the Formal Analysis of Security Ceremonies
papers.authors: Diego Sempreboni, Luca Viganò
papers.abstract: There is an increasing number of cyber-systems (e.g., payment, transportation, voting, critical-infrastructure systems) whose security depends intrinsically on human users. A security ceremony expands a security protocol with everything that is considered out-of-band to it, including, in particular, the mistakes that human users might make when participating actively in the security ceremony. In this paper, we introduce a novel approach for the formal analysis of security ceremonies. Our approach defines mutation rules that model possible behaviors of a human user, and automatically generates mutations in the behavior of the other agents of the ceremony to match the human-induced mutations. This allows for the analysis of the original ceremony specification and its possible mutations, which may include the way in which the ceremony has actually been implemented. To automate our approach, we have developed the tool X-Men, which is a prototype that extends Tamarin, one of the most common tools for the automatic unbounded verification of security protocols. As a proof of concept, we have applied our approach to two real-life case studies, uncovering a number of concrete vulnerabilities.
papers.abstract_zh: 越来越多的网络系统(如支付、运输、投票、关键基础设施系统)的安全性本质上取决于人类用户。安全仪式用被认为是带外的一切来扩展安全协议，尤其包括人类用户在积极参与安全仪式时可能犯的错误。在这篇文章中，我们介绍了一种新的方法进行形式分析的安全仪式。我们的方法定义了模拟人类用户的可能行为的突变规则，并自动生成仪式的其他代理的行为中的突变，以匹配人类诱导的突变。这允许对原始仪式规范及其可能的变化进行分析，其中可能包括仪式实际执行的方式。为了使我们的方法自动化，我们开发了工具X-Men，这是一个扩展Tamarin的原型，Tamarin是用于安全协议自动无界验证的最常见工具之一。作为概念验证，我们将我们的方法应用于两个真实案例研究，发现了许多具体的漏洞。
papers.title_zh: x战警:基于突变的安全仪式形式分析方法

papers.title: "Anyone Else Seeing this Error?": Community, System Administrators, and Patch Information
papers.authors: Adam D. G. Jenkins, Pieris Kalligeros, Kami Vaniea, Maria K. Wolters
papers.abstract: Applying regular patches is vital for the timely correction of security vulnerabilities, but installing patches also risks disrupting working systems by potentially introducing unknown errors. System administrators must manage the challenges of patching using a combination of reliance on best practice and available information to best match their organizations' needs. In this work, we study how patch-related activities are supported by the mailing list of the website PatchManagement.org which is dedicated to the task. We qualitatively coded 356 list emails sent between March and July, 2018, to understand how members interact with the list community. Based on our results, we argue that the mailing list is an example of an Online Community of Practice, where practitioners engage in communal learning and support. We find that the community supports members in multiple phases of the patching process by providing workarounds before a patch is available, guidance prioritizing released patches, and helping with post-patch trouble. Additionally, the community provides help around tool selection and facilitating discussions.
papers.abstract_zh: 应用常规补丁程序对于及时纠正安全漏洞至关重要，但是安装补丁程序也可能会引入未知错误，从而有中断工作系统的风险。系统管理员必须依靠最佳实践和可用信息来应对打补丁的挑战，以最大限度地满足组织的需求。在这项工作中，我们研究了PatchManagement.org网站的邮件列表是如何支持补丁相关的活动的。我们对2018年3月至7月期间发送的356封列表电子邮件进行了定性编码，以了解成员如何与列表社区进行互动。基于我们的结果，我们认为邮件列表是在线实践社区的一个例子，在那里实践者参与公共学习和支持。我们发现，社区通过在补丁可用之前提供解决方法、指导优先发布补丁以及帮助解决补丁后的问题，在补丁过程的多个阶段为成员提供支持。此外，该社区还提供工具选择和促进讨论方面的帮助。
papers.title_zh: “还有人看到这个错误吗？”:社区、系统管理员和修补程序信息

papers.title: User Attitudes On Direct-to-Consumer Genetic Testing
papers.authors: Debjani Saha, Anna Chan, Brook Stacy, Kiran Javkar, Sushant Patkar, Michelle L. Mazurek
papers.abstract: Advances in biotechnology now allow users to obtain their genetic information, including ancestry and predisposition to various diseases and health issues, with relative ease. With these new commercial services come a host of privacy concerns with respect to data sharing and access. User data is being sold to third parties, including pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, and may be accessed by law enforcement in accordance with proper legal procedures. Moreover, many users of these services go on to deposit the data they obtain into online, public repositories that are fully accessible to anyone with an internet connection. The full extent of the risks they face may not be apparent to users. This paper reports on a semistructured interview study ($n=24$) examining user concerns regarding these tests, what information they believe they are revealing, and what they think companies are doing with their data. We find that users are concerned with privacy, and understand at a basic level the nature of the data they are revealing. However, their privacy concerns are often insufficient to deter them from taking such a test, and many have difficulty grasping some of the implications of sharing their genetic information with commercial entities.
papers.abstract_zh: 生物技术的进步现在允许用户相对容易地获得他们的遗传信息，包括祖先和对各种疾病和健康问题的易感性。随着这些新的商业服务的出现，出现了许多关于数据共享和访问的隐私问题。用户数据被出售给第三方，包括制药和生物技术公司，执法部门可能会根据适当的法律程序获取这些数据。此外，这些服务的许多用户继续将他们获得的数据存放在在线公共存储库中，任何有互联网连接的人都可以完全访问这些存储库。用户可能不清楚他们所面临的全部风险。本文报告了一项半结构化访谈研究($n=24$)，该研究调查了用户对这些测试的担忧，他们认为这些测试揭示了什么信息，以及他们认为公司正在对他们的数据做什么。我们发现，用户关心隐私，并在基本层面上理解他们所披露的数据的性质。然而，他们对隐私的担忧往往不足以阻止他们进行这样的测试，许多人很难理解与商业实体分享他们的基因信息的一些影响。
papers.title_zh: 用户对直接面向消费者的基因检测的态度

papers.title: Jekyll: Attacking Medical Image Diagnostics using Deep Generative Models
papers.authors: Neal Mangaokar, Jiameng Pu, Parantapa Bhattacharya, Chandan K. Reddy, Bimal Viswanath
papers.abstract: Advances in deep neural networks (DNNs) have shown tremendous promise in the medical domain. However, the deep learning tools that are helping the domain, can also be used against it. Given the prevalence of fraud in the healthcare domain, it is important to consider the adversarial use of DNNs in manipulating sensitive data that is crucial to patient healthcare. In this work, we present the design and implementation of a DNN-based image translation attack on biomedical imagery. More specifically, we propose Jekyll, a neural style transfer framework that takes as input a biomedical image of a patient and translates it to a new image that indicates an attacker-chosen disease condition. The potential for fraudulent claims based on such generated ‘fake’ medical images is significant, and we demonstrate successful attacks on both X-rays and retinal fundus image modalities. We show that these attacks manage to mislead both medical professionals and algorithmic detection schemes. Lastly, we also investigate defensive measures based on machine learning to detect images generated by Jekyll.
papers.abstract_zh: 深度神经网络(DNNs)的进展在医学领域显示出巨大的前景。然而，帮助该领域的深度学习工具也可以用来对抗它。鉴于医疗保健领域欺诈行为的普遍存在，在操纵对患者医疗保健至关重要的敏感数据时，考虑恶意使用DNNs非常重要。在这项工作中，我们提出了一个基于DNN的生物医学图像图像翻译攻击的设计和实现。更具体地说，我们提出了Jekyll，这是一种神经类型的转移框架，它将患者的生物医学图像作为输入，并将其转换为指示攻击者选择的疾病状况的新图像。基于这种生成的“虚假”医学图像的欺诈性索赔的可能性很大，我们证明了对X射线和视网膜眼底图像形式的成功攻击。我们表明，这些攻击设法误导医疗专业人员和算法检测方案。最后，我们还研究了基于机器学习的防御措施，以检测由Jekyll生成的图像。
papers.title_zh: Jekyll:使用深度生成模型攻击医学图像诊断

papers.title: Evaluating Explanation Methods for Deep Learning in Security
papers.authors: Alexander Warnecke, Daniel Arp, Christian Wressnegger, Konrad Rieck
papers.abstract: Deep learning is increasingly used as a building block of security systems. Unfortunately, neural networks are hard to interpret and typically opaque to the practitioner. The machine learning community has started to address this problem by developing methods for explaining the predictions of neural networks. While several of these approaches have been successfully applied in the area of computer vision, their application in security has received little attention so far. It is an open question which explanation methods are appropriate for computer security and what requirements they need to satisfy. In this paper, we introduce criteria for comparing and evaluating explanation methods in the context of computer security. These cover general properties, such as the accuracy of explanations, as well as security-focused aspects, such as the completeness, efficiency, and robustness. Based on our criteria, we investigate six popular explanation methods and assess their utility in security systems for malware detection and vulnerability discovery. We observe significant differences between the methods and build on these to derive general recommendations for selecting and applying explanation methods in computer security.
papers.abstract_zh: 深度学习越来越多地被用作安全系统的构建模块。不幸的是，神经网络很难解释，通常对从业者来说是不透明的。机器学习社区已经开始通过开发解释神经网络预测的方法来解决这个问题。虽然这些方法中的一些已经成功地应用于计算机视觉领域，但是它们在安全方面的应用迄今为止还没有受到多少关注。哪些解释方法适用于计算机安全，需要满足哪些要求，这是一个悬而未决的问题。在本文中，我们介绍了在计算机安全环境中比较和评估解释方法的标准。这些包括一般属性，如解释的准确性，以及关注安全性的方面，如完整性、效率和健壮性。基于我们的标准，我们调查了六种流行的解释方法，并评估了它们在安全系统中用于恶意软件检测和漏洞发现的效用。我们观察了这些方法之间的显著差异，并在此基础上推导出在计算机安全中选择和应用解释方法的一般建议。
papers.title_zh: 安全领域深度学习的解释方法评估

papers.title: Bypassing Backdoor Detection Algorithms in Deep Learning
papers.authors: Te Juin Lester Tan, Reza Shokri
papers.abstract: Deep learning models are vulnerable to various adversarial manipulations of their training data, parameters, and input sample. In particular, an adversary can modify the training data and model parameters to embed backdoors into the model, so the model behaves according to the adversary's objective if the input contains the backdoor features, referred to as the backdoor trigger (e.g., a stamp on an image). The poisoned model's behavior on clean data, however, remains unchanged. Many detection algorithms are designed to detect backdoors on input samples or model parameters, through the statistical difference between the latent representations of adversarial and clean input samples in the poisoned model. In this paper, we design an adversarial backdoor embedding algorithm that can bypass the existing detection algorithms including the state-of-the-art techniques. We design an adaptive adversarial training algorithm that optimizes the original loss function of the model, and also maximizes the indistinguishability of the hidden representations of poisoned data and clean data. This work calls for designing adversary-aware defense mechanisms for backdoor detection.
papers.abstract_zh: 深度学习模型容易受到对其训练数据、参数和输入样本的各种敌对操纵。具体而言，对手可以修改训练数据和模型参数以将后门嵌入到模型中，因此如果输入包含后门特征，则模型根据对手的目标来表现，这被称为后门触发器(例如，图像上的印记)。然而，中毒模型对干净数据的行为保持不变。许多检测算法被设计成通过中毒模型中敌对和干净输入样本的潜在表示之间的统计差异来检测输入样本或模型参数上的后门。在本文中，我们设计了一个对抗性后门嵌入算法，可以绕过现有的检测算法，包括最先进的技术。我们设计了一个自适应的对抗训练算法，优化了模型的原始损失函数，并且最大化了中毒数据和干净数据的隐藏表示的不可区分性。这项工作要求为后门检测设计对手感知的防御机制。
papers.title_zh: 在深度学习中绕过后门检测算法

papers.title: Biometric Backdoors: A Poisoning Attack Against Unsupervised Template Updating
papers.authors: Giulio Lovisotto, Simon Eberz, Ivan Martinovic
papers.abstract: In this work, we investigate the concept of biometric backdoors: a template poisoning attack on biometric systems that allows adversaries to stealthily and effortlessly impersonate users in the long-term by exploiting the template update procedure. We show that such attacks can be carried out even by attackers with physical limitations (no digital access to the sensor) and zero knowledge of training data (they know neither decision boundaries nor user template). Based on the adversaries' own templates, they craft several intermediate samples that incrementally bridge the distance between their own template and the legitimate user's. As these adversarial samples are added to the template, the attacker is eventually accepted alongside the legitimate user. To avoid detection, we design the attack to minimize the number of rejected samples. We design our method to cope with weak assumptions for the attacker and we evaluate the effectiveness of this approach on state-of-the-art face recognition pipelines based on deep neural networks. We find that in white-box scenarios, adversaries can successfully carry out the attack in over 70 % of cases with less than ten injection attempts. Even in black-box scenarios, we find that exploiting the transferability of adversarial samples from surrogate models can lead to successful attacks in around 15 % of cases. Finally, we design a poisoning detection technique that leverages the consistent directionality of template updates in feature space to discriminate between legitimate and malicious updates. We evaluate such a countermeasure with a set of intra-user variability factors which may present the same directionality characteristics, obtaining equal error rates for the detection between 7-14% and leading to over 99% of attacks being detected after only two sample injections. We design our method to cope with weak assumptions for the attacker and we evaluate the effectiveness of this approach on state-of-the-art face recognition pipelines based on deep neural networks. We find that in white-box scenarios, adversaries can successfully carry out the attack in over 70 % of cases with less than ten injection attempts. Even in black-box scenarios, we find that exploiting the transferability of adversarial samples from surrogate models can lead to successful attacks in around 15 % of cases. Finally, we design a poisoning detection technique that leverages the consistent directionality of template updates in feature space to discriminate between legitimate and malicious updates. We evaluate such a countermeasure with a set of intra-user variability factors which may present the same directionality characteristics, obtaining equal error rates for the detection between 7-14% and leading to over 99% of attacks being detected after only two sample injections.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这项工作中，我们研究了生物识别后门的概念:一种对生物识别系统的模板中毒攻击，它允许对手通过利用模板更新过程，长期秘密地、毫不费力地冒充用户。我们表明，即使攻击者具有物理限制(没有对传感器的数字访问)和对训练数据一无所知(他们既不知道决策界限也不知道用户模板)，也可以实施这种攻击。根据对手自己的模板，他们制作了几个中间样本，逐渐缩小他们自己的模板和合法用户的模板之间的距离。随着这些敌对样本被添加到模板中，攻击者最终会与合法用户一起被接受。为了避免被检测到，我们设计攻击来最小化拒绝样本的数量。我们设计了我们的方法来应对攻击者的弱假设，并且我们在基于深度神经网络的最先进的人脸识别管道上评估了这种方法的有效性。我们发现，在白盒场景中，超过70 %的情况下，对手可以通过不到10次的注入尝试成功实施攻击。即使在黑盒场景中，我们发现，利用替代模型中敌对样本的可转移性，可以在大约15 %的情况下导致成功的攻击。最后，我们设计了一种中毒检测技术，利用特征空间中模板更新的一致性方向性来区分合法和恶意更新。我们使用一组用户内部的可变性因素来评估这种对策，这些可变性因素可能呈现相同的方向性特征，获得7-14%之间的相等检测错误率，并导致仅在两次样本注入后就检测到超过99%的攻击。我们设计了我们的方法来应对攻击者的弱假设，并且我们在基于深度神经网络的最先进的人脸识别管道上评估了这种方法的有效性。我们发现，在白盒场景中，超过70 %的情况下，对手可以通过不到10次的注入尝试成功实施攻击。即使在黑盒场景中，我们发现，利用替代模型中敌对样本的可转移性，可以在大约15 %的情况下导致成功的攻击。最后，我们设计了一种中毒检测技术，利用特征空间中模板更新的一致性方向性来区分合法和恶意更新。我们使用一组用户内部的可变性因素来评估这种对策，这些可变性因素可能呈现相同的方向性特征，获得7-14%之间的相等检测错误率，并导致仅在两次样本注入后就检测到超过99%的攻击。
papers.title_zh: 生物特征后门:针对无监督模板更新的中毒攻击

papers.title: DLA: Dense-Layer-Analysis for Adversarial Example Detection
papers.authors: Philip Sperl, Ching-Yu Kao, Peng Chen, Xiao Lei, Konstantin Böttinger
papers.abstract: In recent years Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) have achieved remarkable results and even showed superhuman capabilities in a broad range of domains. This led people to trust in DNN classifications even in security-sensitive environments like autonomous driving. Despite their impressive achievements, DNNs are known to be vulnerable to adversarial examples. Such inputs contain small perturbations to intentionally fool the attacked model. In this paper, we present a novel end-to-end framework to detect such attacks without influencing the target model's performance. Inspired by research in neuron-coverage guided testing we show that dense layers of DNNs carry security-sensitive information. With a secondary DNN we analyze the activation patterns of the dense layers during classification run-time, which enables effective and real-time detection of adversarial examples. Our prototype implementation successfully detects adversarial examples in image, natural language, and audio processing. Thereby, we cover a variety of target DNN architectures. In addition to effectively defending against state-of-the-art attacks, our approach generalizes between different sets of adversarial examples. Our experiments indicate that we are able to detect future, yet unknown, attacks. Finally, during white-box adaptive attacks, we show our method cannot be easily bypassed.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，深度神经网络已经取得了显著的成果，甚至在广泛的领域显示出超人的能力。这导致人们信任DNN分类，即使在自动驾驶这样的安全敏感环境中。尽管取得了令人印象深刻的成就，但众所周知，dnn容易受到反面例子的影响。这种输入包含小扰动，以故意愚弄被攻击的模型。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的端到端框架来检测这种攻击，而不影响目标模型的性能。受神经元覆盖引导测试研究的启发，我们发现密集的dnn层携带安全敏感信息。利用第二DNN，我们在分类运行期间分析密集层的激活模式，这使得能够有效和实时地检测对立的例子。我们的原型实现成功地检测了图像、自然语言和音频处理中的对立例子。因此，我们涵盖了各种目标DNN架构。除了有效地防御最先进的攻击，我们的方法还可以在不同的对立示例集之间进行推广。我们的实验表明，我们能够检测未来未知的攻击。最后，在白盒自适应攻击中，我们证明了我们的方法不容易被绕过。
papers.title_zh: DLA:用于敌对示例检测的密集层分析

papers.title: Ordinos: A Verifiable Tally-Hiding E-Voting System
papers.authors: Ralf Küsters, Julian Liedtke, Johannes Müller, Daniel Rausch, Andreas Vogt
papers.abstract: Modern electronic voting systems (e-voting systems) are designed to provide not only vote privacy but also (end-to-end) verifiability. Several verifiable e-voting systems have been proposed in the literature, with Helios being one of the most prominent ones. Almost all such systems, however, reveal not just the voting result but also the full tally, consisting of the exact number of votes per candidate or even all single votes. There are several situations where this is undesirable. For example, in elections with only a few voters (e.g., boardroom or jury votings), revealing the complete tally leads to a low privacy level, possibly deterring voters from voting for their actual preference. In other cases, revealing the complete tally might unnecessarily embarrass some candidates. Often, the voting result merely consists of a single winner or a ranking of candidates, so revealing only this information but not the complete tally is sufficient. This property is called tally-hiding and it offers completely new options for e-voting. In this paper, we propose the first provably secure end-to-end verifiable tally-hiding e-voting system, called Ordinos. We instantiated our system with suitable cryptographic primitives, including an MPC protocol for greater-than tests, implemented the system, and evaluated its performance, demonstrating its practicality. Moreover, our work provides a deeper understanding of tally-hiding in general, in particular in how far tally-hiding affects the levels of privacy and verifiability of e-voting systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 现代电子投票系统(e-voting systems)被设计为不仅提供投票隐私，还提供(端到端)可验证性。文献中已经提出了几个可验证的电子投票系统，Helios是其中最著名的一个。然而，几乎所有这样的系统不仅显示投票结果，还显示完整的计票结果，包括每位候选人的确切票数，甚至所有的单票。这在几种情况下是不理想的。例如，在只有少数投票人的选举中(例如，董事会或陪审团投票)，披露完整的计票结果会导致较低的隐私级别，可能会阻止投票人按照他们的实际偏好投票。在其他情况下，披露完整的记录可能会让一些候选人陷入不必要的尴尬。通常，投票结果只包含一个获胜者或候选人的排名，因此只显示这些信息而不是完整的记录就足够了。这个特性被称为计数隐藏，它为电子投票提供了全新的选择。本文提出了第一个可证明安全的端到端可验证的计票隐藏电子投票系统Ordinos。我们用合适的密码原语实例化了我们的系统，包括一个用于大于测试的MPC协议，实现了该系统，并评估了它的性能，证明了它的实用性。此外，我们的工作提供了对计数隐藏的更深入的理解，特别是计数隐藏在多大程度上影响了电子投票系统的隐私和可验证性。
papers.title_zh: Ordinos:一个可验证的计票隐藏电子投票系统

papers.title: Accountability in a Permissioned Blockchain: Formal Analysis of Hyperledger Fabric
papers.authors: Mike Graf, Ralf Küsters, Daniel Rausch
papers.abstract: While accountability is a well-known concept in distributed systems and cryptography, in the literature on blockchains (and, more generally, distributed ledgers) the formal treatment of accountability has been a blind spot: there does not exist a formalization let alone a formal proof of accountability for any blockchain yet. Therefore, in this work we put forward and propose a formal treatment of accountability in this domain. Our goal is to formally state and prove that if in a run of a blockchain a central security property, such as consistency, is not satisfied, then misbehaving parties can be identified and held accountable. Accountability is particularly useful for permissioned blockchains where all parties know each other, and hence, accountability incentivizes all parties to behave honestly. We exemplify our approach for one of the most prominent permissioned blockchains: Hyperledger Fabric in its most common instantiation.
papers.abstract_zh: 虽然在分布式系统和密码学中，可追究性是一个众所周知的概念，但是在关于区块链(以及更一般的分布式分类帐)的文献中，可追究性的正式处理一直是一个盲点:对于任何区块链，都不存在可追究性的形式化，更不用说正式证明了。因此，在这项工作中，我们提出并建议正式处理这一领域的问责制。我们的目标是正式声明并证明，如果在区块链的运行中，不满足核心安全属性(如一致性),则可以识别行为不当的各方并追究其责任。问责制对于允许的区块链特别有用，在那里所有的政党都互相认识，因此，问责制激励所有政党诚实行事。我们以一个最著名的许可区块链:Hyperledger Fabric最常见的实例来举例说明我们的方法。
papers.title_zh: 许可区块链中的问责制:超分类帐结构的形式分析

papers.title: Reward Sharing Schemes for Stake Pools
papers.authors: Lars Brünjes, Aggelos Kiayias, Elias Koutsoupias, Aikaterini-Panagiota Stouka
papers.abstract: We introduce and study reward sharing schemes (RSS) that promote the fair formation of stake pools in collaborative projects that involve a large number of stakeholders such as the maintenance of a proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain. Our mechanisms are parameterized by a target value for the desired number of pools. We show that by properly incentivizing participants, the desired number of stake pools is a Nash equilibrium arising from rational play. Our equilibria also exhibit an efficiency / security tradeoff via a parameter that calibrates between including pools with the smallest cost and providing protection against Sybil attacks, the setting where a single stakeholder creates a large number of pools in the hopes to dominate the collaborative project. We then describe how RSS can be deployed in the PoS setting, mitigating a number of potential deployment attacks and protocol deviations that include censoring transactions, performing Sybil attacks with the objective to control the majority of stake, lying about the actual cost and others. Finally, we experimentally demonstrate fast convergence to equilibria in dynamic environments where players react to each other's strategic moves over an indefinite period of interactive play. We also show how simple reward sharing schemes that are seemingly more “fair”, perhaps counterin-tuitively, converge to centralized equilibria.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们介绍并研究了奖励分享方案(RSS ),该方案在涉及大量利益相关者的合作项目中促进公平形成利益池，例如维护利益相关证明(PoS)区块链。我们的机制由所需池数量的目标值来参数化。我们证明，通过适当激励参与者，期望的赌注池数量是理性博弈产生的纳什均衡。我们的均衡还通过一个参数展示了效率/安全性权衡，该参数在包括具有最小成本的池和提供针对Sybil攻击的保护之间进行校准，在这种情况下，单个利益相关者创建大量池，希望控制协作项目。然后，我们描述了如何在PoS设置中部署RSS，减少大量潜在的部署攻击和协议偏差，包括审查交易、执行Sybil攻击以控制大部分股份、谎报实际成本等。最后，我们通过实验证明了在动态环境中快速收敛到均衡，在动态环境中，玩家在无限期的互动游戏中对彼此的策略移动做出反应。我们还展示了看起来更“公平”的简单的奖励分享方案，也许是违反直觉的，是如何收敛到集中均衡的。
papers.title_zh: 股份池的奖励分享方案

papers.title: Modular Security Analysis of OAuth 2.0 in the Three-Party Setting
papers.authors: Xinyu Li, Jing Xu, Zhenfeng Zhang, Xiao Lan, Yuchen Wang
papers.abstract: OAuth 2.0 is one of the most widely used Internet protocols for authorization/single sign-on (SSO) and is also the foundation of the new SSO protocol OpenID Connect. Due to its complexity and its flexibility, it is difficult to comprehensively analyze the security of the OAuth 2.0 standard, yet it is critical to obtain practical security guarantees for OAuth 2.0. In this paper, we present the first computationally sound security analysis of OAuth 2.0. First, we introduce a new primitive, the three-party authenticated secret distribution (3P-ASD for short) protocol, which plays the role of issuing the secret and captures the token issue process of OAuth 2.0. As far as we know, this is the first attempt to formally abstract the authorization technology into a general primitive and then define its security. Then, we present a sufficiently rich three-party security model for OAuth protocols, covering all kinds of authorization flows, providing reasonably strong security guarantees and moreover capturing various web features. To confirm the soundness of our model, we also identify the known attacks against OAuth 2.0 in the model. Furthermore, we prove that two main modes of OAuth 2.0 can achieve our desired security by abstracting the token issue process into a 3P-ASD protocol. Our analysis is not only modular which can reflect the compositional nature of OAuth 2.0, but also fine-grained which can evaluate how the intermediate parameters affect the final security of OAuth 2.0.
papers.abstract_zh: OAuth 2.0是用于授权/单点登录(SSO)的最广泛使用的互联网协议之一，也是新的SSO协议OpenID Connect的基础。由于OAuth 2.0标准的复杂性和灵活性，很难全面分析OAuth 2.0标准的安全性，但获得OAuth 2.0的实际安全保证是至关重要的。在本文中，我们提出了OAuth 2.0的第一个计算上可靠的安全性分析。首先，我们引入了一个新的原语，三方认证秘密分发(简称3P-ASD)协议，它扮演着发布秘密的角色，并捕获了OAuth 2.0的令牌发布过程。据我们所知，这是首次尝试将授权技术正式抽象成一个通用原语，然后定义其安全性。然后，我们为OAuth协议提出了一个足够丰富的三方安全模型，它覆盖了所有类型的授权流程，提供了相当强的安全保证，而且还捕获了各种web特性。为了证实我们模型的可靠性，我们还在模型中识别了针对OAuth 2.0的已知攻击。此外，我们证明了OAuth 2.0的两种主要模式可以通过将令牌发放过程抽象为3P-ASD协议来实现我们期望的安全性。我们的分析不仅是模块化的，可以反映OAuth 2.0的组合性质，而且是细粒度的，可以评估中间参数如何影响OAuth 2.0的最终安全性。
papers.title_zh: 三方环境下OAuth 2.0的模块化安全性分析

papers.title: Replay Attacks and Defenses Against Cross-shard Consensus in Sharded Distributed Ledgers
papers.authors: Alberto Sonnino, Shehar Bano, Mustafa Al-Bassam, George Danezis
papers.abstract: We present a family of replay attacks against sharded distributed ledgers targeting cross-shard consensus protocols, such as the recently proposed Chainspace and Omniledger. They allow an attacker, with network access only, to double-spend or lock resources with minimal efforts. The attacker can act independently without colluding with any nodes, and succeed even if all nodes are honest; most of the attacks can also exhibit themselves as faults under periods of asynchrony. These attacks are effective against both shard-led and client-led cross-shard consensus approaches. We present Byzcuit-a new cross-shard consensus protocol that is immune to those attacks. We implement a prototype of Byzcuit and evaluate it on a real cloud-based testbed, showing that our defenses impact performance minimally, and overall performance surpasses previous works.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一系列针对分片分布式分类帐的重放攻击，目标是跨分片共识协议，例如最近提出的Chainspace和Omniledger。它们允许仅具有网络访问权限的攻击者以最小的努力重复花费或锁定资源。攻击者可以不与任何节点合谋而独立行动，即使所有节点都是诚实的也能成功；大多数攻击在异步期间也会表现为错误。这些攻击对分片领导和客户领导的跨分片共识方法都有效。我们提出byz cuit——一种新的跨碎片共识协议，可以免疫这些攻击。我们实现了Byzcuit的一个原型，并在一个真正的基于云的测试床上对它进行了评估，表明我们的防御对性能的影响最小，并且整体性能超过了以前的工作。
papers.title_zh: 分片分布式分类帐中跨分片一致性的重放攻击和防御

papers.title: TagBleed: Breaking KASLR on the Isolated Kernel Address Space using Tagged TLBs
papers.authors: Jakob Koschel, Cristiano Giuffrida, Herbert Bos, Kaveh Razavi
papers.abstract: Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (KASLR) has been repeatedly targeted by side-channel attacks that exploit a typical unified user/kernel address space organization to disclose randomized kernel addresses. The community has responded with kernel address space isolation techniques that separate user and kernel address spaces (and associated resources) to eradicate all existing side-channel attacks. In this paper, we show that kernel address space isolation is insufficient to harden KASLR against practical side-channel attacks on modern tagged TLB architectures. While tagged TLBs have been praised for optimizing the performance of kernel address space isolation, we show that they also silently break its original security guarantees and open up opportunities for new derandomization attacks. As a concrete demonstration, we present TagBleed, a new side-channel attack that abuses tagged TLBs and residual translation information to break KASLR even in the face of state-of-the-art mitigations. TagBleed is practical and shows that implementing secure address space isolation requires deep partitioning of microarchitectural resources and a more generous performance budget than previously assumed.
papers.abstract_zh: 内核地址空间布局随机化(KASLR)多次成为旁路攻击的目标，这些攻击利用典型的统一用户/内核地址空间组织来泄露随机化的内核地址。社区用内核地址空间隔离技术作出了回应，这种技术将用户和内核地址空间(以及相关资源)分开，以根除所有现有的旁路攻击。在本文中，我们表明内核地址空间隔离不足以加强KASLR对抗现代标记TLB体系结构上的实际旁路攻击。虽然标记TLB因优化内核地址空间隔离的性能而受到称赞，但我们发现它们也悄悄地打破了原有的安全保证，并为新的去随机化攻击提供了机会。作为一个具体的演示，我们提出了TagBleed，这是一种新的旁道攻击，它滥用带标签的TLB和残余翻译信息来破坏KASLR，即使面对最先进的缓解措施。TagBleed是实用的，它表明实现安全的地址空间隔离需要对微体系结构资源进行深度分区，并且需要比以前设想的更大的性能预算。
papers.title_zh: TagBleed:使用带标签的TLB破坏隔离内核地址空间上的KASLR

papers.title: Chameleons' Oblivion: Complex-Valued Deep Neural Networks for Protocol-Agnostic RF Device Fingerprinting
papers.authors: Ioannis Agadakos, Nikolaos Agadakos, Jason Polakis, Mohamed R. Amer
papers.abstract: Prior work has demonstrated techniques for fingerprinting devices based on their network traffic or transmitted signals, which use software artifacts or characteristics of the underlying protocol. However these approaches are not robust or applicable in many real-world scenarios. In this paper we explore the feasibility of device fingerprinting under challenging realistic settings, by identifying artifacts in the transmitted signals caused by devices' unique hardware “imperfections”. We develop RF-DCN, a novel Deep Complex-valued Neural Network (DCN) that operates on raw RF signals and is completely agnostic of the underlying applications and protocols. We introduce two DCN variations: a retrofitted Convolutional DCN (CDCN) originally created for acoustic signals, and a novel Recurrent DCN (RDCN) for modeling time series. Our work demonstrates the feasibility of operating on raw I/Q data collected within a narrowband spectrum from open air captures across vastly different modulation schemes. In contrast to prior work, we do not utilize knowledge of the modulation scheme or protocol intricacies such as carrier frequencies. We conduct an extensive experimental evaluation on large and diverse datasets as part of a DARPA red team evaluation, and investigate the effects of different environmental factors as well as neural network architectures and hyperparameters on our system's performance. Our novel RDCN consistently outperforms all baseline neural network architectures, is robust to noise, and can identify a target device even when numerous devices are concurrently transmitting within the band of interest under the same or different protocols. While our experiments demonstrate the applicability of our techniques under challenging conditions where other neural network architectures break down, we identify additional challenges in signal-based fingerprinting and provide guidelines for future explorations.
papers.abstract_zh: 先前的工作已经展示了基于设备的网络流量或传输信号来对设备进行指纹识别的技术，这些技术使用软件人工制品或底层协议的特征。然而，这些方法在许多现实场景中并不健壮或适用。在本文中，我们通过识别由设备独特的硬件“缺陷”导致的传输信号中的伪像，来探索设备指纹识别在具有挑战性的现实环境下的可行性。我们开发了RF-DCN，这是一种新型的深度复值神经网络(DCN ),它对原始RF信号进行操作，并且完全不知道底层应用和协议。我们介绍了两种DCN变体:一种改进的卷积DCN (CDCN ),最初是为声学信号创建的，以及一种新的递归DCN (RDCN ),用于时间序列建模。我们的工作证明了对在窄带频谱内收集的原始I/Q数据进行操作的可行性，所述窄带频谱来自跨越非常不同的调制方案的露天捕获。与先前的工作相比，我们不利用调制方案或协议复杂性的知识，例如载波频率。作为DARPA红队评估的一部分，我们对大量不同的数据集进行了广泛的实验评估，并研究了不同环境因素以及神经网络架构和超参数对我们系统性能的影响。我们的新型RDCN始终优于所有基线神经网络架构，对噪声具有鲁棒性，并且即使当许多设备在相同或不同协议下在感兴趣的频带内并发传输时，也可以识别目标设备。虽然我们的实验证明了我们的技术在其他神经网络架构崩溃的挑战性条件下的适用性，但我们确定了基于信号的指纹识别中的其他挑战，并为未来的探索提供了指南。
papers.title_zh: 变色龙的遗忘:用于协议不可知射频设备指纹识别的复值深度神经网络

papers.title: DARIA: Designing Actuators to Resist Arbitrary Attacks Against Cyber-Physical Systems
papers.authors: Jairo Giraldo, Sahand Hadizadeh Kafash, Justin Ruths, Alvaro A. Cárdenas
papers.abstract: In the past decade we have seen an active research community proposing attacks and defenses to Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS). Most of these attacks and defenses have been heuristic in nature, limiting the attacker to a set of predefined operations, and proposing defenses with unclear security guarantees. In this paper, we propose a generic adversary model that can capture any type of attack (our attacker is not constrained to follow specific attacks such as replay, delay, or bias) and use it to design security mechanisms with provable security guarantees. In particular, we propose a new secure design paradigm we call DARIA: Designing Actuators to Resist arbItrary Attacks. The main idea behind DARIA is the design of physical limits to actuators in order to prevent attackers from arbitrarily manipulating the system, irrespective of their point of attack (sensors or actuators) or the specific attack algorithm (bias, replay, delays, etc.). As far as we are aware, we are the first research team to propose the design of physical limits to actuators in a control loop in order to keep the system secure against attacks. We demonstrate the generality of our proposal on simulations of vehicular platooning and industrial processes.
papers.abstract_zh: 在过去的十年中，我们看到了一个活跃的研究社区提出了对网络物理系统(CPS)的攻击和防御。这些攻击和防御中的大多数本质上都是启发式的，将攻击者限制在一组预定义的操作中，并提出了安全保证不明确的防御措施。在本文中，我们提出了一个通用的对手模型，它可以捕获任何类型的攻击(我们的攻击者并不局限于跟随特定的攻击，如重放、延迟或偏见)，并使用它来设计具有可证明的安全保证的安全机制。特别是，我们提出了一个新的安全设计范式，我们称之为DARIA:设计执行器来抵抗任意攻击。DARIA背后的主要思想是设计致动器的物理限制，以防止攻击者任意操纵系统，而不管他们的攻击点(传感器或致动器)或具体的攻击算法(偏差、重放、延迟等)。).据我们所知，我们是第一个提出对控制回路中的致动器进行物理限制的设计的研究团队，以保持系统免受攻击。我们证明了我们的建议的一般性模拟车辆排队和工业过程。
papers.title_zh: DARIA:设计致动器来抵抗对信息物理系统的任意攻击

papers.title: Practical Volume-Based Attacks on Encrypted Databases
papers.authors: Rishabh Poddar, Stephanie Wang, Jianan Lu, Raluca Ada Popa
papers.abstract: Recent years have seen an increased interest towards strong security primitives for encrypted databases (such as oblivious protocols) that hide the access patterns of query execution and reveal only the volume of results. However recent work has shown that even volume leakage can enable the reconstruction of entire columns in the database. Yet existing attacks rely on a set of assumptions that are unrealistic in practice for example they (i) require a large number of queries to be issued by the user or (ii) assume certain distributions on the queries or underlying data (e.g. that the queries are distributed uniformly at random or that the database does not contain missing values). In this work we present new attacks for recovering the content of individual user queries assuming no leakage from the system except the number of results and avoiding the limiting assumptions above. Unlike prior attacks our attacks require only a single query to be issued by the user for recovering the keyword. Furthermore our attacks make no assumptions about the distribution of issued queries or the underlying data. Instead our key insight is to exploit the behavior of real-world applications. We start by surveying 11 applications to identify two key characteristics that can be exploited by attackers-(l) file injection and (ii) automatic query replay. We present attacks that leverage these two properties in concert with volume leakage independent of the details of any encrypted database system. Subsequently we perform an attack on the real Gmail web client by simulating a server-side adversary. Our attack on Gmail completes within a matter of minutes demonstrating the feasibility of our techniques. We also present three ancillary attacks for situations when certain mitigation strategies are employed.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，人们对加密数据库的强安全原语(如遗忘协议)越来越感兴趣，这些原语隐藏查询执行的访问模式，仅显示结果的数量。然而，最近的工作表明，即使是卷泄漏也可以重建数据库中的整个列。然而，现有的攻击依赖于一组假设，这些假设在实践中是不现实的，例如，它们(I)需要用户发出大量查询，或者(ii)假设查询或底层数据的某些分布(例如，查询是随机均匀分布的，或者数据库不包含缺失值)。在这项工作中，我们提出了恢复单个用户查询内容的新攻击，假设除了结果的数量之外没有从系统中泄漏，并避免了上述限制性假设。与以前的攻击不同，我们的攻击只需要用户发出一个查询来恢复关键字。此外，我们的攻击对发出的查询或底层数据的分布不做任何假设。相反，我们的关键见解是利用现实世界应用程序的行为。我们首先调查11个应用程序，以确定攻击者可以利用的两个关键特征-(1)文件注入和(2)自动查询重放。我们提出了利用这两个属性与卷泄漏相结合的攻击，而与任何加密数据库系统的细节无关。随后，我们通过模拟服务器端的对手，对真实的Gmail网络客户端进行攻击。我们对Gmail的攻击在几分钟内完成，证明了我们技术的可行性。我们还提出了三种辅助攻击，用于采用某些缓解策略的情况。
papers.title_zh: 对加密数据库的基于卷的实用攻击

papers.title: On Deploying Secure Computing: Private Intersection-Sum-with-Cardinality
papers.authors: Mihaela Ion, Ben Kreuter, Ahmet Erhan Nergiz, Sarvar Patel, Shobhit Saxena, Karn Seth, Mariana Raykova, David Shanahan, Moti Yung
papers.abstract: In this work, we discuss our successful efforts for industry deployment of a cryptographic secure computation protocol. The problem we consider is privately computing aggregate conversion rate of advertising campaigns. This underlying functionality can be abstracted as Private Intersection-Sum (PI-Sum) with Cardinality. In this setting two parties hold datasets containing user identifiers, and one of the parties additionally has an integer value associated with each of its user identifiers. The parties want to learn the number of identifiers they have in common and the sum of the integer values associated with these users without revealing any more information about their private inputs. We identify the major properties and enabling factors which make the deployment of a cryptographic protocol possible, practical, and uniquely positioned as a solution for the task at hand. We describe our deployment setting and the most relevant efficiency measure, which in our setting is communication overhead rather than computation. We also present a monetary cost model that can be used as a unifying cost measure and the computation model which reflect out use-case: a low-priority batch computing. We present three PI-Sum with cardinality protocols: our currently deployed protocol, which relies on a Diffie-Hellman style double masking, and two new protocols which leverage more recent techniques for private set intersection (PSI) that use Random Oblivious Transfer and encrypted Bloom filters. We compare the later two protocol with our original solution when instantiated with different additively homomorphic encryption schemes. We implement our constructions and compare their costs. We also compare with recent generic approaches for computing on the intersection of two datasets and show that our best protocol has monetary cost that is 20× less than the best known generic approach.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这篇文章中，我们讨论了我们为加密安全计算协议的工业部署所做的成功努力。我们考虑的问题是私下计算广告活动的总转化率。这个底层功能可以抽象为带有基数的私有交集和(PI-Sum)。在该设置中，双方持有包含用户标识符的数据集，并且其中一方另外具有与其每个用户标识符相关联的整数值。各方想要了解他们共有的标识符的数量以及与这些用户相关联的整数值的总和，而不透露关于他们的私人输入的任何更多信息。我们确定了使加密协议的部署成为可能、实用和独特的解决方案的主要属性和使能因素。我们描述了我们的部署设置和最相关的效率度量，在我们的设置中是通信开销而不是计算。我们还提出了一个货币成本模型，可以作为一个统一的成本措施和计算模型，反映出用例:低优先级批处理计算。我们提出了三个带基数的PI-Sum协议:我们当前部署的协议，它依赖于Diffie-Hellman风格的双重掩码，以及两个新的协议，它们利用了最近的私有集合交集(PSI)技术，使用随机不经意传输和加密布隆过滤器。当用不同的加同态加密方案实例化时，我们将后两个协议与我们的原始解决方案进行比较。我们实现我们的构造并比较它们的成本。我们还与最近在两个数据集的交集上计算的通用方法进行了比较，并表明我们的最佳协议的货币成本比已知的最佳通用方法低20倍。
papers.title_zh: 关于部署安全计算:私有交集和基数

papers.title: Differentially Private Two-Party Set Operations
papers.authors: Bailey Kacsmar, Basit Khurram, Nils Lukas, Alexander Norton, Masoumeh Shafieinejad, Zhiwei Shang, Yaser Baseri, Maryam Sepehri, Simon Oya, Florian Kerschbaum
papers.abstract: Private set intersection (PSI) allows two parties to compute the intersection of their data without revealing the data they possess that is outside of the intersection. However, in many cases of joint data analysis, the intersection is also sensitive. We define differentially private set intersection and we propose new protocols using (leveled) homomorphic encryption where the result is differentially private. Our circuit-based approach has an adaptability that allows us to achieve differential privacy, as well as to compute predicates over the intersection such as cardinality. Furthermore, our protocol produces differentially private output for set intersection and set intersection cardinality that is optimal in terms of communication and computation complexity. For a client set of size $m$ and a server set of size $n$, where $m$ is smaller than $n$, our communication complexity is $O(m)$ while previous circuit-based protocols only achieve $O(n+m)$ communication complexity. In addition to our asymptotic optimizations which include new analysis for using nested cuckoo hashing for PSI, we demonstrate the practicality of our protocol through an implementation that shows the feasibility of computing the differentially private intersection for large data sets containing millions of elements.
papers.abstract_zh: 私有集合交集(PSI)允许双方计算他们的数据的交集，而不暴露他们拥有的在交集之外的数据。但是，在很多联合数据分析的情况下，交集也是敏感的。我们定义了差分私有集合交集，并提出了使用(分级)同态加密的新协议，其中结果是差分私有的。我们基于电路的方法具有适应性，允许我们实现差分隐私，以及计算交集上的谓词，如基数。此外，我们的协议为集合交集和集合交集基数产生差分私有输出，这在通信和计算复杂性方面是最优的。对于大小为$m$的客户端组和大小为$n$的服务器组，其中$m$小于$n$，我们的通信复杂度为$O(m)$而先前的基于电路的协议仅实现了$O(n+m)$的通信复杂度。除了我们的渐近优化(包括对PSI使用嵌套cuckoo哈希的新分析)之外，我们还通过一个实现来展示我们的协议的实用性，该实现显示了计算包含数百万个元素的大型数据集的差分私有交集的可行性。
papers.title_zh: 差分私有两方集合运算

papers.title: Zone Encryption with Anonymous Authentication for V2V Communication
papers.authors: Jan Camenisch, Manu Drijvers, Anja Lehmann, Gregory Neven, Patrick Towa
papers.abstract: Vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) communication systems are currently being prepared for real-world deployment, but they face strong opposition over privacy concerns. Position beacon messages are the main culprit, being broadcast in cleartext and pseudonymously signed up to 10 times per second. So far, no practical solutions have been proposed to encrypt or anonymously authenticate V2V messages. We propose two cryptographic innovations that enhance the privacy of V2V communication. As a core contribution, we introduce zone-encryption schemes, where vehicles generate and authentically distribute encryption keys associated to static geographic zones close to their location. Zone encryption provides security against eavesdropping, and, combined with a suitable anonymous authentication scheme, ensures that messages can only be sent by genuine vehicles, while adding only 224 Bytes of cryptographic overhead to each message. Our second contribution is an authentication mechanism fine-tuned to the needs of V2V which allows vehicles to authentically distribute keys, and is called dynamic group signatures with attributes. Our instantiation features unlimited locally generated pseudonyms, negligible credential download-and-storage costs, identity recovery by a trusted authority, and compact signatures of 216 Bytes at a 128-bit security level.
papers.abstract_zh: 车辆对车辆(V2V)通信系统目前正在为现实世界的部署做准备，但他们面临着隐私问题的强烈反对。位置信标消息是罪魁祸首，以明文形式广播，每秒钟以假名签名多达10次。到目前为止，还没有提出加密或匿名认证V2V消息的实际解决方案。我们提出了两个加密创新来增强V2V通信的保密性。作为核心贡献，我们引入了区域加密方案，其中车辆生成并真正分发与靠近其位置的静态地理区域相关的加密密钥。区域加密提供了防止窃听的安全性，并与适当的匿名认证方案相结合，确保消息只能由真正的车辆发送，同时仅向每条消息添加224字节的加密开销。我们的第二个贡献是一个认证机制，该机制根据V2V的需求进行了微调，允许车辆真实地分发密钥，并被称为带属性的动态群签名。我们的实例化具有无限制的本地生成的假名、可忽略的凭证下载和存储成本、可信机构的身份恢复以及128位安全级别的216字节的紧凑签名。
papers.title_zh: V2V通信中带匿名认证的区域加密

papers.title: Extensive Security Verification of the LoRaWAN Key-Establishment: Insecurities & Patches
papers.authors: Stephan Wesemeyer, Ioana Boureanu, Zach Smith, Helen Treharne
papers.abstract: LoRaWAN (Low-power Wide-Area Networks) is the main specification for application-level IoT (Internet of Things). The current version, published in October 2017, is LoRaWAN 1.1, with its 1.0 precursor still being the main specification supported by commercial devices such as PyCom LoRa transceivers. Prior (semi)-formal investigations into the security of the LoRaWAN protocols are scarce, especially for Lo-RaWAN 1.1. Moreover, amongst these few, the current encodings [4], [9] of LoRaWAN into verification tools unfortunately rely on much-simplified versions of the LoRaWAN protocols, undermining the relevance of the results in practice. In this paper, we fill in some of these gaps. Whilst we briefly discuss the most recent cryptographic-orientated works [5] that looked at LoRaWAN 1.1, our true focus is on producing formal analyses of the security and correctness of LoRaWAN, mechanised inside automated tools. To this end, we use the state-of-the-art prover, Tamarin. Importantly, our Tamarin models are a faithful and precise rendering of the LoRaWAN specifications. For example, we model the bespoke nonce-generation mechanisms newly introduced in LoRaWAN 1.1, as well as the “classical” but shortdomain nonces in LoRaWAN 1.0 and make recommendations regarding these. Whilst we include small parts on device-commissioning and application-level traffic, we primarily scrutinise the Join Procedure of LoRaWAN, and focus on version 1.1 of the specification, but also include an analysis of Lo-RaWAN 1.0. To this end, we consider three increasingly strong threat models, resting on a Dolev-Yao attacker acting modulo different requirements made on various channels (e.g., secure/insecure) and the level of trust placed on entities (e.g., honest/corruptible network servers). Importantly, one of these threat models is exactly in line with the LoRaWAN specification, yet it unfortunately still leads to attacks. In response to the exhibited attacks, we propose a minimal patch of the LoRaWAN 1.1 Join Procedure, which is as backwards-compatible as possible with the current version. We analyse and prove this patch secure in the strongest threat model mentioned above. This work has been responsibly disclosed to the LoRa Alliance, and we are liaising with the Security Working Group of the LoRa Alliance, in order to improve the clarity of the LoRaWAN 1.1 specifications in light of our findings, but also by using formal analysis as part of a feedback-loop of future and current specification writing.
papers.abstract_zh: LoRaWAN(低功耗广域网)是应用级IoT(物联网)的主要规范。2017年10月发布的当前版本是LoRaWAN 1.1，其1.0前身仍然是PyCom LoRa收发器等商业设备支持的主要规范。对LoRaWAN协议的安全性，特别是对Lo-RaWAN 1.1的安全性，以前(半)正式的调查很少。此外，不幸的是，在这些少数协议中，LoRaWAN到验证工具的当前编码[4]、[9]依赖于LoRaWAN协议的简化版本，破坏了结果在实践中的相关性。在本文中，我们填补了其中的一些空白。虽然我们简要地讨论了最近关于LoRaWAN 1.1的面向密码的工作[5]，但我们真正的重点是对LoRaWAN的安全性和正确性进行正式的分析，在自动化工具中实现机械化。为此，我们使用最先进的校准仪——Tamarin。重要的是，我们的绢毛猴模型忠实而精确地再现了罗拉万的规格。例如，我们模拟了LoRaWAN 1.1中新引入的定制随机数生成机制，以及LoRaWAN 1.0中“经典”但短域的随机数，并就这些提出了建议。虽然我们包括了设备调试和应用级流量的小部分，但我们主要仔细检查了LoRaWAN的加入过程，并集中于规范的1.1版本，但也包括对Lo-RaWAN 1.0的分析。为此，我们考虑三个日益强大的威胁模型，依赖于Dolev-Yao攻击者对各种信道(例如，安全/不安全)和实体(例如，诚实/可破坏的网络服务器)上的信任级别的不同要求采取行动。重要的是，其中一个威胁模型完全符合LoRaWAN规范，但不幸的是，它仍然会导致攻击。为了应对所展示的攻击，我们提出了一个LoRaWAN 1.1 Join过程的最小补丁，它尽可能向后兼容当前版本。我们分析并证明了该补丁在上述最强威胁模型下是安全的。这项工作已经负责任地向LoRa联盟披露，我们正在与LoRa联盟的安全工作组联系，以便根据我们的发现提高LoRaWAN 1.1规范的清晰度，同时也通过使用形式分析作为未来和当前规范编写的反馈环的一部分。
papers.title_zh: LoRaWAN密钥建立的广泛安全验证:不安全性和补丁

papers.title: AVGuardian: Detecting and Mitigating Publish-Subscribe Overprivilege for Autonomous Vehicle Systems
papers.authors: David Ke Hong, John Kloosterman, Yuqi Jin, Yulong Cao, Qi Alfred Chen, Scott A. Mahlke, Z. Morley Mao
papers.abstract: Autonomous vehicle (AV) software systems are emerging to enable rapidly developed self-driving functionalities. Since such systems are responsible for safety-critical decisions, it is necessary to secure them in face of cyber attacks. Through an empirical study of representative AV software systems Baidu Apollo and Autoware, we discover a common over privilege problem with the publish-subscribe communication model widely adopted by AV systems: due to the coarse-grained message design for the publish-subscribe communication, some message fields are over-granted with publish/subscribe permissions. To comply with the least-privilege principle and reduce the attack surface resulting from such problem, we argue that the publish/subscribe permissions should be defined and enforced at the granularity of message fields instead of messages. To systematically address such publish-subscribe over-privilege problems, we present AVGuardian, a system that includes (1) a static analysis tool that detects overprivilege instances in AV software and generates the corresponding access control policies at the message field granularity, and (2) a low-overhead, module-transparent, runtime pub-lish/subscribe permission policy enforcement mechanism to perform online policy violation detection and prevention. Using our detection tool, we are able to automatically detect 581 overprivilege instances in total in Baidu Apollo. To demonstrate the severity, we further constructed several concrete exploits that can lead to vehicle collision and identity theft for AV owners, which have been reported to Baidu Apollo and confirmed as valid. For defense, we prototype and evaluate the policy enforcement mechanism, and find that it has very low overhead, does not affect original AV decision logic, and also is resilient to message replay attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 自动驾驶车辆(AV)软件系统正在出现，以实现快速开发的自动驾驶功能。由于此类系统负责安全关键决策，因此有必要在面临网络攻击时保护它们。通过对具有代表性的反病毒软件系统Baidu Apollo和Autoware的实证研究，我们发现反病毒系统广泛采用的发布-订阅通信模型存在一个普遍的过度特权问题:由于发布-订阅通信的粗粒度消息设计，一些消息字段被过度授予了发布/订阅权限。为了遵守最小特权原则并减少由此导致的攻击面，我们认为发布/订阅权限应该在消息字段而不是消息的粒度上定义和执行。为了系统地解决这种发布-订阅过度特权问题，我们提出了AVGuardian，该系统包括(1)静态分析工具，其检测反病毒软件中的过度特权实例，并在消息字段粒度生成相应的访问控制策略，以及(2)低开销、模块透明的运行时发布/订阅权限策略实施机制，以执行在线策略违反检测和预防。使用我们的检测工具，我们能够在百度Apollo中自动检测总共581个过度特权实例。为了证明严重性，我们进一步构建了几个可能导致车辆碰撞和反病毒所有者身份被盗的具体漏洞，这些漏洞已报告给百度Apollo并确认有效。在防御方面，我们对策略执行机制进行了原型化和评估，发现它具有很低的开销，不影响原有的AV决策逻辑，并且对消息重放攻击具有很强的抵御能力。
papers.title_zh: AVGuardian:检测和减轻自动车辆系统的发布-订阅过度特权

papers.title: A Vehicular DAA Scheme for Unlinkable ECDSA Pseudonyms in V2X
papers.authors: Christopher Hicks, Flavio D. Garcia
papers.abstract: Vehicle-to-everything (V2X) communication is a broadcast messaging system intended to improve the efficiency and safety of connected and autonomous vehicles. In this paper we present a new V2X architecture and key management solution that reconciles the strong privacy guarantees of Direct Anonymous Attestation (DAA) with the efficiency, low-latency and accountability that is required for V2X. In contrast with the leading V2X standards, and uniquely in the literature, we prevent long-term vehicle pseudonym tracking despite dishonest and colluding certificate authorities and whilst retaining centralised authority over revocation. Our Vehicular DAA (VDAA) scheme includes a novel construction that optimally limits Sybil attacks by restricting each vehicle to one anonymous pseudonym-request per epoch. We present a new security model for VDAA and show that we can reduce the unforgeability and unlinkability of our Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) broadcast messages to the security of the underlying DAA scheme.
papers.abstract_zh: 车辆对一切(V2X)通信是一种广播消息系统，旨在提高互联和自动驾驶车辆的效率和安全性。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的V2X架构和密钥管理解决方案，该解决方案将直接匿名证明(DAA)的强大隐私保证与V2X所需的效率、低延迟和责任性相结合。与领先的V2X标准形成对比，并且在文献中是独一无二的，我们防止长期车辆假名跟踪，尽管存在不诚实和串通的认证机构，同时保留撤销的集中权限。我们的车辆DAA (VDAA)方案包括一个新颖的结构，通过限制每辆车每个时期一个匿名假名请求来最佳地限制Sybil攻击。我们提出了一个新的VDAA安全模型，并且证明了我们可以将椭圆曲线数字签名算法(ECDSA)广播消息的不可伪造性和不可链接性降低到基础DAA方案的安全性。
papers.title_zh: V2X中不可链接ECDSA假名的车载DAA方案

papers.title: IoTFinder: Efficient Large-Scale Identification of IoT Devices via Passive DNS Traffic Analysis
papers.authors: Roberto Perdisci, Thomas Papastergiou, Omar Alrawi, Manos Antonakakis
papers.abstract: Being able to enumerate potentially vulnerable IoT devices across the Internet is important, because it allows for assessing global Internet risks and enables network operators to check the hygiene of their own networks. To this end, in this paper we propose IoTFinder, a system for efficient, large-scale passive identification of IoT devices. Specifically, we leverage distributed passive DNS data collection, and develop a machine learning-based system that aims to accurately identify a large variety of IoT devices based solely on their DNS fingerprints. Our system is independent of whether the devices reside behind a NAT or other middleboxes, or whether they are assigned an IPv4 or IPv6 address. We design IoTFinder as a multi-label classifier, and evaluate its accuracy in several different settings, including computing detection results over a third-party IoT traffic dataset and DNS traffic collected at a US-based ISP hosting more than 40 million clients. The experimental results show that our approach allows for accurately detecting many diverse IoT devices, even when they are hosted behind a NAT and their traffic is “mixed” with traffic generated by other IoT and non-IoT devices hosted in the same local network.
papers.abstract_zh: 能够列举互联网上潜在易受攻击的物联网设备非常重要，因为这可以评估全球互联网风险，并使网络运营商能够检查自己网络的卫生状况。为此，在本文中，我们提出了IoTFinder，一种用于高效、大规模被动识别物联网设备的系统。具体来说，我们利用分布式被动DNS数据收集，并开发了一个基于机器学习的系统，旨在仅根据DNS指纹准确识别大量不同的物联网设备。我们的系统独立于设备是否位于NAT或其他中间盒之后，或者它们是否被分配了IPv4或IPv6地址。我们将IoTFinder设计为多标签分类器，并在几种不同的设置下评估其准确性，包括计算第三方物联网流量数据集的检测结果和在托管超过4000万客户的美国ISP处收集的DNS流量。实验结果表明，我们的方法可以准确检测许多不同的物联网设备，即使它们托管在NAT之后，并且它们的流量与同一本地网络中托管的其他物联网和非物联网设备生成的流量“混合”。
papers.title_zh: IoTFinder:通过被动DNS流量分析高效大规模识别物联网设备

papers.title: Generalized Iterative Bayesian Update and Applications to Mechanisms for Privacy Protection
papers.authors: Ehab ElSalamouny, Catuscia Palamidessi
papers.abstract: The iterative Bayesian update (IBU) and the matrix inversion (INV) are the main methods to retrieve the original distribution from noisy data resulting from the application of privacy protection mechanisms. We show that the foundations of IBU established in the literature are flawed, as they rely on an assumption that in general is not satisfied in typical datasets. We then propose an extension of the method, covering a more general privacy model, where different users are allowed to apply different privacy mechanisms. We call our algorithm GIBU, for Generalized IBU, and we prove its convergence to the maximum likelihood estimate, constructing a proof that does not rely on the problematic assumption, thus fixing also the theory of IBU. Finally we evaluate the precision of GIBU on data sanitized with k-RR, Rappor, geo-indistinguishability and exponential mechanisms. We show that, while GIBU and INV are comparable in the first two cases, the performance of GIBU is definitely superior in the latter cases.
papers.abstract_zh: 迭代贝叶斯更新(IBU)和矩阵求逆(INV)是从应用隐私保护机制产生的噪声数据中恢复原始分布的主要方法。我们表明，文献中建立的IBU的基础是有缺陷的，因为它们依赖于一个通常在典型数据集中不满足的假设。然后，我们提出了该方法的扩展，覆盖了更一般的隐私模型，其中不同的用户被允许应用不同的隐私机制。对于广义IBU，我们称我们的算法为GIBU，我们证明了它收敛于最大似然估计，构造了一个不依赖于有问题的假设的证明，从而也修正了IBU的理论。最后，我们评估了GIBU在经过k-RR、Rappor、地理不可区分性和指数机制处理的数据上的精度。我们发现，虽然GIBU和INV在前两种情况下不相上下，但在后两种情况下，GIBU的性能无疑更胜一筹。
papers.title_zh: 广义迭代贝叶斯更新及其在隐私保护机制中的应用

papers.title: Membership Inference Against DNA Methylation Databases
papers.authors: Inken Hagestedt, Mathias Humbert, Pascal Berrang, Irina Lehmann, Roland Eils, Michael Backes, Yang Zhang
papers.abstract: Biomedical data sharing is one of the key elements fostering the advancement of biomedical research but poses severe risks towards the privacy of individuals contributing their data, as already demonstrated for genomic data. In this paper, we study whether and to which extent DNA methylation data, one of the most important epigenetic elements regulating human health, is prone to membership inference attacks, a critical type of attack that reveals an individual's participation in a given database. We design and evaluate three different attacks exploiting published summary statistics, among which one is based on machine learning and another is exploiting the dependencies between genome and methylation data. Our extensive evaluation on six datasets containing a diverse set of tissues and diseases collected from more than 1,300 individuals in total shows that such membership inference attacks are effective, even when the target's methylation profile is not accessible. It further shows that the machine-learning approach outperforms the statistical attacks, and that learned models are transferable across different datasets.
papers.abstract_zh: 生物医学数据共享是促进生物医学研究进步的关键因素之一，但对提供数据的个人的隐私构成严重风险，基因组数据已经证明了这一点。在这篇论文中，我们研究了DNA甲基化数据(调节人类健康的最重要的表观遗传元素之一)是否以及在何种程度上容易受到成员推理攻击，这是一种揭示个体参与给定数据库的关键类型的攻击。我们设计并评估了三种不同的攻击，利用了已发布的汇总统计数据，其中一种基于机器学习，另一种利用了基因组和甲基化数据之间的相关性。我们对包含从总共超过1，300个个体中收集的一组不同组织和疾病的六个数据集的广泛评估表明，这种成员推断攻击是有效的，即使当目标的甲基化谱不可获得时。它进一步表明，机器学习方法优于统计攻击，并且学习的模型可以跨不同的数据集转移。
papers.title_zh: 基于DNA甲基化数据库的成员推断

papers.title: A Pragmatic Approach to Membership Inferences on Machine Learning Models
papers.authors: Yunhui Long, Lei Wang, Diyue Bu, Vincent Bindschaedler, XiaoFeng Wang, Haixu Tang, Carl A. Gunter, Kai Chen
papers.abstract: Membership Inference Attacks (MIAs) aim to determine the presence of a record in a machine learning model's training data by querying the model. Recent work has demonstrated the effectiveness of MIA on various machine learning models and corresponding defenses have been proposed. However, both attacks and defenses have focused on an adversary that indiscriminately attacks all the records without regard to the cost of false positives or negatives. In this work, we revisit membership inference attacks from the perspective of a pragmatic adversary who carefully selects targets and make predictions conservatively. We design a new evaluation methodology that allows us to evaluate the membership privacy risk at the level of individuals and not only in aggregate. We experimentally demonstrate that highly vulnerable records exist even when the aggregate attack precision is close to 50% (baseline). Specifically, on the MNIST dataset, our pragmatic adversary achieves a precision of 95.05% whereas the prior attack only achieves a precision of 51.7%.
papers.abstract_zh: 成员推理攻击(MIAs)旨在通过查询机器学习模型来确定该模型的训练数据中是否存在记录。最近的工作证明了MIA在各种机器学习模型上的有效性，并提出了相应的防御措施。然而，攻击和防御都集中在对手身上，对手不分青红皂白地攻击所有记录，而不考虑误报或漏报的代价。在这篇文章中，我们从一个谨慎选择目标并保守预测的实用主义对手的角度重新审视成员推理攻击。我们设计了一种新的评估方法，允许我们在个人层面而不仅仅是在总体层面评估会员隐私风险。我们通过实验证明，即使当总攻击精度接近50%(基线)时，也存在高度易受攻击的记录。具体来说，在MNIST数据集上，我们的实用主义对手达到了95.05%的精度，而先前的攻击只达到了51.7%的精度。
papers.title_zh: 机器学习模型成员推理的实用方法
