While some images are shared for free, these can quickly become 'saturated', leading to the demand for (and trade in) more exclusive 'packs'. These images are then sold to unwitting customers who believe they have paid for a virtual sexual encounter. A variety of online services are used for carrying out this fraud type, including email, video, dating sites, social media, classified advertisements, and payment platforms. This analysis reveals potential interventions that could be applied to each stage of the crime commission process to prevent and disrupt this crime type.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们描述了一种新型的在线欺诈，被犯罪分子称为“eWhoring”。这份犯罪脚本分析提供了“eWhoring”商业模式的概述，利用了从一个在线地下论坛抓取的6，500多个帖子。这是一种不寻常的欺诈类型，因为罪犯很容易以一种几乎是指令性的方式分享关于犯罪方式的信息。这里有经济因素在起作用，因为提供如何从“网络外包”中赚钱的信息可以增加对这种类型的图像的需求，从而使这种事情发生。我们发现色情图片通常会被窃取并在网上分享。虽然有些图片是免费共享的，但这些图片很快就会变得“饱和”，导致对更独家的“包”的需求(和交易)。这些图像然后被卖给不知情的顾客，这些顾客相信他们已经为虚拟的性接触付费了。各种在线服务被用于实施这种类型的欺诈，包括电子邮件、视频、约会网站、社交媒体、分类广告和支付平台。这种分析揭示了可以应用于犯罪实施过程每个阶段的潜在干预措施，以防止和破坏这种犯罪类型。
papers.title_zh: 了解电子外包

papers.title: Key-Insulated and Privacy-Preserving Signature Scheme with Publicly Derived Public Key
papers.authors: Zhen Liu, Guomin Yang, Duncan S. Wong, Khoa Nguyen, Huaxiong Wang
papers.abstract: Since the introduction of Bitcoin in 2008, cryptocurrency has been undergoing a quick and explosive development. At the same time, privacy protection, one of the key merits of cryptocurrency, has attracted much attention by the community. A deterministic wallet algorithm and a stealth address algorithm have been widely adopted in the community, due to their virtues on functionality and privacy protection, which come from a key derivation mechanism that an arbitrary number of derived keys can be generated from a master key. However, these algorithms suffer a vulnerability. In particular, when a minor fault happens (say, one derived key is compromised somehow), the damage is not limited to the leaked derived key only, instead, it spreads to the master key and all derived keys are compromised. In this paper, to provide a formal treatment for the problem, we introduce and formalize a new signature variant, called Key-Insulated and Privacy-Preserving Signature Scheme with Publicly Derived Public Key (PDPKS), which forms a convenient and robust cryptographic tool for offering the virtues of deterministic wallet and stealth address, while eliminating the security vulnerabilities. Specifically, PDPKS allows anyone to derive new signature verification keys for a user, say Alice, based on her long-term public key, while only Alice can derive the signing keys corresponding to those verification keys. In terms of privacy, given a derived verification key and valid signatures with respect to it, an adversary is not able to tell which long-term public key, out of a set of known long-term public keys, is the one from which the verification key was derived. A distinguishing security feature of PDPKS, with the above functionality and privacy features, is that the derived keys are independent/insulated from each other, namely, compromising the signing key associated with a verification key does not allow an adversary to forge a valid signature for another verification key, even if both verification keys are derived from the same long-term public key. We formalize the notion of PDPKS and propose a practical and proven secure construction, which could be a convenient and secure cryptographic tool for building privacy-preserving cryptocurrencies and supporting promising use cases in practice, as it can be used to implement secure stealth addresses, and can be used to implement deterministic wallets and the related appealing use cases, without security concerns.
papers.abstract_zh: 自2008年推出比特币以来，加密货币一直在经历快速而爆炸性的发展。与此同时，作为加密货币的关键优点之一，隐私保护备受社会关注。确定性钱包算法和秘密地址算法由于它们在功能和隐私保护方面的优点而在社区中被广泛采用，这些优点来自于密钥派生机制，即可以从主密钥生成任意数量的派生密钥。然而，这些算法有一个弱点。特别是，当一个小故障发生时(比如说，一个派生密钥由于某种原因被破坏)，损害不仅限于泄漏的派生密钥，相反，它会蔓延到主密钥，并且所有派生密钥都被破坏。在本文中，我们引入并形式化了一种新的签名变体，称为密钥隔离和隐私保护的公开公钥签名方案(PDPKS ),它形成了一种方便而健壮的密码工具，提供了确定性钱包和秘密地址的优点，同时消除了安全漏洞。具体来说，PDPKS允许任何人基于Alice的长期公钥为她导出新的签名验证密钥，而只有Alice可以导出对应于那些验证密钥的签名密钥。就保密性而言，给定一个导出的验证密钥和关于它的有效签名，对手不能说出一组已知的长期公钥中的哪一个是导出该验证密钥的那个。具有上述功能和隐私特征的PDPKS的一个显著的安全特征是，导出的密钥是相互独立/隔离的，即，泄露与验证密钥相关联的签名密钥不允许对手伪造另一个验证密钥的有效签名，即使两个验证密钥都是从相同的长期公钥导出的。我们形式化了PDPKS的概念，并提出了一种实用的、经过验证的安全结构，它可以是一种方便的、安全的加密工具，用于构建隐私保护的加密货币并支持实践中有前途的用例，因为它可以用于实现安全的秘密地址，并可以用于实现确定性钱包和相关的有吸引力的用例，而没有安全问题。
papers.title_zh: 公开导出公钥的密钥隔离和隐私保护签名方案

papers.title: A Mechanised Cryptographic Proof of the WireGuard Virtual Private Network Protocol
papers.authors: Benjamin Lipp, Bruno Blanchet, Karthikeyan Bhargavan
papers.abstract: WireGuard is a free and open source Virtual Private Network (VPN) that aims to replace IPsec and OpenVPN. It is based on a new cryptographic protocol derived from the Noise Protocol Framework. This paper presents the first mechanised cryptographic proof of the protocol underlying WireGuard, using the CryptoVerif proof assistant. We analyse the entire WireGuard protocol as it is, including transport data messages, in an ACCE-style model. We contribute proofs for correctness, message secrecy, forward secrecy, mutual authentication, session uniqueness, and resistance against key compromise impersonation, identity mis-binding, and replay attacks. We also discuss the strength of the identity hiding provided by WireGuard. Our work also provides novel theoretical contributions that are reusable beyond WireGuard. First, we extend CryptoVerif to account for the absence of public key validation in popular Diffie-Hellman groups like Curve25519, which is used in many modern protocols including WireGuard. To our knowledge, this is the first mechanised cryptographic proof for any protocol employing such a precise model. Second, we prove several indifferentiability lemmas that are useful to simplify the proofs for sequences of key derivations.
papers.abstract_zh: WireGuard是一个免费的开源虚拟专用网(VPN)，旨在取代IPsec和OpenVPN。它基于从噪声协议框架派生的新的加密协议。本文使用CryptoVerif proof assistant给出了WireGuard协议的第一个机械化密码证明。我们按照ACCE模式分析了整个WireGuard协议，包括传输数据消息。我们提供了正确性、消息保密、前向保密、相互认证、会话唯一性以及抵抗密钥泄露假冒、身份错误绑定和重放攻击的证据。我们还讨论了WireGuard提供的身份隐藏的强度。我们的工作还提供了超出WireGuard可重用的新的理论贡献。首先，我们扩展CryptoVerif以解决流行的Diffie-Hellman组(如Curve25519)中缺少公钥验证的问题，curve 25519用于包括WireGuard在内的许多现代协议中。据我们所知，这是第一个使用如此精确模型的协议的机械化密码证明。其次，我们证明了几个不可微引理，它们有助于简化关键导子序列的证明。
papers.title_zh: WireGuard虚拟专用网协议的机械化密码证明

papers.title: The Case of Adversarial Inputs for Secure Similarity Approximation Protocols
papers.authors: Evgenios M. Kornaropoulos, Petros Efstathopoulos
papers.abstract: Computing similarity between high-dimensional data is a fundamental problem in data mining and information retrieval, with numerous applications—such as e-discovery and patient similarity. To address the relevant performance and scalability challenges, approximation methods are employed. A common characteristic among all privacy-preserving approximation protocols based on sketching is that the sketching is performed locally and is based on common randomness. Inspired by the power of attacks on machine learning models, we introduce the study of adversarial inputs for secure similarity approximations. To formally capture the framework of this family of attacks we present a new threat model where a party is assumed to use the common randomness to perturb her input 1) offline, and 2) before the execution of any secure protocol, so as to steer the approximation result to a maliciously chosen output. We define perturbation attacks under this adversarial model and propose attacks for the techniques of minhash and cosine sketching. We demonstrate the simplicity and effectiveness of the attacks by measuring their success on synthetic and real data from the areas of e-discovery and patient similarity. To mitigate such perturbation attacks we propose a server-aided architecture, where an additional party, the server, assists in the secure similarity approximation by handling the common randomness as private data. We revise and introduce the necessary secure protocols so as to apply minhash and cosine sketching techniques in the server-aided architecture. Our implementation demonstrates that this new design can mitigate offline perturbation attacks without sacrificing the efficiency and scalability of the reconstruction protocol.
papers.abstract_zh: 计算高维数据之间的相似性是数据挖掘和信息检索中的一个基本问题，有许多应用，如电子发现和患者相似性。为了解决相关的性能和可伸缩性挑战，采用了近似方法。所有基于草图的隐私保护近似协议的一个共同特征是，草图是本地执行的，并且基于共同的随机性。受攻击机器学习模型的力量的启发，我们介绍了对安全相似性近似的对抗性输入的研究。为了正式捕获这一攻击家族的框架，我们提出了一个新的威胁模型，其中假设一方使用公共随机性来干扰她的输入1)离线，以及2)在执行任何安全协议之前，以便将近似结果导向恶意选择的输出。我们在这种对抗模型下定义了扰动攻击，并提出了针对minhash和余弦素描技术的攻击。我们通过在来自电子发现和患者相似性领域的合成和真实数据上测量攻击的成功来证明攻击的简单性和有效性。为了减轻这种干扰攻击，我们提出了一种服务器辅助的体系结构，其中一个附加方，即服务器，通过将公共随机性作为私有数据来处理来协助安全的相似性近似。我们修改并引入了必要的安全协议，以便在服务器辅助架构中应用minhash和余弦草图技术。我们的实现表明，这种新的设计可以减轻离线扰动攻击，而不牺牲重建协议的效率和可扩展性。
papers.title_zh: 安全相似近似协议的对抗性输入情况

papers.title: A Practical Attestation Protocol for Autonomous Embedded Systems
papers.authors: Florian Kohnhäuser, Niklas Büscher, Stefan Katzenbeisser
papers.abstract: With the recent advent of the Internet of Things (IoT), embedded devices increasingly operate collaboratively in autonomous networks. A key technique to guard the secure and safe operation of connected embedded devices is remote attestation. It allows a third party, the verifier, to ensure the integrity of a remote device, the prover. Unfortunately, existing attestation protocols are impractical when applied in autonomous networks of embedded systems due to their limited scalability, performance, robustness, and security guarantees. In this work, we propose PASTA, a novel attestation protocol that is particularly suited for autonomous embedded systems. PASTA is the first that (i) enables many low-end prover devices to attest their integrity towards many potentially untrustworthy low-end verifier devices, (ii) is fully decentralized, thus, able to withstand network disruptions and arbitrary device outages, and (iii) is in addition to software attacks capable of detecting physical attacks in a much more robust way than any existing protocol. We implemented our protocol, conducted measurements, and simulated large networks. The results show that PASTA is practical on low-end embedded devices, scales to large networks with millions of devices, and improves robustness by multiple orders of magnitude compared with the best existing protocols.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着最近物联网(IoT)的出现，嵌入式设备越来越多地在自治网络中协同工作。保护连接的嵌入式设备安全运行的一项关键技术是远程证明。它允许第三方(验证者)确保远程设备(证明者)的完整性。不幸的是，当应用于嵌入式系统的自治网络时，现有的证明协议由于其有限的可扩展性、性能、健壮性和安全保证而不切实际。在这项工作中，我们提出了PASTA，一种特别适合自主嵌入式系统的新型证明协议。PASTA首先(I)使许多低端证明者设备能够向许多潜在不可信的低端验证者设备证明它们的完整性，(ii)是完全分散的，因此能够承受网络中断和任意的设备中断，以及(iii)除了软件攻击之外，能够以比任何现有协议更鲁棒的方式检测物理攻击。我们实施了我们的协议，进行了测量，并模拟了大型网络。结果表明，PASTA在低端嵌入式设备上是实用的，可扩展到拥有数百万设备的大型网络，与现有的最佳协议相比，鲁棒性提高了多个数量级。
papers.title_zh: 一种实用的自主嵌入式系统证明协议

papers.title: IFAL: Issue First Activate Later Certificates for V2X
papers.authors: Eric R. Verheul, Christopher Hicks, Flavio D. Garcia
papers.abstract: This paper presents IFAL, a provably secure and privacy conscious scheme for Vehicle-to-Vehicle and Vehicle-to-Infrastructure (V2X) communication. Issue First Activate Later (IFAL) is a practical and secure improvement to the leading European candidate for V2X (ETSI) and one that also merits over the leading US standard. IFAL incorporates a novel cryptographic mechanism that both avoids the need for certificate revocation and which supports vehicles with limited and intermittent connectivity. We introduce a new construction that is equivalent to symmetric key diversification in the public key setting with short, time-delayed activation. We also present a new formalisation of V2X security and privacy which we apply to IFAL to show that it is a provably secure and privacy conscious V2X scheme. IFAL is ETSI compliant and ready for integration into the standard.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了IFAL，一个可证明的安全和隐私意识的车辆对车辆和车辆对基础设施(V2X)的通信方案。“先发行后激活”( IFAL)是对领先的欧洲候选V2X (ETSI)的一个实用且安全的改进，也优于领先的美国标准。IFAL采用了一种新的加密机制，既避免了证书撤销的需要，又支持有限和间歇性连接的车辆。我们引入了一种新的结构，它相当于公钥设置中的对称密钥多样化，具有短暂的延时激活。我们还提出了一个新的V2X安全和隐私的形式化描述，我们将它应用于IFAL来证明它是一个可证明安全和隐私意识的V2X方案。IFAL是ETSI兼容的，并准备集成到标准。
papers.title_zh: IFAL:为V2X颁发先激活后激活证书

papers.title: SAID: Reshaping Signal into an Identity-Based Asynchronous Messaging Protocol with Authenticated Ratcheting
papers.authors: Olivier Blazy, Angèle Bossuat, Xavier Bultel, Pierre-Alain Fouque, Cristina Onete, Elena Pagnin
papers.abstract: As messaging applications are becoming increasingly popular, it is of utmost importance to analyze their security and mitigate existing weaknesses. This paper focuses on one of the most acclaimed messaging applications: Signal. Signal is a protocol that provides end-to-end channel security, forward secrecy, and post-compromise security. These features are achieved thanks to a key-ratcheting mechanism that updates the key material at every message. Due to its high security impact, Signal's key-ratcheting has recently been formalized, along with an analysis of its security. In this paper, we revisit Signal, describing some attacks against the original design and proposing SAID: Signal Authenticated and IDentity-based. As the name indicates, our protocol relies on an identity-based setup, which allows us to dispense with Signal's centralized server. We use the identity-based long-term secrets to obtain persistent and explicit authentication, such that SAID achieves higher security guarantees than Signal. We prove the security of SAID not only in the Authenticated Key Exchange (AKE) model (as done by previous work), but also in the Authenticated and Confidential Channel Establishment (ACCE) model, which we adapted and redefined for SAID and asynchronous messaging protocols in general into a model we call identity-based Multistage Asynchronous Messaging (iMAM). We believe our model to be more faithful in particular to the true security of Signal, whose use of the message keys prevents them from achieving the composable guarantee claimed by previous analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着消息应用程序变得越来越流行，分析它们的安全性并减轻现有的弱点是非常重要的。本文主要关注最受欢迎的消息传递应用程序之一:Signal。Signal是一种提供端到端通道安全性、前向保密性和后向安全性的协议。这些功能的实现要归功于密钥棘轮机制，它可以在每条消息中更新密钥材料。由于它的高安全性影响，Signal的密钥棘轮最近已经正式化，同时还有对其安全性的分析。在本文中，我们重新审视了Signal，描述了一些针对原始设计的攻击，并提出了SAID:信号认证和基于身份。顾名思义，我们的协议依赖于基于身份的设置，这使得我们可以省去Signal的集中式服务器。我们使用基于身份的长期秘密来获得持久和明确的认证，这样SAID比Signal获得了更高的安全保证。我们不仅在认证密钥交换(AKE)模型中证明了SAID的安全性(如以前的工作所做的)，而且在认证和保密信道建立(ACCE)模型中证明了SAID的安全性，我们对该模型进行了修改，并将其重新定义为基于身份的多级异步消息传递(iMAM)模型。我们认为我们的模型更忠实于信号的真实安全性，信号的消息密钥的使用阻止了它们实现先前分析所声称的可组合保证。
papers.title_zh: SAID:将信号改造成基于身份的异步消息传递协议，采用认证的棘轮机制

papers.title: SoK: Benchmarking Flaws in Systems Security
papers.authors: Erik van der Kouwe, Gernot Heiser, Dennis Andriesse, Herbert Bos, Cristiano Giuffrida
papers.abstract: Properly benchmarking a system is a difficult and intricate task. Even a seemingly innocuous mistake can compromise the guarantees provided by a systems security defense and threaten reproducibility and comparability. Moreover, as many modern defenses trade security for performance, the damage caused by benchmarking mistakes is increasingly worrying. To analyze the magnitude of the phenomenon, we identify 22 benchmarking flaws that threaten the validity of systems security evaluations, and survey 50 defense papers published in top venues. We show that benchmarking flaws are widespread even in papers published at tier-1 venues; tier-1 papers contain an average of five benchmarking flaws and we find only a single paper in our sample without any benchmarking flaws. Moreover, the scale of the problem appears constant over time, suggesting that the community is not yet taking sufficient countermeasures. This threatens the scientific process, which relies on reproducibility and comparability to ensure that published research advances the state of the art. We hope to raise awareness and provide recommendations for improving benchmarking quality and safeguard the scientific process in our community.
papers.abstract_zh: 正确地对系统进行基准测试是一项困难而复杂的任务。即使一个看似无害的错误也可能危及系统安全防御提供的保证，并威胁到可重复性和可比性。此外，随着许多现代防御以安全换取性能，基准错误造成的损害越来越令人担忧。为了分析这种现象的规模，我们确定了威胁系统安全评估有效性的22个基准缺陷，并调查了在顶级场所发表的50篇国防论文。我们表明，即使在一级场所发表的论文中，基准缺陷也是普遍存在的；一级论文平均包含五个基准缺陷，我们在样本中仅发现一篇论文没有任何基准缺陷。此外，随着时间的推移，问题的规模似乎保持不变，这表明社区尚未采取足够的对策。这威胁到了科学过程，而科学过程依赖于再现性和可比性来确保发表的研究达到最先进的水平。我们希望提高认识并提供建议，以提高基准质量并保护我们社区的科学过程。
papers.title_zh: SoK:系统安全中的基准缺陷

papers.title: Tell Me You Fixed It: Evaluating Vulnerability Notifications via Quarantine Networks
papers.authors: Orçun Çetin, Carlos Gañán, Lisette Altena, Samaneh Tajalizadehkhoob, Michel van Eeten
papers.abstract: Mechanisms for large-scale vulnerability notifications have been confronted with disappointing remediation rates. It has proven difficult to reach the relevant party and, once reached, to incentivize them to act. We present the first empirical study of a potentially more effective mechanism: quarantining the vulnerable resource until it is remediated. We have measured the remediation rates achieved by a medium-sized ISP for 1, 688 retail customers running open DNS resolvers or Multicast DNS services. These servers can be abused in UDP-based amplification attacks. We assess the effectiveness of quarantining by comparing remediation with two other groups: one group which was notified but not quarantined and another group where no action was taken. We find very high remediation rates for the quarantined users, 87%, even though they can self-release from the quarantine environment. Of those who received the email-only notification, 76% remediated. Surprisingly, over half of the customers who were not notified at all also remediated, though this is tied to the fact that many observations of vulnerable servers are transient. All in all, quarantining appears more effective than other notification and remediation mechanisms, but it is also clear that it can not be deployed as a general solution for Internet-wide notifications.
papers.abstract_zh: 大规模漏洞通知机制面临着令人失望的修复率。事实证明，很难联系到相关方，一旦联系到，也很难激励他们采取行动。我们提出了一个潜在的更有效的机制的第一个实证研究:隔离易受攻击的资源，直到它被补救。我们测量了一家中型ISP为1，688个运行开放式DNS解析器或多播DNS服务的零售客户实现的补救率。这些服务器可能会在基于UDP的放大攻击中被滥用。我们通过将补救措施与其他两个组进行比较来评估隔离的有效性:一个组得到通知但未被隔离，另一个组未采取任何措施。我们发现被隔离用户的补救率非常高，达到87%，尽管他们可以从隔离环境中自行释放。在那些只收到电子邮件通知的人中，76%的人得到了补救。令人惊讶的是，一半以上根本没有得到通知的客户也进行了补救，尽管这与对易受攻击的服务器的许多观察是短暂的这一事实有关。总的来说，隔离似乎比其他通知和补救机制更有效，但很明显，它不能作为Internet范围内通知的通用解决方案。
papers.title_zh: 告诉我你解决了它:通过隔离网络评估漏洞通知

papers.title: Discovering Correlations: A Formal Definition of Causal Dependency Among Heterogeneous Events
papers.authors: Charles Xosanavongsa, Eric Totel, Olivier Bettan
papers.abstract: In order to supervise the security of a large infrastructure, the administrator deploys multiple sensors and intrusion detection systems on several critical places in the system. It is easier to explain and detect attacks if more events are logged. Starting from a suspicious event (appearing as a log entry), the administrator can start his investigation by manually building the set of previous events that are linked to this event of interest. Accordingly, the administrator attempts to identify links among the logged events in order to retrieve those that correspond to the traces of the attacker's actions in the supervised system; previous work is aimed at building these connections. In practice, however, this type of link is not trivial to define and discover. Hence, there is a real necessity to describe and define formally the semantics of these links in literature. In this paper, a clear definition of this relationship, called contextual event causal dependency, is introduced and proposed. The work presented in this paper aims at defining a formal model that would ideally unify previous work on causal dependencies among heterogeneous events. We define a relationship among events that enables the discovery of all events, which can be considered as the cause (in the past) or the effect (in the future) of an event of interest(e.g., an indicator of compromise, produced by an attacker action). This model is gradually introduced and defined by merging two previously defined causality models from the distributed system and operating system research areas (i.e., Lamport's and d'Ausbourg's). Our model takes into consideration heterogeneous events that emanate from different abstraction layers (e.g., network, system, and application) with the main objective of formally defining a causal relationship among logged events. Thereafter, we show how existing implementations separately allow the computation of parts of the model. Finally, we describe the implementation and assessment of the model according to real attacks on distributed environments and its accuracy to extract all causally linked events related to a given attack event trace.
papers.abstract_zh: 为了监控大型基础设施的安全性，管理员在系统中的几个关键位置部署了多个传感器和入侵检测系统。如果记录的事件越多，解释和检测攻击就越容易。从一个可疑事件(以日志条目的形式出现)开始，管理员可以通过手动构建一组与此感兴趣的事件相关联的先前事件来开始调查。因此，管理员试图识别记录的事件之间的联系，以便在受监控的系统中检索那些对应于攻击者行动的痕迹的事件；先前的工作旨在建立这些联系。然而，在实践中，这种类型的链接并不容易定义和发现。因此，在文献中正式描述和定义这些链接的语义是非常必要的。本文介绍并提出了这种关系的一个清晰定义，称为上下文事件因果依赖。本文的工作旨在定义一个形式模型，该模型将理想地统一以前关于异类事件之间因果依赖的工作。我们定义了事件之间的关系，使得能够发现所有事件，这些事件可以被认为是感兴趣的事件(例如，由攻击者操作产生的危害指示)的原因(在过去)或结果(在未来)。这个模型是通过合并以前从分布式系统和操作系统研究领域定义的两个因果关系模型(即Lamport的和d'Ausbourg的)逐步引入和定义的。我们的模型考虑了来自不同抽象层(如网络、系统和应用程序)的异构事件，主要目标是正式定义记录事件之间的因果关系。此后，我们展示了现有的实现如何分别允许模型的各部分的计算。最后，我们根据分布式环境中的真实攻击描述了该模型的实现和评估，以及它提取与给定攻击事件轨迹相关的所有因果关联事件的准确性。
papers.title_zh: 发现相关性:异构事件间因果依赖的形式化定义

papers.title: Noise Explorer: Fully Automated Modeling and Verification for Arbitrary Noise Protocols
papers.authors: Nadim Kobeissi, Georgio Nicolas, Karthikeyan Bhargavan
papers.abstract: The Noise Protocol Framework, introduced recently, allows for the design and construction of secure channel protocols by describing them through a simple, restricted language from which complex key derivation and local state transitions are automatically inferred. Noise "Handshake Patterns" can support mutual authentication, forward secrecy, zero round-trip encryption, identity hiding and other advanced features. Since the framework's release, Noise-based protocols have been adopted by WhatsApp, WireGuard and other high-profile applications. We present Noise Explorer, an online engine for designing, reasoning about, formally verifying and implementing arbitrary Noise Handshake Patterns. Based on our formal treatment of the Noise Protocol Framework, Noise Explorer can validate any Noise Handshake Pattern and then translate it into a model ready for automated verification and also into a production-ready software implementation written in Go or in Rust. We use Noise Explorer to analyze more than 57 handshake patterns. We confirm the stated security goals for 12 fundamental patterns and provide precise properties for the rest. We also analyze unsafe handshake patterns and document weaknesses that occur when validity rules are not followed. All of this work is consolidated into a usable online tool that presents a compendium of results and can parse formal verification results to generate detailed-but-pedagogical reports regarding the exact security goals of each message of a Noise Handshake Pattern with respect to each party, under an active attacker and including malicious principals. Noise Explorer evolves alongside the standard Noise Protocol Framework, having already contributed new security goal verification results and stronger definitions for pattern validation and security parameters.
papers.abstract_zh: 最近推出的Noise协议框架允许设计和构建安全信道协议，通过一种简单、受限的语言对其进行描述，从该语言中可以自动推断出复杂的密钥推导和本地状态转换。噪声“握手模式”可以支持相互认证、前向保密、零往返加密、身份隐藏等高级功能。自该框架发布以来，基于噪声的协议已经被WhatsApp、WireGuard和其他备受瞩目的应用程序所采用。我们介绍Noise Explorer，一个用于设计、推理、正式验证和实现任意噪声握手模式的在线引擎。基于我们对Noise协议框架的正式处理，Noise Explorer可以验证任何Noise握手模式，然后将其转换为可用于自动验证的模型，以及用Go或Rust编写的可用于生产的软件实现。我们使用Noise Explorer分析了超过57种握手模式。我们确认了12个基本模式的安全目标，并提供了其余模式的精确属性。我们还分析不安全的握手模式，并记录不遵守有效性规则时出现的弱点。所有这些工作都被整合到一个可用的在线工具中，该工具提供了一个结果概要，并且可以解析正式的验证结果，以生成详细的但是具有教育性的报告，该报告涉及在主动攻击者的控制下并且包括恶意主体的每一方的噪声握手模式的每条消息的确切安全目标。Noise Explorer伴随着标准Noise协议框架一起发展，已经贡献了新的安全目标验证结果和更强的模式验证和安全参数定义。
papers.title_zh: Noise Explorer:针对任意噪声协议的全自动建模和验证

papers.title: Degenerate Fault Attacks on Elliptic Curve Parameters in OpenSSL
papers.authors: Akira Takahashi, Mehdi Tibouchi
papers.abstract: In this paper, we describe several practically exploitable fault attacks against OpenSSL's implementation of elliptic curve cryptography, related to the singular curve point decompression attacks of Blömer and Günther (FDTC2015) and the degenerate curve attacks of Neves and Tibouchi (PKC 2016). In particular, we show that OpenSSL allows to construct EC key files containing explicit curve parameters with a compressed base point. A simple single fault injection upon loading such a file yields a full key recovery attack when the key file is used for signing with ECDSA, and a complete recovery of the plaintext when the file is used for encryption using an algorithm like ECIES. The attack is especially devastating against curves with j-invariant equal to 0 such as the Bitcoin curve secp256k1, for which key recovery reduces to a single division in the base field. Additionally, we apply the present fault attack technique to OpenSSL's implementation of ECDH, by combining it with Neves and Tibouchi's degenerate curve attack. This version of the attack applies to usual named curve parameters with nonzero j-invariant, such as P192 and P256. Although it is typically more computationally expensive than the one against signatures and encryption, and requires multiple faulty outputs from the server, it can recover the entire static secret key of the server even in the presence of point validation. These various attacks can be mounted with only a single instruction skipping fault, and therefore can be easily injected using low-cost voltage glitches on embedded devices. We validated them in practice using concrete fault injection experiments on a Rapsberry Pi single board computer running the up to date OpenSSL command line tools—a setting where the threat of fault attacks is quite significant.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们描述了针对OpenSSL的椭圆曲线密码实现的几种实际可利用的故障攻击，与blmer和Günther (FDTC2015)的奇异曲线点解压缩攻击以及Neves和Tibouchi (PKC 2016)的退化曲线攻击相关。特别地，我们表明OpenSSL允许构建包含带有压缩基点的显式曲线参数的EC密钥文件。当密钥文件用于ECDSA签名时，加载此类文件时简单的单一错误注入会产生完整的密钥恢复攻击，而当文件用于使用ECIES等算法加密时，会产生明文的完整恢复。对于j不变量等于0的曲线，例如比特币曲线secp256k1，这种攻击尤其具有破坏性，对于这种曲线，密钥恢复简化为基域中的单个除法。此外，通过将本故障攻击技术与Neves和Tibouchi的退化曲线攻击相结合，我们将本故障攻击技术应用于OpenSSL的ECDH实现。这个版本的攻击适用于具有非零j不变量的普通命名曲线参数，例如P192和P256。尽管它通常比针对签名和加密的方案计算量更大，并且需要来自服务器的多个错误输出，但是即使存在点验证，它也可以恢复服务器的整个静态密钥。这些各种各样的攻击只需一个指令跳过故障，因此可以利用嵌入式设备上的低成本电压毛刺轻松注入。我们在运行最新的OpenSSL命令行工具的Rapsberry Pi单板计算机上使用具体的故障注入实验在实践中验证了它们——在这种环境下，故障攻击的威胁相当大。
papers.title_zh: OpenSSL中对椭圆曲线参数的退化故障攻击

papers.title: On Aggregation of Information in Timing Attacks
papers.authors: Itsaka Rakotonirina, Boris Köpf
papers.abstract: A key question for characterising a system's vulnerability against timing attacks is whether or not it allows an adversary to aggregate information about a secret over multiple timing measurements. Existing approaches for reasoning about this aggregate information rely on strong assumptions about the capabilities of the adversary in terms of measurement and computation, which is why they fall short in modelling, explaining, or synthesising real-world attacks against cryptosystems such as RSA or AES. In this paper we present a novel model for reasoning about information aggregation in timing attacks. The model is based on a novel abstraction of timing measurements that better captures the capabilities of real-world adversaries, and a notion of compositionality of programs that explains attacks by divide-and-conquer. Our model thus lifts important limiting assumptions made in prior work and enables us to give the first uniform explanation of high-profile timing attacks in the language of information-flow analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 描述系统对定时攻击的脆弱性的一个关键问题是，它是否允许对手通过多次定时测量来聚集关于秘密的信息。现有的对这种聚合信息进行推理的方法依赖于对对手在测量和计算方面的能力的强有力假设，这就是为什么它们在模拟、解释或综合针对RSA或AES等密码系统的真实攻击方面存在不足。在这篇文章中，我们提出了一个新的模型，用于推理时间攻击中的信息聚集。该模型基于一种新颖的时间测量抽象，可以更好地捕捉真实世界对手的能力，以及一种程序组合的概念，可以通过分治来解释攻击。因此，我们的模型解除了先前工作中做出的重要的限制性假设，并使我们能够用信息流分析的语言对高调的定时攻击给出第一个统一的解释。
papers.title_zh: 计时攻击中的信息聚合

papers.title: In Encryption We Don't Trust: The Effect of End-to-End Encryption to the Masses on User Perception
papers.authors: Sergej Dechand, Alena Naiakshina, Anastasia Danilova, Matthew Smith
papers.abstract: With WhatsApp's adoption of the Signal Protocol as its default, end-to-end encryption by the masses happened almost overnight. Unlike iMessage, WhatsApp notifies users that encryption is enabled, explicitly informing users about improved privacy. This rare feature gives us an opportunity to study people's understandings and perceptions of secure messaging pre-and post-mass messenger encryption (pre/post-MME). To study changes in perceptions, we compared the results of two mental models studies: one conducted in 2015 pre-MME and one in 2017 post-MME. Our primary finding is that users do not trust encryption as currently offered. When asked about encryption in the study, most stated that they had heard of encryption, but only a few understood the implications, even on a high level. Their consensus view was that no technical solution to stop skilled attackers from getting their data exists. Even with a major development, such as WhatsApp rolling out end-to-end encryption, people still do not feel well protected by their technology. Surprisingly, despite WhatsApp's end-to-end security info messages and the high media attention, the majority of the participants were not even aware of encryption. Most participants had an almost correct threat model, but don't believe that there is a technical solution to stop knowledgeable attackers to read their messages. Using technology made them feel vulnerable.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着WhatsApp采用Signal协议作为默认协议，大众的端到端加密几乎是在一夜之间发生的。与iMessage不同，WhatsApp通知用户加密已启用，明确告知用户隐私得到改善。这一罕见的功能为我们提供了一个机会，来研究人们在大规模信使加密(前/后MME)之前和之后对安全消息传递的理解和看法。为了研究认知的变化，我们比较了两项心理模型研究的结果:一项是在2015年MME前进行的，另一项是在2017年MME后进行的。我们的主要发现是，用户不信任当前提供的加密。当被问及研究中的加密时，大多数人表示他们听说过加密，但只有少数人理解其中的含义，即使是在很高的层面上。他们一致的观点是，不存在阻止熟练攻击者获取他们的数据的技术解决方案。即使有了重大发展，如WhatsApp推出了端到端加密，人们仍然觉得他们的技术没有得到很好的保护。令人惊讶的是，尽管WhatsApp的端到端安全信息消息和媒体的高度关注，大多数参与者甚至不知道加密。大多数参与者有一个几乎正确的威胁模型，但不相信有一个技术解决方案可以阻止有知识的攻击者阅读他们的消息。使用科技让他们感到脆弱。
papers.title_zh: 在《我们不信任的加密》中:端到端加密对大众用户感知的影响

papers.title: Rethinking Location Privacy for Unknown Mobility Behaviors
papers.authors: Simon Oya, Carmela Troncoso, Fernando Pérez-González
papers.abstract: Location Privacy-Preserving Mechanisms (LPPMs) in the literature largely consider that users' data available for training wholly characterizes their mobility patterns. Thus, they hardwire this information in their designs and evaluate their privacy properties with these same data. In this paper, we aim to understand the impact of this decision on the level of privacy these LPPMs may offer in real life when the users' mobility data may be different from the data used in the design phase. Our results show that, in many cases, training data does not capture users' behavior accurately and, thus, the level of privacy provided by the LPPM is often overestimated. To address this gap between theory and practice, we propose to use blank-slate models for LPPM design. Contrary to the hardwired approach, that assumes known users' behavior, blank-slate models learn the users' behavior from the queries to the service provider. We leverage this blank-slate approach to develop a new family of LPPMs, that we call Profile Estimation-Based LPPMs. Using real data, we empirically show that our proposal outperforms optimal state-of-the-art mechanisms designed on sporadic hardwired models. On non-sporadic location privacy scenarios, our method is only better if the usage of the location privacy service is not continuous. It is our hope that eliminating the need to bootstrap the mechanisms with training data and ensuring that the mechanisms are lightweight and easy to compute help fostering the integration of location privacy protections in deployed systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 文献中的位置隐私保护机制大多认为可用于训练的用户数据完全表征了他们的移动模式。因此，他们将这些信息硬连线到他们的设计中，并用这些相同的数据评估他们的隐私属性。在本文中，我们旨在了解当用户的移动数据可能不同于设计阶段使用的数据时，这一决定对这些LPPMs在现实生活中可能提供的隐私级别的影响。我们的结果表明，在许多情况下，训练数据并没有准确地捕捉用户的行为，因此，LPPM提供的隐私级别往往被高估。为了解决理论和实践之间的差距，我们建议使用LPPM设计的空白模型。与假设已知用户行为的硬连线方法相反，空白状态模型从对服务提供商的查询中学习用户行为。我们利用这种空白板方法开发了一个新的lppm家族，我们称之为基于轮廓估计的lppm。使用真实数据，我们经验地表明，我们的建议优于在零星硬连线模型上设计的最佳状态的最先进的机制。在非偶发性的位置隐私场景中，如果位置隐私服务的使用不是连续的，我们的方法才是更好的。我们希望消除用训练数据引导该机制的需要，并确保该机制是轻量级的和易于计算的，这有助于在部署的系统中促进位置隐私保护的集成。
papers.title_zh: 面向未知移动行为的位置隐私再思考

papers.title: Revisiting User Privacy for Certificate Transparency
papers.authors: Daniel Kales, Olamide Omolola, Sebastian Ramacher
papers.abstract: Public key infrastructure (PKI) based on certificate authorities is one of the cornerstones of secure communication over the internet. Certificates issued as part of this PKI provide authentication of web servers among others. Yet, the PKI ecosystem is susceptible to certificate misissuance and misuse attacks. To prevent those attacks, Certificate Transparency (CT) facilitates auditing of issued certificates and detecting certificates issued without authorization. Users that want to verify inclusion of certificates on CT log servers contact the CT server directly to retrieve inclusion proofs. This direct contact with the log server creates a privacy problem since the users' browsing activities could be recorded by the log server owner. Lueks and Goldberg (FC 2015) suggested the use of Private Information Retrieval (PIR) in order to protect the users' privacy in the CT ecosystem. With the immense amount of certificates included on CT log servers, their approach runs into performance issues, however. Nevertheless, we build on this approach and extend it using multi-tier Merkle trees, and render it practical using multi-server PIR protocols based on distributed point functions (DPFs). Our approach leads to a scalable design suitable to handle the increasing number of certificates and is, in addition, generic allowing instantiations using secure accumulators and PIRs. We implement and test this mechanism for privacy-preserving membership proof retrieval and show that it can be integrated without disrupting existing CT infrastructure. Most importantly, even for larger CT log sizes of 2^31 certificates, the performance overhead is less than 9 milliseconds in total.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于认证机构的公钥基础设施(PKI)是互联网上安全通信的基石之一。作为此PKI的一部分颁发的证书提供了对web服务器等的身份验证。然而，PKI生态系统容易受到证书错误颁发和滥用攻击的影响。为了防止这些攻击，证书透明性(CT)有助于审核颁发的证书和检测未经授权颁发的证书。想要验证ct日志服务器上证书的包含性的用户直接联系CT服务器以检索包含证明。这种与日志服务器的直接联系产生了隐私问题，因为用户的浏览活动可能会被日志服务器所有者记录下来。Lueks和Goldberg (FC 2015)建议使用隐私信息检索(PIR)来保护ct生态系统中用户的隐私。然而，由于CT日志服务器上包含大量的证书，他们的方法遇到了性能问题。然而，我们在这种方法的基础上，使用多层Merkle树对其进行扩展，并使用基于分布式点功能(DPFs)的多服务器PIR协议使其变得实用。我们的方法导致适合于处理不断增加的证书数量的可扩展设计，并且是通用的，允许使用安全累加器和PIR的实例化。我们实现并测试了这种用于隐私保护成员证明检索的机制，并表明它可以在不中断现有CT基础设施的情况下被集成。最重要的是，即使对于较大的2^31证书的CT日志大小，性能开销总共也不到9毫秒。
papers.title_zh: 重新审视用户隐私以实现证书透明

papers.title: PILOT: Practical Privacy-Preserving Indoor Localization Using OuTsourcing
papers.authors: Kimmo Järvinen, Helena Leppäkoski, Elena Simona Lohan, Philipp Richter, Thomas Schneider, Oleksandr Tkachenko, Zheng Yang
papers.abstract: In the last decade, we observed a constantly growing number of Location-Based Services (LBSs) used in indoor environments, such as for targeted advertising in shopping malls or finding nearby friends. Although privacy-preserving LBSs were addressed in the literature, there was a lack of attention to the problem of enhancing privacy of indoor localization, i.e., the process of obtaining the users' locations indoors and, thus, a prerequisite for any indoor LBS. In this work we present PILOT, the first practically efficient solution for Privacy-Preserving Indoor Localization (PPIL) that was obtained by a synergy of the research areas indoor localization and applied cryptography. We design, implement, and evaluate protocols for Wi-Fi fingerprint-based PPIL that rely on 4 different distance metrics. To save energy and network bandwidth for the mobile end devices in PPIL, we securely outsource the computations to two non-colluding semi-honest parties. Our solution mixes different secure two-party computation protocols and we design size-and depth-optimized circuits for PPIL. We construct efficient circuit building blocks that are of independent interest: Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD) capable oblivious access to an array with low circuit depth and selection of the k-Nearest Neighbors with small circuit size. Additionally, we reduce Received Signal Strength (RSS) values from 8 bits to 4 bits without any significant accuracy reduction. Our most efficient PPIL protocol is 553x faster than that of Li et al. (INFOCOM'14) and 500x faster than that of Ziegeldorf et al. (WiSec'14). Our implementation on commodity hardware has practical run-times of less than 1 second even for the most accurate distance metrics that we consider, and it can process more than half a million PPIL queries per day.
papers.abstract_zh: 在过去的十年中，我们观察到在室内环境中使用的基于位置的服务(lbs)的数量不断增长，例如在购物中心做有针对性的广告或寻找附近的朋友。虽然在文献中提出了保护隐私的LBS，但是缺乏对增强室内定位的隐私的关注，即，获取用户在室内的位置的过程，因此，是任何室内LBS的先决条件。在这项工作中，我们介绍了PILOT，这是第一个实际有效的隐私保护室内定位(PPIL)解决方案，它是由室内定位和应用密码学这两个研究领域的协同作用获得的。我们为基于Wi-Fi指纹的PPIL设计、实施和评估协议，这些协议依赖于4种不同的距离度量。为了节省PPIL移动终端设备的能量和网络带宽，我们安全地将计算外包给两个非共谋的半诚实方。我们的解决方案混合了不同的安全两方计算协议，并为PPIL设计了尺寸和深度优化的电路。我们构造了独立感兴趣的有效电路构建块:单指令多数据(SIMD)能够以低电路深度对阵列进行不经意访问，并以小电路尺寸选择k个最近邻居。此外，我们将接收信号强度(RSS)值从8位减少到4位，而没有任何显著的精度降低。我们最有效的协议比李等人(INFOCOM'14)的协议快553倍，比Ziegeldorf等人(WiSec'14)的协议快500倍。我们在商用硬件上的实现即使对于我们考虑的最精确的距离度量，实际运行时间也不到1秒，并且它每天可以处理超过50万个PPIL查询。
papers.title_zh: 试点:使用外包的实用隐私保护室内本地化

papers.title: The 5G-AKA Authentication Protocol Privacy
papers.authors: Adrien Koutsos
papers.abstract: We study the 5G-AKA authentication protocol described in the 5G mobile communication standards. This version of AKA tries to achieve a better privacy than the 3G and 4G versions through the use of asymmetric randomized encryption. Nonetheless, we show that except for the IMSI-catcher attack, all known attacks against 5G-AKA privacy still apply. Next, we modify the 5G-AKA protocol to prevent these attacks, while satisfying 5G-AKA efficiency constraints as much as possible. We then formally prove that our protocol is sigma-unlinkable. This is a new security notion, which allows for a fine-grained quantification of a protocol privacy. Our security proof is carried out in the Bana-Comon indistinguishability logic. We also prove mutual authentication as a secondary result.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们研究了5G移动通信标准中描述的5G-AKA认证协议。AKA的这个版本试图通过使用非对称随机加密来实现比3G和4G版本更好的隐私保护。尽管如此，我们表明，除了IMSI-凯切攻击，所有已知的针对5G-AKA隐私的攻击仍然适用。接下来，我们修改5G-AKA协议以防止这些攻击，同时尽可能满足5G-AKA效率约束。然后我们正式证明我们的协议是sigma不可链接的。这是一个新的安全概念，它允许对协议隐私进行细粒度的量化。我们的安全性证明是在Bana-common不可分辨逻辑中进行的。我们还证明了相互认证是次要结果。
papers.title_zh: 5G-AKA认证协议隐私

papers.title: Towards Understanding Limitations of Pixel Discretization Against Adversarial Attacks
papers.authors: Jiefeng Chen, Xi Wu, Vaibhav Rastogi, Yingyu Liang, Somesh Jha
papers.abstract: Wide adoption of artificial neural networks in various domains has led to an increasing interest in defending adversarial attacks against them. Preprocessing defense methods such as pixel discretization are particularly attractive in practice due to their simplicity, low computational overhead, and applicability to various systems. It is observed that such methods work well on simple datasets like MNIST, but break on more complicated ones like ImageNet under recently proposed strong white-box attacks. To understand the conditions for success and potentials for improvement, we study the pixel discretization defense method, including more sophisticated variants that take into account the properties of the dataset being discretized. Our results again show poor resistance against the strong attacks. We analyze our results in a theoretical framework and offer strong evidence that pixel discretization is unlikely to work on all but the simplest of the datasets. Furthermore, our arguments present insights why some other preprocessing defenses may be insecure.
papers.abstract_zh: 人工神经网络在各种领域的广泛采用导致对防御针对它们的敌对攻击的兴趣日益增加。像素离散化等预处理防御方法由于其简单性、低计算开销以及对各种系统的适用性，在实践中特别有吸引力。据观察，这种方法在像MNIST这样的简单数据集上工作得很好，但在最近提出的强白盒攻击下，在像ImageNet这样的更复杂的数据集上就失效了。为了了解成功的条件和改进的潜力，我们研究了像素离散化防御方法，包括考虑到被离散化数据集的属性的更复杂的变体。我们的结果再次显示出对强攻击的抵抗力差。我们在一个理论框架中分析了我们的结果，并提供了有力的证据表明，像素离散化不太可能在所有数据集上工作，但最简单的数据集。此外，我们的论点提出了为什么其他一些预处理防御可能是不安全的见解。
papers.title_zh: 理解对抗攻击的像素离散化的限制

papers.title: EzPC: Programmable and Efficient Secure Two-Party Computation for Machine Learning
papers.authors: Nishanth Chandran, Divya Gupta, Aseem Rastogi, Rahul Sharma, Shardul Tripathi
papers.abstract: We present EzPC, a secure two-party computation (2PC) framework that generates efficient 2PC protocols from high-level, easy-to-write programs. EzPC provides formal correctness and security guarantees while maintaining performance and scalability. Previous language frameworks, such as CBMC-GC, ObliVM, SMCL, and Wysteria, generate protocols that use either arithmetic or boolean circuits exclusively. Our compiler is the first to generate protocols that combine both arithmetic and boolean circuits for better performance. We empirically demonstrate that the performance of the protocols generated by EzPC is comparable to or better than (in some cases upto 19x) their state-of-the-art, hand-crafted implementations, while EzPC protocols also outperform their boolean circuits only counterparts by as much as 25x.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了EzPC，一个安全的两方计算(2PC)框架，它从高级的、易于编写的程序中生成高效的2PC协议。EzPC提供形式上的正确性和安全性保证，同时保持性能和可伸缩性。以前的语言框架，如CBMC GC、ObliVM、SMCL和Wysteria，生成的协议要么只使用算术电路，要么只使用布尔电路。我们的编译器是第一个生成结合算术和布尔电路以获得更好性能的协议的。我们根据经验证明，EzPC生成的协议的性能相当于或优于(在某些情况下高达19倍)其最先进的手工实现，而EzPC协议也优于其布尔电路同行高达25倍。
papers.title_zh: EzPC:用于机器学习的可编程和高效的安全两方计算

papers.title: PRADA: Protecting Against DNN Model Stealing Attacks
papers.authors: Mika Juuti, Sebastian Szyller, Samuel Marchal, N. Asokan
papers.abstract: Machine learning (ML) applications are increasingly prevalent. Protecting the confidentiality of ML models becomes paramount for two reasons: (a) a model can be a business advantage to its owner, and (b) an adversary may use a stolen model to find transferable adversarial examples that can evade classification by the original model. Access to the model can be restricted to be only via well-defined prediction APIs. Nevertheless, prediction APIs still provide enough information to allow an adversary to mount model extraction attacks by sending repeated queries via the prediction API. In this paper, we describe new model extraction attacks using novel approaches for generating synthetic queries, and optimizing training hyperparameters. Our attacks outperform state-of-the-art model extraction in terms of transferability of both targeted and non-targeted adversarial examples (up to +29-44 percentage points, pp), and prediction accuracy (up to +46 pp) on two datasets. We provide take-aways on how to perform effective model extraction attacks. We then propose PRADA, the first step towards generic and effective detection of DNN model extraction attacks. It analyzes the distribution of consecutive API queries and raises an alarm when this distribution deviates from benign behavior. We show that PRADA can detect all prior model extraction attacks with no false positives.
papers.abstract_zh: 机器学习(ML)应用越来越普遍。出于两个原因，保护ML模型的机密性变得至关重要:(a)模型可以是其所有者的商业优势，以及(b)对手可以使用窃取的模型来找到可以逃避原始模型分类的可转移的敌对实例。对模型的访问可以被限制为只能通过定义良好的预测API。然而，预测API仍然提供足够的信息，允许对手通过经由预测API发送重复的查询来发起模型提取攻击。在本文中，我们描述了新的模型提取攻击使用新的方法来生成合成查询，并优化训练超参数。在两个数据集上，我们的攻击在目标和非目标对立示例的可转移性(高达+29-44个百分点，pp)和预测准确性(高达+46 pp)方面优于最先进的模型提取。我们提供了如何执行有效的模型提取攻击的要点。然后，我们提出了PRADA，这是对DNN模型提取攻击进行通用有效检测的第一步。它分析连续API查询的分布，并在这种分布偏离良性行为时发出警报。我们表明，PRADA可以检测所有先前的模型提取攻击，而没有误报。
papers.title_zh: 普拉达:防范DNN模特盗窃攻击

papers.title: Mitch: A Machine Learning Approach to the Black-Box Detection of CSRF Vulnerabilities
papers.authors: Stefano Calzavara, Mauro Conti, Riccardo Focardi, Alvise Rabitti, Gabriele Tolomei
papers.abstract: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) is one of the oldest and simplest attacks on the Web, yet it is still effective on many websites and it can lead to severe consequences, such as economic losses and account takeovers. Unfortunately, tools and techniques proposed so far to identify CSRF vulnerabilities either need manual reviewing by human experts or assume the availability of the source code of the web application. In this paper we present Mitch, the first machine learning solution for the black-box detection of CSRF vulnerabilities. At the core of Mitch there is an automated detector of sensitive HTTP requests, i.e., requests which require protection against CSRF for security reasons. We trained the detector using supervised learning techniques on a dataset of 5,828 HTTP requests collected on popular websites, which we make available to other security researchers. Our solution outperforms existing detection heuristics proposed in the literature, allowing us to identify 35 new CSRF vulnerabilities on 20 major websites and 3 previously undetected CSRF vulnerabilities on production software already analyzed using a state-of-the-art tool.
papers.abstract_zh: 跨站点请求伪造(CSRF)是最古老和最简单的网络攻击之一，但它仍然在许多网站上有效，并可能导致严重的后果，如经济损失和帐户被接管。不幸的是，迄今为止提出的用于识别CSRF漏洞的工具和技术要么需要人类专家的人工审查，要么假设web应用的源代码是可用的。在本文中，我们介绍了Mitch，第一个用于CSRF漏洞黑盒检测的机器学习解决方案。Mitch的核心是一个敏感HTTP请求的自动检测器，即出于安全原因需要防范CSRF的请求。我们使用监督学习技术在从流行网站收集的5，828个HTTP请求的数据集上训练检测器，我们将这些数据提供给其他安全研究人员。我们的解决方案优于文献中提出的现有检测试探法，使我们能够识别20个主要网站上的35个新CSRF漏洞和生产软件上的3个以前未检测到的CSRF漏洞，这些漏洞已经使用最先进的工具进行了分析。
papers.title_zh: Mitch:一种机器学习的CSRF漏洞黑盒检测方法

papers.title: Domain Impersonation is Feasible: A Study of CA Domain Validation Vulnerabilities
papers.authors: Lorenz Schwittmann, Matthäus Wander, Torben Weis
papers.abstract: Web security relies on the assumption that certificate authorities (CAs) issue certificates to rightful domain owners only. However, we show that CAs expose vulnerabilities which allow an attacker to obtain certificates from major CAs for domains he does not own. We present a measurement method that allows us to check CAs for a list of technical weaknesses during their domain validation procedures. Our results show that all tested CAs are vulnerable in one or even multiple ways, because they rely on a combination of insecure protocols like DNS and HTTP and do not implement existing secure alternatives like DNSSEC and TLS. We have validated our methodology experimentally and disclosed these vulnerabilities to CAs. Based upon our findings we provide recommendations to domain owners and CAs to close this fundamental weakness in web security.
papers.abstract_zh: Web安全依赖于这样的假设，即证书颁发机构(ca)只向合法的域所有者颁发证书。然而，我们表明ca暴露了漏洞，使得攻击者能够从他不拥有的域的主要ca获得证书。我们提出了一种度量方法，允许我们在域验证过程中检查CAs的一系列技术弱点。我们的结果表明，所有被测试的ca都在一个甚至多个方面存在漏洞，因为它们依赖于DNS和HTTP等不安全协议的组合，并且没有实现DNSSEC和TLS等现有的安全替代方案。我们已经通过实验验证了我们的方法，并向CAs披露了这些漏洞。基于我们的发现，我们向域名所有者和ca提供建议，以弥补网络安全中的这一根本弱点。
papers.title_zh: 域模拟是可行的:CA域验证漏洞的研究

papers.title: TraffickStop: Detecting and Measuring Illicit Traffic Monetization Through Large-Scale DNS Analysis
papers.authors: Baojun Liu, Zhou Li, Peiyuan Zong, Chaoyi Lu, Hai-Xin Duan, Ying Liu, Sumayah A. Alrwais, XiaoFeng Wang, Shuang Hao, Yaoqi Jia, Yiming Zhang, Kai Chen, Zaifeng Zhang
papers.abstract: Illicit traffic monetization is a type of Internet fraud that hijacks users' web requests and reroutes them to a traffic network (e.g., advertising network), in order to unethically gain monetary rewards. Despite its popularity among Internet fraudsters, our understanding of the problem is still limited. Since the behavior is highly dynamic (can happen at any place including client-side, transport-layer and server-side) and selective (could target a regional network), prior approaches like active probing can only reveal a small piece of the entire ecosystem. So far, questions including how this fraud works at a global scale and what fraudsters' preferred methods are, still remain unanswered. To fill the missing pieces, we developed TraffickStop the first system that can detect this fraud passively. Our key contribution is a novel algorithm that works on large-scale DNS logs and efficiently discovers abnormal domain correlations. TraffickStop enables the first landscape study of this fraud, and we have some interesting findings. By analyzing over 231 billion DNS logs of two weeks, we discovered 1,457 fraud sites. Regarding its scale, the fraud sites receive more than 53 billion DNS requests within one year, and a company could lose up to 53K dollars per day due to fraud traffic. We also discovered two new strategies that are leveraged by fraudsters to evade inspection. Our work provides new insights into illicit traffic monetization, raises its public awareness, and contributes to a better understanding and ultimate elimination of this threat.
papers.abstract_zh: 非法流量货币化是一种互联网欺诈，它劫持用户的web请求并将它们重新路由到流量网络(例如广告网络)，以便不道德地获得金钱回报。尽管它在互联网欺诈者中很流行，但我们对这个问题的了解仍然有限。由于行为是高度动态的(可以发生在任何地方，包括客户端、传输层和服务器端)和选择性的(可以针对区域网络)，像主动探测这样的现有方法只能揭示整个生态系统的一小部分。到目前为止，包括这种欺诈如何在全球范围内运作以及欺诈者首选的方法在内的问题仍然没有答案。为了填补缺失的部分，我们开发了TraffickStop，这是第一个可以被动检测这种欺诈的系统。我们的主要贡献是一种新颖的算法，它在大规模DNS日志上工作，并有效地发现异常的域相关性。TraffickStop实现了对这种欺诈的首次景观研究，我们有一些有趣的发现。通过分析两周内超过2310亿个DNS日志，我们发现了1，457个欺诈网站。就其规模而言，欺诈网站一年内会收到超过530亿个DNS请求，一家公司每天可能会因欺诈流量而损失高达5.3万美元。我们还发现了欺诈者用来逃避检查的两种新策略。我们的工作为非法贩运货币化提供了新的见解，提高了公众意识，并有助于更好地理解和最终消除这一威胁。
papers.title_zh: TraffickStop:通过大规模DNS分析检测和衡量非法贩运货币化

papers.title: StopGuessing: Using Guessed Passwords to Thwart Online Guessing
papers.authors: Stuart E. Schechter, Yuan Tian, Cormac Herley
papers.abstract: Practitioners who seek to defend password-protected resources from online guessing attacks will find a shortage of tooling and techniques to help them. Little research suggests anything beyond blocking or throttling traffic from IP addresses sending suspicious traffic; counting failed authentication requests, or some variant, is often the sole feature used to determine suspicion. In this paper we show that several other features can greatly help distinguishing benign and attack traffic. First, we increase the penalties for clients responsible for fail events involving passwords frequently-guessed by attackers. Second, we reduce the threshold (and thus protect better) for accounts with weak passwords. Third, we detect, and are more forgiving of, login failures caused by users mistyping their passwords. Most importantly, we achieve all of these goals without needing any marker that indicates weak accounts, changing the format in which passwords are stored (i.e. we do not store passwords plaintext or in any recoverable form), or storing any information that might be harmful if leaked. We present an open-source implementation of this system and demonstrate its improvement over simpler blocking strategies in various simulated scenarios.
papers.abstract_zh: 寻求保护受密码保护的资源免受在线猜测攻击的从业者会发现缺少工具和技术来帮助他们。几乎没有研究表明，除了阻止或限制来自发送可疑流量的IP地址的流量之外，还能做什么；对失败的认证请求或一些变体进行计数通常是用于确定怀疑的唯一特征。在本文中，我们展示了其他几个特征可以极大地帮助区分良性和攻击性流量。首先，我们增加了对因密码经常被攻击者猜到而导致失败事件的客户的惩罚。其次，我们降低了弱密码帐户的门槛(从而保护得更好)。第三，我们可以检测到由于用户输错密码而导致的登录失败，并且更加宽容。最重要的是，我们实现了所有这些目标，而不需要任何指示弱帐户的标记，不需要更改密码存储的格式(即，我们不存储明文或任何可恢复形式的密码)，也不需要存储任何泄露后可能有害的信息。我们提出了该系统的开源实现，并在各种模拟场景中展示了它相对于简单阻塞策略的改进。
papers.title_zh: 停止猜测:使用猜测的密码来阻止在线猜测

papers.title: MALPITY: Automatic Identification and Exploitation of Tarpit Vulnerabilities in Malware
papers.authors: Walla Sebastian, Christian Rossow
papers.abstract: Law enforcement agencies regularly take down botnets as the ultimate defense against global malware operations. By arresting malware authors, and simultaneously infiltrating or shutting down a botnet's network infrastructures (such as C2 servers), defenders stop global threats and mitigate pending infections. In this paper, we propose malware tarpits, an orthogonal defense that does not require seizing botnet infrastructures, and at the same time can also be used to slow down malware spreading and infiltrate its monetization techniques. A tarpit is a network service that causes a client to stay busy with a network operation. Our work aims to automatically identify network operations used by malware that will block the malware either forever or for a significant amount of time. We describe how to non-intrusively exploit such tarpit vulnerabilities in malware to slow down or, ideally, even stop malware. Using dynamic malware analysis, we monitor how malware interacts with the POSIX and Winsock socket APIs. From this, we infer network operations that would have blocked when provided certain network inputs. We augment this vulnerability search with an automated generation of tarpits that exploit the identified vulnerabilities. We apply our prototype MALPITY on six popular malware families and discover 12 previously-unknown tarpit vulnerabilities, revealing that all families are susceptible to our defense. We demonstrate how to, e.g., halt Pushdo's DGA-based C2 communication, hinder SalityP2P peers from receiving commands or updates, and stop Bashlite's spreading engine.
papers.abstract_zh: 执法机构定期关闭僵尸网络，作为抵御全球恶意软件操作的最终防线。通过逮捕恶意软件作者，同时渗透或关闭僵尸网络的网络基础设施(如C2服务器)，防御者可以阻止全球威胁并减轻即将到来的感染。在本文中，我们提出了恶意软件tarpits，这是一种不需要占领僵尸网络基础设施的正交防御，同时也可以用来减缓恶意软件的传播和渗透其货币化技术。tarpit是一种网络服务，它使客户端忙于网络操作。我们的工作旨在自动识别恶意软件使用的网络操作，从而永久或长时间阻止恶意软件。我们描述了如何非侵入性地利用恶意软件中的这种tarpit漏洞来减缓或者理想情况下甚至阻止恶意软件。使用动态恶意软件分析，我们监控恶意软件如何与POSIX和Winsock套接字API交互。由此，我们推断当提供特定的网络输入时，网络操作将被阻塞。我们通过自动生成利用已识别漏洞的tarpits来增强这种漏洞搜索。我们将我们的原型MALPITY应用于六个流行的恶意软件家族，发现了12个以前未知的tarpit漏洞，揭示了所有家族都容易受到我们的防御。我们演示了如何，例如，停止Pushdo的DGA C2通信，阻止SalityP2P对等体接收命令或更新，以及停止Bashlite的传播引擎。
papers.title_zh: MALPITY:自动识别和利用恶意软件中的Tarpit漏洞

papers.title: Private Votes on Untrusted Platforms: Models, Attacks and Provable Scheme
papers.authors: Sergiu Bursuc, Constantin Catalin Dragan, Steve Kremer
papers.abstract: Modern e-voting systems deploy cryptographic protocols on a complex infrastructure involving different computing platforms and agents. It is crucial to have appropriate specification and evaluation methods to perform rigorous analysis of such systems, taking into account the corruption and computational capabilities of a potential attacker. In particular, the platform used for voting may be corrupted, e.g. infected by malware, and we need to ensure privacy and integrity of votes even in that case. We propose a new definition of vote privacy, formalized as a computational indistinguishability game, that allows to take into account such refined attacker models; we show that the definition captures both known and novel attacks against several voting schemes; and we propose a scheme that is provably secure in this setting. We moreover formalize and machine-check the proof in the EasyCrypt theorem prover.
papers.abstract_zh: 现代电子投票系统在涉及不同计算平台和代理的复杂基础设施上部署加密协议。考虑到潜在攻击者的破坏和计算能力，采用适当的规范和评估方法对此类系统进行严格分析至关重要。特别是，用于投票的平台可能被破坏，例如被恶意软件感染，即使在这种情况下，我们也需要确保投票的隐私和完整性。我们提出了一个新的投票隐私的定义，形式化为一个计算的不可区分性游戏，它允许考虑这种改进的攻击者模型；我们证明了该定义捕获了针对几种投票方案的已知攻击和新攻击；我们提出了一个在这种环境下可证明安全的方案。此外，我们还对EasyCrypt定理证明器中的证明进行了形式化和机器检查。
papers.title_zh: 不可信平台上的私人投票:模型、攻击和可证明方案

papers.title: Is Your Vote Overheard? A New Scalable Side-Channel Attack Against Paper Voting
papers.authors: Kristjan Krips, Jan Willemson, Sebastian Värv
papers.abstract: In an ongoing discussion comparing the security properties of electronic and paper voting, decreased privacy is often presented as an argument against remote Internet voting. We contribute to this discussion by presenting a side-channel attack against the physical environment of traditional paper-based elections. More precisely, we build a device based on an Arduino development board and cheap electret microphones, capable of triangulating the locations of marks made on wooden tables with high precision. In the best configuration, we are able to determine the correct cell having dimensions 4×5 cm with more than 90% accuracy. This will allow breaching privacy of ballot sheet designs that rely on the voter marking her choice(s) between a potentially high number of candidates printed on one large sheet. We complement our attack with a study on various aspects of deployment of facial recognition. This gives rise to the setup where the attacker installs cameras in the polling stations, aiming at automated detection of people leaving the voting booths. Combining the two approaches, we will have a completely automated (and hence relatively well scalable) attack against the privacy of paper-based voting.
papers.abstract_zh: 在比较电子投票和纸质投票的安全性的持续讨论中，隐私的减少经常被作为反对远程互联网投票的一个理由。我们通过对传统纸质选举的物理环境提出一个旁门左道的攻击来促进这一讨论。更准确地说，我们基于Arduino开发板和廉价的驻极体麦克风构建了一个设备，能够高精度地三角测量木桌上标记的位置。在最佳配置中，我们能够以超过90%的准确度确定尺寸为4×5 cm的正确细胞。这将侵犯选票设计的隐私，选票设计依赖于投票人在一张大纸上打印的潜在的大量候选人之间标记她的选择。我们通过研究面部识别部署的各个方面来补充我们的攻击。这导致攻击者在投票站安装摄像头，旨在自动检测离开投票站的人。结合这两种方法，我们将有一个完全自动化的(因此可扩展性相对较好的)针对纸质投票隐私的攻击。
papers.title_zh: 你的投票被偷听了吗？一种新的针对纸质投票的可扩展旁路攻击

papers.title: Improving Automated Symbolic Analysis of Ballot Secrecy for E-Voting Protocols: A Method Based on Sufficient Conditions
papers.authors: Lucca Hirschi, Cas Cremers
papers.abstract: We advance the state-of-the-art in automated symbolic analysis of ballot secrecy for e-voting protocols by proposing a method based on analysing three conditions that together imply ballot secrecy. Our approach has two main advantages over existing automated approaches. The first is a substantial expansion of the class of protocols and threat models that can be automatically analysed: our approach can systematically deal with (a) honest authorities present in different phases, (b) threat models in which no dishonest voters occur, and (c) protocols whose ballot secrecy depends on fresh data coming from other phases. The second advantage is that our approach can significantly improve verification efficiency, as the individual conditions are often simpler to verify. E.g., for the LEE protocol, we obtain a speedup of over two orders of magnitude. We show the scope and effectiveness of our approach using ProVerif in several case studies, including the FOO, LEE, JCJ, and Belenios protocols.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们通过提出一种基于分析三个条件的方法，推进了电子投票协议中投票保密的自动化符号分析的发展。与现有的自动化方法相比，我们的方法有两个主要优点。第一个是可以自动分析的协议和威胁模型的种类的实质性扩展:我们的方法可以系统地处理(a)在不同阶段存在的诚实当局，(b)不存在不诚实投票者的威胁模型，以及(c)投票保密依赖于来自其他阶段的新数据的协议。第二个优点是，我们的方法可以显著提高验证效率，因为各个条件通常更容易验证。例如，对于LEE协议，我们获得了超过两个数量级的加速。我们在几个案例研究中使用ProVerif展示了我们的方法的范围和有效性，包括FOO、LEE、JCJ和Belenios协议。
papers.title_zh: 改进电子投票协议投票保密性的自动符号分析:一种基于充分条件的方法

papers.title: Introduction to Security and Privacy on the Blockchain
papers.authors: Harry Halpin, Marta Piekarska
papers.abstract: The blockchain has fueled one of the most enthusiastic bursts of activity in applied cryptography in years, but outstanding problems in security and privacy research must be solved for blockchain technologies to go beyond the hype and reach their full potential. At the first IEEE Privacy and Security on the Blockchain Workshop (IEEE S&B), we presented peer-reviewed papers bringing together academia and industry to analyze problems ranging from deploying newer cryptographic primitives on Bitcoin to enabling usecases like privacy-preserving file storage. We overview not only the larger problems the workshop has set out to tackle, but also outstanding unsolved issues that will require further cooperation between academia and the blockchain community.
papers.abstract_zh: 区块链引发了近年来应用密码学领域最热情的活动之一，但区块链科技要超越宣传并发挥其全部潜力，必须解决安全和隐私研究方面的突出问题。在第一届IEEE区块链隐私和安全研讨会(IEEE S&B)上，我们提交了同行评审的论文，汇集了学术界和业界，分析了从在比特币上部署更新的加密原语到支持隐私保护文件存储等用例的各种问题。我们不仅概述了研讨会提出要解决的更大的问题，还概述了需要学术界和区块链社区进一步合作的悬而未决的问题。
papers.title_zh: 区块链安全和隐私介绍

papers.title: Zero-Collateral Lotteries in Bitcoin and Ethereum
papers.authors: Andrew Miller, Iddo Bentov
papers.abstract: We present cryptocurrency-based lottery protocols that do not require any collateral from the players. Previous protocols for this task required a security deposit that is O(N2) times larger than the bet amount, where N is the number of players. Our protocols are based on a tournament bracket construction, and require only O(logN) rounds. Our lottery protocols thus represent a significant improvement, both because they allow players with little money to participate, and because of the time value of money. The Ethereum-based implementation of our lottery is highly efficient. The Bitcoin implementation requires an O(2N) off-chain setup phase, which demonstrates that the expressive power of the scripting language can have important implications. We also describe a minimal modification to the Bitcoin protocol that would eliminate the exponential blowup.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了基于加密货币的彩票协议，不需要玩家提供任何担保。这个任务的先前协议要求保证金是下注金额的O(N2)倍，其中N是玩家的数量。我们的协议基于锦标赛括号结构，并且只需要O(logN)轮。因此，我们的彩票协议代表了一个重大的进步，不仅因为它们允许没有多少钱的玩家参与，还因为钱的时间价值。我们的彩票基于以太坊的实现是高效的。比特币的实现需要O(2N)的离线设置阶段，这表明脚本语言的表达能力可能具有重要的意义。我们还描述了对比特币协议的最小修改，这将消除指数爆炸。
papers.title_zh: 比特币和以太坊中的零抵押彩票

papers.title: Design of a Privacy-Preserving Decentralized File Storage with Financial Incentives
papers.authors: Henning Kopp, David Mödinger, Franz J. Hauck, Frank Kargl, Christoph Bösch
papers.abstract: Surveys indicate that users are often afraid to entrust data to cloud storage providers, because these do not offer sufficient privacy. On the other hand, peer-2-peer–based privacy-preserving storage systems like Freenet suffer from a lack of contribution and storage capacity, since there is basically no incentive to contribute own storage capacity to other participants in the network. We address these contradicting requirements by a design which combines a distributed storage with a privacy-preserving blockchain-based payment system to create incentives for participation while maintaining user privacy. By following a Privacy-by-Design strategy integrating privacy throughout the whole system life cycle, we show that it is possible to achieve levels of privacy comparable to state-of-the-art distributed storage technologies, despite integrating a payment mechanism. Our results show that it is possible to combine storage contracts and payments in a privacy-preserving way. Further, our system design may serve as an inspiration for future similar architectures.
papers.abstract_zh: 调查表明，用户通常害怕将数据委托给云存储提供商，因为这些提供商不能提供足够的隐私。另一方面，像Freenet这样的基于对等体-2-对等体的隐私保护存储系统缺乏贡献和存储容量，因为基本上没有动机将自己的存储容量贡献给网络中的其他参与者。我们通过将分布式存储与基于区块链的隐私保护支付系统相结合的设计来解决这些相互矛盾的需求，从而在保持用户隐私的同时鼓励参与。通过遵循在整个系统生命周期中集成隐私的隐私设计策略，我们表明，尽管集成了支付机制，也有可能实现与最先进的分布式存储技术相当的隐私级别。我们的结果表明，以保护隐私的方式将存储合同和支付结合起来是可能的。此外，我们的系统设计可以作为未来类似架构的灵感。
papers.title_zh: 具有财务激励的隐私保护分散文件存储设计

papers.title: Proof-of-Personhood: Redemocratizing Permissionless Cryptocurrencies
papers.authors: Maria Borge, Eleftherios Kokoris-Kogias, Philipp Jovanovic, Linus Gasser, Nicolas Gailly, Bryan Ford
papers.abstract: Permissionless blockchain-based cryptocurrencies commonly use proof-of-work (PoW) or proof-of-stake (PoS) to ensure their security, e.g. to prevent double spending attacks. However, both approaches have disadvantages: PoW leads to massive amounts of wasted electricity and re-centralization, whereas major stakeholders in PoS might be able to create a monopoly. In this work, we propose proof-of-personhood (PoP), a mechanism that binds physical entities to virtual identities in a way that enables accountability while preserving anonymity. Afterwards we introduce PoPCoin, a new cryptocurrency, whose consensus mechanism leverages PoP to eliminate the dis-advantages of PoW and PoS while ensuring security. PoPCoin leads to a continuously fair and democratic wealth creation process which paves the way for an experimental basic income infrastructure.
papers.abstract_zh: 基于区块链的无许可加密货币通常使用工作证明(PoW)或利益证明(PoS)来确保其安全性，例如防止双重消费攻击。然而，这两种方法都有缺点:电力导致大量的电力浪费和重新集中，而公共事业组织的主要利益相关者可能会造成垄断。在这项工作中，我们提出了身份证明(PoP)，这是一种将物理实体与虚拟身份绑定的机制，可以在保持匿名的同时实现问责。然后我们介绍了PoPCoin，一种新的加密货币，它的共识机制利用PoP来消除PoW和PoS的缺点，同时保证安全性。PoPCoin带来了一个持续公平和民主的财富创造过程，为实验性的基本收入基础设施铺平了道路。
papers.title_zh: 身份证明:重新民主化无许可加密货币

papers.title: BIP32-Ed25519: Hierarchical Deterministic Keys over a Non-linear Keyspace
papers.authors: Dmitry Khovratovich, Jason Law
papers.abstract: We show how to adapt the Bitcoin BIP32 proposal for deterministic key generation for the Ed25519 curve which has non-linear key space. We also demonstrate that the alternative proposal by Chain.com is insecure and deviates from the EdDSA standard.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们展示了如何为具有非线性密钥空间的Ed25519曲线调整用于确定性密钥生成的比特币BIP32提案。我们还证明了Chain.com提出的替代方案是不安全的，并且偏离了EdDSA标准。
papers.title_zh: BIP32-Ed25519:非线性密钥空间上的分层确定性密钥

papers.title: Anonymous Alone? Measuring Bitcoin's Second-Generation Anonymization Techniques
papers.authors: Malte Möser, Rainer Böhme
papers.abstract: This paper contributes a systematic account of transaction anonymization techniques that do not require trust in a single entity and support the existing cryptographic currency Bitcoin. It surveys and compares four known techniques, proposes tailored metrics to identify the use of each technique (but not necessarily its users), and presents longitudinal measurements indicating adoption trends and teething troubles. There is a tradeoff between the choice of users' preferred protection mechanisms and the risk that pertaining transactions can be singled out, which hurts privacy due to smaller anonymity sets unless a critical mass adopts the mechanism.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文系统地介绍了交易匿名化技术，这些技术不需要对单个实体的信任，并支持现有的加密货币比特币。它调查和比较了四种已知的技术，提出了定制的度量标准来识别每种技术的使用(但不一定是它的用户)，并提出了纵向测量，表明采用趋势和初期问题。在用户首选保护机制的选择和相关交易可能被挑选出来的风险之间存在权衡，这种风险会由于匿名集较小而损害隐私，除非有足够数量的用户采用该机制。
papers.title_zh: 独自匿名？衡量比特币的第二代匿名技术

papers.title: Long-Term Public Blockchain: Resilience against Compromise of Underlying Cryptography
papers.authors: Masashi Sato, Shin'ichiro Matsuo
papers.abstract: Blockchain technology realizes unforgeable and decentralized ledger by applying P2P network, cryptography and consensus mechanism over distributed network. Its security relies on all of these technologies. One of fundamental problem of the security of blockchain technology is compromise of underlying cryptographic algorithms. This paper shows the impact of compromise of underlying cryptography and the way to extend the validity of blockchain applying the long-term signature scheme which was standardized in ETSI. The long-term signature scheme assume the existence of centralized PKI and secure time-stamp service. In this paper, we propose a method to apply similar concept and data structure with de-centralized manner. Our scheme avoids hard-fork of original blockchain, in the case of compromise of hash function and provides smooth-fork in the case of compromise of digital signature scheme.
papers.abstract_zh: 区块链技术通过在分布式网络上应用P2P网络、密码学和共识机制，实现了不可伪造和去中心化的账本。它的安全性依赖于所有这些技术。区块链技术安全性的一个基本问题是底层密码算法的泄露。本文展示了基础加密技术的危害以及如何应用ETSI标准化的长期签名方案来扩展区块链的有效性。长期签名方案假设存在集中式PKI和安全时间戳服务。在本文中，我们提出了一种以去中心化的方式应用相似概念和数据结构的方法。我们的方案避免了原始区块链在哈希函数泄露情况下的硬分叉，并提供了在数字签名方案泄露情况下的平滑分叉。
papers.title_zh: 长期公共区块链:对底层加密妥协的弹性

papers.title: Towards Better Availability and Accountability for IoT Updates by Means of a Blockchain
papers.authors: Aymen Boudguiga, Nabil Bouzerna, Louis Granboulan, Alexis Olivereau, Flavien Quesnel, Anthony Roger, Renaud Sirdey
papers.abstract: Building the Internet of Things requires deploying a huge number of objects with full or limited connectivity to the Internet. Given that these objects are exposed to attackers and generally not secured-by-design, it is essential to be able to update them, to patch their vulnerabilities and to prevent hackers from enrolling them into botnets. Ideally, the update infrastructure should implement the CIA triad properties, i.e., confidentiality, integrity and availability. In this work, we investigate how the use of a blockchain infrastructure can meet these requirements, with a focus on availability. In addition, we propose a peer-to-peer mechanism, to spread updates between objects that have limited access to the Internet. Finally, we give an overview of our ongoing prototype implementation.
papers.abstract_zh: 构建物联网需要部署大量与互联网完全或有限连接的对象。考虑到这些对象会暴露给攻击者，并且通常不是通过设计来保护的，因此能够更新它们、修补它们的漏洞并防止黑客将它们注册到僵尸网络中是至关重要的。理想情况下，更新基础设施应该实现CIA三元属性，即机密性、完整性和可用性。在这项工作中，我们研究了如何使用区块链基础设施来满足这些要求，重点是可用性。此外，我们提出了一种对等机制，在访问互联网受限的对象之间传播更新。最后，我们给出了我们正在进行的原型实现的概述。
papers.title_zh: 通过区块链实现更好的物联网更新可用性和问责制

papers.title: Auditable Zerocoin
papers.authors: Ken Naganuma, Masayuki Yoshino, Hisayoshi Sato, Takayuki Suzuki
papers.abstract: With the development of Blockchain, more and more distributed cryptocurrencies continue to emerge. Most of these currencies use cryptographic techniques (such as zero-knowledge proofs, ring signatures, etc.) to enhance privacy protection, but at the same time the regulatory authorities have no access to audit transactions. Most existing auditing schemes are based on centralized system and cannot be directly applied to distributed cryptocurrencies. Therefore, an Auditable Zerocoin with User Awareness (AZUA) scheme which supports privacy protection and auditability simultaneously is proposed in this paper. Aiming to ensure that auditors can audit Zerocoin's transactions, auditability is defined in this paper. Meanwhile, in order to prevent auditors from abusing their power, a new security property is proposed: user awareness auditing. Moreover, taking transaction privacy issue into consideration, indistinguishability of audit information is defined. The transaction auditing from auditors is achieved in AZUA through the encryption scheme, which ensures the honesty of the auditors by introducing a commitment mechanism and that the users can be aware of whether they have been audited according to randomized public keys. Finally, it is proved that the scheme can satisfy auditability, user awareness auditing and indistinguishability of audit information simultaneously.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着区块链的发展，越来越多的分布式加密货币不断涌现。这些货币大多使用密码技术(如零知识证明、环签名等。)来增强隐私保护，但同时监管部门无权审核交易。现有的审计方案大多基于集中式系统，不能直接应用于分布式加密货币。因此，本文提出了一种同时支持隐私保护和可审计性的可审计Zerocoin用户感知方案。为了确保审计师能够审计Zerocoin的交易，本文定义了可审计性。同时，为了防止审计人员滥用权力，提出了一种新的安全属性:用户意识审计。此外，考虑到交易隐私问题，定义了审计信息的不可区分性。审计员对交易的审计是在AZUA中通过加密方案实现的，加密方案通过引入一种承诺机制来确保审计员的诚实性，并且用户可以知道他们是否根据随机公钥被审计。最后，证明了该方案能够同时满足可审计性、用户感知审计和审计信息的不可区分性。
papers.title_zh: 可审计零硬币

papers.title: Conditions of Full Disclosure: The Blockchain Remuneration Model
papers.authors: S. Matthew English, Ehsan Nezhadian
papers.abstract: One of the fundamental applications for a practically useful system of money is remuneration. Information pertaining to the amount of compensation awarded to different individuals is often considered sensitive, commanding a certain degree of privacy. As Bitcoin and similarly designed cryptocurrencies evolve into a recognized medium of exchange for larger swaths of the world economy, an increasing number of people will earn income in the form of blockchain-based payments. The nature of these transactions is such that the minute details of an affected individuals compensation package and spending habits will be exposed to public scrutiny. In some cases this violates cultural norms which respect the confidentiality of salaries, yet in other cases it could be regarded as providing the benefits associated with greater transparency. In this work we analyse the Bitcoin blockchain record of periodic payments accruing to an individual address in exchange for goods or services rendered. For differing levels of available information we seek to determine the extent of insights that can be gleaned about the transacting counter-parties and the privacy implications this entails.
papers.abstract_zh: 一个实用的货币体系的基本应用之一是报酬。与判给不同个人的赔偿金额有关的信息通常被认为是敏感的，需要一定程度的隐私。随着比特币和类似设计的加密货币演变为世界经济更大范围的公认交换媒介，越来越多的人将通过区块链支付的形式获得收入。这些交易的性质决定了受影响个人的薪酬方案和消费习惯的细节将暴露在公众的审视之下。在某些情况下，这违反了尊重工资保密的文化规范，但在其他情况下，这可被视为提供了与更大透明度相关的好处。在这项工作中，我们分析了比特币区块链记录，该记录记录了为换取商品或服务而向个人地址支付的定期款项。对于不同级别的可用信息，我们试图确定可以收集到的关于交易对手的洞察程度以及由此带来的隐私影响。
papers.title_zh: 充分披露的条件:区块链薪酬模式

papers.title: Oligarchic Control of Business-to-Business Blockchains
papers.authors: Leif-Nissen Lundbaek, Michael Huth
papers.abstract: The innovative ideas behind blockchain offer exciting perspectives in research and development of electronic distributed ledger technologies. Bitcoin introduced an "eventual consistency" blockchain with the apparent intent of providing an open and inclusive system for secure, anonymous, yet cost-effective financial transactions based on peer-to-peer computing. It uses Proof ofWork as a cryptographic puzzle to control growth of a chain and to strengthen the resiliency of a chain against subsequent rewrite attempts. Commercial sectors and the public sector have realized the potential of this technical approach, and we now see a number of blockchains that may be called private, closed or permissioned – and that may eschew the values inherent in the design of Bitcoin type systems. From a value-neutral research perspective, there are no clear definitions of blockchain attributes such as "private" or "permissioned", nor is there typically a good understanding of the trust assumptions that clients must make when using such services – for example in systems that do not rely on Proof of Work but on a limited and controlled set of consensus-creating agents. We believe that more research in this direction could establish firm foundations for domain-specific or coalition-specific blockchains, and that such underpinnings would offer novel trust architectures beyond those provided by completely open/public blockchains and third-party operated, closed/private blockchains.
papers.abstract_zh: 区块链背后的创新理念为电子分布式账本技术的研发提供了令人兴奋的前景。比特币引入了“最终一致性”区块链，其明显意图是为基于点对点计算的安全、匿名、经济高效的金融交易提供一个开放和包容的系统。它使用工作证明作为密码难题来控制链的增长，并加强链对后续重写尝试的弹性。商业部门和公共部门已经意识到了这种技术方法的潜力，我们现在看到了一些可能被称为私人、封闭或许可的区块链，它们可能回避了比特币类型系统设计中固有的价值。从价值中立的研究角度来看，区块链属性没有明确的定义，如“私有”或“许可”，也没有很好地理解客户在使用此类服务时必须做出的信任假设——例如，在不依赖工作证明，而是依赖一组有限和受控的共识创建代理的系统中。我们相信，在这一方向的更多研究可以为特定领域或特定联盟的区块链奠定坚实的基础，并且这种基础将提供全新的信任架构，超越完全开放/公开的区块链和第三方运营、封闭/私有的区块链所提供的架构。
papers.title_zh: 区块链企业对企业的寡头控制

papers.title: The Privacy API: Facilitating Insights in How One's Own User Data is Shared
papers.authors: Bram Bonné, Peter Quax, Wim Lamotte
papers.abstract: This work describes a proposal to increase transparency and legibility for users of services where the service provider is handing over user data to marketeers, advertisers and other third parties in order to cover the costs of providing the service or to increase revenue. The proposed solution takes the form of an API, offered by the service provider to the user, which provides the user with the same data that is passed on to third parties, but limited to data related to this particular user. In this work, it is discussed how such an API should be implemented, how it should be enforced, and which important considerations should be made when implementing it. The API maps directly on already existing channels used by the service provider, and should require minimal implementation effort while substantially increasing transparency. It provides benefits to users by providing better insight in how their data is used and what it is worth, to service providers by making it easier to comply with regulations and by increasing (potential) user trust, and to regulators by providing a consistent framework for assessing compliance. Furthermore, the proposed approach allows the inclusion of consumer organizations or other trusted third parties as part of the information flow.
papers.abstract_zh: 该工作描述了一种增加服务用户的透明度和易读性的建议，其中服务提供商将用户数据移交给营销商、广告商和其他第三方，以便支付提供服务的成本或增加收入。所提出的解决方案采用由服务提供商向用户提供的API的形式，该API向用户提供传递给第三方的相同数据，但是限于与该特定用户相关的数据。在这篇文章中，我们讨论了这样一个API应该如何实现，应该如何实施，以及在实现时应该考虑哪些重要的因素。API直接映射到服务提供者使用的现有通道上，应该只需要最少的实现工作，同时大大增加了透明度。它通过更好地了解数据的使用方式和价值，为用户带来好处；通过简化合规性和增加(潜在)用户信任，为服务提供商带来好处；通过提供一致的合规性评估框架，为监管机构带来好处。此外，建议的方法允许将消费者组织或其他可信任的第三方作为信息流的一部分。
papers.title_zh: 隐私API:促进对如何共享个人用户数据的洞察

papers.title: The Cost of Push Notifications for Smartphones Using Tor Hidden Services
papers.authors: Stephan A. Kollmann, Alastair R. Beresford
papers.abstract: Push notification services provide reliable, energy efficient, store-and-forward messaging between servers and clients. This mode of communication is widely used, and sufficiently compelling for mobile devices that push notification services are integrated into operating systems. Unfortunately, push notification services today allow the service provider to practice censorship, surveillance, and location tracking. We explore whether running a Tor hidden service from a smartphone offers a viable, privacy-aware alternative. We conduct empirical measurements in the lab as well as modelling using data from 2 014 handsets in the Device Analyzer dataset. We estimate the monthly median cost of cellular data required to support a Tor hidden service from a smartphone at 198 MiB. We further estimate that the network activity would cost at least 9.6% of total battery on a Nexus One device with a daily charging cycle and connected to the Internet via 3G. We explore four strategies for reducing cellular data costs which, when combined, could potentially reduce the total monthly median cost to 61 MiB.
papers.abstract_zh: 推送通知服务在服务器和客户端之间提供可靠、节能、存储转发的消息传递。这种通信模式被广泛使用，并且对于将推送通知服务集成到操作系统中的移动设备来说具有足够的吸引力。不幸的是，今天的推送通知服务允许服务提供商实施审查、监视和位置跟踪。我们探索从智能手机上运行Tor隐藏服务是否提供了一个可行的、有隐私意识的替代方案。我们在实验室进行实证测量，并使用来自设备分析器数据集中的2 014部手机的数据进行建模。我们估计支持198 MiB智能手机Tor隐藏服务所需的每月蜂窝数据中值成本。我们进一步估计，在每天充电并通过3G连接到互联网的Nexus One设备上，网络活动至少会消耗总电池的9.6%。我们探讨了降低蜂窝数据成本的四种策略，当这些策略结合使用时，可能会将每月总中值成本降低到61 MiB。
papers.title_zh: 使用Tor隐藏服务的智能手机推送通知的成本

papers.title: Secure and Efficient RNS Software Implementation for Elliptic Curve Cryptography
papers.authors: Apostolos P. Fournaris, Louiza Papachristodoulou, Nicolas Sklavos
papers.abstract: Elliptic Curve Cryptography operations rely heavily on the strong security of scalar multiplication. However, this operation is vulnerable to side channel (SCA) and fault injection (FA) attacks. The use of alternative arithmetic systems like Residue Number System (RNS) for all scalar multiplication underline operations has been proposed as an efficient countermeasure approach for the above attacks. In RNS, a number is represented as a set of smaller numbers, where each one is the result of the modular reduction with a given moduli basis. Under certain requirements, a number can be uniquely transformed from the integers to the RNS domain (and vice versa) and all arithmetic operations can be performed in RNS. This representation provides an inherent SCA and FA resistance to many attacks and can be further enhanced by additional RNS arithmetic manipulations or more traditional algorithmic countermeasures. In this paper, extending our previous work, we explore the potentials of RNS as an SCA and FA countermeasure. A description of RNS based SCA and FA resistance means is provided through appropriate scalar multiplication algorithmic variations, traces of the proposed algorithm are collected and the results are analyzed regarding the RNS countermeasure strength. More specifically, in this paper, a secure RNS based Montgomery Power Ladder based scalar multiplication algorithm is provided and is implemented on an ARM Cortex A7 processor. The implementation SCA-FA resistance is evaluated by collecting preliminary leakage trace results that validate our initial assumptions.
papers.abstract_zh: 椭圆曲线密码运算非常依赖于标量乘法的强安全性。然而，这种操作容易受到旁路(SCA)和故障注入(FA)攻击。对于所有标量乘法下划线运算，使用替代的算术系统，如剩余数系统(RNS ),已经被提出作为针对上述攻击的有效对抗方法。在RNS中，一个数被表示为一组更小的数，其中每个数都是给定模基的模约简的结果。在某些要求下，一个数可以唯一地从整数变换到RNS域(反之亦然)，并且所有的算术运算都可以在RNS中执行。这种表示提供了对许多攻击的固有的SCA和FA抵抗力，并且可以通过额外的RNS算术操作或更传统的算法对抗来进一步增强。在本文中，扩展我们以前的工作，我们探索了RNS作为一个SCA和FA对策的潜力。通过适当的标量乘算法变化，提供了基于RNS的SCA和FA抵抗方法的描述，收集了所提出算法的痕迹，并分析了关于RNS对抗强度的结果。更具体地说，本文提供了一种基于安全RNS的Montgomery幂阶梯标量乘法算法，并在ARM Cortex A7处理器上实现。通过收集验证我们最初假设的初步泄漏跟踪结果来评估实现SCA-FA阻力。
papers.title_zh: 安全高效的椭圆曲线密码RNS软件实现

papers.title: From Smashed Screens to Smashed Stacks: Attacking Mobile Phones Using Malicious Aftermarket Parts
papers.authors: Omer Shwartz, Guy Shitrit, Asaf Shabtai, Yossi Oren
