In this model, a user visiting a website will download a JavaScript code that executes client-side in her browser, mines a cryptocurrency—typically without her consent or knowledge—and pays out the seigniorage to the website. Websites may consciously employ this as an alternative or to supplement advertisement revenue, may offer premium content in exchange for mining, or may be unwittingly serving the code as a result of a breach (in which case the seigniorage is collected by the attacker). The cryptocurrency Monero is preferred seemingly for its unfriendliness to large-scale ASIC mining that would drive browser-based efforts out of the market, as well as for its purported privacy features. In this paper, we survey this landscape, conduct some measurements to establish its prevalence and profitability, outline an ethical framework for considering whether it should be classified as an attack or business opportunity, and make suggestions for the detection, mitigation and/or prevention of browser-based mining for non- consenting users.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们研究了浏览器内挖掘加密货币的最新趋势；特别是通过Coinhive和类似的代码库开采Monero。在这种模式下，访问网站的用户将下载JavaScript代码，该代码在她的浏览器中执行客户端，挖掘加密货币——通常在她不同意或不知情的情况下——并向网站支付铸币税。网站可能会有意识地利用这一点作为替代或补充广告收入，可能会提供优质内容以换取挖掘，或者可能会因违规而无意中提供代码(在这种情况下，攻击者会收取铸币税)。加密货币Monero似乎更受青睐，因为它对大规模ASIC挖掘不友好，这将把基于浏览器的努力赶出市场，还因为它据称的隐私功能。在本文中，我们调查了这种情况，进行了一些测量以确定其普遍性和盈利能力，概述了一个道德框架，以考虑是否应将它归类为攻击或商业机会，并为检测、缓解和/或防止非同意用户的基于浏览器的挖掘提出了建议。
papers.title_zh: 基于浏览器的密码劫持初探

papers.title: Blockchain as a Service (BaaS): Providers and Trust
papers.authors: Jatinder Singh, Johan David Michels
papers.abstract: Distributed ledger technologies (DLTs) are receiving much attention. As discussion focuses on the potential applications of DLTs, Blockchain-as-a-Service (BaaS) offerings are emerging to provide the underlying supporting infrastructure. BaaS entails a service provider supplying and managing aspects of a DLT infrastructure to facilitate and bring efficiencies regarding the development, experimentation, deployment, and the ongoing management of DLT applications. However, much of the interest in DLTs stems from their potential to decentralise, disintermediate, and enable ‘trustless’ interactions. At first sight, BaaS – being offered by a provider – appears to run counter to this. In practice, whether BaaS raises substantive trust concerns depends on the nature of the offering, the application's specifics, and the participants' goals and risk appetite. This paper elaborates the nature of BaaS and explores the trust considerations it raises, particularly regarding the role of providers as part of a wider infrastructure.
papers.abstract_zh: 分布式账本技术正受到越来越多的关注。随着讨论聚焦于DLT的潜在应用，区块链即服务(BaaS)产品正在兴起，以提供底层支持基础设施。BaaS需要一个服务提供商来提供和管理DLT基础设施的各个方面，以提高DLT应用程序的开发、实验、部署和持续管理的效率。然而，对DLT的兴趣大部分源于它们去中心化、去中介化和实现“无信任”交互的潜力。乍一看，由提供商提供的BaaS似乎与此背道而驰。在实践中，BaaS是否会引发实质性的信任问题取决于产品的性质、应用的具体情况以及参与者的目标和风险偏好。本文阐述了BaaS的性质，并探讨了它提出的信任问题，特别是关于提供者作为更广泛的基础设施的一部分的角色。
papers.title_zh: 区块链即服务(BaaS):提供商和信任

papers.title: Decentralizing Digital Identity: Open Challenges for Distributed Ledgers
papers.authors: Paul Dunphy, Luke Garratt, Fabien A. P. Petitcolas
papers.abstract: Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) has been proposed as a new way to incorporate decentralization into a wide range of digital infrastructures. Applications of DLT to digital identity are increasing in prevalence, with a recent survey reporting that 55% of DLT technologies in development track digital identity. However, while proofs of concept, open source software, and new ideas are readily available, it is still unclear the extent to which DLT can play a role to underpin new forms of digital identity. In this position paper, we situate this fast-moving application domain into the broader challenges faced in digital identity, with the aim to highlight the socio-technical nature of the challenge at hand, and to propose directions for future research.
papers.abstract_zh: 分布式账本技术(DLT)已被提出作为一种新的方式，将分散纳入广泛的数字基础设施。DLT在数字身份中的应用越来越普遍，最近的一项调查报告称，55%的DLT技术在开发中跟踪数字身份。然而，尽管概念证明、开源软件和新想法已经唾手可得，但仍不清楚DLT能在多大程度上支持新形式的数字身份。在这份立场文件中，我们将这一快速发展的应用领域置于数字身份面临的更广泛的挑战中，旨在强调当前挑战的社会技术性质，并为未来的研究提出方向。
papers.title_zh: 去中心化数字身份:分布式分类账面临的公开挑战

papers.title: Interaction-Based Privacy Threat Elicitation
papers.authors: Laurens Sion, Kim Wuyts, Koen Yskout, Dimitri Van Landuyt, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: Threat modeling involves the systematic identification, elicitation, and analysis of privacy- and/or security-related threats in the context of a specific system. These modeling practices are performed at a specific level of architectural abstraction – the use of Data Flow Diagram (DFD) models, for example, is common in this context. To identify and elicit threats, two fundamentally different approaches can be taken: (1) elicitation on a per-element basis involves iteratively singling out individual architectural elements and considering the applicable threats, (2) elicitation at the level of system interactions (which involve the local context of three elements: a source, a data flow, and a destination) performs elicitation at the basis of system-level communication. Although not considering the local context of the element under investigation makes the former approach easier to adopt and use for human analysts, this approach also leads to threat duplication and redundancy, relies more extensively on implicit analyst expertise, and requires more manual effort. In this paper, we provide a detailed analysis of these issues with element-based threat elicitation in the context of LINDDUN, an element-driven privacy-by-design threat modeling methodology. Subsequently, we present a LINDDUN extension that implements interaction-based privacy threat elicitation and we provide indepth argumentation on how this approach leads to better process guidance and more concrete interpretation of privacy threat types, ultimately requiring less effort and expertise. A third standalone contribution of this work is a catalog of realistic and illustrative LINDDUN privacy threats, which in turn facilitates practical threat elicitation using LINDDUN.
papers.abstract_zh: 威胁建模包括对特定系统环境中隐私和/或安全相关威胁的系统识别、启发和分析。这些建模实践是在特定的架构抽象层次上执行的——例如，数据流图(DFD)模型的使用在这种情况下是很常见的。为了识别和引出威胁，可以采用两种根本不同的方法:(1)基于每个元素的引出涉及迭代地挑选出单独的架构元素并考虑可应用的威胁，(2)系统交互级的引出(涉及三个元素的本地上下文:源、数据流和目的地)在系统级通信的基础上执行引出。虽然不考虑被调查元素的本地环境使得前一种方法更容易被人类分析师采用和使用，但是这种方法也导致威胁重复和冗余，更广泛地依赖于隐含的分析师专业知识，并且需要更多的手动工作。在本文中，我们在LINDDUN(一种元素驱动的设计隐私威胁建模方法)的上下文中提供了基于元素的威胁诱导对这些问题的详细分析。随后，我们提出了一个LINDDUN扩展，它实现了基于交互的隐私威胁诱导，我们提供了关于这种方法如何导致更好的过程指导和更具体的隐私威胁类型解释的深入论证，最终需要更少的努力和专业知识。这项工作的第三个独立贡献是现实的和说明性的LINDDUN隐私威胁的目录，这反过来促进了使用LINDDUN的实际威胁引出。
papers.title_zh: 基于交互的隐私威胁诱导

papers.title: The Odyssey: Modeling Privacy Threats in a Brave New World
papers.authors: Rafa Gálvez, Seda Gurses
papers.abstract: In the upcoming General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), privacy by design and privacy impact assessments are given an even more prominent role than before. It is now required that companies build privacy into the core of their technical products. Recently, researchers and industry players have proposed employing threat modeling methods, traditionally used in security engineering, as a way to bridge these two GDPR requirements in the process of engineering systems. Threat modeling, however, typically assumes a waterfall process and monolithic design, assumptions that are disrupted with the popularization of Agile methodologies and Service Oriented Architectures. Moreover, agile service environments make it easier to address some privacy problems, while complicating others. To date, the challenges of applying threat modeling for privacy in agile service environments remain understudied. This paper sets out to expose and analyze this gap. Specifically, we analyze what challenges and opportunities the shifts in software engineering practice introduce into traditional Threat Modeling activities; how they relate to the different Privacy Goals; and what Agile principles and Service properties have an impact on them. Our results show that both agile and services make the end-toend analysis of applications more difficult. At the same time, the former allows for more efficient communications and iterative progress, while the latter enables the parallelization of tasks and the documentation of some architecture decisions. Additionally, we open a new research avenue pointing to Amazon Macie as an example of Machine Learning applications that aim to provide a solution to the scalability and usability of Privacy Threat Modeling processes.
papers.abstract_zh: 在即将出台的《通用数据保护条例》(GDPR)中，隐私设计和隐私影响评估被赋予了比以往更加突出的作用。现在要求公司将隐私构建到技术产品的核心。最近，研究人员和行业参与者已经提议采用传统上在安全工程中使用的威胁建模方法，作为在工程系统的过程中桥接这两个GDPR需求的一种方式。然而，威胁建模通常假设瀑布过程和整体设计，这些假设随着敏捷方法和面向服务的架构的普及而被打破。此外，敏捷服务环境使得解决一些隐私问题变得更加容易，同时也使其他问题变得复杂。迄今为止，在敏捷服务环境中应用隐私威胁建模的挑战仍未得到充分研究。本文旨在揭示和分析这一差距。具体来说，我们分析了软件工程实践的转变给传统的威胁建模活动带来了哪些挑战和机遇；它们如何与不同的隐私目标相关联；以及哪些敏捷原则和服务属性对它们有影响。我们的结果表明，敏捷和服务都使得应用程序的端到端分析变得更加困难。同时，前者允许更有效的通信和迭代过程，而后者支持任务的并行化和一些架构决策的文档化。此外，我们开辟了一条新的研究途径，将Amazon Macie作为机器学习应用的一个例子，旨在为隐私威胁建模过程的可扩展性和可用性提供解决方案。
papers.title_zh: 奥德赛:在一个勇敢的新世界中模拟隐私威胁

papers.title: Privacy Risk Analysis to Enable Informed Privacy Settings
papers.authors: Sourya Joyee De, Daniel Le Métayer
papers.abstract: The work described in this paper is a contribution to enhancing individual control over personal data which is promoted, inter alia, by the new EU General Data Protection Regulation. We propose a method to enable better informed choices of privacy settings. The method relies on a privacy risk analysis parameterized by privacy settings. The user can express his choices, visualize their impact on the privacy risks through a user-friendly interface and, if needed, decide to revise them to reduce risks to an acceptable level.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文描述的工作有助于加强个人对个人数据的控制，这是由新的欧盟一般数据保护条例等推动的。我们提出了一种能够更好地选择隐私设置的方法。该方法依赖于由隐私设置参数化的隐私风险分析。用户可以表达他的选择，通过用户友好的界面可视化他们对隐私风险的影响，如果需要，决定修改他们以将风险降低到可接受的水平。
papers.title_zh: 隐私风险分析，实现知情的隐私设置

papers.title: FP -TESTER : Automated Testing of Browser Fingerprint Resilience
papers.authors: Antoine Vastel, Walter Rudametkin, Romain Rouvoy
papers.abstract: Despite recent regulations and growing user awareness, undesired browser tracking is increasing. In addition to cookies, browser fingerprinting is a stateless technique that exploits a device's configuration for tracking purposes. In particular, browser fingerprinting builds on attributes made available from Javascript and HTTP headers to create a unique and stable fingerprint. For example, browser plugins have been heavily exploited by state-of-the-art browser fingerprinters as a rich source of entropy. However, as browser vendors abandon plugins in favor of extensions, fingerprinters will adapt. We present FP-TESTER, an approach to automatically test the effectiveness of browser fingerprinting countermeasure extensions. We implement a testing toolkit to be used by developers to reduce browser fingerprintability. While countermeasures aim to hinder tracking by changing or blocking attributes, they may easily introduce subtle side-effects that make browsers more identifiable, rendering the extensions counterproductive. FP-TESTER reports on the side-effects introduced by the countermeasure, as well as how they impact tracking duration from a fingerprinter's point-of-view. To the best of our knowledge, FP-TESTER is the first tool to assist developers in fighting browser fingerprinting and reducing the exposure of end-users to such privacy leaks.
papers.abstract_zh: 尽管有最近的法规和不断增长的用户意识，不受欢迎的浏览器跟踪仍在增加。除了cookies之外，浏览器指纹是一种无状态技术，它利用设备的配置来进行跟踪。特别是，浏览器指纹建立在Javascript和HTTP头提供的属性上，以创建一个唯一且稳定的指纹。例如，浏览器插件已经被最先进的浏览器指纹识别器大量利用，作为熵的丰富来源。然而，随着浏览器厂商放弃插件而支持扩展，指纹识别器将会适应。我们提出了FP-TESTER，一种自动测试浏览器指纹对抗扩展有效性的方法。我们实现了一个测试工具包，供开发人员用来降低浏览器的指纹适配性。虽然反措施旨在通过更改或阻止属性来阻碍跟踪，但它们可能很容易引入微妙的副作用，使浏览器更容易识别，从而使扩展适得其反。FP-TESTER报告对抗措施引入的副作用，以及它们如何从指纹识别器的角度影响跟踪持续时间。据我们所知，FP-TESTER是第一款帮助开发人员对抗浏览器指纹并减少最终用户暴露于此类隐私泄露的工具。
papers.title_zh: FP -TESTER:浏览器指纹弹性的自动化测试

papers.title: Methods and Tools for GDPR Compliance Through Privacy and Data Protection Engineering
papers.authors: Yod Samuel Martín, Antonio Kung
papers.abstract: In this position paper we posit that, for Privacy by Design to be viable, engineers must be effectively involved and endowed with methodological and technological tools closer to their mindset, and which integrate within software and systems engineering methods and tools, realizing in fact the definition of Privacy Engineering. This position will be applied in the soon-to-start PDP4E project, where privacy will be introduced into existent general-purpose software engineering tools and methods, dealing with (risk management, requirements engineering, model-driven design, and software/systems assurance).
papers.abstract_zh: 在这份立场文件中，我们假设，为了使隐私设计可行，工程师必须有效地参与，并被赋予更接近他们思维模式的方法和技术工具，这些工具集成在软件和系统工程方法和工具中，实际上实现了隐私工程的定义。该职位将应用于即将启动的PDP4E项目，在该项目中，隐私将被引入到现有的通用软件工程工具和方法中，处理(风险管理、需求工程、模型驱动设计和软件/系统保证)。
papers.title_zh: 通过隐私和数据保护工程实现GDPR合规性的方法和工具

papers.title: It Takes a Village: A Community Based Participatory Framework for Privacy Design
papers.authors: Darakhshan J. Mir, Yan Shvartzshnaider, Mark Latonero
papers.abstract: As data-centric technologies are increasingly being considered in social contexts that intervene in marginalized peoples' lives, we consider design paradigms to create systems that fulfill their unique privacy needs and requirements. Disempowered populations often experience disparate harms from the loss of privacy but, typically, have a limited role in formulating the scope and nature of such interventions, and accompanying (implicit or explicit) privacy policies and consequent engineering processes. This gap can be addressed by including recipient communities in designing these privacy policies. We propose a participatory design model for data-centric applications where privacy policies (norms) emerge out of participation of the community in the research/design process. The framework of Contextual Integrity which articulates privacy as respect for normative rules of information flow in specific contexts, lends itself well to enable a community-generated formulation of these privacy norms within the contexts of the proposed intervention. Employing formal logic, these privacy norms can then be used to engineer systems capable of regulating the flow of information as per the negotiated norms [1]. This entire process which we call Contextualized Participatory Privacy by Design, seeks to empower communities in negotiating and articulating their privacy norms, leading to the development of systems that are capable of enforcing what they deem as ethical, contextualized use of their data.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着以数据为中心的技术越来越多地被考虑到干预边缘化人群生活的社会背景中，我们考虑设计范例来创建满足他们独特的隐私需求和要求的系统。丧失权能的人群往往会因失去隐私而遭受不同的伤害，但通常在制定此类干预措施的范围和性质以及相应的(隐含或明确的)隐私政策和随之而来的工程流程方面作用有限。这一差距可以通过让接收社区参与设计这些隐私政策来解决。我们为以数据为中心的应用程序提出了一个参与式设计模型，其中隐私政策(规范)来自于社区在研究/设计过程中的参与。上下文完整性框架将隐私阐述为对特定上下文中信息流动的规范性规则的尊重，非常有助于在提议干预的上下文中实现这些隐私规范的社区生成。使用形式逻辑，这些隐私规范可以被用来设计能够按照协商的规范管理信息流的系统[1]。这整个过程，我们称之为情境化的参与性隐私设计，寻求授权社区协商和阐明他们的隐私规范，导致系统的发展，能够强制执行他们认为是道德的，情境化的数据使用。
papers.title_zh: 它需要一个村庄:一个基于社区的隐私设计参与框架

papers.title: Enhancing Transparency and Consent in the IoT
papers.authors: Claude Castelluccia, Mathieu Cunche, Daniel Le Métayer, Victor Morel
papers.abstract: The development of the IoT raises specific questions in terms of privacy, especially with respect to information to users and consent. We argue that (1) all necessary information about collected data and the collecting devices should be communicated electronically to all data subjects in their range and (2) data subjects should be able to reply also electronically and express their own privacy choices. In this position paper, we take some examples of technologies and initiatives to illustrate our position (including direct and registry-based communications) and discuss them in the light of the GDPR and the WP29 recommendations.
papers.abstract_zh: 物联网的发展提出了隐私方面的具体问题，特别是关于用户信息和同意的问题。我们认为:( 1)关于收集的数据和收集设备的所有必要信息都应该以电子方式传达给其范围内的所有数据主体;( 2)数据主体也应该能够以电子方式回复并表达他们自己的隐私选择。在本立场文件中，我们举了一些技术和倡议的例子来说明我们的立场(包括直接和基于注册中心的通信)，并根据GDPR和WP29建议对它们进行了讨论。
papers.title_zh: 提高物联网的透明度和同意度

papers.title: Privacy Compliance Via Model Transformations
papers.authors: Thibaud Antignac, Riccardo Scandariato, Gerardo Schneider
papers.abstract: Due to the upcoming, more restrictive regulations (like the European GDPR), designing privacy preserving architectures for information systems is becoming a pressing concern for practitioners. In particular, verifying that a design is compliant with the regulations might be a challenging task for engineers. This work presents an approach based on model transformations, which guarantee that an architectural design encompasses regulation-oriented principles such as purpose limitation, or accountability of the data controller. Our work improves the state of the art along two main dimensions. The approach we propose (i) embeds privacy principles coming from regulations, thus helping to bridge the gap between the technical and the legal worlds, (ii) systematize the embedding of the privacy principles coming from regulations, thus enabling a constructive approach to privacy by design.
papers.abstract_zh: 由于即将到来的更加严格的法规(如欧洲GDPR)，为信息系统设计隐私保护架构成为从业者迫切关注的问题。特别是，对于工程师来说，验证设计是否符合法规可能是一项具有挑战性的任务。这项工作提出了一种基于模型转换的方法，它保证了架构设计包含面向规则的原则，如目的限制或数据控制器的责任。我们的工作在两个主要方面提高了技术水平。我们提出的方法(I)嵌入来自法规的隐私原则，从而有助于弥合技术和法律世界之间的差距，(ii)系统化嵌入来自法规的隐私原则，从而通过设计实现隐私的建设性方法。
papers.title_zh: 通过模型转换实现隐私遵从

papers.title: Simulation of a Trust and Reputation Based Mitigation Protocol for a Black Hole Style Attack on VANETs
papers.authors: Giuseppe Primiero, Agostino Martorana, Jacopo Tagliabue
papers.abstract: From a security standpoint, VANETs (Vehicular ad hoc Networks) are vulnerable to attacks by malicious users, due to the decentralized and open nature of the wireless system. For many of these kinds of attacks detection is unfeasible, thus making it hard to produce security. Despite their characterization as dynamically reconfigurable networks, it is nonetheless essential to identify topology and population properties that can optimise mitigation protocols' deployment. In this paper, we provide an algorithmic definition and simulation of a trust and mitigation based protocol to contain a Black Hole style attack on a VANET. We experimentally show its optimal working conditions: total connectivity, followed by a random network; connection to external networks; early deployment of the protocol and ranking of the message. We compare results with those of existing protocols and future work shall focus on repeated broadcasting, opportunistic message forwarding and testing on real data.
papers.abstract_zh: 从安全角度来看，由于无线系统的分散性和开放性，车载自组织网络容易受到恶意用户的攻击。对于这些类型的攻击，检测是不可行的，因此很难产生安全性。尽管它们被描述为动态可重新配置的网络，但是确定能够优化缓解协议部署的拓扑和群体属性仍然是至关重要的。在本文中，我们提供了一个基于信任和缓解的协议的算法定义和仿真，以遏制对VANET的黑洞式攻击。我们实验性地展示了它的最佳工作条件:全连通，其次是随机网络；连接到外部网络；协议的早期部署和消息的排序。我们将结果与现有协议进行比较，未来的工作将集中在重复广播、机会消息转发和真实数据测试上。
papers.title_zh: 基于信任和声誉的VANETs黑洞式攻击缓解协议仿真

papers.title: Trusted Platform Modules in Cyber-Physical Systems: On the Interference Between Security and Dependability
papers.authors: Andrea Höller, Ronald Toegl
papers.abstract: Cyber physical systems are the key innovation driver for many domains such as automotive, avionics, industrial process control, and factory automation. However, their interconnection potentially provides adversaries easy access to sensitive data, code, and configurations. If attackers gain control, material damage or even harm to people must be expected. To counteract data theft, system manipulation and cyber-attacks, security mechanisms must be embedded in the cyber physical system. Adding hardware security in the form of the standardized Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is a promising approach. At the same time, traditional dependability features such as safety, availability, and reliability have to be maintained. To determine the right balance between security and dependability it is essential to understand their interferences. This paper supports developers in identifying the implications of using TPMs on the dependability of their system.We highlight potential consequences of adding TPMs to cyber-physical systems by considering the resulting safety, reliability, and availability. Furthermore, we discuss the potential of enhancing the dependability of TPM services by applying traditional redundancy techniques.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络物理系统是汽车、航空电子、工业过程控制和工厂自动化等许多领域的关键创新驱动力。然而，它们的互连潜在地为对手提供了对敏感数据、代码和配置的轻松访问。如果攻击者获得控制权，那么必然会造成物质损失甚至人员伤害。为了对抗数据窃取、系统操纵和网络攻击，必须在网络物理系统中嵌入安全机制。以标准化可信平台模块(TPM)的形式增加硬件安全性是一种很有前途的方法。同时，必须维护传统的可靠性特征，如安全性、可用性和可靠性。为了确定安全性和可靠性之间的正确平衡，了解它们的干扰是至关重要的。本文支持开发人员识别使用TPMs对其系统可靠性的影响。我们通过考虑由此产生的安全性、可靠性和可用性，强调将TPMs添加到信息物理系统的潜在后果。此外，我们讨论了通过应用传统的冗余技术来增强TPM服务的可靠性的潜力。
papers.title_zh: 信息物理系统中的可信平台模块:安全性与可信性的冲突

papers.title: The Secret Processor Will Go to the Ball: Benchmark Insider-Proof Encrypted Computing
papers.authors: Peter T. Breuer, Jonathan P. Bowen, Esther Palomar, Zhiming Liu
papers.abstract: ‘Encrypted computing’ is an approach to preventing insider attacks by the privileged operator against the unprivileged user on a computing system. It requires a processor that works natively on encrypted data in user mode, and the security barrier that protects the user is hardware-based encryption, not access. We report on progress and practical experience with our superscalar RISC class prototype processor for encrypted computing and supporting software infrastructure. This paper aims to alert the secure hardware community that encrypted computing is possibly practical, as well as theoretically plausible. It has been shown formally impossible for operator mode to read (or write to order) the plaintext form of data originating from or being operated on in the user mode of this class of processor, given that the encryption is independently secure. Now we report standard Dhrystone benchmarks for the prototype, showing performance with AES-128 like a 433MHz classic Pentium (1 GHz base clock), thousands of times faster than other approaches.
papers.abstract_zh: “加密计算”是一种防止计算系统上特权操作员对非特权用户进行内部攻击的方法。它需要一个在用户模式下处理加密数据的处理器，保护用户的安全屏障是基于硬件的加密，而不是访问。我们报告了用于加密计算和支持软件基础设施的超标量RISC类原型处理器的进展和实践经验。本文旨在提醒安全硬件社区，加密计算不仅在理论上可行，而且可能是可行的。假定加密是独立安全的，已经正式表明操作员模式不可能读取(或按顺序写入)源自或在这类处理器的用户模式中操作的明文形式的数据。现在，我们报告了原型的标准Dhrystone基准，显示了AES-128的性能，就像433MHz经典奔腾(1 GHz基本时钟)，比其他方法快几千倍。
papers.title_zh: 秘密处理器将参加舞会:防内部攻击的加密计算基准测试

papers.title: An Analysis of Cyber Security Attack Taxonomies
papers.authors: Richard Derbyshire, Benjamin Green, Daniel Prince, Andreas Mauthe, David Hutchison
papers.abstract: Taxonomies have been developed as a mechanism for cyber attack categorisation. However, when one considers the recent and rapid evolution of attacker techniques and targets, the applicability and effectiveness of these taxonomies should be questioned. This paper applies two approaches to the evaluation of seven taxonomies. The first employs a criteria set, derived through analysis of existing works in which critical components to the creation of taxonomies are defined. The second applies historical attack data to each taxonomy under review, more specifically, attacks in which industrial control systems have been targeted. This combined approach allows for a more in-depth understanding of existing taxonomies to be developed, from both a theoretical and practical perspective.
papers.abstract_zh: 分类法已经发展成为一种网络攻击分类机制。然而，当考虑到攻击者技术和目标最近的快速发展时，这些分类法的适用性和有效性应该受到质疑。本文应用两种方法来评估七个分类学。第一种使用一个标准集，通过对现有作品的分析得出，其中定义了创建分类法的关键组成部分。第二种方法是将历史攻击数据应用于所审查的每个分类，更具体地说，是针对工业控制系统的攻击。这种结合的方法允许从理论和实践的角度更深入地理解要开发的现有分类法。
papers.title_zh: 网络安全攻击分类分析

papers.title: Ledger design language: designing and deploying formally verified public ledgers
papers.authors: Nadim Kobeissi, Natalia Kulatova
papers.abstract: Cryptocurrencies have popularized public ledgers, known colloquially as “blockchains”. While the Bitcoin blockchain is relatively simple to reason about as, effectively, a hash chain, more complex public ledgers are largely designed without any formalization of desired cryptographic properties such as authentication or integrity. These designs are then implemented without assurances against real-world bugs leading to little assurance with regards to practical, real-world security. Ledger Design Language (LDL) is a modeling language for describing public ledgers. The LDL compiler produces two outputs. The first output is a an applied-pi calculus symbolic model representing the public ledger as a protocol. Using ProVerif, the protocol can be played against an active attacker, whereupon we can query for block integrity, authenticity and other properties. The second output is a formally verified read/write API for interacting with the public ledger in the real world, written in the F* programming language. F* features such as dependent types allow us to validate a block on the public ledger, for example, by type-checking it so that its signing public key be a point on a curve. Using LDL’s outputs, public ledger designers obtain automated assurances on the theoretical coherence and the real-world security of their designs with a single framework based on a single modeling language.
papers.abstract_zh: 加密货币普及了公共账簿，俗称“区块链”。虽然比特币区块链相对容易推理，实际上是一个哈希链，但更复杂的公共分类账在很大程度上是在没有任何所需加密属性(如认证或完整性)的形式化情况下设计的。然后，这些设计在没有针对现实世界中的错误的保证的情况下被实现，导致对于实际的、现实世界中的安全性几乎没有保证。分类帐设计语言(LDL)是一种用于描述公共分类帐的建模语言。LDL编译器产生两个输出。第一个输出是一个应用pi演算符号模型，将公共分类帐表示为一个协议。使用ProVerif，可以对主动攻击者使用该协议，因此我们可以查询块的完整性、真实性和其他属性。第二个输出是一个正式验证的读/写API，用于与真实世界中的公共分类帐进行交互，用F*编程语言编写。F*特性(如依赖类型)允许我们在公共分类账上验证一个块，例如，通过类型检查，使它的签名公钥是曲线上的一个点。使用LDL的输出，公共分类帐设计者通过基于单一建模语言的单一框架，获得了对其设计的理论一致性和现实世界安全性的自动保证。
papers.title_zh: 分类帐设计语言:设计和部署正式验证的公共分类帐

papers.title: A Threat Model for Soft Privacy on Smart Cars
papers.authors: Mario Raciti, Giampaolo Bella
papers.abstract: Modern cars are getting so computerised that ENISA’s phrase “smart cars” is a perfect fit. The amount of personal data that they process is very large and, yet, increasing. Hence, the need to address citizens’ privacy while they drive and, correspondingly, the importance of privacy threat modelling (in support of a respective risk assessment, such as through a Data Protection Impact Assessment). This paper addresses privacy threats by advancing a general modelling methodology and by demonstrating it specifically on soft privacy, which ensures citizens’ full control on their personal data. By considering all relevant threat agents, the paper applies the methodology to the specific automotive domain while keeping threats at the same level of detail as ENISA’s. The main result beside the modelling methodology consists of both domain-independent and automotive domain-dependent soft privacy threats. While cybersecurity has been vastly threat-modelled so far, this paper extends the literature with a threat model for soft privacy on smart cars, producing 17 domain-independent threats that, associated with 41 domain-specific assets, shape a novel set of domain-dependent threats in automotive.
papers.title_zh: 智能汽车软隐私的威胁模型
papers.abstract_zh: 现代汽车变得如此计算机化，以至于ENISA的短语“智能汽车”是一个完美的契合。他们处理的个人数据量非常大，而且还在不断增加。因此，需要解决公民驾驶时的隐私问题，相应地，隐私威胁建模也很重要(以支持相应的风险评估，如通过数据保护影响评估)。本文通过提出一种通用建模方法，并通过具体展示软隐私来解决隐私威胁，从而确保公民对其个人数据的完全控制。通过考虑所有相关的威胁因素，本文将该方法应用于特定的汽车领域，同时将威胁保持在与ENISA相同的详细程度。除了建模方法之外，主要结果包括与领域无关和与汽车领域相关的软隐私威胁。虽然到目前为止，网络安全已经进行了大量的威胁建模，但本文通过智能汽车软隐私的威胁模型扩展了文献，产生了17种与域无关的威胁，这些威胁与41种特定于域的资产相关联，形成了一组新颖的汽车领域相关威胁。

papers.title: Vulnerability Analysis of Vehicular Coordinated Maneuvers
papers.authors: Konstantinos Kalogiannis, Andreas Henriksson, Panos Papadimitratos
papers.abstract: Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) latest standardization efforts focus on a Maneuver Coordination Service (MCS), for automated vehicles to cooperatively perform maneuvers. The goal is to avoid degrading to lower levels of automation, i.e., human input for maneuvering, e.g., when an obstacle ahead needs to be avoided. MCS-equipped vehicles communicate with nearby vehicles that are possibly affected by the impending maneuver, to establish that a maneuver can safely take place. An MCS-equipped vehicle that misbehaves can be catastrophic: transmitting falsified MCS messages or preventing their reception can mislead victim vehicles into aborting a maneuver, being delayed and, worse even, collide. In this work, we investigate the robustness of existing Maneuver Coordination Protocols (MCPs) and analyze the effect of falsification and jamming attacks. Our analysis shows an increased probability for neck injuries, i.e., whiplash, and potentially more severe injuries. As a first step towards thwarting attacks targeting MCPs, we extend MCPs to take into account on-board vehicle sensors, along with MCP messaging, before committing to a maneuver. Our results demonstrate the MCP vulnerability, the improvement thanks to the sensors, and the need to further improve MCP security. We conclude with a road-map towards a resilient MCS.
papers.title_zh: 车辆协同机动的脆弱性分析
papers.abstract_zh: 智能交通系统(ITS)的最新标准化工作集中在机动协调服务(MCS)上，用于自动车辆合作执行机动。目标是避免降级到较低的自动化水平，即，例如，当需要避开前方的障碍物时，用于操纵的人工输入。装有主控站的车辆与附近可能受即将发生的机动影响的车辆进行通信，以确定机动可以安全进行。装有主控站的车辆行为不当可能是灾难性的:传送伪造的主控站讯息或阻止接收讯息，可能会误导受害车辆中止行动、被延误，甚至更糟的是，发生碰撞。在这项工作中，我们调查了现有的机动协调协议(MCPs)的鲁棒性，并分析了伪造和干扰攻击的影响。我们的分析显示颈部受伤的可能性增加，即颈部扭伤，以及潜在的更严重的伤害。作为挫败针对MCP的攻击的第一步，我们扩展了MCP，在实施机动之前，将车载车辆传感器和MCP消息考虑在内。我们的结果证明了MCP的脆弱性、传感器带来的改进以及进一步提高MCP安全性的需要。最后，我们提出了建立一个有复原力的监控监系统的路线图。

papers.title: A Preliminary Study of Privilege Life Cycle in Software Management Platform Automation Workflows
papers.authors: Giacomo Benedetti, Luca Verderame, Alessio Merlo
papers.abstract: This paper focuses on the role of privileges in automation workflows within modern software development practices, which heavily rely on DevOps principles. Automation workflows, which are sets of automated software management processes, have become essential to software development and are integrated into software management platforms such as GitHub, GitLab, and BitBucket. However, privileges are crucial in ensuring the security and integrity of the software development process. This paper aims to identify the phases in which privileges are involved in automation workflows and analyze how these platforms handle the privilege life cycle in automation workflows to provide a better understanding of their security implications. The security discussion highlighted in this analysis aims to stimulate solutions and further research.
papers.title_zh: 软件管理平台自动化工作流中特权生命周期的初步研究
papers.abstract_zh: 本文主要关注特权在现代软件开发实践中的自动化工作流中的作用，这在很大程度上依赖于DevOps原则。自动化工作流是自动化软件管理过程的集合，已经成为软件开发的基本要素，并集成到软件管理平台中，如GitHub、GitLab和BitBucket。然而，特权对于确保软件开发过程的安全性和完整性是至关重要的。本文旨在确定自动化工作流中涉及权限的阶段，并分析这些平台如何处理自动化工作流中的权限生命周期，以便更好地理解它们的安全含义。本分析中强调的安全讨论旨在激发解决方案和进一步的研究。

papers.title: An Investigation of Quality Issues in Vulnerability Detection Datasets
papers.authors: Yuejun Guo, Seifeddine Bettaieb
papers.abstract: Vulnerability detection is a crucial yet challenging task in ensuring software security, and deep learning (DL) has made significant progress in automating this process. However, a DL model requires a massive amount of labeled data (vulnerable and secure source code) to effectively distinguish between the two. Many datasets have been created for this purpose but they suffer from several issues that can lead to low detection accuracy of DL models. In this paper, we define three critical issues (data imbalance, low vulnerability coverage, and biased vulnerability distribution) and three secondary issues (errors in source code, mislabeling, and noisy historical data) that can affect the model performance. We also conduct a study of 14 papers along with 54 datasets for vulnerability detection to confirm these defined issues. Furthermore, we discuss good practices for using existing datasets and creating new ones to improve the quality of data available for automated vulnerability detection. This paper aims to raise awareness of the importance of data quality in vulnerability detection and provide proper guidelines for researchers and practitioners working in this area.
papers.title_zh: 漏洞检测数据集中质量问题的研究
papers.abstract_zh: 漏洞检测是确保软件安全的一项关键但具有挑战性的任务，深度学习(DL)在自动化这一过程中取得了重大进展。然而，DL模型需要大量的标记数据(易受攻击的和安全的源代码)来有效地区分这两者。已经为此目的创建了许多数据集，但是它们受到几个问题的困扰，这些问题会导致DL模型的低检测准确度。在本文中，我们定义了可能影响模型性能的三个关键问题(数据不平衡、低漏洞覆盖率和有偏见的漏洞分布)和三个次要问题(源代码中的错误、错误标记和有噪声的历史数据)。我们还对14篇论文和54个漏洞检测数据集进行了研究，以确认这些已定义的问题。此外，我们讨论了使用现有数据集和创建新数据集的良好实践，以提高可用于自动漏洞检测的数据质量。本文旨在提高对漏洞检测中数据质量重要性的认识，并为该领域的研究人员和从业人员提供适当的指导。

papers.title: GLICE: Combining Graph Neural Networks and Program Slicing to Improve Software Vulnerability Detection
papers.authors: Wesley de Kraker, Harald Vranken, Arjen Hommmersom
papers.abstract: This paper introduces the GLICE (Graph Neural Network with program slice) model for static code analysis to detect vulnerabilities in source code. GLICE combines inter-procedural program slicing with a Graph Neural Network. It builds upon and extends prior work that applies program slicing (as in the SySeVR model) and Graph Neural Networks (as in the FUNDED model) for vulnerability detection. We apply GLICE on a data set of C/C++ code samples with out-of-bounds write (CWE-787) and out-of-bounds read (CWE-125) butter overflow vulnerabilities. We perform experiments with GLICE to evaluate trade-offs in the depth of the inter-procedural analysis, and to compare GLICE with prior models by evaluating the effectiveness for vulnerability detection and the usage of resources. Our experimental results show that detection accuracy of GLICE improves up to 13% when compared to FUNDED, while the time required to train the GLICE model is about 9 times smaller. GLICE allows configuring the depth of the interprocedural analysis. Our experimental results show that increasing the depth will improve detection, which however requires more computing resources. This allows a user of GLICE to steer the trade-off between detection accuracy and computational efficiency.
papers.title_zh: GLICE:结合图形神经网络和程序切片改进软件漏洞检测
papers.abstract_zh: 介绍了GLICE(带程序切片的图形神经网络)模型，用于静态代码分析，检测源代码中的漏洞。GLICE将过程间程序切片与图形神经网络相结合。它建立并扩展了以前的工作，这些工作将程序切片(如在SySeVR模型中)和图形神经网络(如在FUNDED模型中)应用于漏洞检测。我们将GLICE应用于具有越界写入(CWE-787)和越界读取(CWE-125)黄油溢出漏洞的C/C++代码样本的数据集。我们使用GLICE进行实验，以评估过程间分析深度的权衡，并通过评估漏洞检测和资源使用的有效性，将GLICE与以前的模型进行比较。我们的实验结果表明，GLICE的检测准确率比FUNDED提高了13%,而训练GLICE模型所需的时间减少了约9倍。GLICE允许配置过程间分析的深度。我们的实验结果表明，增加深度将改进检测，然而这需要更多的计算资源。这允许GLICE的用户在检测精度和计算效率之间进行权衡。

papers.title: Guiding Directed Fuzzing with Feasibility
papers.authors: Weiheng Bai, Kefu Wu, Qiushi Wu, Kangjie Lu
papers.abstract: Directed fuzzing is a useful technique that can confirm bugs found by static analysis, reproduce existing bugs, and efficiently test code changes. A general mechanism in directed fuzzing is to calculate the distance between the current progress and the target, and use that as a feedback to guide the directed fuzzing. A fundamental problem with existing distance calculation is that it is feasibility-unaware. For instance, it always assumes that the two branches of an if statement have equal feasibility, which is likely not true in real-world programs and would inevitablly incur significant biases in the directed fuzzing. In this work, we propose feasibility-aware directed fuzzing, AFLGopher. Our new feasibility-aware distance calculation provides precise feedback to guide directed fuzzing to reach targets efficiently. We propose new techniques to address challenges of the feasibility prediction. Our new classification method allows to predict the feasibility of all branches based on limited traces, and our runtime feasibility-updating mechanism gradually improves the prediction precision. We implement AFLGopher, and the evaluation results show that AFLGopher uses less time to reach the bugs, compared to the state of the art.
papers.title_zh: 可行性引导定向模糊化
papers.abstract_zh: 定向模糊化是一种有用的技术，可以确认通过静态分析发现的错误，重现现有的错误，并有效地测试代码更改。定向模糊化的一般机制是计算当前进程与目标之间的距离，并将其作为反馈来指导定向模糊化。现有距离计算的一个基本问题是它不知道可行性。例如，它总是假设一个if语句的两个分支具有相同的可行性，这在现实世界的程序中可能是不正确的，并且不可避免地会导致定向模糊中的重大偏差。在这项工作中，我们提出了可行性意识定向模糊化，AFLGopher。我们新的可行性感知距离计算提供了精确的反馈，以指导定向模糊有效地达到目标。我们提出新的技术来解决可行性预测的挑战。我们的新分类方法允许基于有限的轨迹预测所有分支的可行性，并且我们的运行时可行性更新机制逐渐提高了预测精度。我们实现了AFLGopher，评估结果表明，与现有技术相比，AFLGopher使用了更少的时间来发现错误。

papers.title: Effective Machine Learning-based Access Control Administration through Unlearning
papers.authors: Javier Martínez Llamas, Davy Preuveneers, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: With the rapid and increasing complexity of computer systems and software, there is a need for more effective, scalable, and secure access control methods. Machine learning (ML) has gained popularity in complementing manually crafted authorisation policies in such environments. However, given the dynamic and constantly evolving nature of software and access control systems, the administration of the latter presents a significant security challenge. This paper examines the administration problem of Machine Learning-based Access Control (MLBAC) systems through Machine Unlearning as a lightweight and secure method. More specifically, we explore this problem through exact and approximate unlearning and evaluate its impact using real-world data. We demonstrate the effectiveness of Machine Unlearning in both reverting policies and addressing potential vulnerabilities that may emerge during the model’s lifecycle. Compared to alternative options such as retraining from scratch, our approach reduces deployment and verification costs, making it a promising solution for MLBAC administration.
papers.title_zh: 基于机器学习的有效访问控制管理
papers.abstract_zh: 随着计算机系统和软件的快速和日益增加的复杂性，需要更有效、可扩展和安全的访问控制方法。在这种环境下，机器学习(ML)在补充手工制作的授权策略方面已经获得了普及。然而，鉴于软件和出入控制系统的动态和不断演变的性质，后者的管理提出了一个重大的安全挑战。本文通过机器学习作为一种轻量级和安全的方法，研究了基于机器学习的访问控制系统的管理问题。更具体地说，我们通过精确和近似的遗忘来探索这个问题，并使用真实世界的数据来评估它的影响。我们展示了机器遗忘在恢复策略和解决模型生命周期中可能出现的潜在漏洞方面的有效性。与诸如从零开始重新训练的替代选项相比，我们的方法降低了部署和验证成本，使其成为MLBAC管理的有前途的解决方案。

papers.title: An Analysis System to Test Security of Software on Continuous Integration-Continuous Delivery Pipeline
papers.authors: Carmelo Aparo, Cinzia Bernardeschi, Giuseppe Lettieri, Fabio Lucattini, Salvatore Montanarella
papers.abstract: This work presents a modular and scalable analysis system to integrate different Applications Security Testing tools inside a Continuous Integration-Continuous Delivery Pipeline. Docker containerization and tools for stateless execution allow parallelism and replication. As a result of the analysis of an application, the system execution produces as output a unique JSON report that contains all the vulnerabilities found by the tools executed, with a risk score associated to each vulnerability. Two Application Security Testing tools, OWASP ZAP and SonarQube, have been integrated using Gitlab Platform to apply DevOps methodology for java web application analysis. Results on the OWASP Benchmark test suite confirm a consistent improvement of the security analysis and allow comparison of tools accuracy by vulnerability category.
papers.title_zh: 一个测试持续集成软件安全性的分析系统——持续交付流水线
papers.abstract_zh: 这项工作提出了一个模块化和可扩展的分析系统，将不同的应用程序安全测试工具集成到一个持续集成-持续交付管道中。Docker容器化和无状态执行工具支持并行和复制。作为应用程序分析的结果，系统执行产生唯一的JSON报告作为输出，该报告包含由所执行的工具发现的所有漏洞，以及与每个漏洞相关联的风险分数。使用Gitlab平台集成了OWASP ZAP和SonarQube两个应用程序安全测试工具，以应用DevOps方法进行java web应用程序分析。OWASP基准测试套件的结果证实了安全分析的持续改进，并允许按漏洞类别比较工具的准确性。

papers.title: Tales from the Git: Automating the detection of secrets on code and assessing developers' passwords choices
papers.authors: Nikolaos Lykousas, Constantinos Patsakis
papers.abstract: Typical users are known to use and reuse weak passwords. Yet, as cybersecurity concerns continue to rise, understanding the password practices of software developers becomes increasingly important. In this work, we examine developers' passwords on public repositories. Our dedicated crawler collected millions of passwords from public GitHub repositories; however, our focus is on their unique characteristics. To this end, this is the first study investigating the developer traits in password selection across different programming languages and contexts, e.g. email and database. Despite the fact that developers may have carelessly leaked their code on public repositories, our findings indicate that they tend to use significantly more secure passwords, regardless of the underlying programming language and context. Nevertheless, when the context allows, they often resort to similar password selection criteria as typical users. The public availability of such information in a cleartext format indicates that there is still much room for improvement and that further targeted awareness campaigns are necessary.
papers.title_zh: 来自Git的故事:自动检测代码秘密和评估开发人员的密码选择
papers.abstract_zh: 众所周知，典型用户会使用和重复使用弱密码。然而，随着网络安全问题的不断增加，了解软件开发人员的密码实践变得越来越重要。在这项工作中，我们检查了开发人员在公共存储库上的密码。我们的专用爬虫从公共GitHub库收集了数百万个密码；然而，我们的重点是他们独特的特征。为此，这是第一项调查不同编程语言和环境(如电子邮件和数据库)中密码选择的开发者特征的研究。尽管开发人员可能会不小心将他们的代码泄露到公共存储库中，但我们的发现表明，无论底层编程语言和上下文如何，他们都倾向于使用更安全的密码。然而，当环境允许时，他们通常会求助于与典型用户相似的密码选择标准。以明文形式公开提供这类信息表明仍有很大的改进空间，有必要开展进一步的有针对性的宣传活动。

papers.title: A 'Human-in-the-Loop' approach for Information Extraction from Privacy Policies under Data Scarcity
papers.authors: Michael Gebauer, Faraz Maschhur, Nicola Leschke, Elias Grünewald, Frank Pallas
papers.abstract: Machine-readable representations of privacy policies are door openers for a broad variety of novel privacy-enhancing and, in particular, transparency-enhancing technologies (TETs). In order to generate such representations, transparency information needs to be extracted from written privacy policies. However, respective manual annotation and extraction processes are laborious and require expert knowledge. Approaches for fully automated annotation, in turn, have so far not succeeded due to overly high error rates in the specific domain of privacy policies. In the end, a lack of properly annotated privacy policies and respective machine-readable representations persists and enduringly hinders the development and establishment of novel technical approaches fostering policy perception and data subject informedness.In this work, we present a prototype system for a ‘ Human-in-the-Loop’ approach to privacy policy annotation that integrates ML-generated suggestions and ultimately human annotation decisions. We propose an ML-based suggestion system specifically tailored to the constraint of data scarcity prevalent in the domain of privacy policy annotation. On this basis, we provide meaningful predictions to users thereby streamlining the annotation process. Additionally, we also evaluate our approach through a prototypical implementation to show that our ML-based extraction approach provides superior performance over other recently used extraction models for legal documents.
papers.title_zh: 数据稀缺下从隐私策略中提取信息的“人在回路”方法
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私策略的机器可读表示为各种各样的新型隐私增强技术，尤其是透明增强技术(TETs)打开了大门。为了生成这样的表示，需要从书面隐私策略中提取透明度信息。然而，相应的手动注释和提取过程是费力的，并且需要专业知识。反过来，由于在隐私政策的特定领域中过高的错误率，全自动注释的方法迄今为止还没有成功。最终，缺乏正确注释的隐私策略和相应的机器可读表示持续存在，并持久地阻碍了促进策略感知和数据主体信息的新技术方法的开发和建立。在这项工作中，我们提出了一个“人在回路”的隐私策略注释方法的原型系统，该系统集成了ML生成的建议和最终的人工注释决策。我们提出了一个基于最大似然的建议系统，专门针对隐私政策注释领域普遍存在的数据稀缺的限制。在此基础上，我们向用户提供有意义的预测，从而简化标注过程。此外，我们还通过一个原型实现来评估我们的方法，以表明我们的基于ML的抽取方法提供了优于其他最近使用的法律文档抽取模型的性能。

papers.title: An Analysis of Requirements and Privacy Threats in Mobile Data Donations
papers.authors: Leonie Reichert, Björn Scheuermann
papers.abstract: In recent years, personal and medical data collected through mobile apps has become a useful data source for researchers. Platforms like Apple ResearchKit try to make it as easy as possible for non-experts to set up such data collection campaigns. However, since the collected data is sensitive, it must be well protected. Methods that provide technical privacy guarantees often limit the usefulness of the data and results. In this paper, we model and analyze mobile data donation to better understand the requirements that must be fulfilled by privacy-preserving approaches. To this end, we give an overview of the functionalities researchers require from data donation apps by analyzing existing apps. We also create a model of the current practice and analyze it using the LINDDUN privacy framework to identify privacy threats.
papers.title_zh: 移动数据捐赠的需求和隐私威胁分析
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，通过移动应用程序收集的个人和医疗数据已经成为研究人员的有用数据源。像苹果ResearchKit这样的平台试图让非专家尽可能容易地建立这样的数据收集活动。然而，由于收集的数据是敏感的，所以必须很好地保护它。提供技术隐私保证的方法通常会限制数据和结果的有用性。在本文中，我们对移动数据捐赠进行建模和分析，以更好地理解隐私保护方法必须满足的要求。为此，我们通过分析现有应用程序，概述了研究人员要求数据捐赠应用程序提供的功能。我们还创建了一个当前实践的模型，并使用LINDDUN隐私框架对其进行分析，以识别隐私威胁。

papers.title: ATLAS: Automatically Detecting Discrepancies Between Privacy Policies and Privacy Labels
papers.authors: Akshath Jain, David Rodriguez, José M. del Álamo, Norman M. Sadeh
papers.abstract: Privacy policies are long, complex documents that end-users seldom read. Privacy labels aim to ameliorate these issues by providing succinct summaries of salient data practices. In December 2020, Apple began requiring that app developers submit privacy labels describing their apps' data practices. Yet, research suggests that app developers often struggle to do so. In this paper, we automatically identify possible discrepancies between mobile app privacy policies and their privacy labels. Such discrepancies could be indicators of potential privacy compliance issues. We introduce the Automated Privacy Label Analysis System (ATLAS). ATLAS includes three components: a pipeline to systematically retrieve iOS App Store listings and privacy policies; an ensemble-based classifier capable of predicting privacy labels from the text of privacy policies with 91.3% accuracy using state-of-the-art NLP techniques; and a discrepancy analysis mechanism that enables a large-scale privacy analysis of the iOS App Store. Our system has enabled us to analyze 354,725 iOS apps. We find several interesting trends. For example, only 40.3% of apps in the App Store provide easily accessible privacy policies, and only 29.6% of apps provide both accessible privacy policies and privacy labels. Among apps that provide both, 88.0% have at least one possible discrepancy between the text of their privacy policy and their privacy label, which could be indicative of a potential compliance issue. We find that, on average, apps have 5.32 such potential compliance issues. We hope that ATLAS will help app developers, researchers, regulators, and mobile app stores alike. For example, app developers could use our classifier to check for discrepancies between their privacy policies and privacy labels, and regulators could use our system to help review apps at scale for potential compliance issues.
papers.title_zh: ATLAS:自动检测隐私政策和隐私标签之间的差异
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私政策是冗长、复杂的文档，最终用户很少阅读。隐私标签旨在通过提供显著数据实践的简明摘要来改善这些问题。2020年12月，苹果开始要求应用程序开发者提交描述其应用程序数据做法的隐私标签。然而，研究表明，应用程序开发人员往往很难做到这一点。在本文中，我们自动识别移动应用隐私政策和隐私标签之间可能的差异。这种差异可能是潜在的隐私合规性问题的指标。我们介绍了自动隐私标签分析系统(ATLAS)。ATLAS包括三个组成部分:系统检索iOS应用商店列表和隐私政策的管道；一个基于集成的分类器，能够使用最先进的NLP技术以91.3%的准确度从隐私策略的文本中预测隐私标签；以及能够对iOS应用商店进行大规模隐私分析的差异分析机制。我们的系统使我们能够分析354，725个iOS应用程序。我们发现了几个有趣的趋势。例如，App Store中只有40.3%的应用程序提供易于访问的隐私政策，只有29.6%的应用程序同时提供易于访问的隐私政策和隐私标签。在提供两者的应用中，88.0%的应用在其隐私政策文本和隐私标签之间至少有一个可能的差异，这可能表明潜在的合规问题。我们发现，平均而言，应用程序有5.32个这样的潜在合规问题。我们希望ATLAS能够帮助应用开发者、研究人员、监管者和移动应用商店。例如，应用程序开发人员可以使用我们的分类器来检查他们的隐私政策和隐私标签之间的差异，监管机构可以使用我们的系统来帮助审查大规模应用程序的潜在合规性问题。

papers.title: Automating privacy decisions -where to draw the line?
papers.authors: Victor Morel, Simone Fischer-Hübner
papers.abstract: Users are often overwhelmed by privacy decisions to manage their personal data, which can happen on the web, in mobile, and in IoT environments. These decisions can take various forms -- such as decisions for setting privacy permissions or privacy preferences, decisions responding to consent requests, or to intervene and ``reject'' processing of one's personal data --, and each can have different legal impacts. In all cases and for all types of decisions, scholars and industry have been proposing tools to better automate the process of privacy decisions at different levels, in order to enhance usability. We provide in this paper an overview of the main challenges raised by the automation of privacy decisions, together with a classification scheme of the existing and envisioned work and proposals addressing automation of privacy decisions.
papers.title_zh: 隐私决策自动化——底线在哪里？
papers.abstract_zh: 用户经常被管理其个人数据的隐私决策所淹没，这可能发生在web、移动和物联网环境中。这些决定可以采取各种形式，如设置隐私许可或隐私偏好的决定、回应同意请求的决定，或干预和“拒绝”处理个人数据的决定，每种决定都具有不同的法律影响。在所有情况下，对于所有类型的决策，学者和行业一直在提出工具来更好地自动化不同级别的隐私决策过程，以增强可用性。我们在本文中概述了隐私决策自动化带来的主要挑战，以及现有和设想工作的分类方案和解决隐私决策自动化的建议。

papers.title: Lessons Learned: Building a Privacy-Preserving Entity Resolution Adaptation of PPJoin using End-to-End Homomorphic Encryption
papers.authors: Tanmay Ghai, Yixiang Yao, Srivatsan Ravi
papers.abstract: Entity resolution is the task of disambiguating records that refer to the same entity in the real world. In this work, we explore adapting one of the most efficient and accurate Jaccard-based entity resolution algorithms - PPJoin, to the private domain via end-to-end homomorphic encryption. Towards this, we present our precise adaptation: HE-PPJoin that details certain subtle data structure modifications and algorithmic additions needed for correctness and privacy. We implement HE-PPJoin by extending the PALISADE (now merged with OpenFHE) open-source, homomorphic encryption library and perform experiments to analyze its accuracy and incurred overhead. Furthermore, we directly compare HE-PPJoin against P4Join, an existing privacy-preserving variant of PPJoin, which uses hashing for raw content obfuscation (encryption), by demonstrating a rigorous analysis of the efficiency, accuracy, and privacy properties achieved by our adaptation as well as a characterization of those same attributes in P4Join. In building and designing HE-PPJoin, we faced numerous challenges that required making tradeoffs and analyzing possible alternatives. We have thus summarized and detailed all the lessons we have learned, presented throughout the paper, intended as motivating building blocks for future work in this direction.
papers.title_zh: 经验教训:使用端到端同态加密构建保护隐私的PPJoin实体解析适配
papers.abstract_zh: 实体解析的任务是消除现实世界中引用同一实体的记录的歧义。在这项工作中，我们探索通过端到端同态加密将最有效和最准确的基于Jaccard的实体解析算法之一PPJoin应用于私有域。针对这一点，我们提出了我们的精确适应:HE-PPJoin，它详细说明了正确性和隐私所需的某些微妙的数据结构修改和算法添加。我们通过扩展PALISADE(现在与OpenFHE合并)开源同态加密库实现了HE-PPJoin，并通过实验分析了它的准确性和开销。此外，我们直接将HE-PPJoin与PPJoin的现有隐私保护变体P4Join进行比较，P4Join使用哈希对原始内容进行混淆(加密)，方法是展示对我们的适应所实现的效率、准确性和隐私属性的严格分析以及P4 join中这些相同属性的表征。在构建和设计HE-PPJoin的过程中，我们面临着许多挑战，需要进行权衡和分析可能的替代方案。因此，我们总结并详细说明了我们所学到的所有经验教训，在整篇论文中均有介绍，旨在激励今后在这一方向开展工作。

papers.title: Privacy as an Architectural Quality: A Definition and an Architectural View
papers.authors: Immanuel Kunz, Shuqian Xu
papers.abstract: Software architects describe architectures from different perspectives to compare, document, and explain them to other stakeholders. Numerous views have been proposed in the past in the form of architectural models and modelling languages. However, these views do not sufficiently reflect privacy properties, making it difficult for architects to evaluate and compare design candidates.In this paper, we first define privacy as an architectural quality, and then propose a privacy-by-design architectural view which uses an extended data flow diagram to support the documentation, evaluation, and comparison of architecture designs. The view uses control domains, showing which entities actually control personal data in the design, and metrics that can quantify privacy aspects. We also present a method to create the view automatically from source code. This approach can be useful in the maintenance phase of the software lifecycle, as well as in agile development where source code and architecture are changed iteratively. The results can be integrated into the Attribute-Driven Design method, and can also be used to document design decisions, e.g., for future design support or a certification audit.
papers.title_zh: 作为建筑品质的隐私:定义和建筑观点
papers.abstract_zh: 软件架构师从不同的角度描述架构，以便比较、记录并向其他利益相关者解释它们。在过去，已经以架构模型和建模语言的形式提出了许多视图。然而，这些视图没有充分反映隐私属性，使得建筑师难以评估和比较设计候选方案。在本文中，我们首先将隐私定义为一种架构质量，然后提出一种基于设计的隐私架构视图，该视图使用扩展的数据流图来支持架构设计的文档化、评估和比较。该视图使用控制域，显示哪些实体在设计中实际控制个人数据，以及可以量化隐私方面的指标。我们还提出了一种从源代码自动创建视图的方法。这种方法在软件生命周期的维护阶段非常有用，在敏捷开发中，源代码和架构会被反复修改。结果可以集成到属性驱动的设计方法中，并且还可以用于记录设计决策，例如用于未来的设计支持或认证审核。

papers.title: Secure Key Management for Multi-Party Computation in MOZAIK
papers.authors: Enzo Marquet, Jerico Moeyersons, Erik Pohle, Michiel Van Kenhove, Aysajan Abidin, Bruno Volckaert
papers.abstract: The immense growth of data from the proliferation of Internet of Things (IoT) devices presents opportunities and challenges for privacy engineering. On the one hand, this data can be harnessed for personalized services, cost savings, and environmental benefits. On the other hand, (new) legislation must be complied with and privacy risks arise from collecting and processing of such data. Distributed privacy-preserving analytics offers a promising solution, providing insights while also protecting privacy. However, this approach has new challenges and risks, such as key management and confidentiality. When designing a data marketplace which offers distributed privacy-preserving analytics, the key management comes with different threats, which require a solution adapted to the distributed architecture.In this context, the paper presents a comprehensive, end-to-end secure system called MOZAIK for privacy-preserving data collection, analysis, and sharing. The article focuses on the key management aspect of the secure multi-party computation (MPC) component in a distributed privacy-preserving analytics architecture and the specific challenges created by introducing MPC. The proposed solution involves temporary storage of (symmetric) key shares and public-key encryption schemes to ensure secure key management for privacy-preserving computation. Our solution has the potential to be applied in other MPC-based setups, making it a valuable addition to the field of privacy engineering. By addressing key management challenges and risks, MOZAIK enhances data protection while enabling valuable insights from IoT data.
papers.title_zh: MOZAIK中多方计算的安全密钥管理
papers.abstract_zh: 物联网设备的激增带来的巨大数据增长为隐私工程带来了机遇和挑战。一方面，这些数据可以用于个性化服务、成本节约和环境效益。另一方面，必须遵守(新)法规，并且收集和处理此类数据会带来隐私风险。分布式隐私保护分析提供了一个有前途的解决方案，在保护隐私的同时提供见解。然而，这种方法有新的挑战和风险，例如密钥管理和保密性。当设计一个提供分布式隐私保护分析的数据市场时，密钥管理伴随着不同的威胁，这需要一个适应分布式架构的解决方案。在这种背景下，本文提出了一个全面的、端到端的安全系统，称为MOZAIK，用于隐私保护数据的收集、分析和共享。本文重点关注分布式隐私保护分析架构中安全多方计算(MPC)组件的密钥管理方面，以及引入MPC带来的具体挑战。所提出的解决方案涉及(对称)密钥份额的临时存储和公钥加密方案，以确保用于隐私保护计算的安全密钥管理。我们的解决方案有潜力应用于其他基于MPC的设置，使其成为隐私工程领域的一个有价值的补充。通过解决关键的管理挑战和风险，MOZAIK增强了数据保护，同时从物联网数据中获得了宝贵的见解。

papers.title: Unified Communication: What do Digital Activists need?
papers.authors: Thomas Reisinger, Isabel Wagner, Eerke A. Boiten
papers.abstract: Digital activists use tools and platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp, and Twitter to organize networked protest. However, these tools appear to lack the necessary features to establish secure and private communication, particularly regarding anonymity and encryption, which could put activists and others at risk of persecution. However, it is not clear which security and privacy features are actually required from the activists’, rather than the academic, point of view. In this paper, we use semi-structured interviews to collect and analyze the specific requirements for functionality, security, and privacy of Unified Communication (UC) (i.e., audio/video conferencing + instant messaging). We compare these requirements with features provided by common UC platforms and derive critical technical requirements and guidelines for sociotechnical aspects which need further research.
papers.title_zh: 统一通信:数字活动家需要什么？
papers.abstract_zh: 数字活动家使用脸书、WhatsApp和Twitter等工具和平台组织网络抗议。然而，这些工具似乎缺乏建立安全和私密通信的必要功能，特别是在匿名和加密方面，这可能使活动分子和其他人面临被迫害的风险。然而，从积极分子的角度而不是从学术的角度来看，并不清楚哪些安全和隐私特性是实际需要的。在本文中，我们使用半结构化访谈来收集和分析对统一通信(UC)(即音频/视频会议+即时消息)的功能、安全性和隐私的具体要求。我们将这些要求与通用统一通信平台提供的功能进行比较，并得出需要进一步研究的社会技术方面的关键技术要求和指南。

papers.title: Comparing Privacy Label Disclosures of Apps Published in both the App Store and Google Play Stores
papers.authors: David Rodriguez, Akshath Jain, José M. del Álamo, Norman Sadeh
papers.abstract: Apple and Android introduced privacy labels in 2020 and 2022 respectively as a way of providing consumers with succinct summaries of mobile apps’ more salient data practices. A number of apps are published in both stores, offering us the opportunity to compare their privacy label disclosures in the two app stores. This paper compares the data practices privacy labels are intended to capture in each store. It then proceeds to analyze the disclosures of 822 apps published in both app stores, focusing on possible discrepancies. This analysis reveals that privacy label disclosures of what is ostensibly the same mobile app can be quite different. We discuss the different possible reasons behind these differences, including the possibility that these discrepancies might be indicative of potential privacy compliance issues. In particular, focusing on data collection disclosures of five different data types (location, contact info, sensitive info, identifiers, and health & fitness) we find discrepancies between iOS and Google Play privacy label disclosures in 66.5% of the mobile apps we analyze.
papers.title_zh: 比较App Store和Google Play商店中发布的应用程序的隐私标签披露
papers.abstract_zh: 苹果和安卓分别在2020年和2022年推出了隐私标签，作为向消费者提供移动应用更突出的数据实践的简明摘要的一种方式。两家商店都发布了许多应用程序，这为我们提供了比较两家应用程序商店隐私标签披露的机会。本文比较了隐私标签旨在每个商店获取的数据做法。然后，它继续分析两个应用商店中发布的822个应用的披露，重点关注可能的差异。这一分析表明，表面上相同的移动应用程序的隐私标签披露可能会有很大不同。我们讨论了这些差异背后不同的可能原因，包括这些差异可能表明潜在的隐私合规性问题。特别是，通过关注五种不同数据类型(位置、联系信息、敏感信息、标识符和健康与健身)的数据收集披露，我们发现在我们分析的66.5%的移动应用中，iOS和Google Play隐私标签披露之间存在差异。

papers.title: "Get a higher return on your savings!": Comparing adverts for cryptocurrency investment scams across platforms
papers.authors: Gilberto Atondo Siu, Alice Hutchings
papers.abstract: This work compares machine learning methods using supervised, semi-supervised and unsupervised learning, to classify advertisements for cryptocurrency related investment scams found in the online forum Bitcointalk, and the social media platform Reddit. We extract more than 24.2 million posts from Bitcointalk and use Reddit’s API to collect 2,108 submissions. We train and compare several multiclass text classification approaches and use the models with highest accuracy and F-measure to identify cryptocurrency investment scam advertisements found on both platforms. We discover around five percent of all posts collected on both sites are potential scams. We then use another text classifier to identify the scam actors involved in these investment scam advertisements. We also discover the lures used within these fraudulent adverts and find the main differences in luring techniques used between Bitcointalk and Reddit. We identify that the most prevalent lure type uses the financial principle, followed by the distraction principle in Bitcointalk, and by the authority principle in Reddit. Finally, we use subreddits as communities’ proxies and compare scam advertisements within them to identify whether pensioners are being specifically targeted by cryptocurrency scam adverts. Our results show that retirement subreddits do not contain a higher number of cryptocurrency investment scam adverts compared to other investment focused subreddits.
papers.title_zh: “让您的储蓄获得更高的回报！”:跨平台比较加密货币投资骗局的广告
papers.abstract_zh: 这项工作比较了使用监督、半监督和无监督学习的机器学习方法，以对在线论坛Bitcointalk和社交媒体平台Reddit中发现的加密货币相关投资骗局的广告进行分类。我们从Bitcointalk中提取了超过2420万条帖子，并使用Reddit的API收集了2108条提交内容。我们训练和比较了几种多类文本分类方法，并使用具有最高准确性和F-measure的模型来识别在两个平台上发现的加密货币投资诈骗广告。我们发现，在这两个网站上收集的所有帖子中，大约有5%是潜在的骗局。然后，我们使用另一个文本分类器来识别这些投资诈骗广告中涉及的诈骗者。我们还发现了这些欺诈性广告中使用的诱饵，并发现了Bitcointalk和Reddit之间使用的引诱技术的主要差异。我们发现，最普遍的诱惑类型使用财务原则，其次是Bitcointalk中的分散注意力原则，以及Reddit中的权威原则。最后，我们使用subreddits作为社区的代理，并比较其中的诈骗广告，以确定养老金领取者是否是加密货币诈骗广告的特定目标。我们的结果表明，与其他投资类子主题相比，退休类子主题并不包含更多的加密货币投资诈骗广告。

papers.title: An Argument for Linguistic Expertise in Cyberthreat Analysis: LOLSec in Russian Language eCrime Landscape
papers.authors: Dalyapraz Manatova, L. Jean Camp, Julia R. Fox, Sandra Kübler, Maria A Shardakova, Inna Kouper
papers.abstract: In this position paper, we argue for a holistic perspective on threat analysis and other studies of state-sponsored or state-aligned eCrime groups. Specifically, we argue that understanding eCrime requires approaching it as a sociotechnical system and that studying such a system requires combining linguistic, regional, professional, and technical expertise. To illustrate it, we focus on the discourse of the Conti ransomware group in the context of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. We discuss the background of this group and their actions and argue that the technical approach alone can lose the important aspects specific to the cultural and linguistic context, such as language, slang and humor. We provide examples of how the discourse and threats from such groups can be easily misunderstood without appropriate linguistic and domain expertise.
papers.title_zh: 网络威胁分析中的语言学专家论证:俄罗斯语言eCrime景观中的LOLSec
papers.abstract_zh: 在这份立场文件中，我们主张对国家支持或与国家结盟的电子犯罪集团的威胁分析和其他研究采取整体观点。具体来说，我们认为理解eCrime需要将其作为一个社会技术系统来对待，并且研究这样一个系统需要结合语言、地区、专业和技术方面的专业知识。为了说明这一点，我们重点关注俄罗斯入侵乌克兰背景下Conti勒索软件集团的话语。我们讨论了这个群体的背景和他们的行为，并认为技术方法本身可能会失去特定于文化和语言环境的重要方面，如语言、俚语和幽默。我们举例说明，如果没有适当的语言和领域专业知识，这些群体的话语和威胁很容易被误解。

papers.title: Applying Neutralisation Theory to Better Understand Ransomware Offenders
papers.authors: Lena Yuryna Connolly, Hervé Borrion, Budi Arief, Sanna Kaddoura
papers.abstract: The work presented in this paper investigates the crime of ransomware from the perspective of neutralisation theory. In particular, this research-in-progress paper aims to explore the feasibility of using neutralisation theory to better understand one of the key stakeholders in ransomware operations: the offenders. Individuals (including offenders) may employ techniques of neutralisation in order to justify their rule-breaking acts, and to diminish both the perceived consequences of their acts and the feeling of guilt. The focus of this work is on highly organised ransomware groups that not only conduct cyber attacks but also operate Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) businesses. Secondary data was used in this research, including media interviews with alleged ransomware offenders. Data analysis is currently ongoing, but preliminary results show that ransomware offenders mainly use six neutralisation techniques to minimise the perceived impact and/or guilty feeling of their actions. These six neutralisation techniques are (1) denial of victim, (2) denial of injury, (3) claim of benefits, (4) claim of entitlement, (5) defence of necessity, and (6) claim of relative acceptability. The findings from this work can shed some light on the ransomware offending pathways, which in turn can be utilised to devise more effective countermeasures for combatting ransomware crime.
papers.title_zh: 应用中和理论更好地理解勒索软件罪犯
papers.abstract_zh: 本文从中立化理论的角度研究勒索软件犯罪。特别是，这篇正在进行的研究论文旨在探索使用中立化理论的可行性，以更好地了解勒索软件操作中的关键利益相关者之一:罪犯。个人(包括犯罪者)可能会使用中立化的技巧来为他们的违规行为辩护，并减少他们行为的预期后果和负罪感。这项工作的重点是高度组织化的勒索软件集团，这些集团不仅进行网络攻击，还经营勒索软件即服务(RaaS)业务。本次研究使用了二手数据，包括媒体对涉嫌勒索软件罪犯的采访。数据分析目前正在进行中，但初步结果显示，勒索软件罪犯主要使用六种中和技术来最大限度地减少他们行为的感知影响和/或罪恶感。这六种中立化技巧是(1)否认受害者，(2)否认伤害，(3)主张利益，(4)主张权利，(5)为必要性辩护，以及(6)主张相对可接受性。这项工作的发现可以揭示勒索软件的犯罪途径，进而可以用来设计更有效的对策来打击勒索软件犯罪。

papers.title: Digital Drift and the Evolution of a Large Cybercrime Forum
papers.authors: Jack Hughes, Alice Hutchings
papers.abstract: —Cybercrime forum datasets are large and complex. Prior research uses aggregated time series data to create a picture of the whole dataset, or focuses on a smaller sample of cross sectional data, often for a specific subcommunity or crime time. This paper uses the longitudinal time series aspect of cybercrime forums to measure and observe the evolution of forums at a macro scale. Applying the digital drift theoretical framework, borrowed from criminology, we find a large amount of churn on the forum, with only a small proportion of users continuing long-term engagement. Measurements show a continual shift in forum activity, with year-based cohorts moving from starting in hacking discussions, towards starting in general discussions, and later towards e-whoring boards. The group of members who are active on the forum for over 12 months, typically have their last post in the marketplace, while other members, who are active for shorter periods of time, have their last post in hacking-related boards. Overall, we see an increasing trend towards financially-driven cybercrime, at both the user and forum level. Users post more in financially-related boards over time, and forum activity has trended away from gaming/social activity, trending towards more activity in market-related boards.
papers.title_zh: 数字漂移和大型网络犯罪论坛的演变
papers.abstract_zh: —网络犯罪论坛数据集庞大而复杂。以前的研究使用聚合的时间序列数据来创建整个数据集的图片，或者关注较小的横截面数据样本，通常针对特定的子社区或犯罪时间。本文使用纵向时间序列方面的网络犯罪论坛来衡量和观察论坛在宏观层面的演变。运用从犯罪学中借用的数字漂移理论框架，我们发现论坛上有大量的用户流失，只有一小部分用户继续长期参与。测量显示论坛活动的持续变化，以年为基础的群体从黑客讨论开始，转向一般讨论，后来转向电子嫖娼板。活跃在论坛上超过12个月的成员通常会在市场上发布他们的最后一篇帖子，而活跃时间较短的其他成员会在黑客相关的论坛上发布他们的最后一篇帖子。总的来说，无论是在用户层面还是在论坛层面，我们都看到了经济驱动型网络犯罪的增长趋势。随着时间的推移，用户在与金融相关的版块中发布的内容越来越多，论坛活动也从游戏/社交活动转向了与市场相关的版块。

papers.title: Enhancing Vulnerability Prioritization: Data-Driven Exploit Predictions with Community-Driven Insights
papers.authors: Jay Jacobs, Sasha Romanosky, Octavian Suciuo, Benjamin Edwards, Armin Sarabi
papers.abstract: The number of disclosed vulnerabilities has been steadily increasing over the years. At the same time, organizations face significant challenges patching their systems, leading to a need to prioritize vulnerability remediation in order to reduce the risk of attacks. Unfortunately, existing vulnerability scoring systems are either vendor-specific, proprietary, or are only commercially available. Moreover, these and other prioritization strategies based on vulnerability severity are poor predictors of actual vulnerability exploitation because they do not incorporate new information that might impact the likelihood of exploitation. In this paper we present the efforts behind building a Special Interest Group (SIG) that seeks to develop a completely data-driven exploit scoring system that produces scores for all known vulnerabilities, that is freely available, and which adapts to new information. The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) SIG consists of more than 170 experts from around the world and across all industries, providing crowd-sourced expertise and feedback. Based on these collective insights, we describe the design decisions and trade-offs that lead to the development of the next version of EPSS. This new machine learning model provides an 82\% performance improvement over past models in distinguishing vulnerabilities that are exploited in the wild and thus may be prioritized for remediation.
papers.title_zh: 增强漏洞优先级:利用社区驱动的洞察力进行数据驱动的漏洞利用预测
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，已披露的漏洞数量一直在稳步增长。与此同时，组织在修补其系统方面面临着巨大的挑战，因此需要确定漏洞补救的优先顺序，以降低攻击风险。不幸的是，现有的弱点评分系统要么是特定于供应商的、专有的，要么仅在商业上可用。此外，这些和其他基于漏洞严重性的优先级策略是实际漏洞利用的不良预测因素，因为它们没有纳入可能影响利用可能性的新信息。在本文中，我们介绍了建立一个特殊兴趣小组(SIG)的努力，该小组寻求开发一个完全数据驱动的漏洞利用评分系统，该系统可以为所有已知的漏洞生成分数，可以免费获得，并适应新的信息。漏洞利用预测评分系统(EPSS) SIG由来自全球各行业的170多名专家组成，提供众包专业知识和反馈。基于这些集体见解，我们描述了导致下一版本EPSS开发的设计决策和权衡。这种新的机器学习模型在区分在野外被利用的漏洞方面比过去的模型提供了82%的性能改进，因此可以优先进行补救。

papers.title: How Cryptocurrency Exchange Interruptions Create Arbitrage Opportunities
papers.authors: Andrew Morin, Tyler Moore
papers.abstract: Centralized cryptocurrency exchanges offer users a more convenient platform to trade their digital assets at the cost of reduced control. As a result, when these exchanges suffer interruptions users struggle to access their funds or modify their orders. We investigate 41 events at the popular exchange Bitfinex, and measure the impact these events have on trades, volume, and pricing. We find that the volume to trade ratio increases during events, as fewer traders are moving large amounts of bitcoin. We also find that these interruptions often occur at the same time as arbitrage opportunities, with substantial profit opportunities.
papers.title_zh: 加密货币交易中断如何创造套利机会
papers.abstract_zh: 集中式加密货币交易所为用户提供了一个更方便的平台，以减少控制为代价来交易他们的数字资产。因此，当这些交易所遭遇中断时，用户很难获得资金或修改订单。我们调查了热门交易所Bitfinex的41个事件，并测量了这些事件对交易、交易量和定价的影响。我们发现，交易量与交易量的比率在活动期间会增加，因为越来越少的交易者在转移大量的比特币。我们还发现，这些中断往往与套利机会同时发生，具有可观的盈利机会。

papers.title: Mapping the Cyberstalking Landscape: An Empirical Analysis of Federal U.S Crimes
papers.authors: Sasha Romanosky, Peter Schirmer
papers.abstract: Among the new forms of technology-facilitated abuses, cyberstalking has become a growing and important problem. Cyberstalking involves the use of technology to stalk, threaten, or harass one or more individuals. For example, it can include tracking and intimidating a victim over social media, email, or text messages, or threatening to expose someone’s intimate photographs (sextortion). Cyberstalking has become a mechanism used by current or former domestic or intimate-partners, lone perpetrators, individuals targeting victims based on their employment or public image, and members of extremist groups. The innovations of this research are twofold. First, using multiple data sets, we developed an automated capability to identify and collect the complete set of all federally prosecuted cyberstalking cases in the U.S.. Second, we employ natural language processing, network, and regression methods to code and analyze the court records. We apply these methods in order to answer three main research questions: how many federal cyberstalking cases are there?; what kinds of stalking behavior are being committed?; and what characteristics are correlated with conviction and severity of punishment?
papers.title_zh: 描绘网络跟踪景观:美国联邦犯罪的实证分析
papers.abstract_zh: 在新形式的由技术推动的滥用中，网络跟踪已成为一个日益严重的问题。网络跟踪涉及使用技术来跟踪、威胁或骚扰一个或多个个人。例如，它可以包括通过社交媒体、电子邮件或短信跟踪和恐吓受害者，或者威胁要曝光某人的私密照片(sextortion)。网络跟踪已经成为现在或以前的家庭或亲密伴侣、单独作案者、基于其职业或公众形象而以受害者为目标的个人以及极端主义团体成员使用的一种机制。这项研究的创新是双重的。首先，使用多个数据集，我们开发了一种自动识别和收集美国所有联邦政府起诉的网络跟踪案件的能力..其次，我们采用自然语言处理、网络和回归方法对法庭记录进行编码和分析。我们应用这些方法是为了回答三个主要的研究问题:有多少联邦网络跟踪案件？；正在实施哪种跟踪行为？；哪些特征与定罪和惩罚的严厉程度相关？

papers.title: On Gaps in Enterprise Cyber Attack Reporting
papers.authors: Abulfaz Hajizada, Tyler Moore
papers.abstract: It has long been lamented that firms underreport cyber attacks. In recent years, regulators have begun mandating that certain organizations must publicly report when incidents occur. Adherence to these requirements is an empirical question that has been largely unexamined to date. In this paper, we study regulatory filings by U.S. public companies to the Securities Exchange Commission and to the Department Health and Human Services that discuss cyber attacks. We also compare the findings against crowdsourced reports of cyber incidents appearing in media outlets. We find substantial gaps in coverage, both in terms of attacks that make the news but do not appear in regulatory filings and vice versa. We conclude by discussing the implications for the study of cyber attack and defense as well as for policymakers.
papers.title_zh: 企业网络攻击报告中的漏洞
papers.abstract_zh: 长期以来，人们一直哀叹公司漏报网络攻击。近年来，监管机构已经开始强制要求某些组织在事故发生时必须公开报告。遵守这些要求是一个经验性的问题，迄今为止还没有被检验过。在本文中，我们研究了美国上市公司向证券交易委员会和卫生与公众服务部提交的讨论网络攻击的监管文件。我们还将这些发现与媒体上出现的网络事件的众包报道进行了比较。我们发现在报道方面有很大的差距，包括成为新闻但没有出现在监管文件中的攻击，反之亦然。最后，我们讨论了网络攻击和防御研究以及政策制定者的意义。

papers.title: The Peculiar Case of Tailored Phishing against SMEs: Detection and Collective DefenseMechanisms at a Small IT Company
papers.authors: Pavlo Burda, Abdul Malek Altawekji, Luca Allodi, Nicola Zannone
papers.abstract: Phishing attacks are increasingly more sophisticated, with attackers exploiting publicly available information on their targets to personalize their attacks. Although an increasing body of research has investigated the effectiveness of tailored phishing campaigns, researchers have primarily focused on large enterprises. Company size, composition, and resource availability (e.g., of security experts or a phishing response team handling incidents) play an important role in the studied dynamics. However, whether the same also applies to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), which typically do not have those resources, is unclear. On the other hand, studying SME security is hard as they generally have no expertise in-house to run the required experiments. This work provides a first study filling this gap by investigating the effectiveness of tailored phishing campaigns against an SME IT company in Europe. To this end, we conducted a field experiment targeting 30 employees at an SME and, subsequently, interviewed nine employees to understand the cognitive processes underlying the detection and response of our phishing campaign as well as the group defense mechanisms at the SME. Our findings show that expectation mismatch was the primary method for detecting our phishing email and that the collective defense mechanism enabled a surprisingly prompt response and containment of the attack, possibly, due to the network dynamics of a small company.
papers.title_zh: 专门针对中小企业的网络钓鱼特例:一家小型IT公司的检测和集体防御机制
papers.abstract_zh: 网络钓鱼攻击越来越复杂，攻击者利用他们目标的公开信息来个性化他们的攻击。尽管越来越多的研究机构调查了量身定制的网络钓鱼活动的有效性，但研究人员主要关注大型企业。公司规模、组成和资源可用性(例如，处理事件的安全专家或网络钓鱼响应团队)在所研究的动态中起着重要作用。然而，这种情况是否也适用于中小型企业(SMEs)还不清楚，这些企业通常不具备这些资源。另一方面，研究中小企业安全性很难，因为他们通常没有内部专家来进行所需的实验。这项工作首次通过调查针对欧洲一家中小企业IT公司的定制网络钓鱼活动的有效性，填补了这一空白。为此，我们针对一家中小企业的30名员工进行了一项现场实验，随后采访了9名员工，以了解检测和响应我们的网络钓鱼活动的认知过程以及该中小企业的群体防御机制。我们的发现表明，预期不匹配是检测我们的网络钓鱼电子邮件的主要方法，而集体防御机制能够令人惊讶地迅速响应并遏制攻击，这可能是由于一家小公司的网络动态。

papers.title: Visualizing Cyber-Threats in Underground Forums
papers.authors: James Burroughs, Michal Tereszkowski-Kaminski, Guillermo Suarez-Tangil
papers.abstract: In this paper, we develop a language-agnostic methodology to extract features of interest to an analyst from forum posts and visualize them in a way which facilitates identification and stratification of areas of interest in the forums, as well as further manual analysis of the text. We then apply this methodology to a specific Russian underground forum. The visualization acts as a ‘thumbnail’ for individual posts, conveying semantic metadata of post contents. By viewing the thumbnail, an analyst is provided with an immediate ‘sense’ of post length and key features present within a post, as well as their frequency and spatial arrangement. Using the generated visualizations of posts from the underground forum we speed up analyst identification of post subject matter by up to 72%.As a key novelty, we propose that the image output of our method has fractal properties that can be exploited when sorting threats and extracting highly technical posts. Thus, we use a method based on the Minkowski-Bouligand fractal dimension to prioritize analysis of posts which represent more sophisticated threats.
papers.title_zh: 可视化地下论坛中的网络威胁
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们开发了一种语言无关的方法，从论坛帖子中提取分析师感兴趣的特征，并以一种便于识别和分层论坛中感兴趣的区域以及进一步手动分析文本的方式可视化它们。然后，我们将这种方法应用于一个特定的俄罗斯地下论坛。可视化充当单个帖子的“缩略图”,传达帖子内容的语义元数据。通过查看缩略图，分析师可以立即“感知”帖子的长度和帖子中的关键特征，以及它们的频率和空间排列。使用从地下论坛生成的帖子可视化，我们将分析师识别帖子主题的速度提高了72%。作为一个关键的创新，我们提出，我们的方法的图像输出具有分形属性，可以在排序威胁和提取高技术职位时加以利用。因此，我们使用一种基于Minkowski-Bouligand分形维数的方法来优先分析代表更复杂威胁的帖子。

papers.title: A Hybrid Solution for Constrained Devices to Detect Microarchitectural Attacks
papers.authors: Nikolaos Foivos Polychronou, Pierre-Henri Thevenon, Maxime Puys, Vincent Beroulle
papers.abstract: We are seeing an increase in cybersecurity attacks on resource-constrained systems such as the Internet of Things (IoT) and Industrial IoT (I-IoT) devices. Recently, a new category of attacks has emerged called microarchitectural attacks. It targets hardware units of the system such as the processor or memory and is often complicated if not impossible to remediate since it imposes modifying the hardware. In default of remediation, some solutions propose to detect these attacks. Yet, most of them are not suitable for embedded systems since they are based on complex machine learning algorithms.In this paper, we propose an edge-computing security solution for attack detection that uses a local-remote machine learning implementation to find an equilibrium between accuracy and decision-making latency while addressing the memory, performance, and communication bandwidth constraints of resource-constrained systems. We demonstrate effectiveness in the detection of multiple microarchitectural attacks such as Row hammer or cache attacks on an embedded device with an accuracy of 98.75% and a FPR near 0%. To limit the overhead on the communication bus, the proposed solution allows to locally classify as trusted 99% of the samples during normal operation and thus filtering them out.
papers.title_zh: 一种用于受限设备检测微体系结构攻击的混合解决方案
papers.abstract_zh: 我们看到，针对物联网(IoT)和工业物联网(I-IoT)设备等资源受限系统的网络安全攻击正在增加。最近，出现了一种新的攻击类型，称为微体系结构攻击。它的目标是系统的硬件单元，如处理器或内存，并且通常很复杂，如果不是不可能的话，因为它强制修改硬件。在缺乏补救的情况下，一些解决方案建议检测这些攻击。然而，它们中的大多数都不适合嵌入式系统，因为它们基于复杂的机器学习算法。在本文中，我们提出了一种用于攻击检测的边缘计算安全解决方案，该解决方案使用本地-远程机器学习实现来在准确性和决策延迟之间找到平衡，同时解决资源受限系统的内存、性能和通信带宽限制。我们证明了在嵌入式设备上检测多种微体系结构攻击(如行锤或缓存攻击)的有效性，准确率为98.75%，FPR接近0%。为了限制通信总线上的开销，所提出的解决方案允许在正常操作期间将99%的样本本地分类为可信的，从而将其过滤掉。

papers.title: A Practical Deep Learning-Based Acoustic Side Channel Attack on Keyboards
papers.authors: Joshua Harrison, Ehsan Toreini, Maryam Mehrnezhad
papers.abstract: With recent developments in deep learning, the ubiquity of microphones and the rise in online services via personal devices, acoustic side channel attacks present a greater threat to keyboards than ever. This paper presents a practical implementation of a state-of-the-art deep learning model in order to classify laptop keystrokes, using a smartphone integrated microphone. When trained on keystrokes recorded by a nearby phone, the classifier achieved an accuracy of 95%, the highest accuracy seen without the use of a language model. When trained on keystrokes recorded using the video-conferencing software Zoom, an accuracy of 93% was achieved, a new best for the medium. Our results prove the practicality of these side channel attacks via off-the-shelf equipment and algorithms. We discuss a series of mitigation methods to protect users against these series of attacks.
papers.title_zh: 一种实用的基于深度学习的键盘侧声道攻击
papers.abstract_zh: 随着深度学习的最新发展，麦克风的无处不在以及通过个人设备的在线服务的兴起，声学侧声道攻击对键盘的威胁比以往任何时候都大。本文介绍了一种先进的深度学习模型的实际实现，以便使用智能手机集成的麦克风对笔记本电脑的按键进行分类。当对附近手机记录的击键进行训练时，分类器达到了95%的准确率，这是不使用语言模型时的最高准确率。当使用视频会议软件Zoom对击键记录进行训练时，准确率达到了93%，创下了媒体的新记录。我们的结果通过现成的设备和算法证明了这些旁道攻击的实用性。我们讨论一系列缓解方法来保护用户免受这一系列攻击。

papers.title: Combined Internal Attacks on SoC-FPGAs: Breaking AES with Remote Power Analysis and Frequency-based Covert Channels
papers.authors: Anis Fellah-Touta, Lilian Bossuet, Carlos Andres Lara-Nino
papers.abstract: In recent years, the field of side-channel analysis has observed a revolution in the design of the attack methodology. Conventional approaches which require the use of highly specialized equipment like oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers, despite highly precise, might be regarded as impractical in some scenarios. On the other hand, the use of less-accurate internal sensors which can monitor the power footprint of a circuit has risen in popularity. Delay sensors have shown promising results. These structures are interesting since they can be implemented from regular hardware resources available in most circuits. This means that components already available in the target platform might be leveraged to implement a side-channel attack. Moreover, it has been shown that is not necessary to have direct access to the platform to carry out such an attack; which implies that if there is a remote link such as Ethernet, an adversary might be able to perform Remote Power Analysis (RPA) of the system. So far, the main challenge for the success of this kind of attack is the problem of cutting and aligning the power traces.
