papers.abstract_zh: 尽管网络犯罪的患病率越来越高，但对经历过至少发生过一次或成功的网络犯罪事件的个人的响应策略和保护策略和保护性（隐私，安全）实践的理解有限。 为了解决这一差距，我们对英国的n = 605个样本进行了在线调查，这是关于网络犯罪经历的第一手叙述，响应此类事件采取的措施以及他们参与安全和隐私（SP）方法的水平 和技术。 我们在319个网络犯罪报告中确定了8种不同类型的网络犯罪和9种相应的响应策略的发生，涵盖了它和保护主题。 我们描述了网络犯罪经验与通过视觉表示对响应策略的利用之间的关联。 与IT相关或保护性SP主题响应策略并行，我们发现经验丰富的网络犯罪类型（例如恶意软件）以及经验的频率（例如，多个网络犯罪或相同网络犯罪类型的重复体验）会影响与SP的参与 技术。 本文提供了对不同类型网络犯罪（包括其多次事件和（保护性）行动的经验的经验见解。 我们还为研究和实践实施提供了建议，强调满足经历过多次或重复网络犯罪的个人的特定需求的重要性。 我们的论文建议采用取消备份的网络策略，以补充个人监护权，同时促进迎合各种用户范围的基础设施。

papers.title: Android, Notify Me When It Is Time To Go Phishing
papers.authors: Antonio Ruggia, Andrea Possemato, Alessio Merlo, Dario Nisi, Simone Aonzo
papers.abstract: A mobile banking app just started up, and the notification "App updated, click here to restart" appears. The graphic theme is the same as the bank. Can we trust it? What if we cannot even trust that tapping an app actually loads the original one? More generally, what if Android notifies an attacker when her victim has just launched the target app of her phishing campaign so that she could cast the hook at the perfect moment?In this paper, we abuse inotify APIs, a mechanism for monitoring file system events, to mount a state inference-based phishing attack from a malicious app installed on the victim's smartphone. We also verified the novelty of our work analyzing 10,000 recent Android malware, and although we found some cases where malware uses inotify for their petty purposes, our attack seems to be publicly unknown.However, since Android constantly evolves year after year, we studied its feasibility over different Android versions and attacker's capabilities. By analyzing 4, 863 of the most popular apps, the most disconcerting finding is that if the attacker knows the installation path of the target app, all Android apps are vulnerable, regardless of the system version. Getting the installation path of an app is a capability that is only protected by a normal permission, and to make matters worse, there are workarounds to get it even without such permission.Even if this capability is denied, we propose different attack models under which this attack is still possible; however, at the end of our work, we provide the remediation to eradicate once and for all these attacks. Through this work, we reported three vulnerabilities to Google. Two were acknowledged as bugs of moderate severity, while the last one was already known but not public.
papers.title_zh: Android，到了钓鱼的时候通知我
papers.abstract_zh: 某手机银行app刚启动，出现“App更新，点击此处重启”的通知。图形主题与银行相同。我们能相信它吗？如果我们甚至不能相信点击一个应用程序实际上会加载原来的应用程序，那该怎么办？更一般地说，如果当受害者刚刚启动她的钓鱼活动的目标应用程序时，Android通知攻击者，以便她可以在完美的时刻抛出钩子，会怎么样？在本文中，我们滥用inotify APIs(一种监控文件系统事件的机制)，从受害者智能手机上安装的恶意应用程序发起基于状态推断的网络钓鱼攻击。我们还验证了我们的工作的新颖性，分析了10，000个最近的Android恶意软件，尽管我们发现了一些恶意软件出于其琐碎目的使用inotify的情况，但我们的攻击似乎并不为人所知。然而，由于Android年复一年不断发展，我们研究了它在不同Android版本和攻击者能力上的可行性。通过分析4863个最受欢迎的应用程序，最令人不安的发现是，如果攻击者知道目标应用程序的安装路径，所有Android应用程序都容易受到攻击，无论系统版本如何。获取应用程序的安装路径是一项仅受普通权限保护的功能，更糟糕的是，即使没有这样的权限，也有变通办法可以获取它。即使这种能力被否认，我们提出了不同的攻击模型，在这些模型下，这种攻击仍然是可能的；但是，在工作结束时，我们会提供补救措施来彻底根除这些攻击。通过这项工作，我们向Google报告了三个漏洞。两个被认为是中等严重程度的错误，而最后一个是已知的，但不是公开的。

papers.title: Understanding, Measuring, and Detecting Modern Technical Support Scams
papers.authors: Jienan Liu, Pooja Pun, Phani Vadrevu, Roberto Perdisci
papers.abstract: Technical support scams (TSS) are social engineering attacks that aim to exploit users that have limited knowledge about technology, such as the elderly, causing significant financial loss to vulnerable citizens. The security community has attempted to respond to these web-based scams with different countermeasures. However, to the best of our knowledge, no robust countermeasures have been proposed thus far to defend against modern TSS campaigns that abuse web search engines to inflate their rankings in search results and lure many potential victims.To defend against these TSS attacks, in this paper we first study the TSS ecosystem, with particular focus on how modern TSS campaigns are operated and promoted on the web. Then, we capitalize on our findings by proposing a novel detection system named TASR that can be used to differentiate TSS websites from legitimate technical support websites in a topic-agnostic way, by leveraging features that capture key traits of how TSS web pages are promoted. Our cross-validation tests show that TASR can detect 94.5% of the TSS links in web search results at a false positive rate of less than 1%, significantly outperforming previous work.
papers.title_zh: 理解、衡量和检测现代技术支持骗局
papers.abstract_zh: 技术支持骗局(TSS)是一种社会工程攻击，旨在利用老年人等技术知识有限的用户，给弱势公民造成重大经济损失。安全社区试图用不同的对策来应对这些基于web的骗局。然而，据我们所知，迄今为止还没有提出强有力的对策来抵御现代TSS活动，这些活动滥用网络搜索引擎来抬高它们在搜索结果中的排名，并引诱许多潜在的受害者。为了抵御这些TSS攻击，在本文中，我们首先研究TSS生态系统，特别关注现代TSS活动是如何在网络上运作和推广的。然后，我们利用我们的发现，提出了一个名为TASR的新型检测系统，通过利用捕捉TSS网页如何推广的关键特征，可以以主题不可知的方式将TSS网站与合法的技术支持网站区分开来。我们的交叉验证测试表明，TASR可以检测网页搜索结果中94.5%的TSS链接，误报率低于1%，明显优于以前的工作。

papers.title: Active Countermeasures for Email Fraud
papers.authors: Wentao Chen, Fuzhou Wang, Matthew Edwards
papers.abstract: As a major component of online crime, email-based fraud is a threat that causes substantial economic losses every year. To counteract these scammers, volunteers called scam-baiters play the roles of victims, reply to scammers, and try to waste their time and attention with long and unproductive conversations. To curb email fraud and magnify the effectiveness of scam-baiting, we developed and deployed an expandable scam-baiting mailserver that can conduct scam-baiting activities automatically. We implemented three reply strategies using three different models and conducted a one-month-long experiment during which we elicited 150 messages from 130 different scammers. We compare the performance of each strategy at attracting and holding the attention of scammers, finding tradeoffs between human-written and automatically-generated response strategies. We also demonstrate that scammers can be engaged concurrently by multiple servers deploying these strategies in a second experiment, which used two server instances to contact 92 different scammers over 12 days. We release both our platform and a dataset containing conversations between our automatic scam-baiters and real human scammers, to support future work in preventing online fraud.
papers.title_zh: 电子邮件欺诈的积极对策
papers.abstract_zh: 作为在线犯罪的主要组成部分，基于电子邮件的欺诈威胁每年都会造成巨大的经济损失。为了对抗这些骗子，被称为骗局诱饵的志愿者扮演受害者的角色，回复骗子，并试图用漫长而无益的谈话来浪费他们的时间和注意力。为了遏制电子邮件欺诈和扩大诈骗诱饵的有效性，我们开发并部署了一个可扩展的诈骗诱饵邮件服务器，它可以自动进行诈骗诱饵活动。我们使用三种不同的模型实施了三种回复策略，并进行了为期一个月的实验，在此期间，我们从130个不同的骗子那里获得了150条信息。我们比较了每种策略在吸引和保持骗子注意力方面的表现，在人工编写和自动生成的响应策略之间找到了折衷。在第二个实验中，我们还证明了骗子可以通过部署这些策略的多台服务器同时参与，该实验使用两台服务器在12天内联系了92个不同的骗子。我们发布了我们的平台和一个数据集，其中包含我们的自动诈骗诱饵和真实的人类诈骗者之间的对话，以支持未来防止在线欺诈的工作。

papers.title: Multi-Factor Credential Hashing for Asymmetric Brute-Force Attack Resistance
papers.authors: Vivek Nair, Dawn Song
papers.abstract: Since the introduction of bcrypt in 1999, adaptive password hashing functions, whereby brute-force resistance increases symmetrically with computational difficulty for legitimate users, have been our most powerful post-breach countermeasure against credential disclosure. Unfortunately, the relatively low tolerance of users to added latency places an upper bound on the deployment of this technique in most applications. In this paper, we present a multi-factor credential hashing function (MFCHF) that incorporates the additional entropy of multi-factor authentication into password hashes to provide asymmetric resistance to brute-force attacks. MFCHF provides full backward compatibility with existing authentication software (e.g., Google Authenticator) and hardware (e.g., YubiKeys), with support for common usability features like factor recovery. The result is a 10^6 to 10^48 times increase in the difficulty of cracking hashed credentials, with little added latency or usability impact.
papers.title_zh: 抵抗非对称强力攻击的多因素凭证散列
papers.abstract_zh: 自1999年引入bcrypt以来，自适应密码哈希函数(合法用户的蛮力抵抗随着计算难度的增加而对称增加)一直是我们针对凭据泄露的最强大的攻击后对策。不幸的是，用户对额外延迟的相对较低的容忍度限制了这种技术在大多数应用中的部署。在本文中，我们提出了一种多因素凭证散列函数(MFCHF ),该函数将多因素认证的额外熵结合到密码散列中，以提供对暴力攻击的非对称抵抗。MFCHF提供了与现有认证软件(例如，Google Authenticator)和硬件(例如，YubiKeys)的完全向后兼容，并支持常见的可用性功能，如因子恢复。结果是破解散列凭证的难度增加了10^6到10^48倍，而几乎没有增加延迟或可用性影响。

papers.title: Chex-Mix: Combining Homomorphic Encryption with Trusted Execution Environments for Oblivious Inference in the Cloud
papers.authors: Deepika Natarajan, Andrew D. Loveless, Wei Dai, Ronald G. Dreslinski
papers.abstract: —Data, when coupled with state-of-the-art machine learning models, can enable remarkable applications. But, there exists an underlying tension: users wish to keep their data private, and model providers wish to protect their intellectual property. Homomorphic encryption (HE) and multi-party computation (MPC) techniques have been proposed as solutions to this problem; however, both techniques require model providers to fully trust the server performing the machine learning computation. This limits the scale of inference applications, since it prevents model providers from leveraging shared public cloud infrastructures. In this work, we present C HEX -M IX , a solution to the problem of privacy-preserving machine learning between two mutually distrustful parties in an untrusted cloud setting. C HEX -M IX relies on a combination of HE and trusted execution environments (TEEs), using HE to provide clients with confidentiality guarantees, and TEEs to provide model providers with confidentiality guarantees and protect the integrity of computation from malicious cloud adversaries. Unlike prior solutions to this problem, such as multi-key HE, single-key HE, MPC, or TEE-only techniques, our solution assumes that both the client and the cloud can be malicious, makes no collusion assumptions, and frees model providers from needing to maintain private online infrastructures. Our results show that C HEX -M IX can execute at high efficiency, with low communication cost, while providing security guarantees unaddressed by prior work. Compared to a recent multi-key HE work that allows partial cloud offload, for example, C HEX -M IX achieves a 3 × lower communication cost and a 3 × faster computation time.
papers.title_zh: Chex-Mix:将同态加密与可信执行环境相结合，用于云中的不经意推理
papers.abstract_zh: —当数据与最先进的机器学习模型相结合时，可以实现卓越的应用。但是，存在一个潜在的矛盾:用户希望保持他们的数据隐私，模型提供商希望保护他们的知识产权。已经提出了同态加密(HE)和多方计算(MPC)技术作为这个问题的解决方案；然而，这两种技术都要求模型提供者完全信任执行机器学习计算的服务器。这限制了推理应用的规模，因为它阻止了模型提供者利用共享的公共云基础设施。在这项工作中，我们提出了C HEX -M IX，这是一个在不可信云环境中两个互不信任方之间保护隐私的机器学习问题的解决方案。C HEX -M IX依赖于HE和可信执行环境(tees)的组合，使用HE为客户端提供机密性保证，使用TEEs为模型提供者提供机密性保证，并保护计算的完整性免受恶意云对手的攻击。与之前针对此问题的解决方案(如多密钥HE、单密钥HE、MPC或仅TEE技术)不同，我们的解决方案假设客户端和云都可能是恶意的，没有共谋假设，并且使模型提供者无需维护私有在线基础设施。我们的结果表明，C HEX -M IX能够以较低的通信代价高效地执行，同时提供了以前的工作没有解决的安全保证。例如，与最近允许部分云卸载的多键HE工作相比，C HEX -M IX实现了3倍的低通信成本和3倍的快计算时间。

papers.title: A Generic Obfuscation Framework for Preventing ML-Attacks on Strong-PUFs through Exploitation of DRAM-PUFs
papers.authors: Owen Millwood, Meltem Kurt Pehlivanoglu, Aryan Mohammadi Pasikhani, Jack Miskelly, Prosanta Gope, Elif Bilge Kavun
papers.abstract: Considering the limited power and computational resources available, designing sufficiently secure systems for low-power devices is a difficult problem to tackle. With the ubiquitous adoption of the Internet of Things (IoT) not appearing to be slowing any time soon, resource-constrained security is more important than ever. Physical Unclonable Functions (PUFs) have gained momentum in recent years for their potential to enable strong security through the generation of unique identifiers based on entropy derived from unique manufacturing variations. Strong-PUFs, which are desirable for authentication protocols, have often been shown to be insecure to Machine Learning Modelling Attacks (ML-MA). Recently, some schemes have been proposed to enhance security against ML-MA through post-processing of the PUF; however, often, security is not sufficiently upheld, the scheme requires too large an additional overhead or key data must be insecurely stored in Non-Volatile Memory. In this work, we propose a generic framework for securing Strong-PUFs against ML-MA through obfuscation of challenge and response data by exploiting a DRAM-PUF to supplement a One-Way Function (OWF) which can be implemented using the available resources on an FPGA platform. Our proposed scheme enables reconfigurability, strong security and one-wayness. We conduct ML-MA using various classifiers to thoroughly evaluate the performance of our scheme across multiple 16-bit and 32-bit Arbiter-PUF (APUF) variants, showing our scheme reduces model accuracy to around 50% for each PUF (random guessing) and evaluate the properties of the final responses, demonstrating that ideal uniformity and uniqueness are maintained. Even though we demonstrate our proposal through a DRAM-PUF, our scheme can be extended to work with memory-based PUFs in general.
papers.title_zh: 一种通用混淆框架，用于防止通过利用DRAM-puf对强puf的ML攻击
papers.abstract_zh: 考虑到可用的有限功率和计算资源，为低功率设备设计足够安全的系统是一个难以解决的问题。随着无处不在的物联网(IoT)的采用似乎不会很快放缓，资源受限的安全性比以往任何时候都更加重要。近年来，物理不可克隆功能(puf)因其通过基于源自独特制造差异的熵产生独特标识符来实现强大安全性的潜力而获得了发展势头。强puf是认证协议所需要的，但它对于机器学习建模攻击(ML-MA)来说是不安全的。最近，已经提出了一些方案，通过PUF的后处理来增强针对ML-MA的安全性；然而，通常安全性不够，该方案需要太大的额外开销，或者密钥数据必须不安全地存储在非易失性存储器中。在这项工作中，我们提出了一个通用框架，通过利用DRAM-PUF来补充单向函数(OWF ),通过混淆挑战和响应数据来保护强PUF免受ML-MA攻击，该单向函数可以使用FPGA平台上的可用资源来实现。我们提出的方案具有可重构性、强安全性和单向性。我们使用各种分类器进行ML-MA，以全面评估我们的方案在多个16位和32位仲裁PUF (APUF)变体上的性能，显示我们的方案将每个PUF(随机猜测)的模型准确度降低到大约50%,并评估最终响应的属性，表明理想的一致性和唯一性得以保持。尽管我们通过DRAM-PUF来演示我们的方案，但是我们的方案可以扩展到一般的基于存储器的PUF。

papers.title: Automatic verification of transparency protocols
papers.authors: Vincent Cheval, José Moreira, Mark Ryan
papers.abstract: Transparency protocols are protocols whose actions can be publicly monitored by observers (such observers may include regulators, rights advocacy groups, or the general public). The observed actions are typically usages of private keys such as decryptions, and signings. Examples of transparency protocols include certificate transparency, cryptocurrency, transparent decryption, and electronic voting. These protocols usually pose a challenge for automatic verification, because they involve sophisticated data types that have strong properties, such as Merkle trees, that allow compact proofs of data presence and tree extension.We address this challenge by introducing new features in ProVerif, and a methodology for using them. With our methodology, it is possible to describe the data type quite abstractly, using ProVerif axioms, and prove the correctness of the protocol using those axioms as assumptions. Then, in separate steps, one can define one or more concrete implementations of the data type, and again use ProVerif to show that the implementations satisfy the assumptions that were coded as axioms. This helps make compositional proofs, splitting the proof burden into several manageable pieces. We illustrate the methodology and features by providing the first formal verification of the transparent decryption and certificate transparency protocols with a precise modelling of the Merkle tree data structure.
papers.title_zh: 透明协议的自动验证
papers.abstract_zh: 透明协议是其行为可以被观察者(这种观察者可以包括监管者、权利倡导团体或公众)公开监控的协议。观察到的动作通常是私钥的使用，例如解密和签名。透明协议的例子包括证书透明、加密货币、透明解密和电子投票。这些协议通常对自动验证构成挑战，因为它们涉及具有强属性的复杂数据类型，例如Merkle树，这允许数据存在和树扩展的紧凑证明。我们通过在ProVerif中引入新特性以及使用它们的方法来应对这一挑战。使用我们的方法，可以使用ProVerif公理非常抽象地描述数据类型，并使用这些公理作为假设来证明协议的正确性。然后，在单独的步骤中，可以定义该数据类型的一个或多个具体实现，并再次使用ProVerif来表明这些实现满足被编码为公理的假设。这有助于合成证明，将证明负担分成几个可管理的部分。我们通过用Merkle树数据结构的精确建模提供透明解密和证书透明协议的第一个正式验证来说明方法和特征。

papers.title: SoK: Data Sovereignty
papers.authors: Jens Ernstberger, Jan Lauinger, Fatima Elsheimy, Liyi Zhou, Sebastian Steinhorst, Ran Canetti, Andrew Miller, Arthur Gervais, Dawn Song
papers.abstract: Society appears to be on the verge of recognizing the need for control over sensitive data in modern web applications. Recently, many systems claim to give control to individuals, promising the preeminent goal of data sovereignty. However, despite recent attention, research and industry efforts are fragmented and lack a holistic system overview. In this paper, we provide the first transecting systematization of data sovereignty by drawing from a dispersed body of knowledge. We clarify the field by identifying its three main areas: (i) decentralized identity, (ii) decentralized access control and (iii) policy-compliant decentralized computation. We find that literature lacks a cohesive set of formal definitions. Each area is considered in isolation, and priorities in industry and academia are not aligned due to a lack of clarity regarding user control. To solve this issue, we propose formal definitions for each sub-area. By highlighting that data sovereignty transcends the domain of decentralized identity, we aim to guide future works to embrace a broader perspective on user control. In each section, we augment our definition with security and privacy properties, discuss the state of the art and proceed to identify open challenges. We conclude by highlighting synergies between areas, emphasizing the real-world benefit obtained by further developing data sovereign systems.
papers.title_zh: SoK:数据主权
papers.abstract_zh: 社会似乎即将认识到在现代web应用程序中控制敏感数据的必要性。最近，许多系统声称将控制权交给个人，承诺数据主权的卓越目标。然而，尽管最近的关注，研究和行业的努力是分散的，缺乏一个整体的系统概述。在本文中，我们通过从分散的知识体中提取数据，提供了数据主权的第一个横切系统化。我们通过确定其三个主要领域来阐明该领域:(I)分散身份，(ii)分散访问控制和(iii)符合策略的分散计算。我们发现文献缺乏一套连贯的正式定义。每个领域都被认为是孤立的，并且由于缺乏关于用户控制的明确性，行业和学术界的优先事项并不一致。为了解决这个问题，我们提出了每个子领域的正式定义。通过强调数据主权超越了分散身份的领域，我们旨在引导未来的工作拥抱更广阔的用户控制视角。在每一节中，我们都用安全和隐私属性来扩充我们的定义，讨论最新技术，并着手确定公开的挑战。最后，我们强调了各个领域之间的协同作用，强调了通过进一步开发数据主权系统所获得的现实世界的好处。

papers.title: An Unbiased Transformer Source Code Learning with Semantic Vulnerability Graph
papers.authors: Nafis Tanveer Islam, Gonzalo De La Torre Parra, Dylan Manuel, Elias Bou-Harb, Peyman Najafirad
papers.abstract: Over the years, open-source software systems have become prey to threat actors. Even as open-source communities act quickly to patch the breach, code vulnerability screening should be an integral part of agile software development from the beginning. Unfortunately, current vulnerability screening techniques are ineffective at identifying novel vulnerabilities or providing developers with code vulnerability and classification. Furthermore, the datasets used for vulnerability learning often exhibit distribution shifts from the real-world testing distribution due to novel attack strategies deployed by adversaries and as a result, the machine learning model's performance may be hindered or biased. To address these issues, we propose a joint interpolated multitasked unbiased vulnerability classifier comprising a transformer"RoBERTa"and graph convolution neural network (GCN). We present a training process utilizing a semantic vulnerability graph (SVG) representation from source code, created by integrating edges from a sequential flow, control flow, and data flow, as well as a novel flow dubbed Poacher Flow (PF). Poacher flow edges reduce the gap between dynamic and static program analysis and handle complex long-range dependencies. Moreover, our approach reduces biases of classifiers regarding unbalanced datasets by integrating Focal Loss objective function along with SVG. Remarkably, experimental results show that our classifier outperforms state-of-the-art results on vulnerability detection with fewer false negatives and false positives. After testing our model across multiple datasets, it shows an improvement of at least 2.41% and 18.75% in the best-case scenario. Evaluations using N-day program samples demonstrate that our proposed approach achieves a 93% accuracy and was able to detect 4, zero-day vulnerabilities from popular GitHub repositories.
papers.title_zh: 基于语义漏洞图的无偏转换器源代码学习
papers.abstract_zh: 多年来，开源软件系统已经成为威胁者的猎物。即使开源社区迅速采取行动修补漏洞，代码漏洞筛选也应该从一开始就是敏捷软件开发的一个组成部分。不幸的是，当前的弱点筛选技术在识别新的弱点或向开发者提供代码弱点和分类方面是无效的。此外，由于对手部署的新攻击策略，用于漏洞学习的数据集通常表现出与真实世界测试分布的分布偏移，因此，机器学习模型的性能可能受到阻碍或有偏差。为了解决这些问题，我们提出了一种联合插值多任务无偏漏洞分类器，包括变换器“罗伯塔”和图卷积神经网络(GCN)。我们提出了一种利用来自源代码的语义漏洞图(SVG)表示的训练过程，该SVG表示是通过整合来自顺序流、控制流和数据流的边以及被称为偷猎者流(PF)的新流而创建的。偷猎者流边缘减少了动态和静态程序分析之间的差距，并处理复杂的长期依赖关系。此外，我们的方法通过整合聚焦损失目标函数和SVG来减少分类器对不平衡数据集的偏见。值得注意的是，实验结果表明，我们的分类器在漏洞检测方面优于最新的结果，具有更少的假阴性和假阳性。在多个数据集上测试我们的模型后，它显示在最好的情况下至少提高了2.41%和18.75%。使用N天程序样本的评估表明，我们提出的方法实现了93%的准确率，并能够从流行的GitHub库中检测4个零天漏洞。

papers.title: Protecting Voice-Controllable Devices Against Self-Issued Voice Commands
papers.authors: Sergio Esposito, Daniele Sgandurra, Giampaolo Bella
papers.abstract: Self-issued voice commands leverage the voice-controllable device’s internal speaker to issue malicious voice commands to the device itself. These attacks are a class of voice spoofing attacks particularly challenging to protect from, as it is very hard for a countermeasure solution to infer whether the command comes from an external entity or from the device itself. In this paper, we propose a countermeasure against self-issued voice commands by training a Twin Neural Network to recognise the differences between what is being played and what is being recorded by the voice-controllable device. In fact, these audios are very similar in case of voice command self-issue attacks and different in case of legitimate commands. We start with a security and usability trade-off analysis of countermeasures against voice spoofing attacks, by describing different classes of synthesised voice commands that need to be blocked or allowed, depending on the necessities of the user. Then, we present our solution to protect voice-controllable devices from self-issued commands and show that it correctly classifies commands in the benign (real-user) and malign (self-issued) categories 97% of the times on average. We compare this result with state-of-the-art anomaly detection techniques as a baseline and show that our solution outperforms them. Furthermore, we instantiate our countermeasure on three different classes of devices to measure its performance, and we find that the additional overhead is negligible. Finally, we measure the usability impact of our solution when users interact with the tested device under different conditions, showing that our solution is resistant to environmental changes and regardless of the identity of the user issuing the commands.
papers.title_zh: 保护语音可控设备免受自己发出的语音命令的影响
papers.abstract_zh: 自发布的语音命令利用语音可控设备的内部扬声器向设备本身发布恶意的语音命令。这些攻击是一类特别难以防范的语音欺骗攻击，因为对策解决方案很难推断命令是来自外部实体还是来自设备本身。在本文中，我们提出了一种针对自发布语音命令的对策，通过训练一个双神经网络来识别语音可控设备正在播放的内容和正在记录的内容之间的差异。事实上，这些音频在语音命令自发布攻击的情况下非常相似，而在合法命令的情况下则不同。我们从针对语音欺骗攻击的对策的安全性和可用性权衡分析开始，根据用户的需要，描述需要阻止或允许的不同类别的合成语音命令。然后，我们介绍了我们的解决方案，以保护语音可控设备免受自发布命令的影响，并表明它在平均97%的时间内正确地将命令分类为良性(真实用户)和恶性(自发布)类别。我们将这一结果与最先进的异常检测技术作为基线进行比较，表明我们的解决方案优于它们。此外，我们在三种不同类别的设备上实例化了我们的对策来测量其性能，我们发现额外的开销可以忽略不计。最后，当用户在不同条件下与测试设备交互时，我们测量了我们的解决方案的可用性影响，表明我们的解决方案能够抵抗环境变化，并且与发出命令的用户的身份无关。

papers.title: When the Curious Abandon Honesty: Federated Learning Is Not Private
papers.authors: Franziska Boenisch, Adam Dziedzic, Roei Schuster, Ali Shahin Shamsabadi, Ilia Shumailov, Nicolas Papernot
papers.abstract: In federated learning (FL), data does not leave personal devices when they are jointly training a machine learning model. Instead, these devices share gradients, parameters, or other model updates, with a central party (e.g., a company) coordinating the training. Because data never "leaves" personal devices, FL is often presented as privacy-preserving. Yet, recently it was shown that this protection is but a thin facade, as even a passive, honest-but-curious attacker observing gradients can reconstruct data of individual users contributing to the protocol.In this work, we show a novel data reconstruction attack which allows an active and dishonest central party to efficiently extract user data from the received gradients. While prior work on data reconstruction in FL relies on solving computationally expensive optimization problems or on making easily detectable modifications to the shared model’s architecture or parameters, in our attack the central party makes inconspicuous changes to the shared model’s weights before sending them out to the users. We call the modified weights of our attack trap weights.Our active attacker is able to recover user data perfectly, i.e., with zero error, even when this data stems from the same class. Recovery comes with near-zero costs: the attack requires no complex optimization objectives. Instead, our attacker exploits inherent data leakage from model gradients and simply amplifies this effect by maliciously altering the weights of the shared model through the trap weights. These specificities enable our attack to scale to fully-connected and convolutional deep neural networks trained with large mini-batches of data. For example, for the high-dimensional vision dataset ImageNet, we perfectly reconstruct more than 50% of the training data points from mini-batches as large as 100 data points. In textual tasks, such as IMDB sentiment analysis, more than 65% of data points from mini-batches containing 100 data points can be perfectly reconstructed.
papers.title_zh: 当好奇者放弃诚实:联合学习不是私人的
papers.abstract_zh: 在联合学习(FL)中，当他们联合训练机器学习模型时，数据不会离开个人设备。相反，这些设备共享梯度、参数或其他模型更新，由中心方(例如，公司)协调训练。因为数据永远不会“离开”个人设备，所以FL通常以保护隐私的名义出现。然而，最近的研究表明，这种保护只是一个薄薄的门面，因为即使是一个被动的，诚实但好奇的攻击者观察梯度也可以重建对协议有贡献的个人用户的数据。在这项工作中，我们展示了一种新的数据重建攻击，它允许一个积极的和不诚实的中心方从接收到的梯度中有效地提取用户数据。虽然先前在FL中的数据重建工作依赖于解决计算上昂贵的优化问题或者对共享模型的架构或参数进行容易检测的修改，但是在我们的攻击中，中心方在将共享模型的权重发送给用户之前对它们进行不明显的改变。我们称修改后的权重为攻击陷阱权重。我们的主动攻击者能够完美地恢复用户数据，即零错误，即使这些数据来自同一个类。恢复成本几乎为零:攻击不需要复杂的优化目标。相反，我们的攻击者利用了模型梯度固有的数据泄漏，并通过陷阱权重恶意改变共享模型的权重，从而简单地放大了这种影响。这些特性使我们的攻击能够扩展到用大量小批量数据训练的全连接和卷积深度神经网络。例如，对于高维视觉数据集ImageNet，我们从多达100个数据点的小批量数据中完美地重建了超过50%的训练数据点。在文本任务中，例如IMDB情感分析，来自包含100个数据点的小批量的超过65%的数据点可以被完美地重建。

papers.title: A Certified Radius-Guided Attack Framework to Image Segmentation Models
papers.authors: Wenjie Qu, Youqi Li, Binghui Wang
papers.abstract: Image segmentation is an important problem in many safety-critical applications. Recent studies show that modern image segmentation models are vulnerable to adversarial perturbations, while existing attack methods mainly follow the idea of attacking image classification models. We argue that image segmentation and classification have inherent differences, and design an attack framework specially for image segmentation models. Our attack framework is inspired by certified radius, which was originally used by defenders to defend against adversarial perturbations to classification models. We are the first, from the attacker perspective, to leverage the properties of certified radius and propose a certified radius guided attack framework against image segmentation models. Specifically, we first adapt randomized smoothing, the state-of-the-art certification method for classification models, to derive the pixel's certified radius. We then focus more on disrupting pixels with relatively smaller certified radii and design a pixel-wise certified radius guided loss, when plugged into any existing white-box attack, yields our certified radius-guided white-box attack. Next, we propose the first black-box attack to image segmentation models via bandit. We design a novel gradient estimator, based on bandit feedback, which is query-efficient and provably unbiased and stable. We use this gradient estimator to design a projected bandit gradient descent (PBGD) attack, as well as a certified radius-guided PBGD (CR-PBGD) attack. We prove our PBGD and CR-PBGD attacks can achieve asymptotically optimal attack performance with an optimal rate. We evaluate our certified-radius guided white-box and black-box attacks on multiple modern image segmentation models and datasets. Our results validate the effectiveness of our certified radius-guided attack framework.
papers.title_zh: 一个认证的图像分割模型的半径引导攻击框架
papers.abstract_zh: 图像分割是许多安全关键应用中的重要问题。最近的研究表明，现代图像分割模型容易受到敌对扰动，而现有的攻击方法主要遵循攻击图像分类模型的思想。我们认为图像分割和分类有着内在的区别，并设计了一个专门针对图像分割模型的攻击框架。我们的攻击框架受certified radius的启发，它最初被防御者用来防御对分类模型的敌对干扰。从攻击者的角度来看，我们是第一个利用认证radius的属性并针对图像分割模型提出认证radius导向攻击框架的。具体来说，我们首先采用随机化平滑(用于分类模型的最先进的认证方法)来导出像素的认证半径。然后，我们更加关注破坏具有相对较小认证半径的像素，并设计像素级认证半径引导损耗，当插入任何现有白盒攻击时，产生我们认证的半径引导白盒攻击。接下来，我们提出了第一个通过bandit对图像分割模型的黑盒攻击。基于bandit反馈，我们设计了一种新的梯度估计器，它是查询有效的，并且可证明是无偏和稳定的。我们使用这个梯度估计器来设计一个投射的班迪特梯度下降(PBGD)攻击，以及一个认证的半径引导的PBGD (CR-PBGD)攻击。我们证明了我们的PBGD和CR-PBGD攻击能够以最优的速率达到渐近最优的攻击性能。我们在多种现代图像分割模型和数据集上评估了我们的certified-radius引导白盒和黑盒攻击。我们的结果验证了我们认证的半径制导攻击框架的有效性。

papers.title: SoK: Explainable Machine Learning for Computer Security Applications
papers.authors: Azqa Nadeem, Daniël Vos, Clinton Cao, Luca Pajola, Simon Dieck, Robert Baumgartner, Sicco Verwer
papers.abstract: Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) aims to improve the transparency of machine learning (ML) pipelines. We systematize the increasingly growing (but fragmented) microcosm of studies that develop and utilize XAI methods for defensive and offensive cybersecurity tasks. We identify 3 cybersecurity stakeholders, i.e., model users, designers, and adversaries, who utilize XAI for 4 distinct objectives within an ML pipeline, namely 1) XAI-enabled user assistance, 2) XAI-enabled model verification, 3) explanation verification&robustness, and 4) offensive use of explanations. Our analysis of the literature indicates that many of the XAI applications are designed with little understanding of how they might be integrated into analyst workflows -- user studies for explanation evaluation are conducted in only 14% of the cases. The security literature sometimes also fails to disentangle the role of the various stakeholders, e.g., by providing explanations to model users and designers while also exposing them to adversaries. Additionally, the role of model designers is particularly minimized in the security literature. To this end, we present an illustrative tutorial for model designers, demonstrating how XAI can help with model verification. We also discuss scenarios where interpretability by design may be a better alternative. The systematization and the tutorial enable us to challenge several assumptions, and present open problems that can help shape the future of XAI research within cybersecurity.
papers.title_zh: SoK:用于计算机安全应用的可解释机器学习
papers.abstract_zh: 可解释人工智能(XAI)旨在提高机器学习(ML)管道的透明度。我们将日益增长(但支离破碎)的研究微观世界系统化，这些研究开发并利用XAI方法执行防御性和进攻性网络安全任务。我们确定了3个网络安全利益相关者，即模型用户、设计者和对手，他们在ML管道中利用XAI实现4个不同的目标，即1) XAI支持的用户协助，2) XAI支持的模型验证，3)解释验证和稳健性，以及4)解释的攻击性使用。我们对文献的分析表明，许多XAI应用程序在设计时对它们如何集成到分析师工作流中知之甚少——只有14%的案例进行了解释评估的用户研究。安全文献有时也不能理清各种涉众的角色，例如，通过向模型用户和设计者提供解释，同时也将他们暴露给对手。此外，模型设计者的角色在安全文献中被最小化。为此，我们为模型设计者提供了一个说明性的教程，演示了XAI如何帮助模型验证。我们还讨论了设计的可解释性可能是更好的选择的场景。系统化和指南使我们能够挑战几个假设，并提出开放的问题，有助于塑造网络安全领域XAI研究的未来。

papers.title: Reconstructing Individual Data Points in Federated Learning Hardened with Differential Privacy and Secure Aggregation
papers.authors: Franziska Boenisch, Adam Dziedzic, Roei Schuster, Ali Shahin Shamsabadi, Ilia Shumailov, Nicolas Papernot
papers.abstract: Federated learning (FL) is a framework for users to jointly train a machine learning model. FL is promoted as a privacy-enhancing technology (PET) that provides data minimization: data never "leaves" personal devices and users share only model updates with a server (e.g., a company) coordinating the distributed training. While prior work showed that in vanilla FL a malicious server can extract users’ private data from the model updates, in this work we take it further and demonstrate that a malicious server can reconstruct user data even in hardened versions of the protocol. More precisely, we propose an attack against FL protected with distributed differential privacy (DDP) and secure aggregation (SA). Our attack method is based on the introduction of sybil devices that deviate from the protocol to expose individual users’ data for reconstruction by the server. The underlying root cause for the vulnerability to our attack is a power imbalance: the server orchestrates the whole protocol and users are given little guarantees about the selection of other users participating in the protocol. Moving forward, we discuss requirements for privacy guarantees in FL. We conclude that users should only participate in the protocol when they trust the server or they apply local primitives such as local DP, shifting power away from the server. Yet, the latter approaches come at significant overhead in terms of performance degradation of the trained model, making them less likely to be deployed in practice.
papers.title_zh: 在联邦学习中重建个体数据点，通过差异隐私和安全聚合进行强化
papers.abstract_zh: 联邦学习(FL)是用户共同训练机器学习模型的框架。FL被宣传为一种隐私增强技术(PET ),它提供数据最小化:数据从不“离开”个人设备，用户只与协调分布式训练的服务器(例如，公司)共享模型更新。虽然之前的工作表明，在vanilla FL中，恶意服务器可以从模型更新中提取用户的私人数据，但在这项工作中，我们进一步证明了恶意服务器甚至可以在协议的强化版本中重建用户数据。更准确地说，我们提出了一种针对受分布式差分隐私(DDP)和安全聚合(SA)保护的FL的攻击。我们的攻击方法是基于sybil设备的引入，这些设备背离了协议，暴露了单个用户的数据以供服务器重建。我们攻击的潜在根本原因是功率不平衡:服务器编排整个协议，并且用户对于参与协议的其他用户的选择几乎没有保证。接下来，我们将讨论佛罗里达州的隐私保障要求。我们的结论是，只有当用户信任服务器或应用本地原语(如本地DP)时，他们才应该参与协议，将权力从服务器转移出去。然而，就训练模型的性能降级而言，后一种方法的开销很大，使得它们不太可能在实践中部署。

papers.title: Towards Fine-Grained Localization of Privacy Behaviors
papers.authors: Vijayanta Jain, Sepideh Ghanavati, Sai Teja Peddinti, Collin McMillan
papers.abstract: Privacy labels help developers communicate their application’s privacy behaviors (i.e., how and why an application uses personal information) to users. But, studies show that developers face several challenges in creating them and the resultant labels are often inconsistent with their application’s privacy behaviors. In this paper, we create a novel methodology called fine-grained localization of privacy behaviors to locate individual statements in source code which encode privacy behaviors and predict their privacy labels. We design and develop an attention-based multi-head encoder model which creates individual representations of multiple methods and uses attention to identify relevant statements that implement privacy behaviors. These statements are then used to predict privacy labels for the application’s source code and can help developers write privacy statements that can be used as notices. Our quantitative analysis shows that our approach can achieve high accuracy in identifying privacy labels, with the lowest accuracy of 91.41% and the highest of 98.45%. We also evaluate the efficacy of our approach with six software professionals from our university. The results demonstrate that our approach reduces the time and mental effort required by developers to create high-quality privacy statements and can finely localize statements in methods that implement privacy behaviors.
papers.title_zh: 隐私行为的细粒度定位
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私标签帮助开发人员向用户传达他们的应用程序的隐私行为(即，应用程序如何以及为什么使用个人信息)。但是，研究表明，开发人员在创建标签时会面临一些挑战，并且生成的标签通常与其应用程序的隐私行为不一致。在本文中，我们创建了一种称为隐私行为细粒度定位的新方法来定位编码隐私行为的源代码中的各个语句，并预测它们的隐私标签。我们设计并开发了一个基于注意力的多头编码器模型，该模型创建多种方法的单独表示，并使用注意力来识别实现隐私行为的相关语句。这些声明然后用于预测应用程序源代码的隐私标签，并可以帮助开发人员编写可用作通知的隐私声明。我们的定量分析表明，我们的方法在识别隐私标签方面可以达到很高的准确率，最低准确率为91.41%，最高准确率为98.45%。我们还与我们大学的六名软件专业人员一起评估了我们方法的有效性。结果表明，我们的方法减少了开发人员创建高质量隐私声明所需的时间和精力，并且可以在实现隐私行为的方法中精细地本地化声明。

papers.title: Masterkey attacks against free-text keystroke dynamics and security implications of demographic factors
papers.authors: Tim Van hamme, Giuseppe Garofalo, Davy Preuveneers, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: This paper presents and systematically evaluates the first masterkey attack against free-text keystroke dynamics. A masterkey is a typing sequence that matches, hence successfully impersonates, a large part of the population. Therefore, masterkeys are effective tools for an adversary who aims to impersonate someone without knowledge of their typing behavior. On top of the attack itself, we present a new unifying evaluation framework for masterkey attacks that allow for the comparison with knowledge-based authentication factors. In other words, we unify the evaluation of password security with that of masterkey attacks and demonstrate that typing biometrics is approximately 20 times less secure than passwords and approximately two times less secure than a 4-digit pin. Lastly, we study the effect of demographics on typing biometrics, which, among others, provides novel insights into the effect of being a well-versed typist on security.
papers.title_zh: 针对自由文本击键动力学的万能钥匙攻击和人口统计因素的安全含义
papers.abstract_zh: 本文提出并系统地评估了第一个针对自由文本击键动力学的万能钥匙攻击。万能钥匙是一个匹配的打字序列，因此成功地模仿了大部分人。因此，万能钥匙对于想要冒充不知道其打字行为的人的对手来说是有效的工具。在攻击本身之上，我们提出了一个新的针对万能钥匙攻击的统一评估框架，允许与基于知识的认证因素进行比较。换句话说，我们将对密码安全性的评估与对万能钥匙攻击的评估统一起来，并证明键入生物特征的安全性比密码低大约20倍，比4位pin低大约2倍。最后，我们研究了人口统计学对打字生物特征的影响，这为成为一名精通安全的打字员的影响提供了新的见解。

papers.title: "Act natural!": Exchanging Private Messages on Public Blockchains
papers.authors: Thore Tiemann, Sebastian Berndt, Thomas Eisenbarth, Maciej Liskiewicz
papers.abstract: Messengers have become an essential means of interpersonal interaction. Yet untraceable private communication remains an elusive goal, as most messengers hide content, but not communication patterns. The knowledge of communication patterns can by itself reveal too much, as happened, e. g., in the context of the Arab Spring. Subliminal channels in cryptographic systems enable untraceable private communication in plain sight. In this context, bulletin boards in the form of blockchains are a natural object for subliminal communication: accessing them is innocuous, as they rely on distributed access for verification and extension. At the same time, blockchain users generate hundreds of thousands of transactions per day that are individually signed and placed on the blockchain. Thus blockchains may serve as innocuous repository for publicly accessible cryptographic transactions where subliminal channels can be placed. In this paper, we propose a public-key subliminal channel using secret-recoverable splittable signature schemes on blockchains and prove that our construction is undetectable in the random oracle model under common cryptographic assumptions. Our approach is applicable to any secret-recoverable splittable signature scheme and introduces a constant overhead of a single signature per message. Such schemes are used by 98 of the top 100 cryptocurrencies. We also analyze the applicability of our approach to the Bitcoin, Monero, and RippleNet networks and present proof of concept implementations for Bitcoin and RippleNet.
papers.title_zh: “表现自然一点！”:在公共区块链上交换私人信息
papers.abstract_zh: 信使已经成为人际交往的重要手段。然而，无法追踪的私人通信仍然是一个难以捉摸的目标，因为大多数信使隐藏内容，但不是通信模式。传播模式的知识本身就能揭示太多东西，比如在阿拉伯之春的背景下发生的事情。密码系统中的潜意识信道使得秘密通信在众目睽睽之下不可追踪。在这种情况下，区块链形式的公告板是潜意识交流的自然对象:访问它们是无害的，因为它们依赖于分布式访问来验证和扩展。与此同时，区块链用户每天生成数十万笔交易，这些交易都是单独签名并放在区块链上的。因此，区块链可以作为无害的公开密码交易的存放处，在那里可以放置潜意识通道。在本文中，我们利用区块链上秘密可恢复的可分裂签名方案构造了一个公钥阈下信道，并证明了我们的构造在一般密码学假设下，在随机预言模型中是不可检测的。我们的方法适用于任何秘密可恢复的可分裂签名方案，并且引入了每个消息一个签名的恒定开销。前100种加密货币中有98种使用了这种方案。我们还分析了我们的方法对比特币、Monero和RippleNet网络的适用性，并展示了比特币和RippleNet的概念实现证明。

papers.title: smartFHE: Privacy-Preserving Smart Contracts from Fully Homomorphic Encryption
papers.authors: Ravital Solomon, Rick Weber, Ghada Almashaqbeh
papers.abstract: Despite the great potential and flexibility of smart contract-enabled blockchains, building privacy-preserving applications using these platforms remains an open question. Existing solutions fall short since they ask end users to coordinate and perform the computation off-chain themselves. While such an approach reduces the burden of the miners of the system, it largely limits the ability of lightweight users to enjoy privacy since performing the actual computation on their own and attesting to its correctness is expensive even with state-of-the-art proof systems.To address this limitation, we propose smartFHE, a framework to support private smart contracts using fully homomorphic encryption (FHE). To the best of our knowledge, smartFHE is the first to use FHE in the blockchain model; moreover, it is the first to support arbitrary privacy-preserving applications for lightweight users under the same computation-on-demand model pioneered by Ethereum. smartFHE does not overload the user since miners are instead responsible for performing the private computation. This is achieved by employing FHE so miners can compute over encrypted data and account balances. Users are only responsible for proving well-formedness of their private inputs using efficient zero-knowledge proof systems (ZKPs). We formulate a notion for a privacy-preserving smart contract (PPSC) scheme and show a concrete instantiation of our smartFHE framework. We address challenges resulting from using FHE in the blockchain setting—including concurrency and dealing with leveled schemes. We also show how to choose suitable FHE and ZKP schemes to instantiate our framework, since naively choosing these will lead to poor performance in practice. We formally prove correctness and security of our construction. Finally, we conduct experiments to evaluate its efficiency, including comparisons with a state-of-the-art scheme and testing several private smart contract applications. We have open-sourced our (highly optimized) ZKP library, which could be of independent interest.
papers.title_zh: smartFHE:基于全同态加密的隐私保护智能契约
papers.abstract_zh: 尽管支持智能合约的区块链具有巨大的潜力和灵活性，但使用这些平台构建隐私保护应用程序仍然是一个开放的问题。现有的解决方案存在不足，因为它们要求终端用户自己离线协调和执行计算。虽然这种方法减轻了系统挖掘者的负担，但它在很大程度上限制了轻量级用户享受隐私的能力，因为即使使用最先进的证明系统，自己执行实际计算并证明其正确性也是昂贵的。为了解决这个限制，我们提出了smartFHE，一个使用全同态加密(FHE)来支持私有智能契约的框架。据我们所知，smartFHE是第一个在区块链模型中使用FHE的；而且，它是第一个在以太坊首创的相同按需计算模型下，支持轻量级用户任意隐私保护应用的。smartFHE不会使用户过载，因为挖掘器负责执行私有计算。这是通过采用FHE实现的，这样矿工就可以计算加密数据和账户余额。用户只负责使用有效的零知识证明系统(zkp)来证明他们私有输入的良构性。我们提出了一个保护隐私的智能合同(PPSC)方案的概念，并展示了我们的智能合同框架的一个具体实例。我们解决了在区块链环境中使用FHE带来的挑战——包括并发性和处理分级方案。我们还展示了如何选择合适的FHE和ZKP方案来实例化我们的框架，因为天真地选择这些将导致实践中的糟糕性能。我们正式证明了我们构造的正确性和安全性。最后，我们进行实验来评估其效率，包括与最先进的方案进行比较，并测试几个私有智能合约应用程序。我们已经开源了我们的(高度优化的)ZKP图书馆，这可能是独立的利益。

papers.title: Understanding the Security Risks of Decentralized Exchanges by Uncovering Unfair Trades in the Wild
papers.authors: Jiaqi Chen, Yibo Wang, Yuxuan Zhou, Wanning Ding, Yuzhe Tang, XiaoFeng Wang, Kai Li
papers.abstract: DEX, or decentralized exchange, is a prominent class of decentralized finance (DeFi) applications on blockchains, attracting a total locked value worth tens of billions of USD today.This paper presents the first large-scale empirical study that uncovers unfair trades on popular DEX services on Ethereum and Binance Smart Chain (BSC). By joining and analyzing 60 million transactions, we find 671, 400 unfair trades on all six measured DEXes, including Uniswap, Balancer, and Curve. Out of these unfair trades, we attribute 55, 000 instances, with high confidence, to token thefts that cause a value loss of more than 3.88 million USD. Furthermore, the measurement study uncovers previously unknown causes of extractable value and real-world adaptive strategies to these causes. Finally, we propose countermeasures to redesign secure DEX protocols and to harden deployed services against the discovered security risks.
papers.title_zh: 通过揭露不公平交易理解分散交易的安全风险
papers.abstract_zh: DEX或分散式交易所(decentralized exchange)是区块链分散式金融(DeFi)应用的一个突出类别，目前吸引了价值数百亿美元的总锁定价值。本文提出了第一个大规模的实证研究，揭示了以太坊和币安智能链(BSC)上流行的DEX服务的不公平交易。通过合并和分析6000万笔交易，我们发现在所有六个衡量指标上有671，400笔不公平交易，包括Uniswap、Balancer和Curve。在这些不公平交易中，我们非常有把握地将55，000个案例归因于代币盗窃，这些盗窃造成了超过388万美元的价值损失。此外，测量研究揭示了以前未知的可提取价值的原因和现实世界适应这些原因的策略。最后，我们提出对策来重新设计安全DEX协议，并针对发现的安全风险强化部署的服务。

papers.title: MISO: Legacy-compatible Privacy-preserving Single Sign-on using Trusted Execution Environments
papers.authors: Rongwu Xu, Sen Yang, Fan Zhang, Zhixuan Fang
papers.abstract: Single sign-on (SSO) allows users to authenticate to third-party applications through a central identity provider. Despite their wide adoption, deployed SSO systems suffer from privacy problems such as user tracking by the identity provider. While numerous solutions have been proposed by academic papers, none were adopted because they require modifying identity providers, a significant adoption barrier in practice. Solutions do get deployed, however, fail to eliminate major privacy issues. Leveraging Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs), we propose MISO, the first privacy-preserving SSO system that is completely compatible with existing identity providers (such as Google and Facebook). This means MISO can be easily integrated into existing SSO ecosystem today and benefit end users. MISO also enables new functionality that standard SSO cannot offer: MISO allows users to leverage multiple identity providers in a single SSO workflow, potentially in a threshold fashion, to better protect user accounts. We fully implemented MISO based on Intel SGX. Our evaluation shows that MISO can handle high user concurrency with practical performance.
papers.title_zh: MISO:使用可信执行环境的遗留兼容隐私保护单点登录
papers.abstract_zh: 单点登录(SSO)允许用户通过中央身份提供者向第三方应用程序进行身份验证。尽管它们被广泛采用，但是部署的SSO系统遭受隐私问题，例如身份提供者的用户跟踪。虽然学术论文提出了许多解决方案，但没有一个被采用，因为它们需要修改身份提供者，这在实践中是一个重大的采用障碍。解决方案确实得到了部署，但是未能消除主要的隐私问题。利用可信执行环境(TEEs)，我们提出了MISO，这是第一个完全兼容现有身份提供者(如谷歌和脸书)的隐私保护SSO系统。这意味着MISO可以轻松集成到现有的SSO生态系统中，并使最终用户受益。MISO还支持标准SSO无法提供的新功能:MISO允许用户在单个SSO工作流中利用多个身份提供者，可能以阈值的方式来更好地保护用户帐户。我们完全实施了基于英特尔SGX的MISO。我们的评估表明，MISO能够以实用的性能处理高用户并发。

papers.title: Forward Pass: On the Security Implications of Email Forwarding Mechanism and Policy
papers.authors: Enze Liu, Gautam Akiwate, Mattijs Jonker, Ariana Mirian, Grant Ho, Geoffrey M. Voelker, Stefan Savage
papers.abstract: The critical role played by email has led to a range of extension protocols (e.g., SPF, DKIM, DMARC) designed to protect against the spoofing of email sender domains. These protocols are complex as is, but are further complicated by automated email forwarding -- used by individual users to manage multiple accounts and by mailing lists to redistribute messages. In this paper, we explore how such email forwarding and its implementations can break the implicit assumptions in widely deployed anti-spoofing protocols. Using large-scale empirical measurements of 20 email forwarding services (16 leading email providers and four popular mailing list services), we identify a range of security issues rooted in forwarding behavior and show how they can be combined to reliably evade existing anti-spoofing controls. We further show how these issues allow attackers to not only deliver spoofed email messages to prominent email providers (e.g., Gmail, Microsoft Outlook, and Zoho), but also reliably spoof email on behalf of tens of thousands of popular domains including sensitive domains used by organizations in government (e.g., state.gov), finance (e.g., transunion.com), law (e.g., perkinscoie.com) and news (e.g., washingtonpost.com) among others.
papers.title_zh: 转发:电子邮件转发机制和策略的安全含义
papers.abstract_zh: 电子邮件扮演的重要角色导致了一系列扩展协议(例如SPF、DKIM、DMARC)的出现，这些协议旨在防止电子邮件发件人域的欺骗。这些协议本身就很复杂，但自动电子邮件转发使其变得更加复杂——个人用户使用它来管理多个帐户，邮件列表使用它来重新分发邮件。在本文中，我们探讨了这种电子邮件转发及其实现如何打破广泛部署的反电子欺骗协议中的隐含假设。通过对20种电子邮件转发服务(16种领先的电子邮件提供商和4种流行的邮件列表服务)的大规模实证测量，我们发现了一系列源于转发行为的安全问题，并展示了如何将它们结合起来以可靠地规避现有的反电子欺骗控制。我们进一步展示了这些问题如何允许攻击者不仅向著名的电子邮件提供商(例如Gmail、Microsoft Outlook和Zoho)发送欺骗电子邮件，而且还代表数万个流行的域可靠地欺骗电子邮件，这些域包括政府(例如state.gov)、金融(例如transunion.com)、法律(例如perkinscoie.com)和新闻(例如washingtonpost.com)等机构使用的敏感域。

papers.title: Privformer: Privacy-preserving Transformer with MPC
papers.authors: Yoshimasa Akimoto, Kazuto Fukuchi, Youhei Akimoto, Jun Sakuma
papers.abstract: The Transformer is a deep learning architecture that processes sequence data. The Transformer attains the state-of-the-art in several tasks of sequence data analysis, and its variants, such as BERT and GPT-3, are used as a defacto-standard for solving general tasks in natural language processing (NLP). This work presents a 3-party multi-party computation (MPC) protocol for secure inference of the Transfomer in the honest majority setting. The attention layer is the most time-consuming part when implementing an MPC protocol for the Transformer with existing building blocks. The attention mechanism is a core component of the Transformer that captures and exploits complex dependencies among elements in the input sequences. The attention mechanism invokes the exponentiation function O(S2) times, which becomes a major bottleneck when implementing the Transformer with existing MPC primitives. To deal with this, we employ the Performer [11], a variant of the Transformer where the sigmoid function that invokes the exponentiation function is replaced with the ReLU function, a more MPC-friendly nonlinear function. Also, by introducing a kernel-based approximation of the attention matrix with random orthogonal matrices, we show that the attention layer can be processed with O(S) times calls of the ReLU function. We investigate the efficiency of the proposed method by an end-to-end implementation of the Transformer with 3-party MPC. Experimental evaluation shows that, for translating a sequence where the output sequence length is 64, the entire computation time takes about 19 minutes in the LAN environment.
papers.title_zh: Privformer:带有MPC的隐私保护转换器
papers.abstract_zh: 转换器是一种处理序列数据的深度学习架构。该转换器在序列数据分析的几个任务中达到了最先进的水平，其变体，如BERT和GPT-3，被用作解决自然语言处理(NLP)中一般任务的事实标准。本文提出了一个三方多方计算(MPC)协议，用于在诚实多数环境下对转换者进行安全推理。当使用现有的构建块为转换器实现MPC协议时，注意层是最耗时的部分。注意机制是转换器的核心组件，它捕获并利用输入序列中元素之间的复杂依赖关系。注意机制调用求幂函数O(S2)次，这成为用现有MPC原语实现转换器时的主要瓶颈。为了解决这个问题，我们使用了Performer [11]，它是转换器的一个变体，其中调用求幂函数的sigmoid函数被ReLU函数取代，ReLU函数是一个对MPC更友好的非线性函数。此外，通过引入具有随机正交矩阵的关注矩阵的基于核的近似，我们表明关注层可以用ReLU函数的O(S)次调用来处理。我们通过具有三方MPC的转换器的端到端实现来研究所提出的方法的效率。实验评估表明，对于翻译输出序列长度为64的序列，在LAN环境中整个计算时间需要大约19分钟。

papers.title: Coverage and Secure Use Analysis of Content Security Policies via Clustering
papers.authors: Mengxia Ren, Chuan Yue
papers.abstract: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a standardized leading technique for protecting webpages against attacks such as Cross Site Scripting (XSS). However, it is often hard to properly deploy CSPs on webpages, and the deployed CSPs often contain security issues or errors. In this paper, we take the unsupervised clustering approach to analyze the security levels of the deployed CSPs from the directive coverage and secure use perspectives. To effectively protect a webpage, a deployed CSP should cover all types of resources needed on the webpage by using different directive names (or some default directive names if available), and should avoid using unsafe directive values which will allow harmful resources to be loaded into a webpage. We implemented a Google Chrome extension, designed policy features, designed a Contrastive Spectral Clustering (CSC) algorithm, and visited the Alexa top 100K websites to analyze the CSPs deployed on them. From the 13,317 homepages that deployed CSPs under the enforcement mode, we categorized their policies into 16 clusters with different characteristics. We found that 15 clusters are at the low level on the coverage and five clusters are at the low level on the secure use of directives; meanwhile, no cluster is at the high level on the coverage of directives, and nine clusters are at the high level on the secure use of directives. These results indicate that most deployed CSPs do not sufficiently protect webpages, and more importantly, clustering helps identify the corresponding common or different reasons from the directive coverage and secure use perspectives. In addition, by analyzing 110,718 subpages of the 13,317 CSP-deployed homepages, we found that most of them deployed the same CSP as in their homepages. Overall, our approach and results can be helpful for promoting the proper deployment of CSPs.
papers.title_zh: 基于聚类的内容安全策略覆盖和安全使用分析
papers.abstract_zh: 内容安全策略(CSP)是一种标准化的领先技术，用于保护网页免受跨站点脚本(XSS)等攻击。然而，通常很难在网页上正确部署CSP，并且部署的CSP通常包含安全问题或错误。在本文中，我们采用无监督聚类的方法，从方向覆盖和安全使用的角度来分析已部署的CSP的安全级别。为了有效地保护网页，部署的CSP应该通过使用不同的指令名称(或一些默认指令名称，如果可用的话)来覆盖网页上所需的所有类型的资源，并且应该避免使用不安全的指令值，这将允许有害的资源被加载到网页中。我们实现了Google Chrome扩展，设计了策略功能，设计了对比谱聚类(CSC)算法，并访问了Alexa top 100K网站，以分析部署在这些网站上的CSP。从在强制模式下部署了CSP的13，317个主页中，我们将它们的策略分为具有不同特征的16个集群。我们发现15个集群在覆盖率上处于低水平，5个集群在指令的安全使用上处于低水平；同时，没有一个集群在指令覆盖率方面处于高水平，有九个集群在指令的安全使用方面处于高水平。这些结果表明，大多数部署的CSP不能充分保护网页，更重要的是，聚类有助于从指令覆盖和安全使用角度识别相应的共同或不同原因。此外，通过分析13，317个部署了CSP的主页的110，718个子页面，我们发现其中大多数都部署了与其主页中相同的CSP。总的来说，我们的方法和结果有助于促进电信运营商的正确部署。

papers.title: CommiTEE : An Efficient and Secure Commit-Chain Protocol using TEEs
papers.authors: Andreas Erwig, Sebastian Faust, Siavash Riahi, Tobias Stöcker
papers.abstract: Permissionless blockchain systems such as Bitcoin or Ethereum are slow and expensive, since transactions are processed in a distributed network by a large set of parties. To improve on these shortcomings, a prominent approach is given by so-called 2nd-layer protocols. In these protocols parties process transactions off-chain directly between each other, thereby drastically reducing the costly and slow interaction with the blockchain. In particular, in the optimistic case, when parties behave honestly, no interaction with the blockchain is needed. One of the most popular off-chain solutions are Plasma protocols (often also called commit-chains). These protocols are orchestrated by a so-called operator that maintains the system and processes transactions between parties. Importantly, the operator is trustless, i.e., even if it is malicious users of the system are guaranteed to not lose funds. To achieve this guarantee, Plasma protocols are highly complex and rely on involved and expensive dispute resolution processes. This has significantly slowed down development and deployment of these systems.In this work we propose CommiTEE – a simple and efficient Plasma system leveraging the power of trusted execution environments (TEE). Besides its simplicity, our protocol requires minimal interaction with the blockchain, thereby drastically reducing costs and improving efficiency. An additional benefit of our solution is that it allows for switching between operators, in case the main operator goes offline due to system failure, or behaving maliciously. We implemented and evaluated our system over Ethereum and show that it is at least 2 times (and in some cases more than 16 times) cheaper in terms of communication complexity when compared to existing Plasma implementations. Moreover, for protocols using zero-knowledge proofs (like NOCUST-ZKP), CommiTEE decreases the on-chain gas cost by a factor ≈ 19 compared to prior solution.
papers.title_zh: CommiTEE:一种高效安全的使用TEEs的提交链协议
papers.abstract_zh: 比特币或以太坊(Ethereum)等无需许可的区块链系统既慢又贵，因为交易是由一大群人在分布式网络中处理的。为了改进这些缺点，所谓的第二层协议给出了一种突出的方法。在这些协议中，各方直接在彼此之间处理链外事务，从而大大减少了与区块链的昂贵且缓慢的交互。特别是，在乐观的情况下，当各方诚实行事时，不需要与区块链进行交互。最流行的离线解决方案之一是等离子协议(通常也称为提交链)。这些协议由所谓的运营商协调，该运营商维护系统并处理各方之间的交易。重要的是，运营商是不可信的，即，即使它是系统的恶意用户，也保证不会损失资金。为了实现这一保证，血浆协议非常复杂，并且依赖于复杂且昂贵的争议解决流程。这大大减缓了这些系统的开发和部署。在这项工作中，我们提出了commit ee——一个利用可信执行环境(TEE)的简单高效的等离子体系统。除了简单之外，我们的协议需要与区块链最少的交互，从而大大降低了成本并提高了效率。我们的解决方案的另一个好处是，它允许在运营商之间切换，以防主运营商由于系统故障或恶意行为而离线。我们在以太坊上实现并评估了我们的系统，并表明与现有的等离子体实现相比，它在通信复杂性方面至少便宜2倍(在某些情况下超过16倍)。此外，对于使用零知识证明的协议(如NOCUST-ZKP)，与以前的解决方案相比，CommiTEE将链上gas成本降低了因子≈ 19。

papers.title: EF↯CF: High Performance Smart Contract Fuzzing for Exploit Generation
papers.authors: Michael Rodler, David Paaßen, Wenting Li, Lukas Bernhard, Thorsten Holz, Ghassan Karame, Lucas Davi
papers.abstract: Smart contracts are increasingly being used to manage large numbers of high-value cryptocurrency accounts. There is a strong demand for automated, efficient, and comprehensive methods to detect security vulnerabilities in a given contract. While the literature features a plethora of analysis methods for smart contracts, the existing proposals do not address the increasing complexity of contracts. Existing analysis tools suffer from false alarms and missed bugs in today's smart contracts that are increasingly defined by complexity and interdependencies. To scale accurate analysis to modern smart contracts, we introduce EF/CF, a high-performance fuzzer for Ethereum smart contracts. In contrast to previous work, EF/CF efficiently and accurately models complex smart contract interactions, such as reentrancy and cross-contract interactions, at a very high fuzzing throughput rate. To achieve this, EF/CF transpiles smart contract bytecode into native C++ code, thereby enabling the reuse of existing, optimized fuzzing toolchains. Furthermore, EF/CF increases fuzzing efficiency by employing a structure-aware mutation engine for smart contract transaction sequences and using a contract's ABI to generate valid transaction inputs. In a comprehensive evaluation, we show that EF/CF scales better -- without compromising accuracy -- to complex contracts compared to state-of-the-art approaches, including other fuzzers, symbolic/concolic execution, and hybrid approaches. Moreover, we show that EF/CF can automatically generate transaction sequences that exploit reentrancy bugs to steal Ether.
papers.title_zh: EF↯CF:高性能智能合同Fuzzing为剥削一代
papers.abstract_zh: 智能合约越来越多地被用于管理大量高价值的加密货币账户。对于检测给定合同中的安全漏洞的自动化、高效且全面的方法有着强烈的需求。虽然文献中有大量智能合同的分析方法，但现有的建议并没有解决合同日益增加的复杂性。现有的分析工具在今天的智能合约中存在错误警报和遗漏错误，这些智能合约越来越多地由复杂性和相互依赖性来定义。为了将精确分析扩展到现代智能合约，我们引入了EF/CF，一个用于以太坊智能合约的高性能fuzzer。与以前的工作相比，EF/CF以非常高的模糊吞吐率高效、准确地对复杂的智能契约交互(如重入和交叉契约交互)进行建模。为了实现这一点，EF/CF transpiles将智能合同字节码转换为原生C++代码，从而支持重用现有的优化模糊工具链。此外，EF/CF通过为智能合约交易序列采用结构感知变异引擎并使用合约的ABI来生成有效的交易输入，提高了模糊化效率。在一项综合评估中，我们表明，与包括其他fuzzers、符号/concolic执行和混合方法在内的最先进方法相比，EF/CF在不牺牲准确性的情况下更好地扩展到复杂合同。此外，我们证明EF/CF可以自动生成利用可重入性错误窃取以太的事务序列。

papers.title: Fuzzing SGX Enclaves via Host Program Mutations
papers.authors: Arslan Khan, Muqi Zou, Kyungtae Kim, Dongyan Xu, Antonio Bianchi, Dave Jing Tian
papers.abstract: Intel Software Guard eXtension (SGX) is the cornerstone of Confidential Computing, enabling runtime code and data integrity and confidentiality via enclaves. Unfortunately, memory-unsafe and type-unsafe programming languages, such as C/C++, are commonly used to develop enclave implementations. As a result, a memory corruption or a data race within enclaves could lead to different attacks against the enclaves, such as Return-Of-Programming (ROP) and data leakage, breaking the hardware security guarantee provided by SGX. To automatically identify these issues in existing enclave implementations, in this paper, we propose FuzzSGX, an input and program mutation-based fuzzer for Intel SGX enclave implementations. FuzzSGX provides an enclave fuzzing runtime, FuzzSGX Runtime, a drop-in library for Intel SGX SDK, enabling code coverage and sanitization within enclaves. To explore the host app-enclave boundary, FuzzSGX conducts static analysis and symbolic execution on existing host apps and enclave implementations to generate promising fuzzing programs, fuzzing both ECALLs and OCALLs. We evaluate FuzzSGX using 30 popular SGX applications and enclave implementations and find 93 bugs among these SGX projects, including data races, null pointer dereferences, out-of-bound accesses, division-by-zero, etc. FuzzSGX achieves 3.2x higher code coverage and finds 48.2% more bugs by directly targeting the host appenclave boundary by using program mutations, compared to state-of-the-art fuzzers.
papers.title_zh: 通过宿主程序突变模糊SGX飞地
papers.abstract_zh: 英特尔软件保护扩展(SGX)是保密计算的基石，通过enclaves实现运行时代码和数据的完整性和保密性。不幸的是，内存不安全和类型不安全的编程语言，如C/C++，通常用于开发enclave实现。因此，enclave内的内存损坏或数据竞争可能会导致对enclave的不同攻击，如编程返回(ROP)和数据泄漏，破坏SGX提供的硬件安全保证。为了自动识别现有enclave实施中的这些问题，在本文中，我们提出了FuzzSGX，这是一种用于英特尔SGX enclave实施的基于输入和程序变异的模糊器。FuzzSGX提供了一个enclave fuzzing运行时FuzzSGX运行时，这是一个面向英特尔SGX软件开发套件的嵌入式库，支持enclave内的代码覆盖和清理。为了探索主机应用程序-飞地边界，FuzzSGX对现有的主机应用程序和飞地实现进行静态分析和符号执行，以生成有前途的模糊化程序，模糊化ECALLs和OCALLs。我们使用30个流行的SGX应用程序和enclave实现来评估FuzzSGX，在这些SGX项目中发现了93个错误，包括数据竞争、空指针取消引用、越界访问、被零除等。与最先进的fuzzers相比，FuzzSGX通过使用程序突变直接针对主机appenclave边界，实现了3.2倍的代码覆盖率，并发现了48.2%的更多错误。

papers.title: Finding Fixed Vulnerabilities with Off-the-Shelf Static Analysis
papers.authors: Trevor Dunlap, Seaver Thorn, William Enck, Bradley Reaves
papers.abstract: Software depends on upstream projects that regularly fix vulnerabilities, but the documentation of those vulnerabilities is often unreliable or unavailable. Automating the collection of existing vulnerability fixes is essential for downstream projects to reliably update their dependencies due to the sheer number of dependencies in modern software. Prior efforts rely solely on incomplete databases or imprecise or inaccurate statistical analysis of upstream repositories. In this paper, we introduce Differential Alert Analysis (DAA) to discover vulnerability fixes in software projects. In contrast to statistical analysis, DAA leverages static analysis security testing (SAST) tools, which reason over code context and semantics. We provide a language-independent implementation of DAA and show that for Python and Java based projects, DAA has high precision for a ground-truth dataset of vulnerability fixes — even with noisy and low-precision SAST tools. We then use DAA in two large-scale empirical studies covering several prominent ecosystems, finding hundreds of resolved alerts, including many never publicly disclosed. DAA thus provides a powerful, accurate primitive for software projects, code analysis tools, vulnerability databases, and researchers to characterize and enhance the security of software supply chains.
papers.title_zh: 通过现成的静态分析发现已修复的漏洞
papers.abstract_zh: 软件依赖于定期修复漏洞的上游项目，但是这些漏洞的文档通常不可靠或不可用。由于现代软件中大量的依赖关系，自动收集现有的漏洞修复对于下游项目可靠地更新它们的依赖关系是至关重要的。先前的努力仅仅依赖于不完整的数据库或对上游储存库的不精确或不准确的统计分析。在本文中，我们介绍了差分警报分析(DAA)来发现软件项目中的漏洞修复。与统计分析相反，DAA利用静态分析安全测试(SAST)工具，该工具对代码上下文和语义进行推理。我们提供了一个独立于语言的DAA实现，并表明对于基于Python和Java的项目，DAA对漏洞修复的真实数据集具有很高的精度——即使使用嘈杂和低精度的SAST工具。然后，我们在两个大规模实证研究中使用DAA，涵盖了几个主要的生态系统，发现了数百个已解决的警报，包括许多从未公开披露的警报。因此，DAA为软件项目、代码分析工具、漏洞数据库和研究人员描述和增强软件供应链的安全性提供了一个强大、准确的原语。

papers.title: Code Vulnerability Detection via Signal-Aware Learning
papers.authors: Sahil Suneja, Yufan Zhuang, Yunhui Zheng, Jim Laredo, Alessandro Morari, Udayan Khurana
papers.abstract: Machine Learning-based modeling of source code understanding tasks has been gaining popularity. Accompanying their rapid proliferation is an emerging scrutiny over the models’ reliability. Concerns have been raised regarding the models not actually learning task-relevant source code features, but fitting other correlated data. To improve model trustworthiness, in this work, we explore data-driven approaches for enhancing model signal awareness, i.e., learning the relevant signals in the input for making predictions. We do so by incorporating the notion of code complexity during model training, both (i) explicitly via curriculum learning, and (ii) implicitly by augmenting the training dataset with simplified signal-preserving programs. With our techniques, we achieve up to 4.8x improvement in signal awareness of vulnerability detection models. Using the notion of code complexity, we present a novel interpretation of the model learning behaviour from the perspective of the dataset. We use it to introspect model learning difficulties, and analyze the learning enhancements achieved with our approaches.
papers.title_zh: 基于信号感知学习的代码漏洞检测
papers.abstract_zh: 基于机器学习的源代码理解任务建模越来越受欢迎。伴随着它们的快速扩散，对模型可靠性的审查也开始出现。关于模型实际上不学习与任务相关的源代码特性，而是拟合其他相关数据的问题已经引起了关注。为了提高模型的可信度，在这项工作中，我们探索了数据驱动的方法来增强模型信号意识，即学习输入中的相关信号以进行预测。我们通过在模型训练期间引入代码复杂性的概念来做到这一点，既(I)通过课程学习明确地，又(ii)通过用简化的信号保持程序增加训练数据集来隐含地。借助我们的技术，我们将漏洞检测模型的信号感知能力提高了4.8倍。使用代码复杂性的概念，我们从数据集的角度提出了模型学习行为的新解释。我们用它来反思模型学习困难，并分析我们的方法实现的学习增强。

papers.title: Hunting for Truth: Analyzing Explanation Methods in Learning-based Vulnerability Discovery
papers.authors: Tom Ganz, Philipp Rall, Martin Härterich, Konrad Rieck
papers.abstract: Recent research has developed a series of methods for finding vulnerabilities in software using machine learning. While the proposed methods provide a remarkable performance in controlled experiments, their practical application is hampered by their black-box nature: A security practitioner cannot tell how these methods arrive at a decision and what code structures contribute to a reported security flaw. Explanation methods for machine learning may overcome this problem and guide the practitioner to relevant code. However, there exist a variety of competing explanation methods, each highlighting different code regions when given the same finding. So far, this inconsistency has made it impossible to select a suitable explanation method for practical use.In this paper, we address this problem and develop a method for analyzing and comparing explanations for learning-based vulnerability discovery. Given a predicted vulnerability, our approach uses directed fuzzing to create local ground-truth around code regions marked as relevant by an explanation method. This local ground-truth enables us to assess the veracity of the explanation. As a result, we can qualitatively compare different explanation methods and determine the most accurate one for a particular learning setup. In an empirical evaluation with different discovery and explanation methods, we demonstrate the utility of this approach and its capabilities in making learning-based vulnerability discovery more transparent.
papers.title_zh: 寻找真相:分析基于学习的漏洞发现中的解释方法
papers.abstract_zh: 最近的研究开发了一系列使用机器学习来查找软件漏洞的方法。虽然所提出的方法在受控实验中提供了显著的性能，但是它们的实际应用受到它们的黑盒性质的阻碍:安全从业者不能告诉这些方法如何得出决定，以及什么代码结构促成了所报告的安全缺陷。机器学习的解释方法可以克服这个问题，并引导从业者找到相关代码。然而，存在各种竞争性的解释方法，当给出相同的发现时，每种方法强调不同的代码区域。到目前为止，这种不一致使得不可能选择一种适合实际使用的解释方法。在本文中，我们解决了这个问题，并开发了一种方法来分析和比较基于学习的漏洞发现的解释。给定一个预测的漏洞，我们的方法使用定向模糊化来创建由解释方法标记为相关的代码区域周围的局部真实情况。这一局部的基本事实使我们能够评估解释的真实性。因此，我们可以定性地比较不同的解释方法，并为特定的学习设置确定最准确的方法。在使用不同发现和解释方法的实证评估中，我们展示了这种方法的效用及其使基于学习的漏洞发现更加透明的能力。

papers.title: Systematic Improvement of Access-Stratum Security in Mobile Networks
papers.authors: Rhys Miller, Ioana Boureanu, Stephan Wesemeyer, Zhili Sun, Hemant Zope
papers.abstract: In mobile networks, the User Equipment (UE) secures some of the communication with its serving Radio Access Network (RAN) node ("base station") via a set of keys known as Access Stratum (AS) keys. Unfortunately, the level of secrecy of these keys varies with the mobile procedures re-establishing them. To improve the secrecy of the AS keys, we propose minimal changes to 5G & 4G handovers, i.e., the main AS-key establishment procedures. We show the minimality of our changes also via an implementation of one of our protocols in the 3GPP-compliant Open5GCore 5G testbed. We also systematically cross-compare standard handovers with our amended handovers using MobTrustCom: a framework to quantify especially trust but also communication complexity in mobile networks. Moreover, we use Tamarin, a formal security-protocol verification tool, to prove no loss of "classical" security yet an increase in AS-keys' secrecy brought by our improvements to handovers.
papers.title_zh: 移动网络中接入层安全性的系统改进
papers.abstract_zh: 在移动网络中，用户设备(UE)通过一组被称为接入层(as)密钥的密钥来保护与其服务无线接入网(RAN)节点(“基站”)的一些通信。不幸的是，这些密钥的保密级别随着重新建立它们的移动程序而变化。为了提高AS密钥的保密性，我们建议对5G和4G切换(即主要AS密钥建立过程)进行最小的更改。我们还通过在符合3GPP标准的Open5GCore 5G测试床中实现我们的一个协议来展示我们的变化的最小性。我们还使用MobTrustCom系统地交叉比较了标准切换和我们修改的切换:一个特别量化信任以及移动网络中通信复杂性的框架。此外，我们使用Tamarin，一个正式的安全协议验证工具，来证明没有损失“经典的”安全性，但是通过我们对移交的改进，增加了AS-key的保密性。

papers.title: Anomaly-based Filtering of Application-Layer DDoS Against DNS Authoritatives
papers.authors: Jonas Bushart, Christian Rossow
papers.abstract: Authoritative DNS infrastructures are at the core of the Internet ecosystem. But how resilient are typical authoritative DNS name servers against application-layer Denial-of-Service attacks? In this paper, with the help of a large country-code TLD operator, we assess the expected attack load and DoS countermeasures. We find that standard botnets or even single-homed attackers can overload the computational resources of authoritative name servers—even if redundancy such as anycast is in place. To prevent the resulting devastating DNS outages, we assess how effective upstream filters can be as a last resort. We propose an anomaly detection defense that allows both, well-behaving high-volume DNS resolvers as well as low-volume clients to continue name lookups—while blocking most of the attack traffic. Upstream ISPs or IXPs can deploy our scheme and drop attack traffic to reasonable query loads at or below 100k queries per second at a false positive rate of 1.2% to 5.7% (median 2.4%).
papers.title_zh: 针对DNS授权的应用层DDoS异常过滤
papers.abstract_zh: 权威的DNS基础设施是互联网生态系统的核心。但是，典型的权威DNS域名服务器对应用层拒绝服务攻击有多大的弹性呢？在本文中，借助于一个大的国家代码TLD运营商，我们评估了预期的攻击负载和拒绝服务的对策。我们发现，标准僵尸网络甚至单宿攻击者都可能使权威域名服务器的计算资源过载——即使存在诸如任播之类的冗余。为了防止造成灾难性的DNS中断，我们评估了上游过滤器作为最后手段的有效性。我们提出了一种异常检测防御，允许行为良好的高容量DNS解析器以及低容量客户端继续进行名称查找，同时阻止大多数攻击流量。上游ISP或ixp可以部署我们的方案，并以1.2%到5.7%的误报率(中位数为2.4%)将攻击流量降至每秒100k查询或以下的合理查询负载。

papers.title: SoK: A Data-driven View on Methods to Detect Reflective Amplification DDoS Attacks Using Honeypots
papers.authors: Marcin Nawrocki, John Kristoff, Raphael Hiesgen, Chris Kanich, Thomas C. Schmidt, Matthias Wählisch
papers.abstract: In this paper, we revisit the use of honeypots for detecting reflective amplification attacks. These measurement tools require careful design of both data collection and data analysis including cautious threshold inference. We survey common amplification honeypot platforms as well as the underlying methods to infer attack detection thresholds and to extract knowledge from the data. By systematically exploring the threshold space, we find most honeypot platforms produce comparable results despite their different configurations. Moreover, by applying data from a large-scale honeypot deployment, network telescopes, and a real-world baseline obtained from a leading DDoS mitigation provider, we question the fundamental assumption of honeypot research that convergence of observations can imply their completeness. Conclusively we derive guidance on precise, reproducible honeypot research, and present open challenges.
papers.title_zh: SoK:使用蜜罐检测反射放大DDoS攻击方法的数据驱动观点
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们重新审视蜜罐在检测反射放大攻击中的应用。这些测量工具需要仔细设计数据收集和数据分析，包括谨慎的阈值推断。我们调查了常见的放大蜜罐平台以及推断攻击检测阈值和从数据中提取知识的基本方法。通过系统地探索阈值空间，我们发现大多数蜜罐平台尽管配置不同，但产生的结果相当。此外，通过应用来自大规模蜜罐部署、网络望远镜和从领先的DDoS缓解提供商获得的真实世界基线的数据，我们质疑蜜罐研究的基本假设，即观察的收敛可以暗示它们的完整性。最后，我们得到了精确的，可重复的蜜罐研究的指导，并提出了开放的挑战。

papers.title: SoK: Pragmatic Assessment of Machine Learning for Network Intrusion Detection
papers.authors: Giovanni Apruzzese, Pavel Laskov, Johannes Schneider
papers.abstract: Machine Learning (ML) has become a valuable asset to solve many real-world tasks. For Network Intrusion Detection (NID), however, scientific advances in ML are still seen with skepticism by practitioners. This disconnection is due to the intrinsically limited scope of research papers, many of which primarily aim to demonstrate new methods "outperforming" prior work—oftentimes overlooking the practical implications for deploying the proposed solutions in real systems. Unfortunately, the value of ML for NID depends on a plethora of factors, such as hardware, that are often neglected in scientific literature.This paper aims to reduce the practitioners’ skepticism towards ML for NID by changing the evaluation methodology adopted in research. After elucidating which factors influence the operational deployment of ML in NID, we propose the notion of pragmatic assessment, which enable practitioners to gauge the real value of ML methods for NID. Then, we show that the state-of-research hardly allows one to estimate the value of ML for NID. As a constructive step forward, we carry out a pragmatic assessment. We re-assess existing ML methods for NID, focusing on the classification of malicious network traffic, and consider: hundreds of configuration settings; diverse adversarial scenarios; and four hardware platforms. Our large and reproducible evaluations enable estimating the quality of ML for NID. We also validate our claims through a user-study with security practitioners.
papers.title_zh: SoK:用于网络入侵检测的机器学习的实用性评估
papers.abstract_zh: 机器学习(ML)已经成为解决许多现实世界任务的宝贵资产。然而，对于网络入侵检测(NID ),从业者仍然对ML的科学进步持怀疑态度。这种脱节是由于研究论文的内在范围有限，其中许多论文的主要目的是证明新方法“优于”先前的工作，往往忽视了在实际系统中部署建议的解决方案的实际意义。不幸的是，对于NID来说，ML的价值取决于过多的因素，比如硬件，而这些在科学文献中常常被忽略。本文旨在通过改变研究中采用的评估方法来减少实践者对NID ML的怀疑。在阐明了哪些因素影响了NID最大似然法的操作部署之后，我们提出了实用评估的概念，这使得实践者能够衡量最大似然法对NID的真正价值。然后，我们表明，国家的研究几乎不允许一个人来估计NID的ML值。作为向前迈出的建设性一步，我们进行了务实的评估。我们重新评估现有的ML方法，重点是恶意网络流量的分类，并考虑:数百个配置设置；不同的敌对情景；和四个硬件平台。我们的大规模可重复评估能够评估NID ML的质量。我们还通过对安全从业者的用户研究来验证我们的说法。

papers.title: GNN4IFA: Interest Flooding Attack Detection With Graph Neural Networks
papers.authors: Andrea Agiollo, Enkeleda Bardhi, Mauro Conti, Riccardo Lazzeretti, Eleonora Losiouk, Andrea Omicini
papers.abstract: In the context of Information-Centric Networking, Interest Flooding Attacks (IFAs) represent a new and dangerous sort of distributed denial of service. Since existing proposals targeting IFAs mainly focus on local information, in this paper we propose GNN4IFA as the first mechanism exploiting complex non-local knowledge for IFA detection by leveraging Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) handling the overall network topology.In order to test GNN4IFA, we collect SPOTIFAI, a novel dataset filling the current lack of available IFA datasets by covering a variety of IFA setups, including ~40 heterogeneous scenarios over three network topologies. We show that GNN4IFA performs well on all tested topologies and setups, reaching over 99% detection rate along with a negligible false positive rate and small computational costs. Overall, GNN4IFA overcomes state-of-the-art detection mechanisms both in terms of raw detection and flexibility, and – unlike all previous solutions in the literature – also enables the transfer of its detection on network topologies different from the one used in its design phase.
papers.title_zh: GNN4IFA:基于图形神经网络的兴趣泛滥攻击检测
papers.abstract_zh: 在以信息为中心的网络环境中，兴趣泛滥攻击(IFAs)代表了一种新的危险的分布式拒绝服务。由于针对IFA的现有提议主要关注局部信息，因此在本文中，我们提出GNN4IFA作为第一种机制，通过利用图形神经网络(GNNs)处理整体网络拓扑来利用复杂的非局部知识进行IFA检测。为了测试GNN4IFA，我们收集了SPOTIFAI，这是一个新的数据集，通过覆盖各种IFA设置，包括三种网络拓扑上的约40种异构场景，填补了当前可用IFA数据集的缺乏。我们表明GNN4IFA在所有测试的拓扑和设置上表现良好，检测率达到99%以上，误报率可以忽略不计，计算成本很小。总的来说，GNN4IFA在原始检测和灵活性方面克服了最先进的检测机制，并且与文献中所有以前的解决方案不同，它还支持在不同于其设计阶段使用的网络拓扑上传输其检测。

papers.title: SoK: Analysis of Root Causes and Defense Strategies for Attacks on Microarchitectural Optimizations
papers.authors: Nadja Ramhöj Holtryd, Madhavan Manivannan, Per Stenström
papers.abstract: Microarchitectural optimizations are expected to play a crucial role in ensuring performance scalability in future technology nodes. However, recent attacks have demonstrated that microarchitectural optimizations, which were assumed to be secure, can be exploited. Moreover, new attacks surface at a rapid pace limiting the scope of existing defenses. These developments prompt the need to review microarchitectural optimizations with an emphasis on security, understand the attack landscape and the potential defense strategies. We analyze timing-based side-channel attacks targeting a diverse set of microarchitectural optimizations. We provide a framework for analysing non-transient and transient attacks, which highlights the similarities. We identify the four root causes of timing-based side-channel attacks: determinism, sharing, access violation and information flow, through our systematic analysis. Our key insight is that a subset (or all) of the root causes are exploited by attacks and eliminating any of the exploited root causes, in any attack step, is enough to provide protection. Leveraging our framework, we systematize existing defenses and show that they target these root causes in the different attack steps.
papers.title_zh: SoK:对攻击微体系结构优化的根本原因和防御策略的分析
papers.abstract_zh: 微体系结构优化预计将在确保未来技术节点的性能可扩展性方面发挥至关重要的作用。然而，最近的攻击表明，被认为是安全的微体系结构优化可以被利用。此外，新的攻击层出不穷，限制了现有防御的范围。这些发展促使我们需要重新审视微体系结构优化，重点关注安全性，了解攻击形势和潜在的防御策略。我们分析了针对各种微体系结构优化的基于时序的旁路攻击。我们提供了一个分析非瞬时和瞬时攻击的框架，突出了相似性。通过我们的系统分析，我们确定了基于时间的旁道攻击的四个根本原因:确定性、共享、访问违规和信息流。我们的关键见解是，根本原因的子集(或全部)被攻击利用，在任何攻击步骤中消除任何被利用的根本原因都足以提供保护。利用我们的框架，我们将现有的防御系统化，并表明它们在不同的攻击步骤中针对这些根本原因。

papers.title: MicroProfiler: Principled Side-Channel Mitigation through Microarchitectural Profiling
papers.authors: Marton Bognar, Hans Winderix, Jo Van Bulck, Frank Piessens
papers.abstract: —Preventing information leakage through microarchitectural side channels is notoriously challenging and, as a result, an important research question. Recent work has shown the viability of compiler-assisted instruction balancing for small, embedded processors with deterministic timing behavior. However, even in such small processors, more subtle microarchitectural side channels continue to be discovered, complicating mitigation efforts. We propose a methodology for augmenting an existing instruction set architecture (ISA) speciﬁcation with instruction-speciﬁc microarchitectural leakage traces obtained through principled microarchitectural proﬁling . Building on this augmented ISA , it becomes possible to construct software tools to detect and mitigate certain side-channel vulnerabilities. As a case study, we instantiate our methodology on a recently uncovered microarchitectural side channel, which is based on cycle-level timing differences of direct memory access (DMA) requests on 16-bit openMSP430 processors. Using the augmented ISA obtained for this side channel through microarchitectural proﬁling, we develop practical attack scenarios and extend a state-of-the-art compiler-based mitigation and a binary validation tool, both of which originally targeted a coarser-grained, instruction-granular side channel. Our benchmarks show that our extended compiler mitigation, while still mitigating the instruction-granular leakage, also eliminates the cycle-accurate DMA information leakage without incurring any additional overhead.
papers.title_zh: 微分析器:通过微体系结构分析的原则性旁道抑制
papers.abstract_zh: —众所周知，防止信息通过微体系结构侧通道泄漏极具挑战性，因此也是一个重要的研究问题。最近的工作显示了编译器辅助的指令平衡对于具有确定性时序行为的小型嵌入式处理器的可行性。然而，即使在这种小型处理器中，仍会不断发现更微妙的微体系结构侧通道，使缓解工作变得更加复杂。我们提出了一种方法，利用通过原则性微体系结构评测获得的特定于指令的微体系结构泄漏跟踪来增强现有指令集体系结构(ISA)规范。在这个扩充的ISA的基础上，构造软件工具来检测和减轻某些侧信道漏洞成为可能。作为案例研究，我们在最近发现的微体系结构侧通道上实例化了我们的方法，该侧通道基于16位openMSP430处理器上直接存储器访问(DMA)请求的周期级时序差异。使用通过微体系结构评测获得的针对该侧通道的增强ISA，我们开发了实际的攻击场景，并扩展了最先进的基于编译器的缓解和二进制验证工具，这两种工具最初都以粗粒度、指令粒度侧通道为目标。我们的基准测试表明，我们的扩展编译器缓解在缓解指令粒度泄漏的同时，还消除了周期精确的DMA信息泄漏，而不会产生任何额外的开销。

papers.title: You Cannot Always Win the Race: Analyzing mitigations for branch target prediction attacks
papers.authors: Alyssa Milburn, Ke Sun, Henrique Kawakami
papers.abstract: Many recent attacks such as Branch Target Injection (BTI, aka Spectre v2) take advantage of speculative execution in modern processors, and in particular the inherent race condition between transient execution of code at the predicted target of a branch and the architectural resolution of the branch. This can create a speculation window in which code can be transiently executed at an unintended target, and mitigations for these attacks often focus on minimizing or removing such windows. By investigating the potential sources of latency that may contribute to such a speculation window, such as pipeline contention and simultaneous multithreading (SMT) activity, we show that an attacker can "win the race" despite the adoption of widely-used mitigations, on a variety of different x86 CPUs. We also show that such speculation windows may be present for predictions of direct branches. This enables a new class of BTI-style attacks that do not depend on indirect branches, and bypass the majority of previous mitigations against such attacks.
papers.title_zh: 您不可能总是赢得比赛:分析分支目标预测攻击的缓解措施
papers.abstract_zh: 许多最近的攻击，如分支目标注入(BTI，又名Spectre v2)，利用了现代处理器中的推测性执行，特别是在分支的预测目标处代码的瞬时执行和分支的架构解析之间的固有竞争条件。这可能会创建一个推测窗口，在该窗口中，代码可能会在非预期的目标上短暂执行，对这些攻击的缓解措施通常集中在最小化或删除这样的窗口。通过调查可能导致这种推测窗口的潜在延迟源，如管道争用和同步多线程(SMT)活动，我们表明攻击者可以在各种不同的x86 CPUs上“赢得比赛”,尽管采用了广泛使用的缓解措施。我们还表明，这种猜测窗口可能存在的预测直接分支。这使得一类新的BTI式攻击不依赖于间接分支，并绕过了以前对此类攻击的大部分缓解措施。

papers.title: Towards Automated Detection of Single-Trace Side-Channel Vulnerabilities in Constant-Time Cryptographic Code
papers.authors: Ferhat Erata, Ruzica Piskac, Víctor Mateu, Jakub Szefer
papers.abstract: Although cryptographic algorithms may be mathematically secure, it is often possible to leak secret information from the implementation of the algorithms. Timing and power side-channel vulnerabilities are some of the most widely considered threats to cryptographic algorithm implementations.
